)@@G@@ NUMBER OF BITS EACH.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@               PART(<BASE>,<INYC
)@@G@@DEX>,<BITS>) TO DEFINE THE ARRAY.   @F@@@@                   <BASE> IS TYD
)@@G@@HE ARRAY DIMENSIONED ABOVE.  <INDEX>@F@@@@                   IS THE SYMBYE
)@@G@@OL USED IN THE 'DEFINE'.  <BITS> IS @F@@@@                   THE NUMBER YF
)@@G@@OF BITS PER ENTRY.  IF <BITS> DOES  @F@@@@                   NOT DIVIDE YG
)@@G@@36, THE BITS AT THE RIGHTHAND END OF@C@@@@                   EACH WORD WYH
)@@G@@ILL BE WASTED; NO @E@@@@                   ACROSS-WORD-BOUNDARY ALLOCATIYI
)@@G@@ON IS DONE. @[@@@@      @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RAYJ
)@@G@@LPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         10-  1@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@YK
)@@G@@      @D@@@@ 10.   MISCELLANEOUS MACHINE-DEPENDENT STATEMENTS     @[@@@@YL
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@       THE EXEC 8 MONITOR SYSTEM IS YM
)@@G@@A VERY POWERFUL SYSTEM, WHICH @F@@@@ PROVIDES AN INCREDIBLE NUMBER OF SEYN
)@@G@@RVICES TO THE USER.  SOME     @F@@@@ STATEMENTS HAVE BEEN ADDED TO THE MYO
)@@G@@AD LANGUAGE TO ALLOW THE USER @F@@@@ TO TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THEM DIRECTLY YP
)@@G@@FROM A COMPILER-LEVEL PROGRAM.@F@@@@ A PASSING FAMILIARITY WITH THE EXECYQ
)@@G@@ 8 SYSTEM AND THE 1108 MACHINE@#@@@@ CODE IS ASSUMED. @[@@@@      @[@@@@YR
)@@G@@      @D@@@@ 10. 1.   THE 'REQUEST' STATEMENT (FORTRAN AND MAD)   @[@@@@YS
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@       THE 'REQUEST' STATEMENT COMPILES INTO AN YT
)@@G@@'EXECUTIVE RETURN'@F@@@@ (ER) INSTRUCTION.  THERE ARE THREE FORMS OF THIYU
)@@G@@S STATEMENT; ONLY @E@@@@ ONE FORM IS VALID FOR A GIVEN EXECUTIVE REQUESTYV
)@@G@@ FUNCTION.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@       (A)     REQUEST <ER-NAMYW
)@@G@@E>    @[@@@@      @B@@@@       (B)     REQUEST <ER-NAME>,<PACKET> @[@@@@YX
)@@G@@      @C@@@@       (C)     REQUEST <ER-NAME>,*<CONTROL WORD>@[@@@@      YY
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE CLAUSE ',ASSIGN TO <VARIABLE>' MAY BE APPENYZ
)@@G@@DED TO ANY OF     @G@@@@ THE THREE FORMS.  IF <VARIABLE> IS OF ANY SINGLZA
)@@G@@EWORD MODE, IT WILL     @F@@@@ BE GIVEN THE CONTENTS OF REGISTER A0 AFTEZB
)@@G@@R THE 'ER' INSTRUCTION  @F@@@@ RETURNS.  IF <VARIABLE> IS OF COMPLEX OR ZC
)@@G@@DOUBLE-PRECISION MODE,  @D@@@@ THE CONTENTS OF REGISTERS A0 AND A1 WILL ZD
)@@G@@BE STORED.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       <ER-NAME> IS THE SYMBOLIC NAME, LESZE
)@@G@@S THE DOLLAR SIGN, OF THE     @F@@@@ EXECUTIVE REQUEST FUNCTION.  CONSTRZF
)@@G@@UCTION (A) GENERATES AN 'ER'  @F@@@@ INSTRUCTION WITHOUT ANY PACKET LOADZG
)@@G@@ PREVIOUSLY.  CONSTRUCTION (B)@F@@@@ GENERATES AN ADDRESS LOAD (IMMEDIATZH
)@@G@@E LOAD) OF THE ADDRESS OF     @E@@@@ <PACKET> INTO REGISTER A0, FOLLOWEDZI
)@@G@@ BY THE 'ER' INSTRUCTION@F@@@@ ITSELF.  CONSTRUCTION (C) GENERATES A FULZJ
)@@G@@LWORD LOAD OF <CONTROL  @F@@@@ WORD> INTO REGISTER A0, FOLLOWED BY THE 'ZK
)@@G@@ER' INSTRUCTION ITSELF. @F@@@@ THE <PACKET> IN CONSTRUCTION (B) SHOULD BZL
)@@G@@E A POSSIBLY-SUBSCRIPTED@D@@@@ VARIABLE NAME, A CONSTANT, OR A FUNCTION ZM
)@@G@@PARAMETER.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMZN
)@@G@@MING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         10-  2@[@@@@      @[@@@@ZO
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@               EXAMPLES:@^@@@@               ===ZP
)@@G@@======@[@@@@      @#@@@@       TYPE (A):  @C@@@@               REQUEST DZQ
)@@G@@ATE, ASSIGN TO TODAY(1) @ @@@@               REQUEST ABORT  @ @@@@      ZR
)@@G@@         REQUEST SWAIT  @[@@@@      @#@@@@       TYPE (B):  @A@@@@      ZS
)@@G@@         REQUEST IO,PACKET    @C@@@@               REQUEST CSF,VR,ASSIGNZT
)@@G@@ TO STATUS  @C@@@@               REQUEST CSF,$@ASG,T  TAPE,8C . $ @A@@@@ZU
)@@G@@               REQUEST FACIL,ID(0)  @B@@@@               REQUEST TSWAP,$ZV
)@@G@@9      $    @[@@@@      @#@@@@       TYPE (C):  @E@@@@               REQZW
)@@G@@UEST READ,*.LOC.RTN.LS.18.V..LOC.CARDIM   @D@@@@               REQUEST PZX
)@@G@@RINT,*0102K6.V.LOC.($MESSAGE$)@C@@@@               REQUEST FORK,*1K6.V..ZY
)@@G@@LOC.LABEL   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@       ALL OF THE ABOVE EXAMPLZZ
)@@G@@ES ARE FROM MAD.  IN FORTRAN, SIMPLY@F@@@@ REPLACE ANY OCCURRENCE OF $ BAA
)@@G@@Y '.  THERE IS CURRENTLY NO GUARAN- @C@@@@ TEED WAY TO LOAD REGISTER A1 AB
)@@G@@BEFORE AN 'ER'.   @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DAC
)@@G@@ECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         11-  1@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      AD
)@@G@@@A@@@@ 11.   THE MECHANICS OF USING RALPH @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@AE
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       THE FIRST STEP IN COMPILING A PROGRAM UNDER RALPH IS AF
)@@G@@TO CALL     @F@@@@ THE RALPH COMPILER WITH A VALID PROCESSOR-CALL CARD. AG
)@@G@@ THE ONLY   @F@@@@ REQUIRED FIELD ON THE PROCESSOR-CALL CARD IS THE NAMEAH
)@@G@@ 'RALPH':   @[@@@@      @]@@@@ @RALPH     @[@@@@      @E@@@@ A LANGUAGE AI
)@@G@@SPECIFICATION (FORTRAN OR MAD) CAN BE ADDED:    @[@@@@      @ @@@@ @RALPAJ
)@@G@@H,F        . FORTRAN    @[@@@@      @^@@@@ @RALPH,M        . MAD  @[@@@@AK
)@@G@@      @E@@@@ IF DESIRED, ONE MAY ADD A DECKNAME TO THE COMPILATION:     AL
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @^@@@@ @RALPH,MI  <DECKNAME>  @[@@@@      @F@@@@ AND SO ON. AM
)@@G@@ THE COMPLETE STRUCTURE OF THE RALPH PROCESSOR-CONTROL@]@@@@ CARD IS    AN
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @B@@@@ @RALPH<OPTIONS>  <ELEMENT SPECIFICATIONS>@[@@@@      AO
)@@G@@@F@@@@ WHERE <OPTIONS> IS THE POSSIBLY NULL SET OF CALLING OPTIONS, AND AP
)@@G@@@B@@@@ <ELEMENT SPECIFICATIONS> IS THE DES-     @G@@@@ CRIPTOR FOR THE LAQ
)@@G@@OCATION, NAME, VERSION, ETC. OF THE SOURCE INPUT,     @F@@@@ RELOCATABLEAR
)@@G@@ OUTPUT, AND UPDATED SOURCE OUTPUT ELEMENT.  A DISCUS-@F@@@@ SION OF THEAS
)@@G@@SE TERMS IS POSTPONED FOR A BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF THE  @^@@@@ 'PROGRAM FIAT
)@@G@@LE' CONCEPT.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@ 11. 1.   PROGRAM FILES @[@@@@AU
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@       ALL INTERMEDIATE STORAGE OF 'BULK MEDIA' AV
)@@G@@ON THE 1108 UNDER @F@@@@ EXEC 8 IS ON DRUM STORAGE.  ALL DRUM STORAGE ISAW
)@@G@@ DONE THROUGH     @F@@@@ 'FILES'.  A 'FILE' ON DRUM IS A GROUP OF DRUM TAX
)@@G@@RACKS WHICH HAS   @F@@@@ BEEN ASSIGNED A NAME SO THAT IT MAY BE REFERENCAY
)@@G@@ED BY THE USER.   @F@@@@ FOR SECURITY REASONS, IT IS NOT POSSIBLE TO REFAZ
)@@G@@ERENCE A DRUM FILE@F@@@@ EXCEPT THROUGH THE FILE HANDLER, WHICH CAN KEEPBA
)@@G@@ 'PRIVATE' VS.    @F@@@@ 'PUBLIC' DISTINCTIONS ON FILES, AND WHICH CAN DBB
)@@G@@EMAND 'PASSWORDS' @D@@@@ IN ORDER TO PERMIT REFERENCE TO A PRIVILEGED FIBC
)@@G@@LE.   @[@@@@      @C@@@@ 11. 1. 1.   TEMPORARY AND CATALOGUED FILES     BD
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@       THERE ARE TWO TYPES OF DRUM FILES:  TEMPORARY ABE
)@@G@@ND CATALO-  @F@@@@ GUED.  A TEMPORARY FILE IS DISCARDED AFTER USE; A CATBF
)@@G@@ALOGUED FILE@F@@@@ IS RETAINED UNTIL EXPLICITLY REMOVED.  AS AN EXAMPLE,BG
)@@G@@ THE RALPH  @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBEBH
)@@G@@R 1971 VERSION)         11-  2@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@BI
)@@G@@ PROCESSOR IS STORED IN A CATALOGUED DRUM FILE NAMED 'LIB$', AND  @F@@@@BJ
)@@G@@ THE LIBRARY SUBROUTINES NECESSARY TO RUN A RALPH PROGRAM ARE     @F@@@@BK
)@@G@@ STORED IN A CATALOGUED DRUM FILE NAMED 'RLIB$'.  BOTH OF THESE   @G@@@@BL
)@@G@@ FILES ARE PROTECTED BY PASSWORDS AND WRITE LOCKOUT AGAINST ALTERA-     BM
)@@G@@@F@@@@ TION BY A MISGUIDED OR MALEVOLENT USER.  ALL FURTHER DISCUSSION  BN
)@@G@@@A@@@@ WILL ASSUME TEMPORARY FILE USAGE.  @[@@@@      @F@@@@       TO CRBO
)@@G@@EATE A FILE THE '@ASG' CARD IS USED.  THE 'ASG' IS    @F@@@@ MNEMONIC FOBP
)@@G@@R 'ASSIGN'; ONE ASSIGNS A FILE AS NECESSARY.  IN SIMP-@B@@@@ LEST FORM, BQ
)@@G@@THE '@ASG' CARD IS SIMPLY     @[@@@@      @ @@@@ @ASG          <FILENAMEBR
)@@G@@>     @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WHICH WILL ASSIGN A FILE NAMED <FILENAME>.  TO BS
)@@G@@ENSURE THAT THIS IS     @A@@@@ A TEMPORARY FILE, ADD A 'T' OPTION:@[@@@@BT
)@@G@@      @ @@@@ @ASG,T        <FILENAME>     @[@@@@      @G@@@@ FOR A COMPLBU
)@@G@@ETE DISCUSSION OF ALL OF THE MANY OPTIONS AVAILABLE FOR     @G@@@@ THE 'BV
)@@G@@@ASG' CARD AND ITS MANY VARIATIONS, SEE CHAPTER 5 OF THE EXEC     @B@@@@BW
)@@G@@ 8 PROGRAMMERS' REFERENCE MANUAL, UP-4144.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@BX
)@@G@@       A SPECIFIC USE OF A DRUM FILE IS TO DEDICATE IT TO HOLDING @F@@@@BY
)@@G@@ PROGRAMS AND DATA CARD IMAGES FOR THOSE PROGRAMS.  A PROGRAM     @F@@@@BZ
)@@G@@ STORED IN A PROGRAM FILE IS CALLED AN 'ELEMENT' OF THAT PROGRAM  @F@@@@CA
)@@G@@ FILE, OR SIMPLY A 'PROGRAM ELEMENT'.  EVERY RUN IS ASSIGNED ONE  @E@@@@CB
)@@G@@ PROGRAM FILE BY THE EXECUTIVE.  THIS FILE IS NAMED 'TPF$'  @E@@@@ (TEMPCC
)@@G@@ORARY PROGRAM FILE); ITS PURPOSE IS TO SERVE AS A     @F@@@@ BEHIND-THE-CD
)@@G@@SCENES PROGRAM FILE FOR PEOPLE WHO EITHER DON'T KNOW  @F@@@@ WHAT A PROGCE
)@@G@@RAM FILE IS, OR WHO FOR REASONS OF PERSONAL PREFERENCE@G@@@@ OR ABHORRENCF
)@@G@@CE OF KEYPUNCHING CHOOSE NOT TO USE REGULAR FILES.  THE     @F@@@@ CONCECG
)@@G@@PT OF A PROGRAM FILE HAS PROVEN TO BE A DIFFICULT ONE TO    @F@@@@ CONVECH
)@@G@@Y, AND COMPREHENSION OF THE 'TPF$' MORE OFTEN THAN NOT LEADS@F@@@@ TO A CI
)@@G@@PLATEAU OF UNDERSTANDING SATISFACTORY TO THE CASUAL USER,   @F@@@@ WITH CJ
)@@G@@CONCORDANT UNWILLINGNESS TO LEARN ENOUGH TO GREATLY SIMPLIFY@F@@@@ THE ACK
)@@G@@MOUNT OF WORK REQUIRED TO PRODUCE A GIVEN PROGRAM.  THIS    @F@@@@ EXPLACL
)@@G@@NATION IN THE FOLLOWING SECTIONS IS BASED ON THE PEDAGOGIC  @G@@@@ THEORCM
)@@G@@Y THAT IT IS EASIER TO ABBREVIATE THAN TO EXTEND; THE TPF$ IS     @D@@@@CN
)@@G@@ INTRODUCED AS A SPECIAL CASE INSTEAD OF A FIRST CASE.@[@@@@      @B@@@@CO
)@@G@@ 11. 1. 2.   INSERTING A PROGRAM ELEMENT  @[@@@@      @F@@@@       THE FCP
)@@G@@IRST STEP IN USING YOUR SHINY NEW PROGRAM FILE IS TO  @F@@@@ PUT A PROGRCQ
)@@G@@AM INTO IT.  THIS IS DONE USING THE 'I' OPTION ON THE @F@@@@ PROCESSOR-CCR
)@@G@@ALL CARD.  A PROGRAM MUST BE GIVEN A NAME IF IT IS TO @F@@@@ BE PUT INTOCS
)@@G@@ A PROGRAM FILE, SO THAT IT MAY BE RETRIEVED BY NAME. @#@@@@ THE CONSTRUCT
)@@G@@CTION @[@@@@      @^@@@@       <FILE>.<ELEMENT> @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDCU
)@@G@@E TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         11-  3@[@@@@CV
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@ MEANS A PROGRAM ELEMENTCW
)@@G@@ NAMED <ELEMENT> IN A FILE NAMED <FILE>.  @F@@@@ THE '<FILE>.' CONSTRUCTCX
)@@G@@ION IS SOMEWHAT LIKE AN ADJECTIVE OF LOCA-@F@@@@ TION MODIFYING THE 'NOUCY
)@@G@@N' <ELEMENT>.  BOTH <FILE> AND <ELEMENT>  @A@@@@ MAY BE UP TO 12 CHARACTCZ
)@@G@@ERS LONG.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@       ASSEMBLING SEVERAL CONCEPTS TOGETHEDA
)@@G@@R FOR AN EXAMPLE, THE   @[@@@@ CARD @[@@@@      @ @@@@ @RALPH,I   MYFILEDB
)@@G@@.EIGENVALUE @[@@@@      @E@@@@ WILL CAUSE THE CARDS FOLLOWING TO BE WRITDC
)@@G@@TEN INTO THE FILE @F@@@@ 'MYFILE' AND GIVEN THE NAME 'EIGENVALUE'.  THISDD
)@@G@@ OUTPUT TO DRUM IS@D@@@@ DONE IN ADDITION TO COMPILING THE CARDS AS A PRDE
)@@G@@OGRAM.@[@@@@      @B@@@@ 11. 1. 3.   COMPILING FROM A PROGRAM FILE@[@@@@DF
)@@G@@      @F@@@@       A PROGRAM MAY BE COMPILED FROM THE DRUM, PROVIDED THADG
)@@G@@T IT  @F@@@@ HAS PREVIOUSLY BEEN PUT THERE.  THE REFERENCE IS THE SAME, DH
)@@G@@ONLY  @A@@@@ OMIT THE 'I' OPTION:  THE CARD     @[@@@@      @A@@@@ @RALPDI
)@@G@@H        MYFILE.EIGENVALUE    @[@@@@      @F@@@@ WILL CAUSE THE PROGRAM DJ
)@@G@@SAVED INTO THE FILE 'MYFILE' BY THE NAME  @F@@@@ 'EIGENVALUE' TO BE COMPDK
)@@G@@ILED WITH NO FURTHER ADO.  IT CAN BE TEM- @F@@@@ PORARILY MODIFIED (FOR DL
)@@G@@THE PURPOSES OF THE PRESENT COMPILATION   @F@@@@ ONLY) BY USING SOURCE MDM
)@@G@@ODIFICATION CARDS.  SOURCE MODIFICATION   @F@@@@ CARDS ENABLE THE PROGRADN
)@@G@@MMER TO MODIFY, EITHER TEMPORARILY OR     @F@@@@ PERMANENTLY, A PROGRAM DO
)@@G@@WHICH IS SAVED ON THE DRUM.  SEE SECTION  @F@@@@ 10.1.10 FOR A COMPLETE DP
)@@G@@DESCRIPTION OF SOURCE MODIFICATION CARDS. @[@@@@      @E@@@@ 11. 1. 4.  DQ
)@@G@@ UPDATING A PROGRAM IN A PROGRAM FILE.  CYCLES. @[@@@@      @G@@@@      DR
)@@G@@ IF IT IS DESIRED TO MAKE THE SOURCE UPDATES A PERMANENT PART     @F@@@@DS
)@@G@@ OF THE SAVED PROGRAM, I.E. TO UPDATE THE PROGRAM ITSELF RATHER   @F@@@@DT
)@@G@@ THAN JUST UPDATE TEMPORARILY FOR ONE COMPILATION, USE THE 'U'    @A@@@@DU
)@@G@@ OPTION ON THE PROCESSOR-CALL CARD: @[@@@@      @ @@@@ @RALPH,U  MYFILE.DV
)@@G@@EIGENVALUE  @[@@@@      @F@@@@ THIS WILL CAUSE A NEW 'CYCLE' OF THE SAVEDW
)@@G@@D PROGRAM TO BE GENERA- @F@@@@ TED.  A 'CYCLE' IS A SAFETY FEATURE:  IF DX
)@@G@@AN UPDATE TO A PROGRAM  @G@@@@ MAKES IT STOP WORKING, THEN IT IS POSSIBLDY
)@@G@@E TO EXTRACT THE PREVIOUS     @F@@@@ CYCLE, WHICH IS THE PROGRAM BEFORE DZ
)@@G@@MODIFICATION, AND TRY AGAIN.  @F@@@@ THE 'BASE LEVEL' UNUPDATED ELEMENT EA
)@@G@@INPUT VIA THE 'I' OPTION IS   @F@@@@ CYCLE 0, THE FIRST UPDATE TO THIS PEB
)@@G@@ROGRAM ELEMENT PRODUCES CYCLE @F@@@@ 1, AND SO ON.  FIVE CYCLES ARE RETAEC
)@@G@@INED, SO THAT IF A PROGRAM HAS@F@@@@ BEEN UPDATED 12 TIMES, PRODUCING CYED
)@@G@@CLE 12, CYCLES 8,9,10,11, AND @F@@@@ 12 ARE AVAILABLE.  IF NO CYCLE IS SEE
)@@G@@PECIFIED, THE LATEST CYCLE IS @F@@@@ ALWAYS ASSUMED.  TO COMPILE AN OLDEEF
)@@G@@R CYCLE AND TRY AGAIN, PLACE  @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WEG
)@@G@@ITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         11-  4@[@@@@      @[@@@@      EH
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @E@@@@ THE CYCLE NUMBER IN PARENTHESES AFTER THE ELEMENT NAMEI
)@@G@@E:    @[@@@@      @A@@@@       <FILE>.<ELEMENT>(<CYCLE>)    @[@@@@      EJ
)@@G@@@F@@@@ SO THAT TO GO BACK TO CYCLE 11 OF OUR PROGRAM 'EIGENVALUE', ONE  EK
)@@G@@@]@@@@ WOULD PUNCH@[@@@@      @A@@@@ @RALPH        MYFILE.EIGENVALUE(11)EL
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ 11. 1. 5.   ALTERNATE VERSIONS     @[@@@@EM
)@@G@@      @F@@@@       SEVERAL 'VERSIONS' OF A PROGRAM MAY BE KEPT AS TOTALLEN
)@@G@@Y     @F@@@@ SEPARATE ENTITIES WITH THE SAME NAME, IF THE 'VERSION' QUALEO
)@@G@@IFIER @ @@@@ IS USED ON AN ELEMENT NAME:  @[@@@@      @A@@@@       <FILEEP
)@@G@@>.<ELEMENT>/<VERSION>   @B@@@@ OR    <FILE>.<ELEMENT>/<VERSION>(<CYCLE>)EQ
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@ THE VERSION NAME <VERSION> MAY BE UP TO 12 CHARACTERSER
)@@G@@ LONG.  A   @F@@@@ PROGRAM WITH A NON-NULL VERSION MAY BE CREATED FROM AES
)@@G@@N EXISTING  @F@@@@ PROGRAM EITHER VIA THE SOURCE-OUTPUT FIELD (DESCRIBEDET
)@@G@@ LATER IN   @F@@@@ THIS SECTION), OR VIA ONE OF THE PROGRAM-UTILITY STATEU
)@@G@@EMENTS DES- @F@@@@ CRIBED IN CHAPTER 13 OF THE EXEC 8 PROGRAMMERS' REFEREV
)@@G@@ENCE MANUAL,@F@@@@ UP-4144.  A PROGRAM WITH A VERSION SPECIFIED MAY ALSOEW
)@@G@@ BE INSERTED@^@@@@ DIRECTLY FROM CARDS:   @[@@@@      @A@@@@ @RALPH,I  MEX
)@@G@@YFILE.EIGENVALUE/NEW    @[@@@@      @F@@@@ WHICH WILL BE KEPT DISTINCT FEY
)@@G@@ROM 'MYFILE.EIGENVALUE', ALLOWING   @C@@@@ BOTH PROGRAMS TO BE DEVELOPEDEZ
)@@G@@ INDEPENDENTLY.   @[@@@@      @A@@@@ 11. 1. 6.   RELOCATABLE ELEMENTS   FA
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@       THE OUTPUT OF A COMPILATION IS A 'RELOCATABLE EFB
)@@G@@LEMENT', OR @F@@@@ 'OBJECT PROGRAM', WHICH IS A PROGRAM IN A BINARY MACHFC
)@@G@@INE LANGUAGE@G@@@@ TOGETHER WITH ENOUGH 'RELOCATION INFORMATION' TO ALLOFD
)@@G@@W THE PROGRAM     @E@@@@ TO BE LINKED UP WITH OTHER SUBROUTINES TO FORM FE
)@@G@@AN 'ABSOLUTE@E@@@@ ELEMENT', WHICH IS A PROGRAM READY FOR EXECUTION.  THFF
)@@G@@E NAME@F@@@@ 'RELOCATABLE' MEANS THAT THE PROGRAM MAY BE LOADED ANYWHEREFG
)@@G@@ IN   @F@@@@ MEMORY, ALL OF ITS REFERENCES TO ITSELF ARE RELATIVE WITH RFH
)@@G@@ESPECT@A@@@@ TO THE BEGINNING OF THE PROGRAM.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@      FI
)@@G@@ A RELOCATABLE ELEMENT IS ALSO KEPT IN A PROGRAM FILE; TO   @G@@@@ DISTIFJ
)@@G@@NGUISH IT FROM A CARD-IMAGE SOURCE PROGRAM ELEMENT THE LATTER     @F@@@@FK
)@@G@@ IS BETTER CALLED A 'SYMBOLIC ELEMENT'.  A SYMBOLIC ELEMENT CON-  @G@@@@FL
)@@G@@ SISTS OF CARD IMAGES, A RELOCATABLE ELEMENT IS THE CODED OUTPUT OF     FM
)@@G@@@F@@@@ THE COMPILATION OF A SYMBOLIC ELEMENT.  RELOCATABLE ELEMENTS ARE FN
)@@G@@@F@@@@ NAMED IN EXACTLY THE SAME WAY AS SYMBOLIC ELEMENTS; IN FACT,     FO
)@@G@@@F@@@@ UNLESS SPECIFIED EXPLICITLY, THE SAME NAME AND FILE ARE USED FOR FP
)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSIFQ
)@@G@@ON)         11-  5@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@ THE RELOCATFR
)@@G@@ABLE ELEMENT AS FOR THE SYMBOLIC.  ONE SPECIFIES THE  @F@@@@ RELOCATABLEFS
)@@G@@ ELEMENT NAME, IF DESIRED, VIA A SECOND FIELD ON THE  @^@@@@ PROCESSOR-CFT
)@@G@@ALL CARD:   @[@@@@      @E@@@@ @RALPH  <SYMBOLIC ELEMENT NAME>,<RELOCATAFU
)@@G@@BLE ELEMENT NAME> @[@@@@      @C@@@@ WHERE <RELOCATABLE ELEMENT NAME> COFV
)@@G@@NSISTS OF   @[@@@@      @ @@@@       <FILE>.<NAME>/<VERSION>@[@@@@      FW
)@@G@@@F@@@@ BECAUSE IT IS NOT FEASIBLE TO UPDATE A RELOCATABLE ELEMENT, NO   FX
)@@G@@@E@@@@ CYCLES OR CYCLE LEVELS ARE KEPT OR PERMITTED IN THE NAME.  @[@@@@FY
)@@G@@      @F@@@@       BECAUSE A MISSING RELOCATABLE OUTPUT FIELD WILL BE COFZ
)@@G@@PIED  @F@@@@ FROM THE FIRST, OR 'SOURCE INPUT' FIELD, THE FOLLOWING TWO GA
)@@G@@CON-  @A@@@@ STRUCTIONS ARE EQUIVALENT EXAMPLES:@[@@@@      @ @@@@ @RALPGB
)@@G@@H  MYFILE.EIGENVALUE/NEW@D@@@@ @RALPH  MYFILE.EIGENVALUE/NEW,MYFILE.EIGEGC
)@@G@@NVALUE/NEW  @[@@@@      @F@@@@ THE SECOND FORM EXPLICITLY SPECIFIES A REGD
)@@G@@LOCATABLE NAME, BUT IT  @G@@@@ SPECIFIED THE SAME NAME WHICH WOULD BE ASGE
)@@G@@SUMED FROM THE FIRST.  TO     @D@@@@ PUT THE RELOCATABLE OUTPUT OF THE CGF
)@@G@@OMPILATION OF     @F@@@@ MYFILE.EIGENVALUE/NEW INTO 'OTHERFILE' AND NAMEGG
)@@G@@ IT 'PROG1', ONE  @#@@@@ WOULD PUNCH:     @[@@@@      @C@@@@ @RALPH  MYFGH
)@@G@@ILE.EIGENVALUE/NEW,OTHERFILE.PROG1  @[@@@@      @F@@@@ IF THE PROGRAM ISGI
)@@G@@ BEING INPUT INITIALLY FROM CARDS, ONE MAY IF   @E@@@@ DESIRED SAVE ONLYGJ
)@@G@@ THE RELOCATABLE OUTPUT:  THE STATEMENT   @[@@@@      @ @@@@ @RALPH,I  ,GK
)@@G@@OTHERFILE.PROG1   @[@@@@      @F@@@@ WILL INPUT AN ELEMENT FROM CARDS WIGL
)@@G@@THOUT SAVING IT ANYWHERE,     @B@@@@ SAVING ONLY THE RELOCATABLE ELEMENTGM
)@@G@@.     @[@@@@      @C@@@@ 11. 1. 7.   SOURCE OUTPUT.  RENAMING AN UPDATE.GN
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@       IT IS OFTEN CONVENIENT TO HAVE THE ABILITY TO CGO
)@@G@@HANGE A     @E@@@@ PROGRAM, BUT ASSIGN THE NEW VERSION A SEPARATE NAME WGP
)@@G@@ITHOUT@A@@@@ ALTERING THE OLDER VERSION.  THUS, @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDGQ
)@@G@@E TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         11-  6@[@@@@GR
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@ @RALPH,U  <PROGRAM-NAME>     @[@@@@GS
)@@G@@      @F@@@@ WILL UPDATE <PROGRAM-NAME> ACCORDING TO THE SOURCE  MODIFICGT
)@@G@@ATION @F@@@@ CARDS WHICH FOLLOW.  THE ADDITION OF A THIRD FIELD, PAST THGU
)@@G@@E     @F@@@@ RELOCATABLE OUTPUT FIELD, PERMITS THIS UPDATE TO BE MADE ANGV
)@@G@@D     @G@@@@ RENAMED WITHOUT ALTERING THE ORIGINAL.  THIS THIRD FIELD ISGW
)@@G@@ CALLED     @C@@@@ THE 'SOURCE OUTPUT' FIELD:  THE CONSTRUCTION   @[@@@@GX
)@@G@@      @C@@@@ @RALPH  <PROGRAM-NAME>,,<OUTPUT-PROGRAM-NAME>  @[@@@@      GY
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WILL CAUSE A NEW PROGRAM TO BE GENERATED FROM THE EXISTING PROGRAGZ
)@@G@@M     @F@@@@ <PROGRAM-NAME>.  THE SOURCE MODIFICATION CARDS WHICH FOLLOWHA
)@@G@@ ARE  @G@@@@ APPLIED TO <PROGRAM-NAME> TO PRODUCE <OUTPUT-PROGRAM-NAME> HB
)@@G@@WITHOUT     @F@@@@ ALTERING THE ORIGINAL <PROGRAM-NAME>.  FOR EXAMPLE, THC
)@@G@@HE STATEMENT@[@@@@      @D@@@@ @RALPH  MYFILE.EIGENVALUE,,MYFILE.EIGENVAHD
)@@G@@LUE/NEW     @[@@@@      @F@@@@ WILL PRODUCE A PROGRAM ELEMENT NAMED 'EIGHE
)@@G@@ENVALUE/NEW' IN THE FILE@F@@@@ 'MYFILE' BY APPLYING THE SOURCE MODIFICATHF
)@@G@@ION CARDS TO THE ELEMENT@F@@@@ 'EIGENVALUE' IN FILE 'MYFILE'.  THE ORIGIHG
)@@G@@NAL, 'EIGENVALUE', WILL @#@@@@ NOT BE ALTERED.  @[@@@@      @F@@@@      HH
)@@G@@ THE SOURCE OUTPUT FIELD MAY NOT BE USED IN CONJUNCTION WITH@F@@@@ THE 'HI
)@@G@@I' OR 'U' OPTIONS.  IN THE ABOVE EXAMPLE, IF ONE WISHES TO  @]@@@@ SPECIHJ
)@@G@@FY A  @G@@@@ SOURCE OUTPUT FIELD WITHOUT A RELOCATABLE OUTPUT FIELD, TWOHK
)@@G@@ CONSE-     @F@@@@ CUTIVE COMMAS DENOTE A NULL RELOCATABLE OUTPUT FIELD.HL
)@@G@@  REGARDLESS@F@@@@ OF THE CYCLE LEVEL OF THE SOURCE INPUT ELEMENT, THE SHM
)@@G@@OURCE OUTPUT@^@@@@ ELEMENT IS CYCLE 0.    @[@@@@      @ @@@@ 11. 1. 8.  HN
)@@G@@ FILE QUALIFIERS  @[@@@@      @F@@@@       IN ORDER TO PREVENT CONFLICT HO
)@@G@@BETWEEN USERS WHO HAVE UNKNO- @F@@@@ WINGLY CREATED FILES WITH THE SAME HP
)@@G@@NAME, THE UP-TO-12 CHARACTER  @E@@@@ 'PROJECT' OR 'NAME' FIELD FROM THE HQ
)@@G@@'@RUN' CARD IS USED AS A@F@@@@ 'QUALIFIER' FOR ALL FILES CREATED OR RE RHR
)@@G@@EFERENCED WITHIN THAT   @F@@@@ RUN.  IF ANOTHER USER HAS DECLARED HIS CAHS
)@@G@@TALOGUED FILE TO BE     @F@@@@ 'PUBLIC', THEN IT MAY BE REFERENCED REGARHT
)@@G@@DLESS OF ONES' OWN PRO- @E@@@@ JECT QUALIFIER BY ADDING A QUALIFIER TO THU
)@@G@@HE FILE REFERENCE:@[@@@@      @C@@@@       <QUALIFIER>*<FILE>.<ELEMENT>/HV
)@@G@@<VERSION>   @[@@@@      @F@@@@ FOR EXAMPLE, IF A USER NAMED 'JONES' HAS HW
)@@G@@CATALOGUED A PUBLIC FILE@F@@@@ NAMED 'LIBRARY', AND IT IS DESIRED TO COMHX
)@@G@@PILE A PROGRAM NAMED    @G@@@@ 'ANALYZE' FROM THIS FILE, THE CORRECT PROHY
)@@G@@CESSOR-CALL CARD WOULD BE     @]@@@@ OF THE FORM@[@@@@      @C@@@@ @RALPHZ
)@@G@@H  JONES*LIBRARY.ANALYZE,FILE.ANALYZE     @[@@@@      @F@@@@ BECAUSE MR.IA
)@@G@@ JONES MIGHT HAVE TAKEN THE PRECAUTION OF ADDING A    @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@IB
)@@G@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         11-  7IC
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@ 'WRITE KEY' TO HIS FILE TO FOID
)@@G@@RBID THOSE WHO CANNOT PROVIDE THE   @F@@@@ PASSWORD FROM WRITING INTO ITIE
)@@G@@, THE RELOCATABLE OUTPUT SHOULD BE  @A@@@@ DIRECTED TO ANOTHER FILE AS SIF
)@@G@@HOWN. @[@@@@      @F@@@@       ALL SYSTEM LIBRARY FILES ARE PUBLIC FILESIG
)@@G@@, AND GENERALLY   @F@@@@ HAVE A 'WRITE KEY' IN ADDITION TO BEING 'READ OIH
)@@G@@NLY' FILES, FOR   @G@@@@ EXTRA PROTECTION.  THE USUAL QUALIFIER FOR SYSTII
)@@G@@EM LIBRARY FILES IS     @#@@@@ 'SYS$':  THUS    @[@@@@      @#@@@@      IJ
)@@G@@ SYS$*LIB$. @#@@@@ AND   SYS$*RLIB$.@[@@@@      @F@@@@ ARE THE COMPLETE IK
)@@G@@NAMES OF THE SYSTEM PROCESSOR AND SUBROUTINE    @ @@@@ LIBRARIES, RESPECIL
)@@G@@TIVELY.     @[@@@@      @C@@@@ 11. 1. 9.   ASSUMED ENTRIES FOR NULL FIELIM
)@@G@@DS    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       INCLUDING READ-KEY, WRITE-KEY, AND FILE CIN
)@@G@@YCLE, NONE OF WHICH     @F@@@@ IS DISCUSSED IN THIS MANUAL, THE COMPLETEIO
)@@G@@ REFERENCE TO AN ARBI-  @#@@@@ TRARY ELEMENT IS @[@@@@      @G@@@@ <QUALIP
)@@G@@IFIER>*<FILE>(<F-CYCLE>)/<READ>/<WRITE>.<ELEMT>/<VERS>(<CYC>)     @[@@@@IQ
)@@G@@      @F@@@@ WHICH IS INCREDIBLY LONG.  ANY OR ALL OF THESE FIELDS MAY BIR
)@@G@@E     @F@@@@ OMITTED, AS MAY THE PUNCTUATION ASSOCIATED WITH DEFINING THIS
)@@G@@E     @B@@@@ OMITTED FIELD.  THE ASSUMED ENTRIES ARE: @[@@@@      @D@@@@IT
)@@G@@       <QUALIFIER>      (PROJECT FIELD FROM RUN CARD) @ @@@@       <FILEIU
)@@G@@>           TPF$  @ @@@@       <FCYCLE>         0     @A@@@@       <READIV
)@@G@@>            (BLANK)    @A@@@@       <WRITE>           (BLANK)    @ @@@@IW
)@@G@@       <ELEMT>          NAME$ @A@@@@       <VERSION>         (BLANK)    IX
)@@G@@@E@@@@       <CYC>             (CURRENT CYCLE OF THE ELEMENT)     @[@@@@IY
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE FILE NAMED 'TPF$' IS ASSIGNED TO EVERIZ
)@@G@@Y RUN BY THE EXECU-     @F@@@@ TIVE; THUS IT IS ALWAYS SAFE TO ASSUME 'TJA
)@@G@@PF$' BECAUSE IT WILL    @F@@@@ ALWAYS BE THERE.  THE BASIC 'ALL FIELDS VJB
)@@G@@OID' PROCESSOR CALL     @[@@@@      @]@@@@ @RALPH     @[@@@@      @B@@@@JC
)@@G@@ IS EQUIVALENT TO (FOR A MAIN PROGRAM)    @[@@@@      @^@@@@ @RALPH,SI  JD
)@@G@@,TPF$.NAME$ @[@@@@      @G@@@@       NOTICE THAT THE ONLY ELEMENT ACTUALJE
)@@G@@LY GENERATED IN THIS CASE     @F@@@@ IS THE RELOCATABLE ELEMENT.  IF THEJF
)@@G@@ 'ALL FIELDS VOID' FEATURE IS @F@@@@ USED ON A SUBROUTINE, THE NAME OF TJG
)@@G@@HE FIRST ENTRY TO THE SUBROU- @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WJH
)@@G@@ITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         11-  8@[@@@@      @[@@@@      JI
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @C@@@@ TINE IS USED IN PLACE OF THE NAME 'NAME$'.     @[@@@@JJ
)@@G@@      @F@@@@       A FURTHER TYPE OF ABBREVIATION IS ALLOWED:  IF THE REJK
)@@G@@LOCA- @F@@@@ TABLE OUTPUT FIELD REFERS TO THE SAME FILE AS THE SOURCE INJL
)@@G@@PUT   @F@@@@ FIELD, THE R.O. FIELD MAY BE BEGUN WITH A PERIOD, AND THE FJM
)@@G@@ILE   @D@@@@ NAME WILL BE CARRIED OVER FROM THE PREVIOUS FIELD:   @[@@@@JN
)@@G@@      @B@@@@ @RALPH  <FILE>.<ELEMENT>,<FILE>.<ELEMENT>@[@@@@      @ @@@@JO
)@@G@@ MAY BE WRITTEN AS SIMPLY     @[@@@@      @A@@@@ @RALPH  <FILE>.<ELEMENTJP
)@@G@@>,.<ELEMENT>@[@@@@      @F@@@@ AND THE LEADING PERIOD IS SUFFICIENT TO IJQ
)@@G@@NDICATE THE ABBREVIATION@[@@@@ HERE.@[@@@@      @E@@@@       ASSUMED OPTJR
)@@G@@IONS ARE DISCUSSED IN LATER SECTIONS.     @[@@@@      @B@@@@ 11. 1.10.  JS
)@@G@@ SOURCE MODIFICATION CARDS    @[@@@@      @F@@@@       DIRECT MODIFICATIJT
)@@G@@ON OF A SYMBOLIC PROGRAM ELEMENT WHICH HAS@G@@@@ BEEN STORED ON DRUM MAYJU
)@@G@@ BE EFFECTED VIA THE TEXT EDITOR, '@ED', AS     @F@@@@ DISCUSSED IN SECTJV
)@@G@@ION 15.3 OF THE PROGRAMMERS' REFERENCE MANUAL,  @F@@@@ UP-4144.  MINOR MJW
)@@G@@ODIFICATIONS MAY BE MADE AS THE PROGRAM IS BEING@]@@@@ COMPILED.  @[@@@@JX
)@@G@@      @F@@@@       WHEN A PROGRAM LISTING IS PRINTED BY RALPH, THE CARD JY
)@@G@@NUMBER@F@@@@ OF EACH CARD IS PRINTED IN THE LEFT MARGIN.  ALL MODIFICATIJZ
)@@G@@ONS   @F@@@@ MADE VIA THE COMPILER MUST BE MADE BY CARD NUMBER.  MODIFICKA
)@@G@@ATIONS@F@@@@ MUST BE MADE IN STRICTLY INCREASING ORDER:  ANY CHANGE TO CKB
)@@G@@ARD 1 @F@@@@ MUST BE PHYSICALLY BEFORE A CHANGE TO CARD 2 IN THE MODIFICKC
)@@G@@ATION @]@@@@ CARD DECK. @[@@@@      @F@@@@       A SOURCE MODIFICATION CKD
)@@G@@ARD IS DISTINGUISHED FROM A SOURCE  @F@@@@ PROGRAM CARD BY THE PRESENCE KE
)@@G@@OF A HYPHEN (-) IN COLUMN 1.  SINCE @F@@@@ NO SYNTACTICALLY CORRECT SOURKF
)@@G@@CE CARD MAY CONTAIN A HYPHEN IN     @F@@@@ COLUMN 1, THIS WILL CAUSE NO KG
)@@G@@AMBIGUITY.  ALL MODIFICATIONS ARE ON@G@@@@ A COMPLETE CARD-BY-CARD BASISKH
)@@G@@; NO PARTIAL CARD IMAGE MODIFICATIONS     @#@@@@ MAY BE MADE.     @[@@@@KI
)@@G@@      @A@@@@ 11. 1.10. 1.   INSERTING NEW CARDS @[@@@@      @E@@@@      KJ
)@@G@@ THE FORM OF AN 'INSERT' SOURCE MODIFICATION CARD IS: @[@@@@      @#@@@@KK
)@@G@@ -<CARD NUMBER>   @[@@@@      @F@@@@       ALL OF THE CARDS UNTIL THE NEKL
)@@G@@XT '-' CARD OR '@' CARD ARE   @B@@@@ ADDED *FOLLOWING*  CARD <CARD NUMBEKM
)@@G@@R>.   @[@@@@      @B@@@@ 11. 1.10. 2.   DELETING EXISTING CARDS   @[@@@@KN
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)   KO
)@@G@@      11-  9@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @E@@@@      KP
)@@G@@ THE FORM OF A 'DELETE' SOURCE MODIFICATION CARD IS:  @[@@@@      @ @@@@KQ
)@@G@@ -<START DELETE>,<STOP DELETE>@[@@@@      @G@@@@       ALL CARDS FROM CAKR
)@@G@@RD NUMBER <START DELETE> THROUGH AND INCLU-     @C@@@@ DING CARD NUMBER KS
)@@G@@<STOP DELETE> ARE DELETED.    @[@@@@      @A@@@@ 11. 1.10. 3.   DELETE WKT
)@@G@@ITH INSERT  @[@@@@      @F@@@@       IF SOURCE CARDS FOLLOW A 'DELETE' CKU
)@@G@@ARD, THEY WILL BE INSER-@G@@@@ TED IN PLACE OF THE DELETED LINE IMAGES. KV
)@@G@@ THERE NEED BE NO CORRESPON-  @G@@@@ DENCE OF COUNT; AS MANY IMAGES AS DKW
)@@G@@ESIRED MAY BE INSERTED IN PLACE     @B@@@@ OF ONE DELETED IMAGE, OR VICEKX
)@@G@@ VERSA.     @[@@@@      @C@@@@ 11. 1.10. 4.   MISCELLANEOUS CONSIDERATIOKY
)@@G@@NS    @[@@@@      @F@@@@       WHEN OPERATING FROM A TELETYPE, ONE MUST KZ
)@@G@@SIGNAL THE END OF @F@@@@ THE MODIFICATION CARD STREAM BY AN END-OF-FILE LA
)@@G@@(ANY CARD WITH THE@F@@@@ MASTER SPACE CHARACTER '@' IN COLUMN 1 IS AN ENLB
)@@G@@D-OF-FILE).  IT IS@F@@@@ CONSIDERED AN ERROR TO UPDATE PAST THE END OF TLC
)@@G@@HE DECK, OR TO    @F@@@@ DELETE THE SAME CARD TWICE, OR TO MODIFY IN OTHLD
)@@G@@ER THAN STRICTLY  @F@@@@ INCREASING CARD NUMBER ORDER.  THE 'W' OPTION WLE
)@@G@@ILL CAUSE THE     @F@@@@ SOURCE MODIFICATIONS TO BE INDICATED ON THE SOULF
)@@G@@RCE LISTING IN THE@#@@@@ LEFT MARGIN.     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PLG
)@@G@@ROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         11- 10@[@@@@      LH
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ 11. 2.   SOURCE SLI
)@@G@@TATEMENT FORMAT   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ 11. 2. 1.  LJ
)@@G@@ PROGRAM STATEMENTS     @[@@@@      @F@@@@       FORTRAN SOURCE STATEMENLK
)@@G@@TS ARE PUNCHED IN COLUMNS 1 TO 72 OF@F@@@@ THE SOURCE CARD, WITH COLUMNSLL
)@@G@@ 1 TO 5 RESERVED FOR THE STATEMENT  @F@@@@ LABEL.  COLUMNS 73 TO 80 ARE LM
)@@G@@IGNORED, AND MAY CONTAIN ANY SORT OF@F@@@@ IDENTIFICATION INFORMATION.  LN
)@@G@@IF A STATEMENT IS TOO LONG TO FIT ON@F@@@@ ONE CARD, IT MAY BE CONTINUEDLO
)@@G@@ STARTING IN COLUMN 7 OF THE NEXT   @G@@@@ CARD IF A NONBLANK, NONZERO CLP
)@@G@@HARACTER IS PLACED IN COLUMN 6 OF THE     @]@@@@ NEXT CARD. @[@@@@      LQ
)@@G@@@G@@@@       MAD SOURCE STATEMENTS ARE PUNCHED IN COLUMNS 12 TO 72 OF THLR
)@@G@@E     @F@@@@ SOURCE CARD, WITH COLUMNS 1 THROUGH 10 RESERVED FOR A STATELS
)@@G@@MENT  @F@@@@ LABEL.  IF A STATEMENT IS TOO LONG TO FIT ON ONE CARD, IT MLT
)@@G@@AY BE @F@@@@ CONTINUED STARTING IN COLUMN 12 OF THE NEXT CARD IF A DIGITLU
)@@G@@ PUNCH@F@@@@ (0 TO 9) IS PLACED IN COLUMN 11 OF THE NEXT CARD.  IF MORE LV
)@@G@@THAN 1@F@@@@ CONTINUATION CARD IS USED, THE CONTINUATION DIGITS NEED NOTLW
)@@G@@ BE   @]@@@@ DIFFERENT. @[@@@@      @F@@@@       UP TO 660 NON-BLANK CHALX
)@@G@@RACTERS OVER ANY NUMBER OF SOURCE   @F@@@@ CARDS MAY BE INCLUDED; THIS ILY
)@@G@@S THE EQUIVALENT OF 20 FULLY-PACKED @F@@@@ CONTINUATION CARDS.  IF CARDSLZ
)@@G@@ ARE NOT FULLY PACKED, MORE MAY BE  @F@@@@ USED.  THERE IS NO INSTANCE IMA
)@@G@@N EITHER THE FORTRAN OR MAD LANGUAGE@F@@@@ WHERE MORE CARDS CAN BE REQUIMB
)@@G@@RED; SIMPLIFICATION OF LOCAL CODING @F@@@@ TO MORE THAN 1 STATEMENT CAN MC
)@@G@@ALWAYS PERFORM THE EQUIVALENT FUNC- @D@@@@ TION OF A LONG STATEMENT WITHMD
)@@G@@ SEVERAL SHORT ONES.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ 11. 2. 2.   REMARME
)@@G@@K (COMMENT) CARDS @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@       A REMARK (COMMENTMF
)@@G@@) CARD IS INCLUDED IN A SOURCE PROGRAM FOR@F@@@@ DOCUMENTATION PURPOSES.MG
)@@G@@  IN FORTRAN, THE CHARACTER 'C' IN COLUMN @F@@@@ 1, OR IN MAD AN 'R' IN MH
)@@G@@COLUMN 11, WILL CAUSE THE REMAINDER OF THE@A@@@@ CARD TO BE PRINTED AND MI
)@@G@@IGNORED.    @[@@@@      @B@@@@ 11. 2. 3.   CARD-TRUNCATION CHARACTER    MJ
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@       IF IT IS DESIRED TO PUT A COMMENT AT THE END OFMK
)@@G@@ THE STATE- @F@@@@ MENT TO WHICH IT REFERES, RATHER THAN PLACING IT ON AML
)@@G@@ SEPARATE   @F@@@@ CARD, THE CHARACTER (@) WILL CAUSE THE COMPILER TO TRMM
)@@G@@EAT THE REST@D@@@@ OF THE STATEMENT IN WHICH IT OCCURS AS A COMMENT.    MN
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @A@@@@ 11. 2. 4.   SOURCE LISTING CONTROL @[@@@@      @[@@@@MO
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)   MP
)@@G@@      11- 11@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@       THE CHARACTMQ
)@@G@@ER '-' IN COLUMN 11 OF A MAD SOURCE STATEMENT   @F@@@@ WILL CAUSE THE LIMR
)@@G@@STING TO BE DOUBLE-SPACED BEFORE THAT CARD.  THE@G@@@@ CHARACTER '.' IN MS
)@@G@@COLUMN 11 OF A MAD SOURCE STATEMENT IS EQUIVALENT     @F@@@@ TO THE 'R' MT
)@@G@@EXCEPT THAT A PAGE-UP WILL OCCUR BEFORE PRINTING THE  @F@@@@ CARD.  THE MU
)@@G@@CHARACTER 'H' IN COLUMN 11 OF A MAD SOURCE STATEMENT  @F@@@@ WILL CAUSE MV
)@@G@@COLS 12 TO 72 TO BE TAKEN AS A NEW HEADING FOR THE    @#@@@@ OUTPUT LISTMW
)@@G@@ING.  @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971MX
)@@G@@ VERSION)         11- 12@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      MY
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @A@@@@ 11. 3.   PROCESSOR-CALL OPTIONS    @[@@@@      @[@@@@MZ
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       THE OPTIONS USED ON A CALL TO THE RALPH COMPILER ARE NA
)@@G@@USED TO     @F@@@@ MODIFY STANDARD COMPILER ACTION.  AVAILABLE OPTIONS, NB
)@@G@@AND THEIR   @ @@@@ MEANINGS, ARE LISTED BELOW.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      NC
)@@G@@@F@@@@ A     ALLOW COMPILATION TO CONTINUE REGARDLESS OF THE NUMBER OF  ND
)@@G@@@#@@@@       ERRORS.    @G@@@@ C     CHECK ALL SUBSCRIPTS AT EXECUTION TNE
)@@G@@IME, AND TERMINATE EXECU-     @D@@@@       TION WITH A MESSAGE IF THE RANF
)@@G@@NGE IS EXCEEDED.  @D@@@@ D     TURN ON THE DIAGNOSTIC SYSTEM.  SEE SEC. NG
)@@G@@11.6  @E@@@@ E     TERMINATE THE RUN IN ERROR IF THIS COMPILATION IS NOTNH
)@@G@@@#@@@@       ERROR-FREE.@A@@@@ F     COMPILE A FORTRAN PROGRAM.   @E@@@@NI
)@@G@@ G*    INPUT FROM COMPRESSED SYMBOLIC CARDS (COLS 1-80)     @D@@@@ H*   NJ
)@@G@@ INPUT FROM COMPRESSED SYMBOLIC (COLS 1-72)     @B@@@@ I*    INPUT A NEWNK
)@@G@@ PROGRAM FROM CARDS     @D@@@@ J*    OUTPUT COMPRESSED SYMBOLIC TO PROGRNL
)@@G@@AM FILE     @F@@@@ K*    CHECK SEQUENCE NUMBERS OF CC73-80.  MUST BE USENM
)@@G@@D WITH 'H'  @#@@@@       OPTION.    @B@@@@ L*    LIST THE OBJECT PROGRAMNN
)@@G@@ GENERATED. @ @@@@ M     COMPILE A MAD PROGRAM. @ @@@@ N*    GIVE NO PRONO
)@@G@@GRAM LISTING@A@@@@ O     SUPPRESS ALL OPTIMIZATION.   @D@@@@ R     INVERNP
)@@G@@T STATUS OF REMOTE FLAG (BATCH VS. DEMAND)@C@@@@ S*    PROVIDE A COMPLETNQ
)@@G@@E SOURCE PROGRAM LISTING@B@@@@ T     LIST COMPILER TIMES BY PASS NUMBER.NR
)@@G@@@B@@@@ U*    UPDATE THE SOURCE INPUT ELEMENT.   @F@@@@ V     OUTPUT AN ANS
)@@G@@SSEMBLY-LANGUAGE SYMBOLIC OBJECT ELEMENT TO THE @F@@@@       SOURCE OUTPNT
)@@G@@UT FIELD (WHICH MUST SPECIFY A DIFFERENT FILE   @ @@@@       THAN THE RENU
)@@G@@L.OUT.)     @F@@@@ W*    LIST SOURCE MODIFICATION CARDS WITH SOURCE PROGNV
)@@G@@RAM LISTING @E@@@@ X*    ABORT THE RUN IF THE COMPILATION IS NOT ERROR-FNW
)@@G@@REE   @G@@@@ Y     PROVIDE AN EXECUTION-TIME STATEMENT TRACE (SEE SECTIONX
)@@G@@N 11.3)     @C@@@@ Z     ALLOW ZERO ELEMENT IN FORTRAN PROGRAM    @[@@@@NY
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @D@@@@ *     CONSIDERED A 'STANDARD' PROCESSOR-CALL OPNZ
)@@G@@TION. @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971OA
)@@G@@ VERSION)         11- 13@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      OB
)@@G@@@ @@@@ 11. 3. 1.   ASSUMED OPTIONS  @[@@@@      @E@@@@       THE 'F' OPTOC
)@@G@@ION IS ASSUMED IF THE CORRESPONDING 'M'   @F@@@@ NEGATIVE OPTION IS NOT OD
)@@G@@SPECIFIED.  THE 'M' OPTION CARRIES ALONG  @^@@@@ THE 'Z' OPTION WITH IT.OE
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       IF INITIAL COMPILATION MODE IS MAD, THEN ARRAY OF
)@@G@@STORAGE IS BY     @F@@@@ ROWS; IF INITIAL COMPILATION MODE IS FORTRAN, TOG
)@@G@@HEN ARRAY STORAGE @F@@@@ IS BY COLUMNS.  IF INITIAL COMPILATION MODE IS OH
)@@G@@FORTRAN, THEN AN  @F@@@@ IMPLICIT INTEGER TYPE FOR NAMES BEGINNING WITH OI
)@@G@@THE LETTERS 'I'   @ @@@@ THROUGH 'N' IS GENERATED.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@OJ
)@@G@@ IF NEITHER THE 'N' NOR THE 'S' OPTION IS SPECIFIED, THE ONLY     @F@@@@OK
)@@G@@ LISTED CARDS WILL BE THOSE IN WHICH AN ERROR HAS BEEN DETECTED.  @F@@@@OL
)@@G@@ THE CARD(S) IN ERROR WILL BE PRINTED IMMEDIATELY ABOVE THE ERROR @]@@@@OM
)@@G@@ MESSAGE.   @[@@@@      @B@@@@ 11. 3. 2.   MISCELLANEOUS CONSIDERATIONS ON
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@       WHEN THE 'V' OPTION IS USED, THE ASSEMBLY LISTIOO
)@@G@@NG PRODUCED @F@@@@ BY THE 'L' OPTION IS EXPANDED TO INCLUDE STORAGE ALLOOP
)@@G@@CATION.  THE@F@@@@ STORAGE ALLOCATION IS IN INCLUDED IN THE OUTPUT SYMBOOQ
)@@G@@LIC ELEMENT.@F@@@@ VARIABLE NAMES WHICH MATCH REGISTER OR J-DESIGNATOR NOR
)@@G@@AMES DEFINED@F@@@@ BY 'AXR$' WILL CAUSE 'T' OR 'D' FLAGS IN THE ASSEMBLYOS
)@@G@@ OF THE     @G@@@@ SOURCE OUTPUT.  BECAUSE THE RELOCATABLE OUTPUT AND ASOT
)@@G@@SEMBLY SOURCE     @F@@@@ OUTPUT ARE BOTH GENERATED IN PASS 4 OF THE COMPOU
)@@G@@ILER, THEY MUST BE@F@@@@ OUTPUT TO SEPARATE FILES.  IF THE 'V' OPTION SPOV
)@@G@@ECIFIES SOURCE    @F@@@@ OUTPUT TO THE SAME FILE AS THE RELOCATABLE OUTPOW
)@@G@@UT DESTINATION, IT@#@@@@ WILL BE IGNORED. @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@OX
)@@G@@ 11. 4.   OVERALL DECK SETUP  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE COY
)@@G@@ONTROL CARDS REFERENCED IN THIS SECTION ARE ALL INDEXED     @E@@@@ AND DOZ

)@@G@@ANDING, BUT NOT THE ROTE DUPLICATION, OF THIS SECTION.@[@@@@      @F@@@@PC

)@@G@@URE.  @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971PG

)@@G@@@]@@@@ ALIKE.     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @C@@@@ 12. 1.   EXECUTION-TIMEPL
)@@G@@ SUBSCRIPT CHECKING     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@       IF THE 'C' PM
)@@G@@OPTION IS USED ON THE PROCESSOR-CALL CARD, ALL  @F@@@@ SUBSCRIPTS WILL BPN
)@@G@@E CHECKED AGAINST LEGAL MAXIMUM, AND IN THE CASE@F@@@@ OF NEGATIVE SUBSCPO
)@@G@@RIPTS, LEGAL MINIMUM.  IF A SUBSCRIPT IS EXCEE- @#@@@@ DED, THE MESSAGE PP
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @C@@@@       SUBSCRIPT OUT OF RANGE:  <SUBSCRIPT>     @[@@@@PQ
)@@G@@      @F@@@@ FOLLOWED BY AN ERROR TRACE, WILL BE PRINTED.  <SUBSCRIPT> IPR
)@@G@@S THE @B@@@@ LINEAR SUBSCRIPT WHICH WAS OUT OF RANGE. @[@@@@      @[@@@@PS
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@ 12. 2.   STATEMENT TRACE     @[@@@@      @[@@@@PT
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       IF THE 'Y' OPTION IS USED WHEN COMPILING A RALPH SUBRPU
)@@G@@OUTINE,     @F@@@@ THEN WHILE THAT SUBROUTINE IS EXECUTING, AN ALTERNATEPV
)@@G@@ PRINT FILE @F@@@@ WILL BE AUTOMATICALLY GENERATED AND PRINTED.  THIS FIPW
)@@G@@LE WILL     @F@@@@ CONTAIN A STATEMENT-BY-STATEMENT TRACE OF THE PROGRAMPX
)@@G@@ EXECUTION  @F@@@@ FLOW, WITH PRINTOUT IN THE FORM OF 20 OCTAL STATEMENTPY
)@@G@@ NUMBERS PER@F@@@@ LINE, WITH THE DECK NAME PRINTED WHENEVER IT CHANGES.PZ
)@@G@@  THE NUMBER@F@@@@ PRINTED IS THE NUMBER CORRESPONDING TO THE SECOND COLQA
)@@G@@UMN OF NUM- @C@@@@ BERS PRINTED ON THE SOURCE PROGRAM LISTING.    @[@@@@QB
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@ 12. 3.   ARGUMENT WALK-BACK  @[@@@@      @[@@@@QC
)@@G@@      @F@@@@       WHENEVER A FATAL ERROR IS MADE AND IT IS POSSIBLE FORQD
)@@G@@ THE  @F@@@@ MONITOR TO DETERMINE THE EXECUTION FLOW WHICH LED TO THE ERQE
)@@G@@ROR, A@F@@@@ COMPLETE 'WALK-BACK', OR SUBROUTINE-CALL TRACE, WILL BE PRIQF
)@@G@@NTED  @#@@@@ WHICH INCLUDES   @[@@@@      @#@@@@       DECK NAME  @A@@@@QG
)@@G@@       RELATIVE LOCATION OF CALL    @A@@@@       LINE NUMBER IN SOURCE PQH
)@@G@@ROGRAM@C@@@@       OCTAL VALUES OF ALL ARGUMENTS TO CALL    @[@@@@      QI
)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSIQJ
)@@G@@ON)         12-  2@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@ IF AN ARGUMQK
)@@G@@ENT IS DOUBLE-PRECISION OR COMPLEX, BOTH OCTAL WORDS  @#@@@@ WILL BE PRIQL
)@@G@@NTED  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ 12. 4.   SYMBOL ONE-LINK WARNING   QM
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       WHENEVER A PROGRAM VARIABLE OCCURS QN
)@@G@@ONLY ONCE IN THE PROGRAM,     @F@@@@ THE COMPILER ASSUMES THAT A SPELLINQO
)@@G@@G OR KEYPUNCHING ERROR HAS    @C@@@@ OCCURRED AND PRINTS AN ERROR (WARNIQP
)@@G@@NG) MESSAGE.@F@@@@ SIMILARLY, IF THE COMPILER HAS NOT DETECTED A VALUE AQQ
)@@G@@SSIGNED TO A@F@@@@ VARIABLE, EITHER BY READING A VALUE IN WITH A 'READ' QR
)@@G@@STATEMENT,  @G@@@@ REFERENCING IT ON THE LEFT SIDE OF AN EQUALS SIGN, ORQS
)@@G@@ INCLUDING IT     @F@@@@ IN A 'COMMON' OR DATA-INTRODUCTION STATEMENT OFQT
)@@G@@ SOME KIND, A     @ @@@@ MESSAGE WILL BE PRINTED.     @[@@@@      @[@@@@QU
)@@G@@      @C@@@@ 12. 5.   CONTINGENCY INTERCEPTION AND ANALYSIS @[@@@@      QV
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@       WHENEVER AN ERROR OCCURS WHOSE 'FATALITY LEVEL'QW
)@@G@@ IS HIGH    @G@@@@ ENOUGH TO WARRANT IMMEDIATE TERMINATION OF THE PROGRAQX
)@@G@@M, A STATE OF     @F@@@@ 'PROGRAM CONTINGENCY' IS DECLARED AND AN ERROR QY
)@@G@@TYPE CODE IS PRIN-@F@@@@ TED AFTER RETURNING CONTROL TO THE EXECUTIVE.  QZ
)@@G@@NORMALLY, THESE   @F@@@@ HIEROGLYPHIC MESSAGES MUST BE LOOKED UP IN THE RA
)@@G@@PROGRAMMERS' RE-  @F@@@@ FERENCE MANUAL.  THE RALPH EXECUTION MONITOR WIRB
)@@G@@LL INTERCEPT AND  @F@@@@ INTERPRET ALL PROGRAM CONTINGENCIES, PRINTING TRC
)@@G@@HE APPROPRIATE    @G@@@@ 1-LINE MESSAGE FROM A DICTIONARY OF OVER 50 DIFRD
)@@G@@FERENT MESSAGES.  A     @F@@@@ GREAT DEAL OF CARE IS TAKEN TO ENSURE THARE
)@@G@@T THESE MESSAGES ARE    @G@@@@ APPROPRIATE TO THE ERROR CONDITION, BUT ORF
)@@G@@CCASIONALLY THE INTERPRE-     @E@@@@ TER WILL BE OUTFOXED.  SEE SECTION RG
)@@G@@12.2 FOR A DISCUSSION OF@A@@@@ EXECUTION-MONITOR ERROR MESSAGES.  @[@@@@RH
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@ 12. 6.   DUMP SYMBOL TABLE   @[@@@@RI
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE CONVERSATIONAL PMD PROCESSOR (CPMD) CRJ
)@@G@@AN WORK IN CONJUNCTION  @E@@@@ WITH THE RALPH COMPILER TO ALLOW A VARIABRK
)@@G@@LE-NAME DUMP MODE @F@@@@ FOR DUMPING RALPH PROGRAMS.  THE NAME-MODE DUMPRL
)@@G@@ REQUIRES THAT    @F@@@@ RALPH GENERATE A SYMBOL TABLE DESCRIBING THE NARM
)@@G@@ME, ADDRESS, MODE,@F@@@@ DIMENSIONALITY, ETC. OF PROGRAM VARIABLES, AND RN
)@@G@@THAT THIS TABLE BE@F@@@@ CONTAINED IN THE OBJECT PROGRAM SO THAT IT MAY RO
)@@G@@BE FOUND BY THE   @F@@@@ DUMP PROCESSOR.  COMPILING A RALPH PROGRAM WITHRP
)@@G@@ THE 'D' OPTION   @C@@@@ SET WILL CAUSE THIS TABLE TO BE GENERATED.     RQ
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ 12. 7.   'D'-OPTION COMPILE SWITCH.@[@@@@RR
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)   RS
)@@G@@      12-  3@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@       NORMALLY, ART
)@@G@@NY CARD WITH THE LETTER 'D' IN COLUMN 1 WILL    @E@@@@ BE TREATED AS IF RU
)@@G@@IT HAD A 'C' IN COLUMN 1--I.E. IT WILL    @D@@@@ BE IGNORED BY THE COMPIRV
)@@G@@LER AND PRINTED AS A COMMENT. @D@@@@ IF THE 'D' OPTION (DIAGNOSTIC) IS SRW
)@@G@@PECIFIED ON THE   @D@@@@ PROCESSOR-CALL CARD, HOWEVER, THE 'D' WILL BE IRX
)@@G@@GNORED@E@@@@ AND THE STATEMENT WILL BE COMPILED.  THIS FEATURE PERMITS  RY
)@@G@@@D@@@@ THE PROGRAMMER TO INSERT DIAGNOSTIC PRINT AND DUMP   @E@@@@ STATERZ
)@@G@@MENTS INTO HIS PROGRAM FOR USE WITH THE 'D' OPTION,   @E@@@@ AND THEN TOSA
)@@G@@ HAVE THEM MAGICALLY VANISH (UNTIL NEEDED AGAIN)@A@@@@ WHEN THE 'D' OPTISB
)@@G@@ON IS REMOVED.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WSC
)@@G@@ITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         13-  1@[@@@@      @[@@@@      SD
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @^@@@@ 13.   ERROR MESSAGES   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@SE
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ 13. 1.   COMPILER ERROR MESSAGES   SF
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       FOR REASONS OF INTERNAL EFFICIENCY,SG
)@@G@@ THE COMPILER PRINTS ONLY     @F@@@@ A BRIEF 1-LINE ERROR MESSAGE WHEN ASH
)@@G@@N ERROR IS ENCOUNTERED.  EVERY@F@@@@ ATTEMPT HAS BEEN MADE TO KEEP THE MSI
)@@G@@ESSAGES WITHIN THE BOUNDS OF  @F@@@@ SOBER LITERACY WHILE DRAWING FROM ASJ
)@@G@@ VOCABULARY OF LESS THAN 200  @F@@@@ WORDS.  THE STILTED GRAMMAR OF SOMESK
)@@G@@ OF THE MESSAGES IS NOT DUE TO@F@@@@ THE IGNORANCE OF THEIR WRITER (WHO SL
)@@G@@IS ALSO THE AUTHOR OF THIS    @F@@@@ MANUAL) BUT TO THE SEVERELY LIMITEDSM
)@@G@@ VOCABULARY FROM WHICH ONE IS @F@@@@ FORCED TO DRAW.  THIS CHAPTER HAS BSN
)@@G@@EEN INCLUDED TO AID THE BEGIN-@C@@@@ NING OR BAFFLED USER IN DEBUGGING HSO
)@@G@@IS PROGRAMS.@[@@@@      @B@@@@       THE FORMAT OF AN ERROR MESSAGE IS  SP
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @C@@@@ <<< LEVEL  LOCATION .... TEXT OF ERROR MESSAGE @[@@@@SQ
)@@G@@      @F@@@@       THE LOCATION IS THE ABSOLUTE CORE LOCATION WITHIN THESR
)@@G@@ RALPH@E@@@@ COMPILER WHERE THE ERROR WAS CALLED.  THERE THREE LEVELS OFSS
)@@G@@@]@@@@ ERRORS.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@       A 'WARNING' IS INSERTED AS A ST
)@@G@@SUGGESTION THAT THERE MIGHT BE@G@@@@ SOMETHING WRONG, ALTHOUGH THE COMPISU
)@@G@@LER IS PERFECTLY WILLING TO LET     @F@@@@ IT PASS.  AN 'ERROR' IS JUST SV
)@@G@@THAT:  SOMETHING IS WRONG WITH THE  @F@@@@ SOURCE CODE.  A 'DISASTER' ISSW
)@@G@@ AN ERROR FROM WHICH THE COMPILER   @F@@@@ CANNOT RECOVER, OR WHICH WOULSX
)@@G@@D MAKE EXECUTION MEANINGLESS.  A    @F@@@@ 'DISASTER' WILL TERMINATE THESY
)@@G@@ COMPILATION AT THE END OF THE CUR- @^@@@@ RENT COMPILER PHASE.   @[@@@@SZ
)@@G@@      @F@@@@       ALL PASS 1 ERROR MESSAGES ARE PRINTED IMMEDIATELY AFTTA
)@@G@@ER THE@F@@@@ STATEMENT (AND ASSOCIATED COMMENT CARDS) TO WHICH THEY APPLTB
)@@G@@Y.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@       THESE MESSAGES WILL EVENTUALLY BE IN ALPHTC
)@@G@@ABETICAL ORDER;   @F@@@@ RIGHT NOW THEY ARE IN THE SAME ORDER AS OUR INTTD
)@@G@@ERNAL TABLES SO   @C@@@@ THAT WE CAN FIND THEM.  PLEASE BEAR WITH US.   TE
)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSITF
)@@G@@ON)         13-  3@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @D@@@@ ILLEGAL STATG
)@@G@@TEMENT IN SCOPE OF SIMPLE CONDITIONAL.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@           (TH
)@@G@@PASS 1).  A SIMPLE CONDITIONAL MAY NOT CONTAIN CERTAIN@F@@@@       TYPESTI
)@@G@@ OF STATEMENTS.  SEE SECTION 5.3.1 FOR A DISCUSSION OF@ @@@@       SIMPLTJ
)@@G@@E CONDITIONALS.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ CORRECTION CARD SEQUENCTK
)@@G@@E ERROR.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@           (PASS 1).  WHEN CORRECTION CARDTL
)@@G@@S ARE BEING USED TO     @E@@@@       UPDATE A PROGRAM FROM A PROGRAM FILTM
)@@G@@E, THEY MUST BE IN@F@@@@       STRICTLY INCREASING ORDER NUMERICALLY BY TN
)@@G@@LINE NUMBER.  ANY @D@@@@       ATTEMPT TO BACK UP FOR A CORRECTION IS ILTO
)@@G@@LEGAL.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@ ILLEGAL STATEMENT FORMATION. @[@@@@TP
)@@G@@      @F@@@@           (PASS 1).  SOMEWHAT GENERAL ERROR MESSAGE.  USUALTQ
)@@G@@LY,   @F@@@@       THIS ERROR IS CALLED WHEN AN ERROR IN PUNCTUATION PRETR
)@@G@@VENTS @F@@@@       THE EXACT ANALYSIS OF WHAT IS WRONG WITH A STATEMENT.TS
)@@G@@  SEE @F@@@@       THE DESCRIPTION OF THE PARTICULAR STATEMENT AT HAND FTT
)@@G@@OR    @ @@@@       FURTHER INFORMATION.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@TU
)@@G@@ INTERNAL COMPILER ERROR.     @[@@@@      @F@@@@           (ALL PASSES).TV
)@@G@@  RALPH NEEDS ITS HEAD EXAMINED.  SEE YOUR@D@@@@       FRIENDLY LOCAL SYTW
)@@G@@STEMS-STAFF PROGRAM DOCTOR.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@ TOO MANY PATX
)@@G@@RAMETERS.   @G@@@@           (PASS 1).  THE PARAMETER TABLE HAS BEEN EXCTY
)@@G@@EEDED.  THERE     @F@@@@       IS NO CURE FOR THIS PROBLEM EXCEPT TO USETZ
)@@G@@ FEWER 'PARAMETER'@#@@@@       STATEMENTS.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@UA
)@@G@@ ILLEGAL USE OF DUMMY VARIABLE '---'.     @[@@@@      @F@@@@           (UB
)@@G@@PASS 1).  A DUMMY VARIABLE IS A FUNCTION PARAMETER.   @F@@@@       THEREUC
)@@G@@ ARE CERTAIN CONTEXTS IN WHICH IT IS ILLEGAL TO USE A @F@@@@       FUNCTUD
)@@G@@ION PARAMETER, SUCH AS STATEMENT LABELS, FUNCTION     @D@@@@       NAMESUE
)@@G@@, EQUIVALENCE DECLARATIONS, AND SUCH.     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@UF
)@@G@@ TABLE SIZE EXCEEDED IN '---' TABLE.@[@@@@      @F@@@@           (ALL PAUG
)@@G@@SSES).  AN INTERNAL TABLE HAS BEEN FILLED TO    @F@@@@       OVERFLOWINGUH
)@@G@@.  FOR PROGRAMS OF MODERATE SIZE, THIS IS DUE TO@G@@@@       SLOPPY PROGUI
)@@G@@RAMMING HABITS.  THE TABLES IN RALPH WHICH CAN BE     @ @@@@       OVERFUJ
)@@G@@LOWN (?) ARE:     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DUK
)@@G@@ECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         13-  4@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      UL
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       MST--   MAIN SYMBOL TABLE.  ALL VARIABLES, STATUM
)@@G@@EMENT LABELS,     @F@@@@               FUNCTION PARAMETERS, ETC. GO IN TUN
)@@G@@HE MST.  THE ABC  @G@@@@               COMES IN FROM THE BACK OF THE MSTUO
)@@G@@, SO IT IS POSSIBLE     @F@@@@               TO EXCEED THE SIZE OF THE MUP
)@@G@@ST BECAUSE THE ABC WAS  @A@@@@               TOO BIG.  SEE BELOW. @[@@@@UQ
)@@G@@      @F@@@@       ABC--   ABSOLUTE CONSTANT TABLE.  ALL CONSTANTS GO INUR
)@@G@@ THE  @G@@@@               ABC.  THE ABC COMES IN FROM THE BACK END OF TUS
)@@G@@HE MST,     @F@@@@               SO THAT IT IS POSSIBLE TO HAVE AN ABC OUT
)@@G@@VERFLOW     @E@@@@               CAUSED BY TOO MUCH IN THE MST.  SEE ABOUU
)@@G@@VE.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       DIM--   DIMENSION TABLE.  ALL 'DIMENSION'UV
)@@G@@ STATEMENTS PRODUCE     @F@@@@               ENTRIES IN THE DIM TABLE.  UW
)@@G@@IF IT IS EXCEEDED, THEN @F@@@@               THERE ARE TOO MANY SUBSCRIPUX
)@@G@@TS ON TOO MANY VARIABLES@G@@@@               AS DIMENSIONED.  ONLY THE NUY
)@@G@@UMBER OF DIMENSION STATE-     @F@@@@               MENTS, AND NOT THE SIUZ
)@@G@@ZE, HAS ANY EFFECT ON THE     @B@@@@               OVERFLOW OF THIS TABLVA
)@@G@@E.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@       ET--    EQUIVALENCE TABLE.  ALL 'EQUIVALEVB
)@@G@@NCE' STATEMENTS   @G@@@@               MAKE ENTRIES IN THE ET.  AN ET OVVC
)@@G@@ERFLOW IS CAUSED BY     @D@@@@               HAVING SIMPLY TOO MANY EQUIVD
)@@G@@VALENCES.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@       PCT--   PROGRAM COMMON TABLE.  ALL VE
)@@G@@'COMMON' DECLARATIONS   @F@@@@               MAKE ENTRIES IN THE PCT.  AVF
)@@G@@N OVERFLOW IS CAUSED BY @F@@@@               TOO MANY SEPARATE VARIABLESVG
)@@G@@ BEING DECLARED IN COM- @^@@@@               MON.     @[@@@@      @F@@@@VH
)@@G@@       CDIC--  CONTROL DICTIONARY.  ALL ENTRY POINTS, 'EXTERNAL'  @G@@@@VI
)@@G@@               DECLARATIONS, FUNCTION NAMES, AND INTERNAL FUNCTIONS     VJ
)@@G@@@ @@@@               GO IN THE CDIC.@[@@@@      @F@@@@       PL--    PARVK
)@@G@@AMETER LIST.  ALL INTERNAL FUNCTION PARAMETERS  @B@@@@               AREVL
)@@G@@ ENTERED IN THE PL.     @[@@@@      @F@@@@       XPL--   EXTERNAL PARAMEVM
)@@G@@TER LIST.  ALL EXTERNAL FUNCTION    @F@@@@               PARAMETERS ARE VN
)@@G@@ENTERED IN THE XPL.  THE PL AND XPL @F@@@@               ARE OVERFLOWED VO
)@@G@@IF THERE ARE TOO MANY DISTINCT PARA-@C@@@@               METERS OF THE RVP
)@@G@@ESPECTIVE TYPE.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@       MT--    MODE TABLE.  ALL OUTSVQ
)@@G@@TANDING MODE DECLARATIONS     @F@@@@               (THOSE FOR WHICH THE VR
)@@G@@DECLARED ITEM HAS NOT YET BEEN@F@@@@               ENCOUNTERED FOR THE FVS
)@@G@@IRST TIME) ARE KEPT IN THE MT.@G@@@@               MIXING MODE AND DIMENVT
)@@G@@SION STATEMENTS WILL OFTEN CURE     @ @@@@               AN MT OVERFLOW.VU
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       ERS--   ERASABLE TABLE.  ALL 'ERASABLE' DECLARAVV
)@@G@@TIONS ARE PUT     @F@@@@               IN THE 'ERS' TABLE.  IT IS OVERFLVW
)@@G@@OWED IF TOO MANY  @E@@@@               VARIABLES ARE DECLARED TO BE IN EVX
)@@G@@RASABLE.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RAVY
)@@G@@LPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         13-  5@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@VZ
)@@G@@      @F@@@@       FLAD--  FLOATING ADDRESS TABLE.  A FLOATING ADDRESS IWA
)@@G@@S A   @F@@@@               FORWARD TRANSFER OR OCCASIONALLY BACK TRANSFEWB
)@@G@@R TO A@E@@@@               COMPILER-GENERATED LABEL.  A 'THROUGH' LOOP  WC
)@@G@@@G@@@@               GENERATES 3 FLOATING ADDRESSES, A SIMPLE CONDITIONAWD
)@@G@@L     @F@@@@               GENERATES 1, A COMPOUND CONDITIONAL GENERATESWE
)@@G@@ 3 + 1@F@@@@               FOR EACH 'OR WHENEVER' OR 'OTHERWISE'.  A FUNWF
)@@G@@CTION @F@@@@               CALL WITH A SUBSCRIPTED VARIABLE AS AN ARGUMEWG
)@@G@@NT    @F@@@@               GENERATES 1 FLOATING ADDRESS; EACH ENTRY GENEWH
)@@G@@RATES @#@@@@               3. @[@@@@      @F@@@@       PARUSE-PARAMETER WI
)@@G@@USE TABLE.  EACH REFERENCE TO AN INTERNAL @G@@@@               OR EXTERNWJ
)@@G@@AL FUNCTION PARAMETER GENERATES AN ENTRY IN     @F@@@@               THEWK
)@@G@@ APPROPRIATE PARAMETER USE TABLE.  THE EXTERNAL @F@@@@               PARWL
)@@G@@AMETER USE TABLE IS DYNAMICALLY ASSIGNED FROM   @E@@@@               CODWM
)@@G@@E BUFFER SPACE, AND SHOULD NEVER OVERFLOW.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@WN
)@@G@@ ILLEGAL OR INCONSISTENT MODE.@[@@@@      @F@@@@           (PASS 1).  A WO
)@@G@@MODE DECLARATION CONFLICTS WITH A PREVIOUS@F@@@@       ONE, OR AN ATTEMPWP
)@@G@@T TO PRESET A VARIABLE TO A VALUE IN A    @ @@@@       DIFFERENT MODE, EWQ
)@@G@@TC.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ ILLEGAL USE OF CONTINUATION CARD.  WR
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@          (PASS 1).  A CONTINUATION CARD MAY NOT BE THWS
)@@G@@E FIRST     @E@@@@       NON-COMMENT CARD IN THE PROGRAM, THE FIRST CARDWT
)@@G@@ IN AN@E@@@@       'INCLUDE', OR THE FIRST CARD AFTER AN 'INCLUDE'.     WU
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ END OF PROGRAM ASSUMED BY COMPILER.@[@@@@WV
)@@G@@      @F@@@@           (PASS 1).  A MISSING 'END' CARD WAS FILLED IN BY WW
)@@G@@RALPH.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @C@@@@ ILLEGAL CHARACTER '-' IN COLUMN '--WX
)@@G@@' ON CARD.  @[@@@@      @F@@@@           (PASS 1).  THE CHARACTER '-' ISWY
)@@G@@ ILLEGAL AS USED.  THIS @F@@@@       IS USUALLY BECAUSE A STATEMENT HAS WZ
)@@G@@STARTED IN THE WRONG    @G@@@@       COLUMN, AND AN ILLEGAL CONTINUATIONXA
)@@G@@ CHARACTER (MAD ONLY) HAS     @#@@@@       BEEN FOUND.@[@@@@      @[@@@@XB
)@@G@@      @D@@@@ THE VARIABLE NAME BEGINNING '------' IS TOO LONG.    @[@@@@XC
)@@G@@      @F@@@@           (PASS 1).  VARIABLE NAMES ARE LIMITED TO 6 CHARACXD
)@@G@@TERS. @G@@@@       THERE IS A CHARACTER COMBINATION LONGER THAN 6 CHARACXE
)@@G@@TERS IN     @F@@@@       A CONTEXT WHERE A VARIABLE NAME IS EXPECTED.  TXF

)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSIXH
)@@G@@ON)         13-  6@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@XI
)@@G@@      @A@@@@ UNRECOGNIZABLE STATEMENT IGNORED.  @[@@@@      @F@@@@      XJ

)@@G@@ IS EXPECTED IS ASSUMED TO BE AN OPERATOR.@E@@@@       ONLY LETTERS ARE XQ

)@@G@@LATANTLY OBVIOUS AS TO REMOVE THE NEED FOR@G@@@@       ELUCIDATION OF THXU
)@@G@@E COMPLAINT, OR, QUITE HONESTLY, THE COMPI-     @F@@@@       LER KNOWS SXV
)@@G@@OMETHING IS WRONG BUT HASN'T THE SLIGHTEST IDEA @^@@@@       EXACTLY WHAXW
)@@G@@T.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @C@@@@ MISSING END OF CONDITIONAL OR ILLEGXX
)@@G@@AL NESTING. @[@@@@      @F@@@@           (PASS 1).  A COMPOUND CONDITIONXY

)@@G@@BUT STARTED OUTSIDE.  ANY     @F@@@@       REFERENCE TO THIS 'END OF CONYA
)@@G@@DITIONAL' WILL BE SHUNTED TO A@ @@@@       SYSTEM ERROR CALL.     @[@@@@YB

)@@G@@T FOUND TO CLOSE A@F@@@@       LOOP.  IF AN OUTER LOOP IS 'CLOSED' BEFORYE

)@@G@@ION OR THE END OF PROGRAM HAS @^@@@@       BEEN ENCOUNTERED.@[@@@@      YK
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @ @@@@ TOO MANY EQUIVALENCE GROUPS. @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDYL
)@@G@@E TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         13-  7@[@@@@YM
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@           (PASS 1).  TOYN

)@@G@@CK.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@           (PASS 1).  THE '...' BLOCK OPERATOR HEF

)@@G@@E OF VARIABLE NAME,     @ @@@@       I.E. A(1)...B(12).     @[@@@@      EI
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @ @@@@ VARIABLE GROUP TOO LONG.     @[@@@@      @F@@@@      EJ
)@@G@@     (PASS 1).  IN A FORTRAN 'DATA' STATEMENT, THE VARIABLE @F@@@@      EK

)@@G@@ MESSAGE WILL ARISE IF THERE ARE MORE VARIABLES THAN LI-    @#@@@@      EM
)@@G@@ TERALS.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @C@@@@ REDEFINITION OF DIMENSION VECEN
)@@G@@TORS NOT ALLOWED. @[@@@@      @F@@@@           (PASS 1).  A 'DIMENSION' EO
)@@G@@STATEMENT SPECIFYING MULTIPLE @F@@@@       SUBSCRIPTS, AND THUS SETTING EP
)@@G@@UP A DIMENSION VECTOR, MAY NOT@D@@@@       BE GIVEN MORE THAN ONCE FOR TEQ
)@@G@@HE SAME VARIABLE. @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@ ILLEGAL SUBSCRIPT FORMAER
)@@G@@TION. @[@@@@      @F@@@@           (PASS 1).  A NONSTANDARD-BASE DIMENSIES
)@@G@@ON STATEMENT MUST @F@@@@       SPECIFY THE SMALLER SUBSCRIPT OF A RANGE ET
)@@G@@FIRST.  THE ORDER @C@@@@       IS REVERSED INTERNALLY BY THE COMPILER.  EU
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@ CONSTANT GROUP TOO LONG.     @[@@@@      EV
)@@G@@@F@@@@           (PASS 1).  IN A FORTRAN 'DATA' STATEMENT, THE VARIABLE EW

)@@G@@@E@@@@       MESSAGE WILL ARISE IF THERE ARE MORE LITERALS THAN   @#@@@@EY
)@@G@@       VARIABLES. @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @E@@@@ ARITHMETIC IF HAS MISSIEZ
)@@G@@NG LABEL OR ILLEGAL PUNCTUATION.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@           (PASS 1FA

)@@G@@RMAT STATEMENT OR AN EXECUTABLE STATEMENT.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@FK

)@@G@@MBOL IN A MODE, EQUIVALENCE, COMMON,@F@@@@       ETC.  DECLARATION WAS NMO

)@@G@@SHOULD NOT?) EXIST.  IF IT DOES, . .@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMQ
)@@G@@MING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         13- 20@[@@@@      @[@@@@MR
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@ 13. 2.   EXECUTION-MONIMS
)@@G@@TOR ERROR MESSAGES@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THOSE ERRORS WHICMT
)@@G@@H ARE PRIMARILY LOGIC ERRORS RATHER THAN SYNTAX @F@@@@ ERRORS CANNOT BE MU
)@@G@@DETECTED DURING COMPILATION BY THE COMPILER.    @G@@@@ THESE LOGIC ERRORMV
)@@G@@S INSTEAD MUST BE DETECTED DURING PROGRAM EXECUTION.  @E@@@@ THE RALPH EMW
)@@G@@XECUTION MONITOR IS A SUBROUTINE WHOSE NAME IS  @F@@@@ 'H$MONITOR'.  THIMX
)@@G@@S SUBROUTINE DETECTS EXECUTION ERRORS AND PRINTS@A@@@@ OUT AN APPROPRIATMY
)@@G@@E ERROR MESSAGE.  @[@@@@      @C@@@@       EXECUTION ERRORS ARE OF TWO BMZ
)@@G@@ASIC TYPES: @[@@@@      @A@@@@       1)  SYSTEM SUBROUTINE ERRORS @A@@@@NA
)@@G@@       2)  PROGRAM CONTINGENCIES.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE FIRST TNB
)@@G@@YPE OF ERROR, THE SYSTEM SUBROUTINE ERROR, IS ONE     @[@@@@ WHICH@G@@@@NC
)@@G@@ IS DETECTED BY A SYSTEM SUBROUTINE IN THE COURSE OF ITS PERFORMING     ND
)@@G@@@F@@@@ ITS TASK.  FOR THIS TYPE OF ERROR, IT IS POSSIBLE TO PRINT THE   NE
)@@G@@@E@@@@ DECK NAME AND LINE NUMBER OF THE SUBROUTINE WHICH COMMITTED@C@@@@NF
)@@G@@ THE ERROR.  A WALK-BACK TRACE IS ALSO PRINTED. @[@@@@      @G@@@@      NG
)@@G@@ THE SECOND TYPE OF ERROR, THE PROGRAM CONTINGENCY, IS AN ERROR   @E@@@@NH
)@@G@@ WHICH WAS INTERCEPTED BY THE COMPUTER HARDWARE AND WHICH   @E@@@@ COMPLNI
)@@G@@ETELY PREVENTS FURTHER EXECUTION.  THIS TYPE OF ERROR @F@@@@ INCLUDES GUNJ
)@@G@@ARD-MODE VIOLATIONS, ETC., AND IS AN ABSOLUTE AND     @F@@@@ IRREVERSIBLNK
)@@G@@E ERROR.  THESE ERRORS ARE MUCH MORE DIFFICULT TO     @F@@@@ TRACK DOWN NL
)@@G@@TO THE COMPILER LEVEL, AS IT IS NEARLY IMPOSSIBLE     @E@@@@ FOR THE EXENM
)@@G@@CUTION MONITOR TO DETERMINE THE DECK NAME AND   @B@@@@ LINE NUMBER FROM NN
)@@G@@A CONTINGENCY ADDRESS.  @[@@@@      @E@@@@       THE CONVERSATIONAL POSTNO
)@@G@@ MORTEM DUMP PROCESSOR (CPMD) @F@@@@ CONTAINS A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF AUTOMANP
)@@G@@TIC-LOCATION CODE TO HELP     @E@@@@ THE PROGRAMMER DETERMINE WHICH SOURNQ
)@@G@@CE STATEMENT CAUSED A   @F@@@@ PARTICULAR CONTINGENCY, BUT FOR THE MOST NR
)@@G@@PART, THE PROGRAMMER    @F@@@@ IS ON HIS OWN.  THIS IS WHAT THE ART OF DNS
)@@G@@EBUGGING IS ALL ABOUT.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@      NT
)@@G@@ THE FOLLOWING ERRORS ARE INTERCEPTED BY THE EXECUTION ERROR@]@@@@ MONITNU
)@@G@@OR:   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @E@@@@ ATTEMPT TO EXECUTE STATEMENT WITH SNV
)@@G@@OURCE PROGRAM ERROR.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@               THE COMPILER DENW
)@@G@@TECTED A NON-FATAL ERROR IN THE USER@F@@@@       PROGRAM AND CHOSE TO IGNX
)@@G@@NORE THE STATEMENT.  IN ORDER TO    @F@@@@       PREVENT COSTLY LOOPS, ENY
)@@G@@TC., AN ERROR CALL WAS INSERTED IN  @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMNZ
)@@G@@MING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         13- 21@[@@@@      @[@@@@OA
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@       PLACE OF THE STATEMENT.  THE ERROR CALL POB
)@@G@@RINTS THIS ERROR  @F@@@@       MESSAGE, AND THEN TERMINATES EXECUTION OFOC
)@@G@@ THE PROGRAM.     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ SUBSCRIPT OUT OF RANGE-OD
)@@G@@-   NNNNNNNN@[@@@@      @F@@@@               THE 'C' OPTION WAS SPECIFIEOE
)@@G@@D ON A RALPH COMPILATION@F@@@@       TO INTERCEPT OUT-OF-RANGE SUBSCRIPTOF
)@@G@@S, AND IT CAUGHT ONE.   @D@@@@       THE ILLEGAL VALUE IS PRINTED OUT ASOG
)@@G@@ 'NNNNNNNN'.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@ ERROR RETURN TO SYSTEM @^@@@@OH
)@@G@@ UNDEFINED ERROR RETURN @[@@@@      @E@@@@               THE MAD 'ERROR OI
)@@G@@RETURN' FEATURE WAS USED IN A @F@@@@       SUBROUTINE AS AN ALTERNATE REOJ
)@@G@@TURN, BUT THE CALLING PROGRAM @F@@@@       DID NOT PROVIDE AN ADDITIONALOK
)@@G@@ ARGUMENT TO USE AS AN ERROR  @E@@@@       RETURN.  THE ERROR RETURN IS OL
)@@G@@THUS INTERCEPTED BY THE @D@@@@       SYSTEM AND CAUSES AN ERROR PROGRAM OM
)@@G@@TERMINATION.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @D@@@@ PROGRAM CONTINGENCY AT 'XXXXXON
)@@G@@X'--PREVIOUSLY IGNORED. @[@@@@      @G@@@@               CERTAIN TYPES OOO
)@@G@@F PROGRAM CONTINGENCIES ARE ALLOWED TO    @F@@@@       HAPPEN TWICE BEFOOP
)@@G@@RE THEY ARE DECLARED FATAL.  THESE ARE    @F@@@@       THE UNDERFLOW, OVOQ
)@@G@@ERFLOW, AND DIVIDE FAULT CONTINGENCIES.   @F@@@@       THE FIRST OCCURREOR
)@@G@@NCE OF THESE WILL SET A SWITCH IN THE     @E@@@@       EXECUTION MONITOROS
)@@G@@ WHICH CAN BE CLEARED VIA CALLS TO  @E@@@@       THE FORTRAN SUBROUTINESOT
)@@G@@ 'DIVCHK' AND 'OVERFL'.  IF A @E@@@@       SECOND CONTINGENCY OF THE SAMOU
)@@G@@E TYPE OCCURS BEFORE THE@F@@@@       FIRST ONE HAS BEEN TESTED AND CLEAROV
)@@G@@ED, THEN IT IS OBVIOUS  @F@@@@       THAT THE PROGRAMMER HAS NO INTENTIOOW
)@@G@@N OF EVER TESTING OR    @C@@@@       CLEARING, AND HIS PROGRAM IS TERMINOX
)@@G@@ATED. @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ CALL ON NON-EXISTENT SUBROUTINE.   OY
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@               A SUBROUTINE WAS CALLED BUT NOT DEFINEDOZ
)@@G@@.  SEE THE MAP    @F@@@@       DIAGNOSTICS FOR CLUES AS TO WHAT SUBROUTIPA
)@@G@@NE MIGHT NOT HAVE @F@@@@       BEEN DEFINED.  THERE IS NO WAY OF TELLINGPB
)@@G@@ AT EXECUTION     @E@@@@       TIME WHAT THE NAME OF THE UNDEFINED SUBROPC
)@@G@@UTINE WAS-- @E@@@@       SUBROUTINE NAMES HAVE LONG SINCE BEEN REPLACED PD
)@@G@@BY    @A@@@@       NUMERICAL CORE ADDRESSES.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      PE
)@@G@@@E@@@@ VIOLATION OF PROGRAM LIMITS.  PROBABLE SUBSCRIPT ERROR.    @[@@@@PF
)@@G@@      @G@@@@               A 'GUARD MODE VIOLATION' INTERRUPT HAS OCCURRPG
)@@G@@ED.  THIS   @F@@@@       ERROR IS THE MOST COMMON ONE TO OCCUR IN PROGRAPH
)@@G@@MS WHICH    @E@@@@       ARE UNDER DEVELOPMENT.  IT MEANS THAT THE PROGRPI
)@@G@@AM HAS@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971PJ
)@@G@@ VERSION)         13- 22@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @E@@@@      PK
)@@G@@ TRIED TO ACCESS CORE MEMORY WHICH IT HAS NOT BEEN    @F@@@@       ASSIGPL
)@@G@@NED--I.E. CORE WHICH IS NOT A PART OF THAT PROGRAM.   @E@@@@       THE UPM
)@@G@@SUAL CAUSE OF A STORAGE LIMITS VIOLATION IS A   @E@@@@       SUBSCRIPT WPN
)@@G@@HICH IS LARGER THAN THE ORIGINAL DIMENSION@E@@@@       LIMITS.  STORAGE PO
)@@G@@LIMITS VIOLATIONS CAN ALSO OCCUR    @D@@@@       (UNFORTUNATELY) IN THE PP
)@@G@@FORMAT-SCANNER WHEN THE @E@@@@       PARENTHESES IN A FORMAT STATEMENT APQ
)@@G@@RE NOT BALANCED.  @D@@@@       OTHER COMMON CAUSES ARE:  INCONSISTENCY OPR
)@@G@@F MODE@E@@@@       DECLARATION FOR SUBROUTINE PARAMETERS, FORGETTING TO PS
)@@G@@@F@@@@       DIMENSION A FORTRAN ARRAY WHICH IS USED AS A SUBROUTINE    PT
)@@G@@@G@@@@       ARGUMENT(THUS CAUSING A FUNCTION TRANSFER TO THE ARRAY ITSEPU
)@@G@@LF),  @G@@@@       ANY USE OF A FLOATING-POINT VALUE IN AN INTEGER VARIAPV
)@@G@@BLE, ETC.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ PAGE OUTPUT ESTIMAGE EXCEEDEDPW
)@@G@@.     @[@@@@      @H@@@@               THE NUMBER OF PAGES PRINTED BY THPX
)@@G@@E PROGRAM HAS EXCEEDED THE    @D@@@@       ALLOWED VALUE AS SPECIFIED ONPY
)@@G@@ THE RUN CARD.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ CARD OUTPUT ESTIMATE EXPZ
)@@G@@CEEDED.     @[@@@@      @F@@@@               THE NUMBER OF CARDS PUNCHEDQA
)@@G@@ BY THE PROGRAM HAS     @F@@@@       EXCEEDED THE ALLOWED VALUE AS SPECIQB
)@@G@@FIED ON THE RUN CARD.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@ FASTRAND FILE SIZQC
)@@G@@E EXCEEDED--FILE XXXXXX @[@@@@      @F@@@@               THE SPECIFIED DQD
)@@G@@RUM FILE HAS BEEN REFERENCED WITH AN@F@@@@       ADDRESS HIGHER THAN THEQE
)@@G@@ LARGEST ALLOWED VALUE SPECIFIED ON @E@@@@       THE ASSIGN OR CATALOG CQF
)@@G@@ARD.  THIS CORRESPONDS TO AN  @F@@@@       INPUT/OUTPUT ERROR TYPE 22 (CQG
)@@G@@ODE 1 TYPE 22) AS DESCRIBED   @E@@@@       IN CHAPTER 10 OF THE PROGRAMMQH
)@@G@@ER'S REFERENCE MANUAL   @A@@@@       (UNIVAC PUBLICATION UP-4144).@[@@@@QI
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@ I/O ATTEMPTED ON UNASSIGNED FILE XXXXXX  @[@@@@QJ
)@@G@@      @G@@@@               A FILE HAS BEEN REFERENCED BUT HAS NOT BEEN AQK
)@@G@@SSIGNED.    @F@@@@       THIS APPLIES TO FORTRAN 'READ' REQUESTS AND NONQL

)@@G@@N UNASSIGNED@E@@@@       FILE WILL CAUSE A SCRATCH FILE WITH THAT NAME TQN

)@@G@@      @I@@@@               AN 'ER CSF$' (REQUEST CSF) HAS BEEN PERFORMEDRM

)@@G@@SSIBLE STATEMENT TYPES ARE @ASG,    @G@@@@       @CAT, @USE, @FREE, @STARP

)@@G@@LEGAL.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@ CONTROL STATEMENT IMAGE SYNTAX ERRORR
)@@G@@R.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@               AN 'ER CSF$' (REQUEST CSF) WAS PERS
)@@G@@RFORMED, AND ALTHOUGH   @F@@@@       THE STATEMENT TYPE WAS LEGAL, THE BRT
)@@G@@ODY OF THE STATEMENT    @D@@@@       CONTAINED ILLEGAL CHARACTERS OR PUNRU
)@@G@@CTUATION.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@ INTERNAL ERROR REQUEST:  ERR$RV
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @H@@@@               THE PROGRAM HAS PERFORMED AN 'ER ERR$' RW
)@@G@@(REQUEST ERR).  THE     @F@@@@       REQUEST WAS INTERCEPTED BY THE EXECRX
)@@G@@UTION MONITOR SO THAT IT@E@@@@       COULD PERFORM THE NECESSARY WRAPUP RY
)@@G@@AFTER EXECUTION.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@ ATTEMPT TO EXECUTE ILLERZ
)@@G@@GAL MACHINE INSTRUCTION: XXXXXXXXXXXX     @[@@@@      @G@@@@            SA
)@@G@@   THE PROGRAM HAS EXECUTED A MACHINE WORD WHICH DOES NOT   @C@@@@      SB
)@@G@@ COMPRISE A VALID MACHINE INSTRUCTION.    @F@@@@       THE OFFENDING INSSC
)@@G@@TRUCTION HAS BEEN PRINTED OUT IN OCTAL.   @F@@@@       THE USUAL CAUSE OSD
)@@G@@F THIS ERROR IS TRANSFERRING TO A DATA    @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@A GUIDE TO PSE
)@@G@@ROGRAMMING WITH RALPH (DECEMBER 1971 VERSION)         13- 24@[@@@@      SF
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@       CELL.  THE USUAL CAUSE OF TRANSFERRSG
)@@G@@ING TO A DATA CELL IS   @E@@@@       NEGLECTING TO DIMENSION AN ARRAY INSH
)@@G@@ A SUBROUTINE EVEN@F@@@@       THOUGH IT IS USED WITH A SUBSCRIPT (THUS SI
)@@G@@CAUSING IT TO BE  @ @@@@       TREATED AS A FUNCTION).@[@@@@      @[@@@@SJ
)@@G@@      @ @@@@ FLOATING POINT OVERFLOW.     @ @@@@ FLOATING POINT UNDERFLOSK
)@@G@@W.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@               A FLOATING-POINT ARITHMETIC INSTRSL
)@@G@@UCTION (ADD, SUBTRACT,  @F@@@@       MULTIPLY, OR DIVIDE) HAS RESULTED ISM
)@@G@@N A NUMBER WHICH IS TOO @E@@@@       LARGE (OVERFLOW) OR TOO CLOSE TO ZESN
)@@G@@RO (UNDERFLOW).   @F@@@@       THE FIRST TIME THIS SITUATION OCCURS, THESO
)@@G@@ FACT IS RECORDED @F@@@@       IN THE EXECUTION MONITOR AND THE PROGRAM SP
)@@G@@IS ALLOWED TO     @E@@@@       CONTINUE.  THE OVERFLOW OR UNDERFLOW CONDSQ
)@@G@@ITION MAY BE@G@@@@       CHECKED VIA CALLS TO SUBROUTINES IN THE MATHEMASR
)@@G@@TICAL LIBRARY     @F@@@@       ('OVERFL').  THE CALLS ALSO CLEAR THE RECSS
)@@G@@ORD OF THE ERROR. @F@@@@       IF A SECOND ERROR OF THIS TYPE HAPPENS BEST
)@@G@@FORE THE FIRST    @F@@@@       HAS BEEN TESTED AND CLEARED, THEN THE PROSU
)@@G@@GRAM IS TERMINATED@B@@@@       IN ERROR WITH SUITABLE MESSAGES.   @[@@@@SV
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@ DIVIDE OVERFLOW  @[@@@@      @H@@@@            SW
)@@G@@   A DIVIDE OVERFLOW OCCURS WHEN THE RESULT OF A DIVISION IS TOO  @G@@@@SX
)@@G@@       LARGE TO FIT IN A COMPUTER WORD.  DIVISION BY ZERO IS A COMMON   SY
)@@G@@@G@@@@       CAUSE OF A DIVIDE OVERFLOW.  THE CASE INSTITUTE ALGOL SYSTESZ
)@@G@@M     @F@@@@       PRINTS THE MESSAGE 'INFINITY, INFINITY, YOU DONE DIVITA
)@@G@@DED   @G@@@@       BY ZERO!!' IN THIS INSTANCE.  THE UNIVAC 1108, ALTHOUTB
)@@G@@GH LESS     @F@@@@       PICTURESQUE, IS A BIT MORE PRACTICAL, IN THAT ITC
)@@G@@T GIVES YOU @F@@@@       A SECOND CHANCE.  SEE THE ABOVE DESCRIPTION OF TD
)@@G@@UNDERFLOW   @F@@@@       AND OVERFLOW FOR MORE DISCUSSION OF THIS SECONDTE
)@@G@@ CHANCE.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@ SYMBIONT-CALL ERROR, TYPE XX TF
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@               AN ERROR (CODE 2) INVOLVING THE READ, PTG
)@@G@@RINT, OR PUNCH    @G@@@@       SYMBIONTS HAS OCCURRED.  SEE THE APPENDIXTH
)@@G@@ OF THE PROGRAMMER'S    @F@@@@       REFERENCE MANUAL (UP-4144) FOR THE TI
)@@G@@COMPLETE LISTING OF     @F@@@@       SYMBIONT-CALL ERRORS.  THE MOST COMTJ
)@@G@@MON ERROR TYPES ARE     @F@@@@       TYPE 02:  ATTEMPT TO READ TWICE THRTK
)@@G@@OUGH AN END-OF-FILE.    @F@@@@       TYPE 05:  @ADD OF NON-EXISTENT ELEMTL
)@@G@@ENT OR FILE.  TYPE 04:  @C@@@@       @ADD IMAGES ARE LONGER THAN 14 WORDTM
)@@G@@S.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@ PROGRAM RESTART  @[@@@@      @G@@@@TN

)@@G@@@E@@@@       THIS IS NOT AN ERROR.  THE USER MUST SPECIFY HIS OWN @G@@@@TP

)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@               THIS MESSAGE IS PRINTED WHENEVER A CONTTZ
)@@G@@INGENCY INTERRUPT @G@@@@       OCCURS WHOSE ERROR CODE AND TYPE ARE UNKNUA
)@@G@@OWN TO THE EXECUTION    @F@@@@       MONITOR.  IF YOU ARE PLAYING AROUNDUB

)@@G@@@[@@@@      @D@@@@ RETURN FROM FUNCTION TO ILLEGAL CALLING SEQUENCE.    UK
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@               AN ALTERNATE RETURN (RETURN 1, RETURN 3UL
)@@G@@, ETC.) HAS BEEN  @F@@@@       PERFORMED IN A SUBROUTINE, BUT THE CALLINUM
)@@G@@G PROGRAM DOES    @E@@@@       NOT HAVE PROVISIONS FOR SUCH AN ALTERNATEUN
)@@G@@ RETURN.  IF@F@@@@       THE RETURN WERE TAKEN, IT WOULD RESULT IN A GUAUO
)@@G@@RD MODE     @F@@@@       VIOLATION OR AN ILLEGAL INSTRUCTION.  EITHER THUP
)@@G@@E SPECIFIED @F@@@@       RETURN ARGUMENT DOES NOT EXIST, OR IT IS A VARIUQ
)@@G@@ABLE RATHER @^@@@@       THAN A RETURN.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@UR
)@@G@@ CONSOLE-CALL ERROR     @[@@@@      @G@@@@               AN 'ER COM$' (RUS

)@@G@@                         1-  1@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@WI
)@@G@@  1.   DOCUMENT PROCESSOR DESCRIPTION     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@WJ
)@@G@@      @F@@@@ THE 1108 DOCUMENT PROCESSOR (DOC) IS A SYSTEM PROCESSOR WHIWK
)@@G@@CH    @G@@@@ PRODUCES A STANDARDIZED PRINTED LISTING OF A DOCUMENT.  A DWL
)@@G@@OCUMENT     @F@@@@ IS A SYMBOLIC ELEMENT IN THE STANDARD 1108 FORMAT, ANWM
)@@G@@D MAY BE    @C@@@@ MANIPULATED WITH THE USUAL FUNCTIONS OF FURPUR.@[@@@@WN
)@@G@@      @F@@@@ THE APPEARANCE OF THE FINISHED DOCUMENT MAY BE CONTROLLED IWO
)@@G@@N FOUR@#@@@@ WAYS AS FOLLOWS: @[@@@@      @D@@@@  - PROCESSOR CONTROL STWP
)@@G@@ATEMENT OPTIONS (,SIDHL ETC.) @F@@@@  - DIVISIONAL CONTROL STATEMENTS (CWQ
)@@G@@HAPTERS, SECTIONS, PARAGRAPHS)@E@@@@  - LISTING CONTROL STATEMENTS (SPACWR
)@@G@@ING, PAGE EJECTS ETC.)  @^@@@@  - EDITING (UPDATING.) @[@@@@      @E@@@@WS
)@@G@@ IN ADDITION TO THE REGULAR FEATURES OF DOC, THIS DOCUMENT  @B@@@@ DESCRWT
)@@G@@IBES THE FOLLOWING NEW FEATURES:    @G@@@@       -  'G' OPTION TO REMOVEWU
)@@G@@ HYPHENATED WORDS FROM INPUT ELEMENT.     @C@@@@       -  'R' OPTION TO WV
)@@G@@ALIGN THE RIGHT MARGIN. @D@@@@       -  'RIGHTM' (RIGHT MARGIN) CONTROL WW
)@@G@@STATEMENT.  @E@@@@       -  'UNHYPH' (REMOVE HYPHENATION) CONTROL STATEMWX
)@@G@@ENT.  @E@@@@       -  THE MEANING OF THE 'H' OPTION HAS BEED CHANGED.   WY
)@@G@@@F@@@@          THE PRESENCE OF THE 'H' OPTION ON THE PROCESSOR CALL    WZ
)@@G@@@F@@@@          CARD INDICATES THAT THE AUTOMATIC HYPHENATOR IS TO BE   XA
)@@G@@@^@@@@          TURNED ON.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@XB
)@@G@@  1. 1.   THE PROCESSOR CONTROL STATEMENT.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@XC
)@@G@@ THIS VERSION OF THE DOCUMENT PROCESSOR MAY BE CALLED BY A CONTROL@A@@@@XD
)@@G@@ STATEMENT OF THE FOLLOWING FORM:   @[@@@@      @B@@@@         @DOC,OPTIXE
)@@G@@ONS   SPEC1,SPEC2,,SPEC4@[@@@@      @E@@@@ WHERE:  SPEC1 = SYMBOLIC INPUXF
)@@G@@T ELEMENT (TAPE OR FASTRAND)  @B@@@@         SPEC2 = SYMBOLIC OUTPUT ELEXG
)@@G@@MENT. @F@@@@         SPEC4 = AN OPTIONAL THREE DIGIT INTEGER SPECIFYING XH
)@@G@@NUMBER@F@@@@                 OF POSITIONS OF FASTRAND TO BE USED AS A MAXI
)@@G@@XIMUM @G@@@@                 FOR THE DOC SCRATCH FILE.  IF OMITTED, SPECXJ
)@@G@@4=10 IS     @F@@@@                 ASSUMED.  THIS IS SUFFICIENT TO PROVIXK
)@@G@@DE SPACE FOR@A@@@@                 OVER 30,000 LINES. @C@@@@         SPEXL
)@@G@@C3 IS OMITTED AND MUST NOT BE USED. @[@@@@      @G@@@@ THE OPTIONS FIELDXM
)@@G@@ MAY CONSIST OF A STRING OF ANY OF THE CHARACTERS     @F@@@@ DESCRIBED BXN
)@@G@@ELOW.  IF A CHARACTER IS PRESENT IN THE STRING THE    @C@@@@ OPTION IS AXO
