)@@G@@   MODE IS CFH CLAUSE IN THE FILE DESCRIPTION ENTRY.  THE   @E@@@@      UW
)@@G@@   CFH FILE PROCESSING MODE IS DESCRIBED IN DETAIL IN @F@@@@         SECUX
)@@G@@TION 10 OF THE ASCII COBOL PROGRAMMERS REFERENCE,     @#@@@@         UP-UY
)@@G@@7923. @[@@@@      @F@@@@         IT SHOULD BE NOTED THAT CFH FILES MAY BUZ
)@@G@@E SPECIFIED WITH  @F@@@@         LABEL RECORDS ARE STANDARD AS WELL AS WVA
)@@G@@ITH LABEL RECORDS @E@@@@         OMMITTED AS IS STATED IN 10.3.1.6.7 OF VB
)@@G@@THE PRM.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@     *   CODASYL COMPATIBLE REPORT WRITER VC
)@@G@@PRESENTATION RULES-     @[@@@@      @E@@@@         THE CODASYL PROGRAMMIVD
)@@G@@NG LANGUAGE COMMITTEE RECENTLY@F@@@@         REVISED THE REPORT WRITER LVE
)@@G@@ANGUAGE SPECIFICATION IN AN   @E@@@@         EFFORT TO ELIMINATE AMBIGUIVF
)@@G@@TIES FROM THE PREVIOUS  @F@@@@         SPECIFICATIONS.  AS A RESULT, PREVG
)@@G@@SENTATIONS RULES HAVE   @F@@@@         BEEN BETTER DEFINED AND CERTAIN IVH
)@@G@@LL DEFINED PROCESSING   @F@@@@         SITUATIONS HAVE BEEN DECLARED ILLVI
)@@G@@EGAL.  THE AMERICAN     @E@@@@         NATIONAL STANDARD COBOL COMMITTEEVJ
)@@G@@, X3J4, HAS SINCE @F@@@@         ACCEPTED THIS REVISED SPECIFICATION FORVK
)@@G@@ INCLUSION IN THE @F@@@@         FORTHCOMING COBOL STANDARD.  ASCII COBOVL
)@@G@@L VERSION 1.7 HAS @F@@@@         BEEN EXTENDED TO FULL COMPLIANCE WITH TVM
)@@G@@HE SPECIFICATION  @C@@@@         WITH THE FOLLOWING THREE EXCEPTIONS.   VN
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@                   1. A TYPE DETAIL REPORT GROUP CANNOVO
)@@G@@T BE THE    @F@@@@                      OBJECT OF A USE BEFORE REPORTINGVP
)@@G@@ CLAUSE.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@                   2. A SPECIFIED PAGE LIMVQ
)@@G@@IT OR RELATIVE LINE     @D@@@@                      VALUE CAN NOT EXCEEDVR
)@@G@@ 511 LINES. @[@@@@      @F@@@@                   3. MNEUMOTIC-NAME MUST VS
)@@G@@BE SPECIFIED IN THE     @G@@@@                      CODE CLAUSE AS OPPOSVT
)@@G@@ED TO THE SYNTAX ''CODE IS    @A@@@@                      LITERAL''.    VU
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@         AS A RESULT OF THE REVISED, AND MUCH MORE COMVV
)@@G@@PREHENSIVE, @F@@@@         PRESENTATION RULES, ATTENTION SHOULD BE DIRECVW
)@@G@@TED TOWARD  @F@@@@         POSSIBLE DIFFERENCES IN GENERATED REPORT FORMVX
)@@G@@AT BETWEEN  @ @@@@         LEVEL 1.4 AND 1.7.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@      VY
)@@G@@   SPECIFICATIONS FOR THE ENHANCED REPORT WRITER FEATURES   @E@@@@      VZ
)@@G@@   ARE LISTED IN MORE DETAIL UNDER DOCUMENTATION.     @[@@@@      @ @@@@WA
)@@G@@     *   PICTURE SYMBOL'H'-   @[@@@@      @D@@@@         THE PICTURE SYMWB
)@@G@@BOL 'H' IS NOW ALLOWED FOR THE@F@@@@         SPECIFICATION OF COMPUTATIOWC
)@@G@@NAL USAGE ON NUMERIC ITEMS.   @F@@@@         THIS FEATURE HAS BEEN INCLUWD
)@@G@@DED AS A COMPATABILITY FEATURE@F@@@@         WITH FD/ANSI AND DOD COBOL.WE
)@@G@@  USE OF THE PICTURE SYMBOL   @F@@@@         'H' IS DOCUMENTED IN DETAILWF
)@@G@@ UNDER 3.6.3.3, THE 'PICTURE  @ @@@@         CLAUSE' OF UP-7923.  @[@@@@WG
)@@G@@      @B@@@@     *   COMMON-STORAGE INITIAL VALUE-    @[@@@@      @F@@@@WH
)@@G@@         UNDER VERSION 1.7 IT IS NOW ALLOWABLE TO SPECIFY A VALUE @E@@@@WI
)@@G@@         CLAUSE IN THE COMMON-STORAGE SECTION.  IT SHOULD BE@E@@@@      WJ
)@@G@@   NOTED THAT WHERE SUB-PROGRAMS ARE INVOLVED, EACH   @F@@@@         PROWK
)@@G@@GRAM'S COMMON-STORAGE SECTION SHOULD CONTAIN VALUE    @F@@@@         CLAWL
)@@G@@USES, IF DESIRED, WITH THE SAME INITIAL VALUE LITERAL @F@@@@         SPEWM
)@@G@@CIFIED IN ORDER TO INSURE INITIALIZATION OF THE FIELD @ @@@@         AFTWN
)@@G@@ER COLLECTION.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@         THIS FEATURE HAS BEEN INCLUWO
)@@G@@DED FOR COMPATABILITY WITH    @A@@@@         FD/ANSI AND DOD COBOLS.    WP

)@@G@@.2.3 ALL REPORT GROUPS MUST BE DESCRIBED SUCH THAT    @E@@@@           TDM
)@@G@@HEY CAN BE PRESENTED ON ONE PAGE.  THE REPORT   @D@@@@           WRITER DN
)@@G@@CONTROL SYSTEM(RWCS)NEVER SPLITS A  @E@@@@           MULTI-LINE REPORT GDO
)@@G@@ROUP ACROSS PAGE BOUNDARIES.  @[@@@@      @E@@@@     1.2.4 IF THE PAGE CDP
)@@G@@LAUSE IS SPECIFIED, THE FOLLOWING   @D@@@@           IMPLICIT VALUES AREDQ
)@@G@@ ASSUMED FOR ANY OMITTED@^@@@@           PHRASES:     @[@@@@      @E@@@@DR
)@@G@@                A. IF THE HEADING IS OMITTED, A VALUE OF ONE@C@@@@      DS
)@@G@@             (1) IS ASSUMED FOR INTEGER-2.@[@@@@      @E@@@@            DT
)@@G@@    B. IF THE FIRST DETAIL PHRASE IS OMITTED, A @F@@@@                  DU
)@@G@@ VALUE EQUAL TO INTEGER-2 IS GIVEN TO INTEGER-3.@[@@@@      @F@@@@      DV
)@@G@@          C. IF THE LAST DETAIL AND THE FOOTING PHRASES     @F@@@@      DW
)@@G@@             ARE BOTH OMITTED, THE VALUE OF INTEGER-1 IS    @E@@@@      DX
)@@G@@             GIVEN TO BOTH INTEGER-4 AND INTEGER-5.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@DY
)@@G@@                D. IF THE FOOTING PHRASE IS SPECIFIED AND THE     @F@@@@DZ
)@@G@@                   LAST DETAIL PHRASE IS OMITTED, THE VALUE OF    @D@@@@EA
)@@G@@                   INTEGER-5 IS GIVEN TO INTEGER-4.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@EB
)@@G@@                E. IF THE LAST DETAIL PHRASE IS SPECIFIED AND     @F@@@@EC
)@@G@@                   THE FOOTING PHRASE IS OMITTED, THE VALUE OF    @D@@@@ED
)@@G@@                   INTEGER-4 IS GIVEN TO INTEGER-5.   @[@@@@      @D@@@@EE
)@@G@@     1.2.5 IF THE PAGE CLAUSE IS OMITTED, THE REPORT  @E@@@@           CEF
)@@G@@ONSISTS OF A SINGLE PAGE OF INDEFINITE LENGTH.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      EG
)@@G@@@^@@@@ 2. PRESENTATION RULES  @[@@@@      @A@@@@     2.1 PRESENTATION RUEH
)@@G@@LES TABLES  @[@@@@      @F@@@@         THE TABLES AND RULES ON THE FOLLOEI
)@@G@@WING PAGES SPECIFY:     @[@@@@      @F@@@@         (1) THE PERMISSABLE CEJ
)@@G@@OMBINATIONS OF LINE NUMBER AND NEXT @E@@@@             GROUP CLAUSES FOREK
)@@G@@ EACH TYPE OF REPORT GROUP.   @F@@@@         (2) THE REQUIREMENTS THAT AEL
)@@G@@RE PLACED ON THE USE OF THESE @ @@@@             CLAUSES, AND     @E@@@@EM
)@@G@@         (3) THE INTERPRETATION THAT THE RWCS GIVES TO THESE@^@@@@      EN
)@@G@@       CLAUSES.   @[@@@@      @ @@@@         2.1.1 ORGANIZATION   @[@@@@EO
)@@G@@      @F@@@@                   THERE IS AN INDIVIDUAL PRESENTATION RULESEP
)@@G@@ TABLE@E@@@@                   FOR EACH OF THE FOLLOWING TYPES OF REPORTEQ
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   GROUPS: REPORT HEADING, PAGE HEADING, PAGE     ER
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   FOOTING, REPORT FOOTING.  IN ADDITION, DETAIL  ES
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   REPORT GROUPS, CONTROL HEADING REPORT GROUPS,  ET
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   AND CONTROL FOOTING REPORT GROUPS ARE TREATED  EU
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   JOINTLY IN THE BODY GROUP PRESENTATION RULES   EV
)@@G@@@ @@@@                   TABLES.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@         COLUMNS 1EW
)@@G@@ AND 2 OF A PRESENTATION RULES TABLE LIST ALL OF@F@@@@         THE PERMIEX
)@@G@@SSABLE COMBINATIONS OF LINE NUMBER AND NEXT     @E@@@@         GROUP CLAEY
)@@G@@USES FOR THE DESIGNATED REPORT GROUP TYPE.@F@@@@         CONSEQUENTLY, FEZ
)@@G@@OR THE PURPOSE OF IDENTIFYING THE SET OF  @D@@@@         PRESENTATION RUFA
)@@G@@LES THAT APPLY TO A PARTICULAR@F@@@@         COMBINATION OF LINE NUMBER FB
)@@G@@AND NEXT GROUP CLAUSES, A     @F@@@@         PRESENTATION RULES TABLE ISFC
)@@G@@ READ FROM LEFT TO RIGHT,     @A@@@@         ALONG THE SELECTED ROW.    FD
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@         THE APPLICABLE RULES COLUMNS OF A PRESENTATIOFE
)@@G@@N RULES     @F@@@@         TABLE ARE PARTITIONED INTO TWO PARTS.  THE FIFF
)@@G@@RST PART    @F@@@@         SPECIFIED THE RULES THAT APPLY IF THE REPORT FG
)@@G@@DESCRIPTION @F@@@@         CONTAINS A PAGE CLAUSE, AND THE SECOND PART SFH
)@@G@@PECIFIES THE@F@@@@         RULES THAT APPLY IF THE PAGE CLAUSE IS OMITTEFI
)@@G@@D.  THE     @E@@@@         PURPOSE OF THE RULES NAMED IN THE APPLICABLE FJ
)@@G@@RULES @A@@@@         COLUMNS IS DISCUSSED BELOW:@[@@@@      @F@@@@      FK
)@@G@@   (1)       UPPER LIMIT RULES AND LOWER LIMIT RULES.  THESE@F@@@@      FL
)@@G@@             RULES SPECIFY THE VERTICAL SUBDIVISIONS OF THE @F@@@@      FM
)@@G@@             PAGE WITHIN WHICH THE SPECIFIED REPORT GROUP   @A@@@@      FN
)@@G@@             MAY BE PRESENTED.@F@@@@                   IN THE ABSENCE OFFO
)@@G@@ A PAGE CLAUSE THE PRINTED    @F@@@@                   REPORT IS NOT CONFP
)@@G@@SIDERED TO BE PARTITIONED     @F@@@@                   INTO VERTICAL SUBFQ
)@@G@@DIVISIONS.  CONSEQUENTLY,     @F@@@@                   WITHIN THE TABLESFR
)@@G@@ NO UPPER LIMIT RULE AND LOWER@E@@@@                   LIMIT RULE IS SPEFS
)@@G@@CIFIED FOR A REPORT     @E@@@@                   DESCRIPTION IN WHICH THFT
)@@G@@E PAGE CLAUSE IS  @ @@@@                   OMITTED.   @[@@@@      @E@@@@FU
)@@G@@         (2)       FIT TEST RULES.  THE FIT TEST RULES ARE  @F@@@@      FV
)@@G@@             APPLICABLE ONLY TO BODY GROUPS, AND HENCE FIT  @F@@@@      FW
)@@G@@             TEST TEST RULES ARE SPECIFIED ONLY WITHIN THE  @F@@@@      FX
)@@G@@             BODY GROUP PRESENTATION RULES TABLE.  AT OBJECT@F@@@@      FY
)@@G@@             TIME THE RCWCS APPLIES THE FIT TEST RULES TO   @F@@@@      FZ
)@@G@@             DETERMINE WHETHER THE DESIGNATED BODY GROUP    @E@@@@      GA
)@@G@@             CAN BE PRESENTED ON THE PAGE TO WHICH THE@D@@@@            GB
)@@G@@       REPORT IS CURRENTLY POSITIONED.    @F@@@@                   HOWEVGC
)@@G@@ER, EVEN FROM BODY GROUPS THERE ARE NO FIT@F@@@@                   TEST GD
)@@G@@RULES WHEN THE PAGE CLAUSE IS OMITTED FROM@C@@@@                   THE RGE
)@@G@@EPORT DESCRIPTION ENTRY.@[@@@@      @F@@@@         (3)       FIRST PRINTGF
)@@G@@ LINE POSITION RULES.  THE FIRST    @F@@@@                   PRINT LINE GG
)@@G@@POSITION RULES SPECIFY WHERE ON THE @F@@@@                   REPORT MEDIGH
)@@G@@UM THE RWCS SHALL PRESENT THE FIRST @E@@@@                   PRINT LINE GI
)@@G@@OF THE GIVEN REPORT GROUP.    @F@@@@                   THE PRESENTATION GJ
)@@G@@RULE TABLES DO NOT SPECIFY    @E@@@@                   WHERE ON THE REPOGK
)@@G@@RT MEDIUM THE RWCS SHALL@F@@@@                   PRESENT THE SECOND AND GL
)@@G@@SUBSEQUENT PRINT LINES  @F@@@@                   (IF ANY) OF A REPORT GRGM
)@@G@@OUP.  CERTAIN GENERAL   @E@@@@                   RULES DETERMINE WHERE TGN
)@@G@@HE SECOND AND     @F@@@@                   SUBSEQUENT PRINT LINES OF A RGO
)@@G@@EPORT GROUP SHALL @F@@@@                   BE PRESENTED.  REFER TO THE LGP
)@@G@@INE NUMBER CLAUSE @D@@@@                   GENERAL RULES FOR THIS INFORMGQ
)@@G@@ATION.@[@@@@      @F@@@@         (4)       NEXT GROUP RULES.  THE NEXT GGR
)@@G@@ROUP RULES RELATE @F@@@@                   TO THE PROPER USE OF THE NEXTGS
)@@G@@ GROUP CLAUSES.   @[@@@@      @E@@@@         (5)       FINAL LINE-COUNTEGT
)@@G@@R SETTING RULES.  THE   @F@@@@                   TERMINAL VALUES THAT THGU
)@@G@@E RWCS PLACES IN LINE-  @F@@@@                   COUNTER AFTER PRESENTINGV
)@@G@@G REPORT GROUPS ARE     @F@@@@                   SPECIFIED BY THE FINAL GW
)@@G@@LINE-COUNTER SETTING    @ @@@@                   RULES.     @[@@@@      GX
)@@G@@@B@@@@         2.1.2 LINE NUMBER CLAUSE NOTATION@[@@@@      @F@@@@      GY
)@@G@@             COLUMN 1 OF THE PRESENTATION RULES TABLE USES A@F@@@@      GZ
)@@G@@             SHORTHAND NOTATION TO DESCRIBE THE SEQUENCE OF @F@@@@      HA
)@@G@@             LINE NUMBER CLAUSES THAT MAY APPEAR IN THE     @F@@@@      HB
)@@G@@             DESCRIPTION OF A REPORT GROUP.  THE MEANING OF @E@@@@      HC
)@@G@@             THE ABBREVIATIONS USED IN COLUMN 1 IS AS @ @@@@            HD
)@@G@@       FOLLOWS:   @[@@@@      @E@@@@               (1) THE LETTER 'A' REHE
)@@G@@PRESENTS ONE OR MORE    @F@@@@                   ABSOLUTE LINE NUMBER CLHF
)@@G@@AUSES, NONE OF WHICH    @E@@@@                   HAVE THE NEXT PAGE PHRAHG
)@@G@@SE, THAT APPEAR IN@F@@@@                   CONSECUTIVE ORDER WITHIN THE HH
)@@G@@SQEUENCE OF LINE  @F@@@@                   NUMBER CLAUSES IN THE REPORT HI
)@@G@@GROUP DESCRIPTION @ @@@@                   ENTRY.     @[@@@@      @E@@@@HJ
)@@G@@               (2) THE LETTER 'R' REPRESENTS ONE OR MORE    @F@@@@      HK
)@@G@@             RELATIVE LINE NUMBER CLAUSES THAT APPEAR IN    @F@@@@      HL
)@@G@@             CONSECUTIVE ORDER WITHIN THE SEQUENCE OF LINE  @F@@@@      HM
)@@G@@             NUMBER CLAUSES IN THE REPORT GROUP DESCRIPTION @ @@@@      HN
)@@G@@             ENTRY.     @[@@@@      @E@@@@               (3) THE LETTERSHO
)@@G@@ 'NP' REPRESENT ONE OR MORE   @F@@@@                   ABSOLUTE LINE NUMHP
)@@G@@BER CLAUSES THAT APPEAR IN    @F@@@@                   CONSECUTIVE ORDERHQ
)@@G@@ WITHIN THE SEQUENCE OF LINE  @F@@@@                   NUMBER CLAUSES INHR
)@@G@@ THE REPORT GROUP DESCRIPTION @F@@@@                   ENTRY, WITH THE PHS
)@@G@@HRASE NEXT PAGE APPEARING IN  @F@@@@                   THE FIRST, AND ONHT
)@@G@@LY IN THE FIRST, LINE NUMBER  @ @@@@                   CLAUSE.    @[@@@@HU
)@@G@@      @F@@@@                   WHEN TWO ABBREVIATIONS APPEAR TOGETHER, THV
)@@G@@HEY   @F@@@@                   REFER TO A SEQUENCE OF LINE NUMBER CLAUSEHW
)@@G@@S THAT@E@@@@                   CONSISTS OF THE TWO SPECIFIED CONSECUTIVEHX
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   SEQUENCES.  FOR EXAMPLE 'AR' REFERS TO A REPORTHY
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   GROUP DESCRIPTION ENTRY WITHIN WHICH THE 'A'   HZ
)@@G@@@E@@@@                   SEQUENCE (DEFINED IN RULE 1 ABOVE) IS    @E@@@@IA
)@@G@@                   IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWED BY THE 'R' SEQUENCE @C@@@@      IB
)@@G@@             (DEFINED IN RULE 2 ABOVE).   @[@@@@      @E@@@@         2.1IC
)@@G@@.3 LINE NUMBER CLAUSE SEQUENCE SUBSTITUTIONS    @[@@@@      @E@@@@      ID
)@@G@@             WHERE 'AR' IS SHOWN TO BE A PERMISSABLE  @F@@@@            IE
)@@G@@       SEQUENCE IN THE PRESENTATION RULES TABLE, 'A'  @F@@@@            IF
)@@G@@       IS ALSO PERMISSABLE AND THE SAME PRESENTATION  @B@@@@            IG
)@@G@@       RULES ARE APPLICABLE.  @E@@@@                   WHEN 'NP R' IS SHIH
)@@G@@OWN TO BE A PERMISSABLE @F@@@@                   SEQUENCE IN THE PRESENTII
)@@G@@ATION RULES TABLE, 'NP' @F@@@@                   IS ALSO PERMISSABLE ANDIJ
)@@G@@ THE SAME PRESENTATION  @B@@@@                   RULES ARE APPLICABLE.  IK
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @D@@@@         2.1.4 SAVED NEXT GROUP INTEGER DESCRIPTION   IL
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@                   SAVED NEXT GROUP INTEGER IS A DATA IM
)@@G@@ITEM THAT IS@F@@@@                   ADDRESSABLE ONLY BY THE RWCS.  WHENIN
)@@G@@ AN ABSOLUTE@E@@@@                   NEXT GROUP CLAUSE SPECIFIES A VERTIIO
)@@G@@CAL   @F@@@@                   POSITIONING VALUE WHICH CANNOT BE ACCOMMOIP
)@@G@@DATED @F@@@@                   ON THE CURRENT PAGE, THE RWCS STORES THATIQ
)@@G@@ VALUE@E@@@@                   IN SAVED NEXT GROUP INTEGER.  AFTER PAGE IR
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   ADVANCE PROCESSING, THE RWCS POSITIONS THE NEXTIS
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   BODY GROUP USING THE VALUE STORED IN SAVED NEXTIT
)@@G@@@A@@@@                   GROUP INTEGER.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@         2.2IU

)@@G@@LICABLE RULES COLUMN INDICATES THE  @H@@@@                   ABSENCE OF JZ

)@@G@@FIRST LINE NUMBER ON WHICH THE@F@@@@         REPORT HEADING REPORT GROUPKH
)@@G@@ CAN BE PRESENTED IS THE LINE @E@@@@         NUMBER SPECIFIED BY THE HEAKI
)@@G@@DING PHRASE OF THE PAGE @#@@@@         CLAUSE.  @[@@@@      @ @@@@      KJ
)@@G@@   (2) LOWER LIMIT RULES@[@@@@      @E@@@@                A. THE LAST LIKK
)@@G@@NE NUMBER ON WHICH THE REPORT @F@@@@                   HEADING REPORT GRKL
)@@G@@OUP CAN BE PRESENTED IS THE   @F@@@@                   LINE NUMBER THAT KM
)@@G@@IS OBTAINED BY SUBTRACTING 1  @F@@@@                   FROM THE VALUE OFKN
)@@G@@ INTEGER-3 OF THE FIRST DETAIL@C@@@@                   PHRASE OF THE PAGKO
)@@G@@E CLAUSE.   @E@@@@                B. THE LAST LINE NUMBER ON WHICH THE RKP
)@@G@@EPORT @F@@@@                   HEADING REPORT GROUP CAN BE PRESENTED IS KQ
)@@G@@THE   @F@@@@                   LINE NUMBER SPECIFIED BY INTEGER-1 OF THEKR
)@@G@@ PAGE @ @@@@                   CLAUSE.    @[@@@@      @C@@@@         (3)KS
)@@G@@ FIRST PRINT LINE POSITION RULES    @[@@@@      @F@@@@                A.KT
)@@G@@ THE FIRST PRINT LINE OF THE REPORT HEADING     @F@@@@                  KU
)@@G@@ REPORT GROUP IS PRESENTED ON THE LINE NUMBER   @F@@@@                  KV
)@@G@@ SPECIFIED BY THE INTEGER OF ITS LINE NUMBER    @ @@@@                  KW
)@@G@@ CLAUSE.    @F@@@@                B. THE FIRST PRINT LINE OF THE REPORT KX
)@@G@@HEADING     @F@@@@                   REPORT GROUP IS PRESENTED ON THE LIKY
)@@G@@NE NUMBER   @F@@@@                   OBTAINED BY ADDING THE INTEGER OF TKZ
)@@G@@HE FIRST    @F@@@@                   LINE NUMBER CLAUSE AND THE VALUE OBLA
)@@G@@TAINED BY   @F@@@@                   SUBTRACTING 1 FROM THE VALUE OF INTLB
)@@G@@EGER-1 FROM @F@@@@                   THE VALUE OF INTEGER-2 OF THE HEADILC
)@@G@@NG OF THE   @A@@@@                   PAGE CLAUSE.     @F@@@@            LD
)@@G@@    C. THE REPORT HEADING GROUP IS NOT PRESENTED.     @F@@@@            LE
)@@G@@    D. THE FIRST PRINT LINE OF THE REPORT HEADING     @F@@@@            LF
)@@G@@       REPORT GROUP IS PRESENTED ON THE LINE NUMBER   @F@@@@            LG
)@@G@@       OBTAINED BY ADDING THE CONTENTS OF ITS FIRST   @E@@@@            LH
)@@G@@       LINE-COUNTER (IN THIS CASE, ZERO) TO THE @E@@@@                  LI
)@@G@@ INTEGER OF THE FIRST LINE NUMBER CLAUSE. @[@@@@      @ @@@@         (4)LJ
)@@G@@ NEXT GROUP RULES @[@@@@      @F@@@@                A. THE NEXT GROUP INLK
)@@G@@TEGER MUST BE GREATER THAN    @F@@@@                   THE LINE NUMBER OLL
)@@G@@N WHICH THE FINAL PRINT LINE  @E@@@@                   OF THE REPORT HEALM
)@@G@@DING REPORT GROUP IS    @F@@@@                   PRESENTED.  IN ADDITIONLN
)@@G@@, THE NEXT GROUP INTEGER@F@@@@                   MUST BE LESS THAN THE LLO
)@@G@@INE NUMBER SPECIFIED BY @F@@@@                   THE VALUE OF INTEGER-3 LP
)@@G@@OF THE FIRST DETAIL     @C@@@@                   PHRASE OF THE PAGE CLAULQ
)@@G@@SE.   @E@@@@                B. THE SUM OF THE NEXT GROUP INTEGER AND THELR
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   LINE NUMBER ON WHICH THE FINAL PRINT LINE OF   LS
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   THE REPORT HEADING REPORT GROUP IS PRESENTED   LT
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   MUST BE LESS THAN THE VALUE OF INTEGER-3 OF THELU
)@@G@@@E@@@@                   FIRST DETAIL PHRASE OF THE PAGE CLAUSE.  @E@@@@LV
)@@G@@                C. NEXT GROUP NEXT PAGE SIGNIFIES THAT THE  @E@@@@      LW
)@@G@@             REPORT HEADING GROUP IS TO BE PRESENTED  @F@@@@            LX
)@@G@@       ENTIRELY BY ITSELF ON THE FIRST PAGE OF THE    @F@@@@            LY
)@@G@@       REPORT.  THE RWCS PROCESSES NO OTHER REPORT    @F@@@@            LZ
)@@G@@       GROUP WHILE POSITIONED TO THE FIRST PAGE OF THE@ @@@@            MA
)@@G@@       REPORT.    @[@@@@      @C@@@@         (5) FINAL LINE-COUNTER SETTMB
)@@G@@ING RULES   @[@@@@      @D@@@@                A. AFTER THE REPORT HEADINMC
)@@G@@G REPORT IS @E@@@@                   PRESENTED, THE RWCS PLACES THE NEXTMD
)@@G@@ GROUP@F@@@@                   INTEGER INTO LINE COUNTER AS THE FINAL LIME
)@@G@@NE    @A@@@@                   COUNTER SETTING. @E@@@@                B.MF
)@@G@@ AFTER THE REPORT HEADING REPORT GROUP IS @F@@@@                   PRESEMG
)@@G@@NTED, THE RWCS PLACES THE SUM OF THE NEXT @F@@@@                   GROUPMH
)@@G@@ INTEGER AND THE LINE NUMBER ON WHICH THE @F@@@@                   ON WHMI
)@@G@@ICH THE FINAL PRINT LINE OF THE REPORT    @F@@@@                   HEADIMJ
)@@G@@NG REPORT GROUP WAS PRESENTED INTO LINE-  @F@@@@                   COUNTMK
)@@G@@ER AS THE FINAL LINE-COUNTER SETTING.     @E@@@@                C. AFTERML
)@@G@@ THE REPORT HEADING REPORT GROUP IS @E@@@@                   PRESENTED, MM
)@@G@@THE RWCS PLACES ZERO INTO LINE@F@@@@                   COUNTER AS THE FIMN
)@@G@@NAL LINE-COUNTER SETTING.     @E@@@@                D. AFTER THE REPORT MO
)@@G@@HEADING REPORT GROUP IS @F@@@@                   PRESENTED, THE FINAL LIMP
)@@G@@NE-COUNTER SETTING IS   @F@@@@                   THE LINE NUMBER ON WHICMQ
)@@G@@H THE FINAL PRINT LINE  @E@@@@                   OF THE REPORT HEADING RMR
)@@G@@EPORT GROUP WAS   @ @@@@                   PRESENTED. @F@@@@            MS
)@@G@@    E. LINE-COUNTER IS UNAFFECTED BY THE PROCESSING   @D@@@@            MT
)@@G@@       OF A NON-PRINTABLE REPORT GROUP.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@         2.3MU

)@@G@@AGE HEADING REPORT GROUP CAN BE     @E@@@@             PRESENTED IS THE OG

)@@G@@ROM THE VALUE OF  @E@@@@             INTEGER-3 OF THE FIRST DETAIL PHRASOI

)@@G@@ CLAUSE.    @E@@@@                B. IF A REPORT HEADING REPORT GROUP HAOO

)@@G@@         TABLE 3 PRESENTATION RULES @[@@@@      @D@@@@         (1) UPPERQZ
)@@G@@ LIMIT RULE.  THE FIRST LINE NUMBER @E@@@@             ON WHICH A BODY GRA
)@@G@@ROUP CAN BE PRESENTED IS THE  @D@@@@             LINE NUMBER SPECIFIED BRB
)@@G@@Y THE FIRST DETAIL@B@@@@             PHRASE OF THE PAGE CLAUSE.   @[@@@@RC
)@@G@@      @E@@@@         (2) LOWER LIMIT RULES.  THE LAST LINE NUMBER ON    RD
)@@G@@@E@@@@             WHICH A CONTROL HEADING REPORT GROUP OR DETAIL @D@@@@RE
)@@G@@             REPORT GROUP CAN BE PRESENTED IS THE LINE@E@@@@            RF
)@@G@@ NUMBER SPECIFIED BY THE LAST DETAIL PHRASE OF  @ @@@@             THE  RG
)@@G@@PAGE CLAUSE.@E@@@@             THE LAST LINE ON WHICH A CONTROL FOOTING RH
)@@G@@REPORT@D@@@@             GROUP CAN BE PRESENTED IS THE LINE NUMBER@E@@@@RI
)@@G@@             SPECIFIED BY THE FOOTING PHRASE OF THE PAGE    @^@@@@      RJ
)@@G@@       CLAUSE.    @[@@@@      @ @@@@         (3) FIT TEST RULES   @[@@@@RK
)@@G@@      @E@@@@                A. IF THE VALUE IN LINE-COUNTER IS LESS THANRL
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   THE INTEGER OF THE FIRST ABSOLUTE LINE NUMBER  RM
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   CLAUSE, THEN THE BODY GROUP SHALL BE PRESENTED RN
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   ON THE PAGE TO WHICH THE REPORT IS CURRENTLY   RO
)@@G@@@ @@@@                   POSITIONED.@E@@@@                   OTHERWISE TRP
)@@G@@HE RWCS EXECUTES PAGE ADVANCE @F@@@@                   PROCESSING.  AFTERQ
)@@G@@R THE PAGE HEADING REPORT     @F@@@@                   GROUP(IF DEFINED)RR
)@@G@@ HAS BEEN PROCESSED, THE RWCS @F@@@@                   DETERMINES WHETHERS
)@@G@@R THE SAVED NEXT GROUP INTEGER@F@@@@                   LOCATION WAS SET RT
)@@G@@WHEN THE FINAL BODY GROUP WAS @F@@@@                   PRESENTED ON THE RU
)@@G@@PRECEDING PAGE.  (SEE FINAL   @F@@@@                   LINE-COUNTER SETTRV
)@@G@@ING RULE 6A).  IF THE SAVED   @F@@@@                   NEXT GROUP INTEGERW
)@@G@@R WAS NOT SO SET, THE BODY    @F@@@@                   GROUP SHALL BE PRRX
)@@G@@ESENTED ON THE PAGE TO WHICH  @F@@@@                   THE REPORT IS CURRY
)@@G@@RENTLY POSITIONED.  IF THE    @F@@@@                   SAVED NEXT GROUP RZ
)@@G@@INTEGER WAS SO SET, THE RWCS  @F@@@@                   MOVES THE SAVED NSA
)@@G@@EXT GROUP INTEGER INTO LINE-  @F@@@@                   COUNTER, RESETS TSB
)@@G@@HE SAVED NEXT GROUP INTEGER TO@E@@@@                   ZERO, AND REAPPLISC
)@@G@@ES FIT TEST RULE 3A.    @[@@@@      @E@@@@                B. IF A BODY GSD
)@@G@@ROUP HAS BEEN PRESENTED ON THE@E@@@@                   PAGE TO WHICH THESE
)@@G@@ REPORT IS CURRENTLY    @F@@@@                   POSITIONED, THE RWCS COSF
)@@G@@MPUTES A TRIAL SUM IN A @F@@@@                   WORK LOCATION.  THE TRISG
)@@G@@AL SUM IS COMPUTED BY   @F@@@@                   ADDING THE CONTENTS OF SH
)@@G@@LINE-COUNTER TO THE     @F@@@@                   INTEGERS OF ALL LINE COSI
)@@G@@UNTER CLAUSES OF THE    @F@@@@                   REPORT GROUP.  IF THE TSJ
)@@G@@RIAL SUM IS NOT GREATER @F@@@@                   THAN THE BODY GROUP'S LSK
)@@G@@OWER LIMIT INTEGER,     @E@@@@                   THEN THE REPORT GROUP ISL
)@@G@@S PRESENTED ON THE@F@@@@                   CURRENT PAGE.  IF THE TRIAL SSM
)@@G@@UM EXCEEDS THE    @F@@@@                   BODY GROUP'S LOWER LIMIT INTESN
)@@G@@GER, THEN THE RWCS@F@@@@                   EXECUTES PAGE ADVANCE PROCESSSO
)@@G@@ING.  AFTER THE   @F@@@@                   PAGE HEADING REPORT GROUP(IF SP
)@@G@@DEFINED) HAS BEEN @F@@@@                   PROCESSED, THE RWCS REAPPLIESSQ
)@@G@@ FIT TEST RULE 3B.@F@@@@                   IF NO BODY GROUP HAS YET BEENSR
)@@G@@ PRESENTED ON THE @E@@@@                   PAGE TO WHICH THE REPORT IS CSS
)@@G@@URRENTLY    @F@@@@                   POSITIONED, THE RWCS DETERMINES WHEST
)@@G@@THER THE    @F@@@@                   SAVED NEXT GROUP INTEGER LOCATION WSU
)@@G@@AS SET WHEN @E@@@@                   THE FINAL BODY GROUP WAS PRESENTED SV
)@@G@@ON THE@F@@@@                   PRECEDING PAGE.(SEE FINAL LINE-COUNTER SESW
)@@G@@TTING @F@@@@                   RULE 6A).  IF THE SAVED NEXT GROUP INTEGESX
)@@G@@R WAS @F@@@@                   NOT SO SET, THE BODY GROUP SHALL BE PRESESY
)@@G@@NTED  @F@@@@                   ON THE PAGE TO WHICH THE REPORT IS CURRENSZ
)@@G@@TLY   @F@@@@                   POSITIONED.  IF THE SAVED NEXT GROUP INTETA
)@@G@@GER   @E@@@@                   WAS SO SET, THE RWCS MOVES THE SAVED NEXTTB
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   GROUP INTEGER INTO LINE-COUNTER, RESETS THE    TC
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   SAVED NEXT GROUP INTEGER TO ZERO, AND COMPUTES TD
)@@G@@@D@@@@                   A TRIAL SUM IN A WORK LOCATION.    @E@@@@      TE
)@@G@@             THE TRIAL SUM IS COMPUTED BY ADDING THE  @F@@@@            TF
)@@G@@       CONTENTS OF LINE-COUNTER TO THE INTEGER ONE(1) @F@@@@            TG
)@@G@@       AND THE INTEGERS OF ALL BUT THE FIRST LINE     @F@@@@            TH
)@@G@@       NUMBER CLAUSE OF THE BODY GROUP.  IF THE TRIAL @F@@@@            TI
)@@G@@       SUM IS NOT GREATER THAN THE BODY GROUP'S LOWER @F@@@@            TJ
)@@G@@       LIMIT INTEGER, THEN THE BODY GROUP IS PRESENTED@F@@@@            TK
)@@G@@       ON THE CURRENT PAGE.  IF THE TRIAL SUM EXCEEDS @F@@@@            TL
)@@G@@       THE BODY GROUP'S LOWER LIMIT INTEGER, THEN THE @F@@@@            TM
)@@G@@       RWCS EXECUTES PAGE ADVANCE PROCESSING.  AFTER  @F@@@@            TN
)@@G@@       THE PAGE HEADING REPORT GROUP(IF DEFINED) HAS  @F@@@@            TO
)@@G@@       BEEN PROCESSED, THE RWCS PRESENTS THE BODY     @B@@@@            TP
)@@G@@       GROUP ON THAT PAGE.    @[@@@@      @E@@@@                C. IF A TQ
)@@G@@BODY GROUP HAS BEEN PRESENTED ON THE@E@@@@                   PAGE TO WHITR
)@@G@@CH THE REPORT IS CURRENTLY    @F@@@@                   POSITIONED, THE RTS
)@@G@@WCS EXECUTES PAGE ADVANCE     @F@@@@                   PROCESSING.  AFTETT
)@@G@@R THE PAGE HEADING REPORT     @F@@@@                   GROUP(IF DEFINED)TU
)@@G@@ HAS BEEN PROCESSED, THE RWCS @C@@@@                   REAPPLIES FIT TESTV
)@@G@@T RULE 3C.  @F@@@@                   IF NO BODY GROUP HAS YET BEEN PRESETW
)@@G@@NTED ON THE @E@@@@                   PAGE TO WHICH THE REPORT IS CURRENTTX
)@@G@@LY    @F@@@@                   POSITIONED, THE RWCS DETERMINES WHETHER TTY
)@@G@@HE    @F@@@@                   SAVED NEXT GROUP INTEGER LOCATION WAS SETTZ
)@@G@@ WHEN @E@@@@                   THE FINAL BODY GROUP WAS PRESENTED ON THEUA
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   PRECEDING PAGE.(SEE FINAL LINE-COUNTER SETTING UB
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   RULE 6A)  IF THE SAVED NEXT GROUP INTEGER WAS  UC
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   NOT SO SET, THE BODY GROUP SHALL BE PRESENTED  UD
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   ON THE PAGE TO WHICH THE REPORT IS CURRENTLY   UE
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   POSITIONED.  IF THE SAVED NEXT GROUP INTEGER   UF
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   WAS SO SET, THE RWCS MOVES THE SAVED NEXT GROUPUG
)@@G@@@H@@@@                   INTEGER INTO LINE-COUNTER AND RESETS THE SAVED UH
)@@G@@NEXT GROUP  @H@@@@                   INTEGER TO ZERO.  IF THEN THE VALUEUI
)@@G@@ IN LINE-COUNTER IS     @F@@@@                   LESS THAN THE INTEGER OUJ
)@@G@@F THE FIRST ABSOLUTE    @F@@@@                   LINE NUMBER CLAUSE, THEUK
)@@G@@ BODY GROUP SHALL BE    @F@@@@                   PRESENTED ON THE PAGE TUL
)@@G@@O WHICH THE REPORT IS   @E@@@@                   CURRENTLY POSITIONED.  UM
)@@G@@OTHERWISE THE RWCS@F@@@@                   EXECUTES PAGE ADVANCE PROCESSUN
)@@G@@ING.  AFTER THE   @F@@@@                   PAGE HEADING REPORT GROUP(IF UO
)@@G@@DEFINED) HAS BEEN @F@@@@                   PROCESSED, THE RWCS PRESENTS UP
)@@G@@THE BODY GROUP ON @ @@@@                   THAT PAGE. @[@@@@      @B@@@@UQ
)@@G@@         (4) FIRST PRINT POSITION RULES   @[@@@@      @E@@@@            UR
)@@G@@    A. THE FIRST PRINT LINE OF THE BODY GROUP IS@F@@@@                  US
)@@G@@ PRESENTED ON THE LINE NUMBER SPECIFIED BY THE  @D@@@@                  UT
)@@G@@ INTEGER OF ITS LINE NUMBER CLAUSE. @F@@@@                B. IF THE VALUUU
)@@G@@E IN LINE-COUNTER IS EQUAL TO OR    @F@@@@                   GREATER THAUV
)@@G@@N THE LINE NUMBER SPECIFIED BY THE  @F@@@@                   FIRST DETAIUW
)@@G@@L PHRASE OF THE PAGE CLAUSE, AND IF @E@@@@                   NO BODY GROUX
)@@G@@UP HAS BEEN PREVIOUSLY BEEN   @F@@@@                   PRESENTED ON THE UY
)@@G@@PAGE TO WHICH THE REPORT IS   @F@@@@                   CURRENTLY POSITIOUZ
)@@G@@NED, THEN THE FIRST PRINT     @F@@@@                   LINE OF THE CURREVA
)@@G@@NT BODY GROUP IS PRESENTED    @F@@@@                   ON THE LINE IMMEDVB
)@@G@@IATELY FOLLOWING THE LINE     @D@@@@                   INDICATED BY THE VC
)@@G@@VALUE CONTAINED IN@A@@@@                   LINE-COUNTER.    @F@@@@      VD
)@@G@@             IF THE VALUE IN LINE-COUNTER IS EQUAL TO OR    @F@@@@      VE
)@@G@@             GREATER THAN THE LINE NUMBER SPECIFIED BY THE  @F@@@@      VF
)@@G@@             FIRST DETAIL PHRASE OF THE PAGE CLAUSE, AND IF @F@@@@      VG
)@@G@@             A BODY GROUP HAS PREVIOUSLY BEEN PRESENTED ON  @E@@@@      VH
)@@G@@             THE PAGE TO WHICH THE REPORT IS CURRENTLY@F@@@@            VI
)@@G@@       POSITIONED, THEN THE FIRST PRINT LINE OF THE   @F@@@@            VJ
)@@G@@       CURRENT BODY GROUP IS PRESENTED ON THE LINE    @F@@@@            VK
)@@G@@       THAT IS OBTAINED BY ADDING THE CONTENTS OF     @F@@@@            VL
)@@G@@       LINE-COUNTER AND THE INTEGER OF THE FIRST LINE @E@@@@            VM
)@@G@@       NUMBER CLAUSE OF THE CURRENT BODY GROUP. @F@@@@                  VN
)@@G@@ IF THE VALUE IN LINE-COUNTER IS LESS THAN THE  @E@@@@                  VO
)@@G@@ LINE NUMBER SPECIFIED BY THE FIRST DETAIL@F@@@@                   PHRASVP
)@@G@@E OF THE PAGE CLAUSE, THEN THE FIRST PRINT@F@@@@                   LINE VQ
)@@G@@OF THE BODY GROUP IS PRESENTED ON THE LINE@E@@@@                   SPECIVR
)@@G@@FIED BY THE FIRST DETAIL PHRASE.    @D@@@@                C. THE BODY GRVS
)@@G@@OUP IS NOT PRESENTED.   @F@@@@                D. THE SUM OF THE CONTENTSVT
)@@G@@ OF LINE-COUNTER AND    @F@@@@                   THE INTEGER OF THE FIRSVU
)@@G@@T LINE NUMBER CLAUSE    @F@@@@                   DEFINES THE LINE NUMBERVV
)@@G@@ ON WHICH THE FIRST     @C@@@@                   PRINT LINE IS PRESENTEDVW
)@@G@@.     @[@@@@      @D@@@@         (5) NEXT GROUP RULE.  THE INTEGER OF THVX
)@@G@@E     @E@@@@             ABSOLUTE NEXT GROUP CLAUSE MUST SPECIFY A LINE VY
)@@G@@@E@@@@             NUMBER THAT IS NOT LESS THAN THAT SPECIFIED IN @E@@@@VZ
)@@G@@             THE FIRST DETAIL PHRASE OF THE OAGE CLAUSE, AND@E@@@@      WA
)@@G@@       THAT IS NOT GREATER THAN THAT SPECIFIED IN THE @C@@@@            WB
)@@G@@ FOOTING PHRASE OF THE PAGE CLAUSE. @[@@@@      @C@@@@         (6) FINALWC
)@@G@@ LINE-COUNTER SETTING RULES   @[@@@@      @E@@@@                A. IF THWD
)@@G@@E BODY GROUP THAT HAS JUST BEEN     @F@@@@                   PRESENTED IWE
)@@G@@S A CONTROL FOOTING REPORT GROUP AND@F@@@@                   IF THE CONTWF
)@@G@@ROL FOOTING REPORT GROUP IS NOT     @F@@@@                   ASSOCIATED WG
)@@G@@WITH THE HIGHEST LEVEL AT WHICH THE @F@@@@                   RWCS DETECTWH
)@@G@@ED A CONTROL BREAK, THEN THE FINAL  @F@@@@                   LINE-COUNTEWI
)@@G@@R SETTING IS THE LINE NUMBER ON     @E@@@@                   WHICH THE FWJ
)@@G@@INAL PRINT LINE OF THE CONTROL@D@@@@                   FOOTING REPORT GRWK
)@@G@@OUP WAS PRESENTED.@F@@@@                   FOR ALL OTHER CASES THE RWCS WL
)@@G@@MAKES A COMPARISON@F@@@@                   OF THE LINE NUMBER ON WHICH TWM
)@@G@@HE FINAL PRINT    @F@@@@                   LINE OF THE BODY GROUP WAS PRWN
)@@G@@ESENTED AND THE   @E@@@@                   INTEGER OF THE NEXT GROUP CLAWO
)@@G@@USE.  IF THE@F@@@@                   FORMER IS LESS THAN THE LATTER, THEWP
)@@G@@N THE RWCS  @E@@@@                   PLACES THE NEXT GROUP INTEGER INTO WQ
)@@G@@LINE- @F@@@@                   COUNTER AS THE FINAL LINE-COUNTER SETTINGWR
)@@G@@.  IF @F@@@@                   THE FORMER IS EQUAL TO OR GREATER THAN THWS
)@@G@@E     @F@@@@                   LATTER THEN THE RWCS PLACES THE LINE NUMBWT
)@@G@@ER    @F@@@@                   SPECIFIED BY THE FOOTING PHRASE OF THE PAWU
)@@G@@GE    @F@@@@                   CLAUSE INTO LINE-COUNTER AS THE FINAL LINWV
)@@G@@E-    @F@@@@                   COUNTER SETTING; IN ADDITION THE RWCS PLAWW
)@@G@@CES   @F@@@@                   THE NEXT GROUP INTEGER INTO THE SAVED NEXWX
)@@G@@T     @B@@@@                   GROUP INTEGER LOCATION.@[@@@@      @E@@@@WY
)@@G@@                B. IF THE BODY GROUP THAT HAS JUST BEEN     @F@@@@      WZ
)@@G@@             PRESENTED IS A CONTROL FOOTING REPORT GROUP,   @F@@@@      XA
)@@G@@             AND IF THE CONTROL FOOTING REPORT GROUP IS NOT @F@@@@      XB
)@@G@@             ASSOCIATED WITH THE HIGHEST LEVEL AT WHICH THE @F@@@@      XC
)@@G@@             RWCS DETECTED A CONTROL BREAK, THEN THE FINAL  @F@@@@      XD
)@@G@@             LINE-COUNTER SETTING IS THE LINE NUMBER ON     @E@@@@      XE
)@@G@@             WHICH THE FINAL PRINT LINE OF THE CONTROL@D@@@@            XF
)@@G@@       FOOTING REPORT GROUP WAS PRESENTED.@F@@@@                   FOR AXG
)@@G@@LL OTHER CASES THE RWCS COMPUTES A TRIAL  @E@@@@                   SUM IXH
)@@G@@N A WORK LOCATION.  THE TRIAL SUM IS@F@@@@                   COMPUTED BYXI
)@@G@@ ADDING THE INTEGER OF THE NEXT     @F@@@@                   GROUP CLAUSXJ
)@@G@@E TO THE LINE NUMBER ON WHICH THE   @E@@@@                   FINAL PRINTXK
)@@G@@ LINE OF THE BODY GROUP WAS   @F@@@@                   PRESENTED.  IF THXL
)@@G@@E SUM IS LESS THAN THE LINE   @F@@@@                   NUMBER SPECIFIED XM
)@@G@@BY THE FOOTING PHRASE OF THE  @F@@@@                   PAGE CLAUSE, THENXN
)@@G@@ THE RWCS PLACES THAT SUM INTO@F@@@@                   LINE-COUNTER AS TXO
)@@G@@HE FINAL LINE-COUNTER SETTING.@F@@@@                   IF THE SUM IS EQUXP
)@@G@@AL TO OR GREATER THAN THE LINE@A@@@@                   NUMBER SPECIFIED XQ
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   BY THAT FOOTING PHRASE OF THE PAGE CLAUSE, THENXR
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   THE RWCS PLACES THE LINE NUMBER SPECIFIED BY   XS
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   THE FOOTING PHRASE OF THE PAGE CLAUSE INTO     XT
)@@G@@@E@@@@                   LINE-COUNTER AS THE FINAL LINE-COUNTER   @F@@@@XU
)@@G@@                   SETTING.  IF THE SUM IS EQUAL TO OR GREATER    @F@@@@XV
)@@G@@                   THAN THE LINE NUMBER SPECIFIED BY THE FOOTING  @F@@@@XW
)@@G@@                   PHRASE OF THE PAGE CLAUSE, THEN THE RWCS PLACES@F@@@@XX
)@@G@@                   THE LINE NUMBER SPECIFIED BY THE FOOTING PHRASE@F@@@@XY
)@@G@@                   OF THE PAGE CLAUSE INTO LINE-COUNTER AS THE    @C@@@@XZ
)@@G@@                   FINAL LINE-COUNTER SETTING.  @[@@@@      @E@@@@      YA
)@@G@@          C. IF THE BODY GROUP THAT HAS JUST BEEN     @F@@@@            YB
)@@G@@       PRESENTED IS A CONTROL FOOTING REPORT GROUP,   @F@@@@            YC
)@@G@@       AND IF THE CONTROL FOOTING REPORT GROUP IS NOT @F@@@@            YD
)@@G@@       ASSOCIATED WITH THE HIGHEST LEVEL AT WHICH THE @F@@@@            YE
)@@G@@       RWCS DETECTED A CONTROL BREAK, THEN THE FINAL  @F@@@@            YF

)@@G@@       WHICH THE FINAL PRINT LINE OF THE CONTROL@D@@@@                  YH
)@@G@@ FOOTING REPORT GROUP WAS PRESENTED.@F@@@@                   FOR ALL OTHYI
)@@G@@ER CASES THE RWCS PLACES THE LINE   @F@@@@                   NUMBER SPECYJ
)@@G@@IFIED BY THE FOOTING PHRASE OF THE  @F@@@@                   PAGE CLAUSEYK

)@@G@@R SETTING.  @[@@@@      @F@@@@                D. THE FINAL LINE-COUNTER YM

)@@G@@AL PRINT LINE OF THE    @C@@@@                   BODY GROUP WAS PRESENTEYO

)@@G@@                B. THE FIRST LINE NUMBER ON WHICH THE REPORT@F@@@@      DB
)@@G@@             FOOTING REPORT GROUP CAN BE PRESENTED, IS THE  @F@@@@      DC
)@@G@@             LINE NUMBER SPECIFIED BY THE HEADING PHRASE OF @A@@@@      DD
)@@G@@             THE PAGE CLAUSE. @[@@@@      @E@@@@         (2) LOWER LIMITDE
)@@G@@ RULE.  THE LAST LINE NUMBER ON     @E@@@@             WHICH THE REPORT DF
)@@G@@FOOTING REPORT GROUP CAN BE   @D@@@@             PRESENTED IS THE LINE NDG
)@@G@@UMBER SPECIFIED BY@B@@@@             INTEGER-1 OF THE PAGE CLAUSE.@[@@@@DH
)@@G@@      @C@@@@         (3) FIRST PRINT LINE POSITION RULES    @[@@@@      DI
)@@G@@@F@@@@                A. THE FIRST PRINT LINE OF THE REPORT FOOTING     DJ
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   REPORT GROUP IS PRESENTED ON THE LINE SPECIFIEDDK
)@@G@@@E@@@@                   BY THE INTEGER OF ITS LINE NUMBER CLAUSE.@[@@@@DL
)@@G@@      @E@@@@                B. IF A PAGE FOOTING REPORT GROUP HAS BEEN  DM
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   PRESENTED ON THE PAGE TO WHICH THE REPORT IS   DN
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   CURRENTLY POSITIONED, THEN THE SUM OF THE FINALDO
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   LINE-COUNTER SETTING ESTABLISHED BY THE PAGE   DP
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   FOOTING REPORT GROUP AND THE INTEGER OF THE    DQ
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   FIRST LINE NUMBER CLAUSE OF THE REPORT FOOTING DR
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   REPORT GROUP DEFINES THE LINE NUMBER ON WHICH  DS
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   THE FIRST PRINT LINE OF THE REPORT FOOTING     DT
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   REPORT GROUP IS PRESENTED.  OTHERWISE THE SUM  DU
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   OF THE INTEGER OF THE FIRST LINE NUMBER CLAUSE DV
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   OF THE REPORT FOOTING REPORT GROUP, AND THE    DW
)@@G@@@F@@@@                   LINE NUMBER SPECIFIED BY THE VALUE OF INTEGER-5DX
)@@G@@@E@@@@                   OF THE FOOTING PHRASE OF THE PAGE CLAUSE @F@@@@DY
)@@G@@                   DEFINES THE LINE NUMBER ON WHICH THE FIRST     @F@@@@DZ
)@@G@@                   PRINT LINE OF THE REPORT FOOTING REPORT GROUP  @A@@@@EA
)@@G@@                   IS PRESENTED.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@                C.EB
)@@G@@ THE NEXT PAGE PHRASE IN THE FIRST ABSOLUTE     @F@@@@                  EC
)@@G@@ LINE NUMBER CLAUSE DIRECTS THAT THE REPORT     @F@@@@                  ED
)@@G@@ FOOTING REPORT GROUP IS PRESENTED ON A PAGE ON @F@@@@                  EE
)@@G@@ WHICH NO OTHER REPORT GROUP HAS BEEN PRESENTED.@F@@@@                  EF
)@@G@@ THE FIRST PRINT LINE OF THE REPORT FOOTING     @F@@@@                  EG
)@@G@@ REPORT GROUP IS PRESENTED ON THE LINE NUMBER   @F@@@@                  EH
)@@G@@ SPECIFIED BY THE INTEGER OF ITS LINE NUMBER    @ @@@@                  EI
)@@G@@ CLAUSE.    @[@@@@      @F@@@@                D. THE SUM OF THE CONTENTSEJ
)@@G@@ OF LINE-COUNTER AND    @F@@@@                   THE INTEGER OF THE FIRSEK
)@@G@@T LINE NUMBER CLAUSE    @F@@@@                   DEFINES THE LINE NUMBEREL
)@@G@@ ON WHICH THE FIRST     @C@@@@                   PRINT LINE IS PRESENTEDEM
)@@G@@.     @[@@@@      @F@@@@                E. THE REPORT FOOTING GROUP IS NEN
)@@G@@OT PRESENTED.     @[@@@@      @C@@@@         (4) FINAL LINE-COUNTER SETTEO

)@@G@@UP.   @[@@@@      @#@@@@ 3.  LINE NUMBER  @[@@@@      @F@@@@     NEW CODEU

)@@G@@OF THE LINE CLAUSE.  FOLLOWING ARE THE SPECIFICATIONS @C@@@@     FOR THEEW

)@@G@@@B@@@@                        PLUS INTEGER-2    @[@@@@      @^@@@@     3EZ

)@@G@@ MUST NOT EXCEED THREE  @B@@@@             SIGNIFICANT DIGITS IN LENGTH.FB

)@@G@@LY THAT THE SUBROUTINE CALLING SEQUENCE GENERATED BY THE    @^@@@@'ENTERKQ
)@@G@@' WILL BE CHANGED.@[@@@@      @G@@@@THE PARAMETER LISTS GENERATED BY 'CAKR

)@@G@@REFERENCING' - THIS WILL REQUIRE RECODING @^@@@@OF SOME SUBROUTINES.    KT
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @H@@@@THE RELATIVE ADDRESSES PREVIOUSLY INCLUDED ON THE LEFTKU
)@@G@@ HAND COLUMN OF THE     @E@@@@LISTING ARE NOW INCLUDED IN THE CROSS REFEKV

)@@G@@ GENERAL, 'SMALL' PROGRAMS MAY HAVE A LARGER    @F@@@@COLLECTED SIZE USIKY
)@@G@@NG ASCII, BUT 'LARGE' PROGRAMS TEND TO HAVE     @B@@@@A SMALLER COLLECTEKZ
)@@G@@D SIZE USING ASCII.     @[@@@@      @G@@@@THE SYMBOLIC OUTPUT (ON @COB,ILA
)@@G@@) IS MARKED 'SYMBOLIC' - IT WILL BE MARKED@A@@@@'COB SYMB' IN A FUTURE RLB
)@@G@@ELEASE.     @[@@@@      @G@@@@UP-7923 WILL BE CHANGED TO COINCIDE WITH ULC
)@@G@@P-4144 REGARDING OPTIONS ON   @^@@@@THE PROCESSOR CALL CARD.@[@@@@      LD

)@@G@@ OF THE COMPILER WILL NOT INSERT THE PRTCN$     @]@@@@HEADING.    @[@@@@LG
)@@G@@      @H@@@@THE MEANING OF 'D' AND 'SB' IN THE CROSS REFERENCE LISTING ILH
)@@G@@S AS FOLLOWS:     @[@@@@      @H@@@@         'D'   THE NUMBER OF DIMENSILI
)@@G@@ONS THIS DATA ITEM HAS, I.E., 0,1,2, OR 3 @H@@@@         'SB'  STARTING LJ
)@@G@@BIT POSITION FOR THE FIELD NUMBERING LEFT TO RIGHT.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@LK
)@@G@@THE GENERATED INITIALIZATION CODE FOR A COBOL MAIN PROGRAM IS DIFFERENT LL
)@@G@@@F@@@@THAN FOR SUBROUTINES.  THIS IS BECAUSE A4 IS STORED IN A DIFFERENTLM
)@@G@@@^@@@@PLACE IN EITHER CASE.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@THE ASCII COMPILER DOES LN
)@@G@@NOT HANDLE RECORDING MODES 1, 2, AND 3.  THIS   @G@@@@HAS BEEN THE SUBJELO
)@@G@@CT OF A USE RECOMMENDATION AND IS PRESENTLY UNDER     @#@@@@CONSIDERATIOLP
)@@G@@N.    @[@@@@      @H@@@@IN GENERAL THE TAPE FORMATS OTHER THAN 'INTERNALLQ
)@@G@@' ARE PROVIDED FOR EASE OF    @G@@@@CONVERSION.  THE INTERNAL FORMAT IS LR
)@@G@@OPTIMIZED FOR PROCESSING EFFICIENCY.@[@@@@      @F@@@@WHEN PROCESSING IBLS
)@@G@@M TYPE TAPES THROUGH AN MSA, THE 'Q' TRANSLATE  @E@@@@FIELD SHOULD BE SELT

)@@G@@:     @]@@@@------------@[@@@@      @G@@@@ASCII COBOL REQUIRES THE PROGRNC
)@@G@@AM-WIDE MCORE$/LCORE$ EXECUTIVE FEATURE   @G@@@@FOR ASYNCHRONOUS PROGRAMND
)@@G@@ EXECUTION.  EXEC LEVEL 27-20-164 OR HIGHER IS  @G@@@@THEREFORE REQUIREDNE
)@@G@@ TO USE THE ASYNCHRONOUS FEATURES OF THE COMPILER.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@NF
)@@G@@THE MCS RE-ENTRANT PROCESSOR MUST BE GENERATED INTO THE EXEC IN ORDER   NG
)@@G@@@ @@@@TO EXECUTE COBOL MCS PROGRAMS.@[@@@@      @G@@@@IBM OS-360 TAPE CONH
)@@G@@MPATIBILITY IS AVAILABLE EITHER WITH OR WITHOUT MSA   @F@@@@INTERFACE, HNI
)@@G@@OWEVER, IBM COMPATIBLE TAPES WRITTEN WITHOUT THE MSA  @G@@@@INTERFACE WINJ
)@@G@@LL NECESSITATE LABELS TO BE BYPASSED WHEN READ AT AN IBM    @F@@@@SITE. NK
)@@G@@ A PROBLEM HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED WITH RESPECT TO READING AND  @G@@@@WRITINNL
)@@G@@G IBM FORMATTED TAPES WHERE 'COMP' OR 'COMP-3' ITEMS ARE DEFINED  @F@@@@NM
)@@G@@PRIOR TO THE RECORD SELECTOR FIELD.  A FURTHER ASSOCIATED PROBLEM @G@@@@NN
)@@G@@EXISTS WHERE 'COMP' AND 'COMP-3' FIELDS EXIST IN DIFFERENT PORTIONS     NO
)@@G@@@F@@@@OF MULTIPLE RECORD FORMATTED IBM FILES AND PROGRAM LOGIC RELIES ONNP
)@@G@@@G@@@@THE IBM DATA ALLOCATION RULES AND REDEFINES.  THESE PROBLEMS ARE UNQ
)@@G@@NDER  @G@@@@INVESTIGATION, HOWEVER CORRECTIONS ARE NOT AVAILABLE FOR VERNR
)@@G@@SION 1.4.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@CONVERSION REQUIREMENTS:@^@@@@NS
)@@G@@----------------------- @[@@@@      @G@@@@IN GENERAL, THE FD/ANSI COBOL NT
)@@G@@LANGUAGE IS COMPATIBLE WITH THE ASCII     @F@@@@COBOL SYNTAX, HOWEVER SONU
)@@G@@ME DIFFERENCES DO EXIST AND A DIFFERENC   @F@@@@DOCUMENT IS AVAILABLE UPNV
)@@G@@ON REQUEST (PER FSB #193) WHICH OUTLINES  @G@@@@CONVERSION INFORMATION. NW
)@@G@@ EXCEPT FOR RARE CASES, MINOR SOURCE LANGUAGE   @H@@@@CHANGES TO FD/ANSINX
)@@G@@ COBOL PROGRAMS WILL BE REQUIRED PRIOR TO RECOMPILATION.    @F@@@@MASS SNY
)@@G@@TORAGE FILE FORMATS ARE NOT COMPATIBLE AND THEREFIRE MUST BE@]@@@@CONVERNZ
)@@G@@TED.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@DOCUMENTATION     @]@@@@------------OA
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @H@@@@THE ASCII COBOL PRM, UP-7923, AND THE ASCII COBOL SUMMOB
)@@G@@ARY BOOKLET, UP-7924    @#@@@@ARE AVAILABLE.    @[@@@@      ___@@@FIELD OC
)@@G@@TEST VERSION WHICH WOULD*[@@@@*SDFF*@F@@@@THE LONG VERSION OF THIS ITEM OD

)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE         WF
)@@G@@       1-  1@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@  1.   INTRODUCTIOWG
)@@G@@N     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  UNIVERSITY OWH
)@@G@@F  MARYLAND TEXT EDITOR (@EDM) IS A PROGRAM     @G@@@@ DESIGNED  TO  EDIWI
)@@G@@T  PROGRAMS  AND/OR DATA ON A LINE BY LINE BASIS.     @G@@@@ VARIOUS  COWJ
)@@G@@MMANDS  ARE  PROVIDED  WHICH  ALLOW ONE TO ADD,  DELETE     @G@@@@ AND/OWK
)@@G@@R  CHANGE SELECTED LINES OR PORTIONS OF LINES,  TO SEARCH FOR     @A@@@@WL
)@@G@@ SPECIFIC STRINGS OF TEXT, ETC.     @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE EDITOR WM
)@@G@@COMMANDS VARY IN COMPLEXITY AND POWER.   ALTHOUGH     @G@@@@ THE  EDITORWN
)@@G@@  CAN  BE  USED WITH ONLY KNOWLEDGE OF THE BASIC SET OF     @G@@@@ COMMAWO
)@@G@@NDS, THE MORE SOPHISTICATED COMMANDS ALLOW MANY EDITING TASKS     @G@@@@WP
)@@G@@ TO  BE  DONE MUCH MORE RAPIDLY.   THE MORE ADVANCED COMMANDS ALLOW     WQ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ FOR  SELECTIVELY  PRINTING  RESULTS  (CUTTING  DOWN  ON TIME SPENWR
)@@G@@T     @G@@@@ WAITING  FOR  TERMINAL PRINTOUT),  DOING SEVERAL OF THE BASWS
)@@G@@IC COM-     @G@@@@ MANDS IN ONE STEP,  ALIGNING COLUMNS WITH A TAB FEATUWT
)@@G@@RE, MANIPULA-     @B@@@@ TING GROUPS OF IMAGES AS A UNIT, ETC.    @[@@@@WU
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       THIS  EDITOR  IS  UNDER  CONTINUOUS  DEVELOPMENT  BY WV
)@@G@@THE UOM     @G@@@@ SYSTEM'S STAFF.   ITS IMMEDIATE ANCESTOR WAS LEVEL 9 WW
)@@G@@OF THE UNIVAC     @G@@@@ @EDM  PROCESSOR  WHICH WAS IN TURN DERIVED FROMWX
)@@G@@ J.  SALZER'S 'CTSS'    @G@@@@ EDITOR  WRITTEN AT MIT.   SINCE WE HAVE NWY
)@@G@@O SCRUPLES,  A GREAT MANY     @G@@@@ NIFTY  FEATURES  WERE  PIRATED  FROWZ
)@@G@@M  OTHER  EDITORS SUCH AS THOSE     @G@@@@ AVAILABLE  ON  GE  AND  DEC SXA
)@@G@@YSTEMS.   THE    MATCH    COMMAND WAS     @G@@@@ ORIGINALLY DESIGNED ANDXB
)@@G@@ IMPLEMENTED AT THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN     @G@@@@ BY ERIC NORMAN.  XC
)@@G@@MANY OTHER USEFUL IDEAS AND SUGGESTIONS WERE MADE     @G@@@@ BY  THE  UOXD
)@@G@@M USER COMMUNITY,  BUT MOST OF THE IDEAS AND ALL OF THE     @B@@@@ WORK XE
)@@G@@ARE DUE TO KERN SIBBALD'S EFFORTS.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       USERS ARE CXF
)@@G@@AUTIONED THAT ALTHOUGH THE UOM EDITOR WAS DERIVED     @G@@@@ FROM  A  UNXG
)@@G@@IVAC  EDITOR,   IT IS NOT THE SAME;  COMMANDS HAVE BEEN     @G@@@@ DELETXH
)@@G@@ED,  ADDED, AND IN SOME CASES CHANGED.  UNIVAC MANUALS SHOULD     @G@@@@XI
)@@G@@ NOT  BE  USED AS REFERENCES FOR THE UOM EDITOR.   DIFFERENCES FROM     XJ
)@@G@@@C@@@@ THE UNIVAC EDITOR ARE TABULATED IN AN APPENDIX.@[@@@@      @G@@@@XK
)@@G@@       THIS  VERSION  OF  THE USER'S GUIDE (REVISION 4),  DOCUMENTS     XL
)@@G@@@G@@@@ FEATURES  AVAILABLE  IN  LEVEL 28 OF THE UOM EDITOR.   IT IS BEINXM
)@@G@@G     @G@@@@ RELEASED PRIOR TO THE RELEASE OF LEVEL 28 ITSELF SINCE MANYXN
)@@G@@ OF THE     @G@@@@ FEATURES  DOCUMENTED  HEREIN ARE AVAILABLE IN LEVEL 2XO
)@@G@@7 AND EARLIER     @G@@@@ EDITORS BUT HAVE NOT PREVIOUSLY BEEN DOCUMENTEDXP
)@@G@@.  THE MAIN FEATURE     @G@@@@ OF  LEVEL  28  WHICH  IS  NOT AVAILABLE IXQ
)@@G@@N PREVIOUS EDITORS IS THE     @G@@@@ EDITING OF UPPER AND LOWER CASE ASCXR
)@@G@@II FILES FROM TERMINALS RESTRI-     @G@@@@ CTED  TO UPPER CASE.   SOME OXS
)@@G@@F THE MORE ESOTERIC COMMANDS ARE ALSO     @G@@@@ NOT AVAILABLE IN EARLIEXT
)@@G@@R EDITORS; AN ATTEMPT TO USE SUCH A COMMAND     @G@@@@ WILL  RESULT  IN XU
)@@G@@ A  DIAGNOSTIC  MESSAGE.   DEVELOPMENT OF THE UOM     @G@@@@ EDITOR IS AXV
)@@G@@ CONTINUING PROCESS;  THE MANUAL WILL BE UPDATED AS NEW     @ @@@@ FEATUXW
)@@G@@RES BECAME AVAILABLE.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@      XX
)@@G@@        UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                1-  2@[@@@@XY
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@  1. 1.   GENERAL @[@@@@      @[@@@@XZ
)@@G@@      @G@@@@      THE EDITOR HAS TWO MODES OF OPERATION, THE INPUT MODE YA
)@@G@@AND THE     @G@@@@ COMMAND MODE.   IN THE INPUT MODE,  LINES OF TEXT AREYB
)@@G@@ ACCEPTED AND     @G@@@@ INSERTED AS IS INTO THE OBJECT BEING EDITED.  IYC
)@@G@@N THE COMMAND MODE,     @G@@@@ ONE  TYPES  COMMANDS WHICH DIRECT THE EDIYD
)@@G@@TOR TO CHANGE OR SCAN THE     @^@@@@ TEXT IN VARIOUS WAYS.  @[@@@@      YE
)@@G@@@G@@@@      THE OBJECT BEING EDITED (WHETHER PROGRAM,  FILE, OR DATA) MAYF
)@@G@@Y     @G@@@@ BE  CONSIDERED  TO BE A SERIES OF LINES ARRANGED ONE AFTER YG
)@@G@@ANOTHER     @G@@@@ ON  A SCROLL.   AT ANY POINT IN TIME,  ONE MAY CONSIDYH
)@@G@@ER THAT HE IS     @G@@@@ LOOKING AT THE SCROLL THROUGH A WINDOW WHICH ISYI
)@@G@@ ONE LINE LONG.  IN     @G@@@@ THE COMMAND MODE,  ONE MAY MOVE THIS WINDYJ
)@@G@@OW UP AND DOWN THROUGHOUT     @G@@@@ THE  TEXT  EXAMINING AND/OR MODIFYIYK
)@@G@@NG A LINE AT A TIME.   COMMANDS     @G@@@@ WHICH  CHANGE THE TEXT OR FINYL
)@@G@@D PARTICULAR CHARACTER STRINGS AFFECT     @G@@@@ THE 'CURRENT' LINE AND YM
)@@G@@THOSE BELOW IT,  I.E.  THE NORMAL DIRECTION     @G@@@@ OF MOVEMENT OF THYN
)@@G@@E WINDOW IS DOWNWARD THROUGH THE TEXT.   THE LINE     @G@@@@ WHICH  CAN YO
)@@G@@ BE  'SEEN' THROUGH THE WINDOW AT ANY GIVEN TIME IS THE     @G@@@@ 'CURRYP
)@@G@@ENT' LINE.   IT IS POSSIBLE FOR THE WINDOW TO BE EMPTY; DELE-     @F@@@@YQ
)@@G@@ TING THE CURRENT LINE, FOR EXAMPLE, RESULTS IN AN EMPTY WINDOW.  @[@@@@YR
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@  1. 2.   SIGNING ON    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      YS
)@@G@@@D@@@@      THE NORMAL METHOD OF SIGNING ON THE EDITOR IS   @[@@@@      YT
)@@G@@@B@@@@                          @EDM   <NAME>   @B@@@@                  YU
)@@G@@        @EDM   <NAME>   @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WHERE <NAME> IS THE NAME OF TYV
)@@G@@HE OBJECT (PROGRAM, FILE, ETC.) TO BE     @G@@@@ EDITED.   EXEC 8 FILE.EYW
)@@G@@LEMENT NOTATION IS ALLOWED, BUT THE NAME IS     @G@@@@ MORE  USUALLY THEYX
)@@G@@ NAME OF A PROGRAM BEING ACTIVELY WORKED ON, I.E.     @G@@@@ 12  OR  FEWYY
)@@G@@ER  CHARACTERS FROM THE SET  A-Z,  0-9,  $ AND -.   THE     @G@@@@ EDITOYZ
)@@G@@R  WILL  RESPOND  WITH  A  SIGNON LINE.   IF THE NAMED OBJECT     @G@@@@ZA
)@@G@@ ALREADY  EXISTS,  THE EDITOR WILL ASSUME IT IS TO BE UPDATED,  AND     ZB
)@@G@@@G@@@@ PRINT 'EDIT',  FOLLOWED BY AN ASTERISK SIGNALLING ITS READINESS TZC
)@@G@@O     @G@@@@ ACCEPT COMMANDS.  IF THE OBJECT DOES NOT EXIST, THE EDITOR ZD
)@@G@@ASSUMES     @G@@@@ IT IS TO BE CREATED,  PRINTS 'INPUT', AND THEN WAITS ZE
)@@G@@FOR THE LINES     @G@@@@ OF INPUT TO BE TYPED IN.  ALTHOUGH THE EDITOR OZF
)@@G@@RIGINALLY STARTS IN     @G@@@@ THE  EDIT  OR  INPUT  MODE DEPENDING UPONZG
)@@G@@ WHETHER THE NAMED OBJECT     @G@@@@ EXISTS OR NOT,  ONE MAY TOGGLE BETWZH
)@@G@@EEN THESE MODES AT ANY POINT BY     @^@@@@ ENTERING A BLANK LINE. @[@@@@ZI
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@  1. 3.   SIGNING OFF   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      ZJ
)@@G@@@G@@@@       REGARDLESS  OF  WHETHER  ONE  IS  IN INPUT OR COMMAND MODESZK
)@@G@@,     @G@@@@ NORMAL  EXIT  FROM  THE EDITOR MAY BE EFFECTED BY TYPING ANZL
)@@G@@ EXEC 8     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USEZM
)@@G@@R'S GUIDE                1-  3@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ZN
)@@G@@ CONTROL  CARD  (@  SIGN  IN  COLUMN 1);  A SINGLE @ IN COLUMN 1 IS     ZO
)@@G@@@G@@@@ SUFFICIENT.    ALTERNATIVELY,  THE COMMANDS    EXIT    OR    ABORZP
)@@G@@T     @G@@@@ MAY BE USED TO TERMINATE EDITING.   EXIT    CAUSES NORMAL TZQ
)@@G@@ERMINA-     @G@@@@ TION,   WHILE     ABORT     WILL  CAUSE THE EFFECTS OZR
)@@G@@F THE CURRENT     @G@@@@ EDITING SESSION TO BE DISCARDED.   FOR EITHER TZS
)@@G@@O BE EFFECTIVE, ONE     @G@@@@ MUST  BE  IN  THE  COMMAND MODE;  IN THE ZT
)@@G@@INPUT MODE TYPING    EXIT     @G@@@@ OR     ABORT    WOULD MERELY ADD THZU
)@@G@@OSE CHARACTERS AS A NEW LINE OF     @[@@@@ TEXT.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      ZV
)@@G@@@^@@@@  1. 4.   INPUT MODE    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      IN THEZW
)@@G@@ INPUT MODE, LINES OF TEXT ARE TYPED IN AND ACCEPTED AS     @G@@@@ DATA.ZX
)@@G@@   EACH LINE ACCEPTED IS INSERTED BELOW THE CURRENT LINE; THE     @G@@@@ZY
)@@G@@ WINDOW  IS  THEN MOVED DOWN SUCH THAT THE LINE ENTERED BECOMES THE     ZZ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ NEW 'CURRENT' LINE.   THUS,  IF ONE SWITCHES FROM INPUT TO COMMANAA
)@@G@@D     @G@@@@ MODE  (BY TYPING A BLANK LINE),  THE LINE AVAILABLE TO THE AB
)@@G@@COMMAND     @F@@@@ MODE (I.E. THE LINE IN THE WINDOW) IS THE LAST LINE TAC
)@@G@@YPED IN.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      IF THE DATA BEING ENTERED IS COLUMNAAD
)@@G@@R, THE 'TAB' COMMAND (SEE     @G@@@@ BELOW)  MAY BE USED TO ESTABLISH TAAE
)@@G@@B FUNCTIONS.   SINCE ATTEMPTING     @G@@@@ TO ENTER A BLANK LINE CAUSES AF
)@@G@@THE EDITOR TO CHANGE TO COMMAND MODE,     @G@@@@ COMPLETELY  BLANK  LINEAG
)@@G@@S  ARE ADDED TO THE TEXT BY TYPING IN LINES     @G@@@@ CONSISTING  ONLY AH
)@@G@@ OF  THE  TAB CHARACTER;  BLANK LINES CAN ALSO BE     @B@@@@ ENTERED IN AI
)@@G@@THE @EOF MODE (SEE BELOW).    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      UNLESS @EDM IS IN AJ
)@@G@@THE @EOF OR ASCII MODE, ANY IMAGE WITH AN @     @G@@@@ SIGN IN COLUMN 1 AK
)@@G@@WILL BE INTERPRETED AS AN EXEC 8 CONTROL CARD AND     @G@@@@ CAUSE SIGNOAL
)@@G@@FF OF THE EDITOR.   CONSEQUENTLY,  SUCH CARDS CANNOT BE     @G@@@@ ENTERAM
)@@G@@ED IN THE INPUT MODE.  METHODS FOR CIRCUMVENTING THIS RESTRI-     @A@@@@AN
)@@G@@ CTION ARE NOTED IN THE TEXT BELOW. @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@  1. 5AO
)@@G@@.   COMMAND MODE  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  COMMAND  MODAP
)@@G@@E  IS THE MODE IN WHICH EDITOR COMMANDS ARE     @G@@@@ ACCEPTED.    UPONAQ
)@@G@@  INITIAL  ENTRY  TO  THE COMMAND MODE,  THE WORD     @G@@@@ EDIT WILL PAR
)@@G@@RINT; IN ADDITION, A PROMPT (NORMALLY AN ASTERISK) WILL     @G@@@@ PRINTAS
)@@G@@ EACH TIME THE EDITOR IS READY TO ACCEPT A NEW COMMAND.   THE     @G@@@@AT
)@@G@@ COMMANDS DIRECT THE EDITOR TO PERFORM A SPECIFIC ACTION,  E.G.  TO     AU
)@@G@@@G@@@@ LOCATE AND/OR CHANGE A PARTICULAR STRING OF TEXT, TO DELETE LINESAV
)@@G@@,     @ @@@@ TO PRINT SELECTED LINES, ETC.@[@@@@      @ @@@@  1. 5. 1.  AW
)@@G@@ COMMAND FORMAT   @[@@@@      @G@@@@      IN GENERAL AN EDITOR COMMAND CAX
)@@G@@ONSISTS OF THE COMMAND SPECIFI-     @G@@@@ CATION  FOLLOWED  BY  AT  LEAAY
)@@G@@ST ONE BLANK,  FOLLOWED BY PARAMETERS     @G@@@@ WHICH  FURTHER  QUALIFYAZ
)@@G@@  THE  ACTION OF THE COMMAND.   THE COMMAND     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@      BA
)@@G@@        UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                1-  4@[@@@@BB
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ SPECIFICATION  IS THE NAME OF THE CBC
)@@G@@OMMAND (E.G.     PRINT  ) SOME-     @G@@@@ TIMES  FOLLOWED  BY AN OPTIONBD
)@@G@@S FIELD.   OPTIONS FIELDS ARE USUALLY     @G@@@@ GIVEN  TO SPECIFY THE NBE
)@@G@@UMBER OF TIMES A COMMAND IS TO BE REPEATED;     @G@@@@ IF GIVEN,  THE OPBF
)@@G@@TIONS FIELD IS SEPARATED FROM THE COMMAND NAME BY     @G@@@@ A COMMA (NOBG
)@@G@@ INTERVENING BLANKS).   ALL COMMAND NAMES MAY BE ABBRE-     @G@@@@ VIATEBH
)@@G@@D DOWN TO THEIR FIRST THREE CHARACTERS; SOME MAY BE ABBREVIA-     @G@@@@BI
)@@G@@ TED  TO  THEIR  FIRST TWO OR EVEN ONE.   THE NOTATION USED IN THIS     BJ
)@@G@@@F@@@@ DOCUMENT TO DESCRIBE THE SYNTAX OF COMMANDS IS THE FOLLOWING:    BK
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @E@@@@   (1)  THE COMMAND NAME WILL BE FULLY SPELLED OUT, FOBL
)@@G@@LLOWED@D@@@@        BY THE MINIMUM ABBREVIATION IN PARENTHESES,   @]@@@@BM
)@@G@@        E.G.@[@@@@      @B@@@@                     PRINT(P)  OR   TOP(T)BN
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@   (2)  THE PARAMETERS REQUIRED (IF ANY) WILL BE SPECIBO
)@@G@@FIED BY     @E@@@@        ENCLOSING THEM IN BRACKETS < >.  THE CONTENTS BP
)@@G@@OF THE@E@@@@        BRACKETS DESCRIBE WHAT THE PARAMETER SHOULD BE; ONE BQ
)@@G@@@F@@@@        SHOULD SUBSTITUTE THE DESIRED QUANTITY FOR THE BRACKETS.  BR
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @^@@@@        FOR EXAMPLE     @[@@@@      @C@@@@            BS
)@@G@@         PRINT(P) <NO. OF LINES>    @[@@@@      @F@@@@        MEANS THATBT
)@@G@@ THE PARAMETER IS THE NUMBER OF LINES TO BE     @C@@@@        PRINTED; TBU
)@@G@@O PRINT 5 LINES, ONE WOULD SAY@[@@@@      @B@@@@                       PBV
)@@G@@RINT 5   OR   P 5 @[@@@@      @G@@@@ SOME COMMANDS (E.G.  TOP(T)) NEED NBW
)@@G@@O PARAMETERS.   FOR OTHERS, THE     @G@@@@ PARAMETER IS OPTIONAL; IF OMIBX
)@@G@@TTED A DEFAULT VALUE WILL BE ASSUMED.     @G@@@@ NOTICE  THAT  THE  BRACBY
)@@G@@KETS  THEMSELVES ARE NOT PART OF THE ACTUAL     @]@@@@ COMMAND.   @[@@@@BZ
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @E@@@@  1. 6.   MOVEMENT OF THE VIEWING WINDOW (CURRENCA
)@@G@@T LINE)     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       MANY  OF THE EDITOR COMCB
)@@G@@MANDS MOVE THE VIEWING WINDOW THROUGH     @G@@@@ THE TEXT IN SOME MANNERCC
)@@G@@.  IF AN ATTEMPT IS MADE TO MOVE THE WINDOW     @G@@@@ OFF  THE  BOTTOM CD
)@@G@@ OF  THE  TEXT, AN 'END OF FILE' MESSAGE RESULTS.     @G@@@@ WHEN  AN  ECE
)@@G@@ND  OF FILE CONDITION ARISES,  THE WINDOW IS POSITIONED     @G@@@@ BELOWCF
)@@G@@ THE LAST LINE OF TEXT AND IS EMPTY; THIS ALLOWS INSERTION OF     @^@@@@CG
)@@G@@ NEW TEXT AT THE END.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IT IS ALSO POSSIBLE TO CH
)@@G@@ATTEMPT TO MOVE THE WINDOW UP OFF THE     @G@@@@ TOP  OF  THE  TEXT.   ICI
)@@G@@N THIS CASE,  THE WINDOW WILL BE POSITIONED     @G@@@@ ABOVE  THE  FIRSTCJ
)@@G@@  LINE OF TEXT AND WILL AGAIN BE EMPTY,  ALLOWING     @G@@@@ TEXT  TO  BCK
)@@G@@E  INSERTED  AHEAD OF OLD TEXT.   THIS IS A 'LINE ZERO'     @G@@@@ CONDICL
)@@G@@TION.    THE     TOP(T)    COMMAND ALWAYS MOVES THE WINDOW TO     @[@@@@CM
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE         CN
)@@G@@       1-  5@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @]@@@@ LINE ZERO. @[@@@@CO
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       IN  ADDITION TO THE END OF FILE AND LINE ZERO POSITIOCP
)@@G@@NS,  AN     @G@@@@ EMPTY  WINDOW  WILL  ALSO  RESULT  WHEN LINES ARE DELCQ
)@@G@@ETED.   EMPTY     @G@@@@ WINDOW  CONDITIONS  ARE  OF SIGNIFICANCE ONLY ICR
)@@G@@N THE FOLLOWING TWO     @]@@@@ CASES:     @F@@@@   (1)  EXECUTION OF A CCS
)@@G@@OMMAND WHICH IS TO BE REPEATED FOR SEVERAL@ @@@@        LINES, FOR EXAMPCT
)@@G@@LE    @[@@@@      @A@@@@                             PRINT 5@[@@@@      CU
)@@G@@@E@@@@        IN THIS SITUATION, THE CURRENT WINDOW CONTENTS ARE  @F@@@@CV
)@@G@@        COUNTED AS A LINE EVEN IF THE WINDOW IS EMPTY.  THUS,     @E@@@@CW
)@@G@@        IF ONE IS LOOKING AT AN EMPTY WINDOW, THE COMMAND   @[@@@@      CX
)@@G@@@A@@@@                             PRINT 5@[@@@@      @E@@@@        WILLCY
)@@G@@ RESULT IN THE DISPLAY OF ONLY 4 LINES.  ANY    @E@@@@        ATTEMPT TOCZ
)@@G@@ DISPLAY AN EMPTY WINDOW RESULTS IN NO    @^@@@@        DISPLAY AT ALL. DA
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @E@@@@   (2)  EXECUTION OF COMMANDS WHICH REQUIRE THAT THEREDB
)@@G@@ BE AN@B@@@@        IMAGE IN THE WINDOW, FOR EXAMPLE  @[@@@@      @B@@@@DC
)@@G@@                          CHANGE /X/Y/    @[@@@@      @E@@@@        IF TDD
)@@G@@HERE IS NO LINE AVAILABLE (THE WINDOW IS EMPTY),@D@@@@        THE MESSAGDE
)@@G@@E 'NO CURRENT IMAGE' WILL RESULT.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IT  SHOULD DF
)@@G@@BE NOTED THAT AN EMPTY WINDOW INDICATES THE COMP-     @G@@@@ LETE ABSENCDG
)@@G@@E OF ANY LINE AT ALL;  THIS IS NOT THE SAME AS A WINDOW     @E@@@@ CONTADH
)@@G@@INING A VALID LINE WHICH HAPPENS TO BE ALL BLANKS.    @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@DI
)@@G@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                2-  1DJ
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@  2.   BASIC COMMANDS   @[@@@@DK
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  BASIC  COMMANDS ENABLE ODL
)@@G@@NE TO PERFORM ALMOST ALL OF THE     @G@@@@ NECESSARY  FUNCTIONS  FOR  EDDM
)@@G@@ITING PROGRAMS AND SHOULD BE MASTERED     @G@@@@ BEFORE  PROCEEDING  TO DN
)@@G@@THE MORE SOPHISTICATED COMMANDS.   THE MORE     @G@@@@ SOPHISTICATED  CODO
)@@G@@MMANDS  MAKE  EDITING  MUCH EASIER,  BY COMBINING     @G@@@@ SEVERAL  OFDP
)@@G@@ THE FUNCTIONS OF THE BASIC COMMANDS,  BY ALLOWING MORE     @G@@@@ CONTRDQ
)@@G@@OL OVER THE OUTPUT DISPLAYED ON THE TERMINAL,  ETC.   TO MAKE     @G@@@@DR
)@@G@@ THE MOST EFFECTIVE USE OF THE EDITOR, ONE SHOULD BE FULLY AWARE OF     DS
)@@G@@@G@@@@ ALL OF THE FEATURES OF THE ADVANCED COMMANDS.   THE BASIC COMMANDDT
)@@G@@S     @G@@@@ ARE:   TOP(T),   PRINT(P),  NEXT(N),   DELETE(D),   LOCATE(DU
)@@G@@L), AND     @G@@@@ CHANGE(C).   IN ADDITION,  THE TERMINAL 'BREAK' KEY MDV
)@@G@@AY BE USED AS     @G@@@@ AN  EMERGENCY  PANIC  BUTTON (SEE BELOW),  AND DW
)@@G@@'UNDO',  'RC',  AND     @B@@@@ 'ABORT' MAY BE USED FOR ERROR RECOVERY.  DX
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@  2. 1.   TOP(T)  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      DY
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE    TOP(T)   COMMAND HAS NO PARAMETERS;  IT MOVES THE WINDOW TDZ
)@@G@@O     @G@@@@ THE TOP OF THE TEXT, AHEAD OF THE FIRST LINE OF TEXT.  AFTEEA
)@@G@@R A TOP     @F@@@@ , THE WINDOW IS EMPTY; I.E. A 'LINE ZERO' CONDITION REB
)@@G@@ESULTS.     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  2. 2.   PRINT(P) <NUMBER-OF-EC
)@@G@@LINES>@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    PRINT(P)    COMMAND  PED
)@@G@@RINTS  THE  SPECIFIED NUMBER OF     @G@@@@ LINES,  MOVING THE WINDOW DOWEE
)@@G@@NWARD AS IT DOES SO.   THE FIRST LINE     @G@@@@ PRINTED  WILL  BE  THE EF
)@@G@@'CURRENT' LINE;  NO PRINTING WILL RESULT IF     @G@@@@ THERE IS NO CURREEG
)@@G@@NT LINE (I.E. THE WINDOW IS EMPTY), BUT THE EMPTY     @G@@@@ WINDOW  WILEH
)@@G@@L BE COUNTED IN THE NUMBER OF LINES SPECIFIED;  THUS IF     @G@@@@ ONE  EI
)@@G@@HAS  JUST  DELETED  LINES OR DONE A   TOP   AND THE WINDOW IS     @]@@@@EJ
)@@G@@ EMPTY,     @[@@@@      @A@@@@                               P 1  @[@@@@EK
)@@G@@      @A@@@@ WILL RESULT IN NO DISPLAY, AND     @[@@@@      @A@@@@      EL
)@@G@@                         P 2  @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WILL DISPLAY ONE LINE, EM
)@@G@@THE LINE AFTER THE CURRENT WINDOW.  AFTER A     @G@@@@ PRINT,  THE  WINDEN
)@@G@@OW WILL BE POSITIONED OVER THE LAST LINE PRINTED.     @F@@@@ IF THE NUMBEO
)@@G@@ER OF LINES IS NOT SPECIFIED, ONE (1) IS ASSUMED.     @[@@@@      @[@@@@EP
)@@G@@      @A@@@@  2. 3.   NEXT(N) <NUMBER-OF-LINES> @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@      EQ
)@@G@@        UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                2-  2@[@@@@ER
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      THE    NEXT(N)    COMMAND MOVEES
)@@G@@S THE WINDOW UP AND DOWN THROU-     @G@@@@ GHOUT THE TEXT;  IT TAKES AS ET
)@@G@@A PARAMETER THE NUMBER OF LINES TO BE     @G@@@@ MOVED.    TO  MOVE  THEEU
)@@G@@  WINDOW UP,  THE NUMBER OF LINES SHOULD BE     @^@@@@ NEGATIVE.  FOR EXEV
)@@G@@AMPLE @[@@@@      @A@@@@                             NEXT 10@[@@@@      EW
)@@G@@@B@@@@ MOVES THE WINDOW DOWN TEN LINES, WHILE   @[@@@@      @A@@@@      EX
)@@G@@                         N -3 @[@@@@      @A@@@@ MOVES THE WINDOW UP THREY
)@@G@@EE LINES.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IF  THE  NUMBER  OF  LINES  TO BE MEZ
)@@G@@OVED DOWNWARD EXCEEDS THE     @G@@@@ NUMBER OF LINES REMAINING, THE END FA
)@@G@@OF FILE CONDITION RESULTS, I.E.     @G@@@@ THE WINDOW IS POSITIONED BELOFB
)@@G@@W THE LAST LINE OF TEXT AND IS EMPTY.     @G@@@@ WHEN AN END OF FILE CONFC
)@@G@@DITION ARISES,  THE NUMBER OF LINES ENCOUN-     @G@@@@ TERED BEFORE THE FD
)@@G@@END IS PRINTED;  THIS FEATURE MAY BE TAKEN ADVAN-     @G@@@@ TAGE  OF  TFE
)@@G@@O  DETERMINE  THE  TOTAL NUMBER OF LINES IN THE CURRENT     @G@@@@ TEXT.FF
)@@G@@  TO DETERMINE THE NUMBER OF LINES, ENTER   TOP(T)   FOLLOWED     @[@@@@FG
)@@G@@ BY   @A@@@@                            NEXT *  @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WHEN FH
)@@G@@ USED  IN PLACE OF A NUMBER (AS ABOVE) THE ASTERISK CHARACTER     @B@@@@FI
)@@G@@ IS EQUIVALENT TO A 'VERY LARGE' NUMBER.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IF  TFJ
)@@G@@HE  NUMBER  OF LINES IS NOT GIVEN, ONE LINE IS ASSUMED.     @G@@@@ ONCE FK
)@@G@@ THE    NEXT    COMMAND  HAS  MOVED THE WINDOW,  IT WILL THEN     @G@@@@FL
)@@G@@ DISPLAY  THE  NEW  WINDOW  CONTENTS  (UNLESS INHIBITED BY   BRIEF,     FM
)@@G@@@G@@@@ BELOW).  IF A   NEXT   COMMAND IS GIVEN WHEN THE WINDOW IS ALREADFN
)@@G@@Y     @G@@@@ AT THE END OF FILE,  A WRAPAROUND CONDITION WILL OCCUR,  I.FO
)@@G@@E.  THE     @G@@@@ EDITOR  WILL  ASSUME  THAT  A    TOP(T)   HAD BEEN GIFP
)@@G@@VEN AND START     @A@@@@ DOWNWARD FROM THE TOP OF THE TEXT. @[@@@@      FQ
)@@G@@@G@@@@      A    NEXT    IS IMPLIED WHENEVER A COMMAND CONSISTS OF ONLY FR
)@@G@@A     @F@@@@ SIGNED NUMBER.  THUS    +3    AND    -5    ARE EQUIVALENT TFS
)@@G@@O     @^@@@@ N 3    AND    N -5    .@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@  2. 4FT
)@@G@@.   DELETE(D) <NUMBER-OF-LINES>     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ THE  FU
)@@G@@  DELETE    COMMAND  DELETES  THE  SPECIFIED NUMBER OF LINES,     @E@@@@FV
)@@G@@ STARTING WITH THE 'CURRENT' LINE AND GOING DOWNWARD.  THUS @[@@@@      FW
)@@G@@@A@@@@                               D 5  @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WILL DELETEFX
)@@G@@ THE CURRENT LINE AND THE FOUR WHICH FOLLOW IT; AFTER A     @G@@@@ DELETFY
)@@G@@E,   THE WINDOW WILL ALWAYS BE EMPTY.   NOTE THAT THE CURRENT     @G@@@@FZ
)@@G@@ WINDOW CONTENTS ARE ALWAYS COUNTED AS THE FIRST LINE DELETED, EVEN     GA
)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE   GB
)@@G@@             2-  3@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@ IF THE WINDGC
)@@G@@OW IS EMPTY.@[@@@@      @G@@@@      THE FACT THAT AN EMPTY WINDOW RESULTGD
)@@G@@S FROM A   DELETE ENABLES     @G@@@@ ONE TO DELETE SEVERAL LINES AND THEGE
)@@G@@N INPUT NEW DATA TO REPLACE THE     @G@@@@ DELETED  LINES  WITHOUT  ANY GF
)@@G@@UNNECESSARY INTERMEDIATE COMMANDS FOR     @^@@@@ WINDOW REPOSITIONING.  GG
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       IF THE NUMBER OF LINES TO BE DELETED HAS NOT BEGH
)@@G@@EN SPECIFIED,     @^@@@@ ONE (1) IS ASSUMED.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      GI
)@@G@@@ @@@@  2. 5.   LOCATE(L) <STRING>  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      GJ
)@@G@@THE   LOCATE   COMMAND SEARCHES THROUGH THE TEXT DOWNWARD FOR     @G@@@@GK
)@@G@@ AN  OCCURRENCE OF THE SPECIFIED STRING OF CHARACTERS.   THE SEARCH     GL
)@@G@@@G@@@@ STARTS  AT THE LINE AFTER THE CURRENT LINE AND CONTINUES UNTIL THGM
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ STRING  IS  FOUND  OR  AN END OF FILE CONDITION ARISES.   WGN
)@@G@@HEN THE     @G@@@@ STRING IS FOUND, THE LINE CONTAINING IT IS PRINTED (UGO
)@@G@@NLESS INHIBI-     @F@@@@ TED BY BRIEF MODE), AND THE WINDOW IS POSITIONEGP
)@@G@@D OVER THAT LINE. @[@@@@      @G@@@@       BLANKS IN THE TEXT BEING EDITGQ
)@@G@@ED ARE IGNORED,  HENCE THE COM-     @[@@@@ MAND @A@@@@                  GR
)@@G@@            L XYZ @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD FIND AN IMAGE CONTAINING   X GS
)@@G@@ YZ,  EVEN THOUGH BLANKS APPEAR     @G@@@@ BETWEEN  THE X AND THE Y.   IGT
)@@G@@F A BLANK APPEARS IN THE STRING GIVEN     @G@@@@ ON THE LOCATE COMMAND IGU
)@@G@@TSELF,  THEN A 'HIT' WILL OCCUR IF THERE IS     @G@@@@ AT  LEAST  ONE BLGV
)@@G@@ANK IN THE TEXT,  BUT ALSO IF IT CONTAINS SEVERAL     @]@@@@ BLANKS.    GW
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@      IF A   LOCATE   IS GIVEN WHILE AT THE END OF FILGX
)@@G@@E, THE EDITOR     @G@@@@ WILL  ASSUME  AN  IMPLIED    TOP(T)   AND STARTGY
)@@G@@ SEARCHING DOWNWARD     @A@@@@ FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE TEXT.    @[@@@@GZ
)@@G@@      @G@@@@      IF <STRING> IS NOT SPECIFIED,  THE EDITOR WILL USE THEHA
)@@G@@ STRING     @C@@@@ IT USED ON THE LAST LOCATE PRIOR TO THIS TIME. @[@@@@HB
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  2. 6.   CHANGE(C) <EDIT-STRING>   @[@@@@      HC
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     CHANGE     COMMAND IS ONE OF THE MOST IHD
)@@G@@MPORTANT COM-     @G@@@@ MANDS,   ALLOWING  ONE  TO  CHANGE SELECTED OCCHE
)@@G@@URRENCES OF A GIVEN     @G@@@@ CHARACTER  STRING  TO  A  DIFFERENT STRINHF
)@@G@@G.   BASIC OPTIONS ON THE     @C@@@@ CHANGE    COMMAND ALLOW SELECTIVE CHG
)@@G@@HANGING OF  @[@@@@      @D@@@@   (1)  ALL OCCURRENCES ON A LINE OF A PARHH
)@@G@@TICULAR     @D@@@@        STRING, OR ONLY THE FIRST SUCH OCCURRENCE.    HI
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USEHJ
)@@G@@R'S GUIDE                2-  4@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @E@@@@HK
)@@G@@   (2)  SEVERAL LINES AT ONE TIME, OR ONLY THE CURRENT LINE.@[@@@@      HL
)@@G@@@G@@@@       IN  USING  THE  CHANGE COMMAND,  ONE SPECIFIES THE STRING OHM
)@@G@@F     @G@@@@ CHARACTERS  TO BE CHANGED,  AND THE STRING OF CHARACTERS ITHN
)@@G@@ SHOULD     @G@@@@ BE CHANGED TO.  THIS IS DONE BY TYPING THE TWO STRINGHO
)@@G@@S (OLD FIRST)     @G@@@@ ENCLOSED BY AN ARBITRARY DELIMITING CHARACTER; HP
)@@G@@ THE DELIMITER USED     @G@@@@ WILL  BE  THE  FIRST  NON-BLANK  CHARACTEHQ
)@@G@@R AFTER THE COMMAND NAME.     @G@@@@ BLANKS ARE SIGNIFICANT IN BOTH THE HR
)@@G@@'OLD' AND 'NEW' STRINGS.  AS AN     @G@@@@ EXAMPLE,   CONSIDER  THAT  ONHS
)@@G@@E WISHES TO CHANGE THE WORD 'SINF' TO     @C@@@@ 'SINE' IN THE CURRENT LHT
)@@G@@INE.  ONE WOULD TYPE    @[@@@@      @D@@@@            CHANGE ;SINF;SINE;HU
)@@G@@   OR   C ;SINF;SINE;   @[@@@@      @D@@@@ IN THIS CASE, THE SEMICOLON IHV
)@@G@@S USED AS THE DELIMITER.@[@@@@      @G@@@@      EITHER THE OLD OR THE NEHW
)@@G@@W STRING MAY BE NULL,  I.E.   CONTAIN     @G@@@@ NO  CHARACTERS.   THUS HX
)@@G@@ONE COULD ENTIRELY REMOVE THE WORD 'GLITCH'     @^@@@@ FROM A LINE BY ENHY
)@@G@@TERING@B@@@@                           C #GLITCH##    @[@@@@      @G@@@@HZ
)@@G@@ (NOTICE THAT IN THE ABOVE EXAMPLE THE DELIMITER IS A NUMBER SIGN),     IA
)@@G@@@G@@@@ AND ONE COULD INSERT THE WORK 'HERE' AT THE BEGINNING OF A LINE BIB
)@@G@@Y     @]@@@@ TYPING     @B@@@@                         CHANGE //HERE/   IC
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@      THE ABOVE EXAMPLES OF THE   CHANGE   COMMAND WILID
)@@G@@L CHANGE ONLY     @G@@@@ THE  FIRST  OCCURRENCE  OF THE GIVEN STRING ON IE
)@@G@@THE LINE.   ONE CAN     @G@@@@ INDICATE  THAT  ALL  OCCURRENCES  ON  A  IF
)@@G@@LINE ARE TO BE CHANGED BY     @E@@@@ TYPING A   G   (FOR GLOBAL) AFTER TIG
)@@G@@HE EDIT STRING - THUS   @[@@@@      @B@@@@                           C /IH
)@@G@@XX/XY/ G    @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD  CHANGE  ALL  OCCURRENCES  OF THE SII
)@@G@@TRING  XX  TO  XY  ON THE     @#@@@@ CURRENT LINE.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@IJ
)@@G@@       THE    CHANGE    COMMAND IN EITHER OF THE ABOVE FORMS MAY BE     IK
)@@G@@@G@@@@ DIRECTED TO OPERATE ON SEVERAL LINES BY TYPING THE NUMBER OF LINEIL
)@@G@@S     @^@@@@ TO BE CHANGED.  THUS   @[@@@@      @B@@@@                  IM
)@@G@@      CHANGE ;ABC;AB; 3 @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WILL CHANGE THE FIRST OCCURREIN
)@@G@@NCE OF  ABC  TO  AB  IN THREE SUCCES-     @C@@@@ SIVE LINES, STARTING WIIO
)@@G@@TH THE CURRENT LINE, AND@[@@@@      @C@@@@                   C /3.1416/3IP
)@@G@@.1415926/ 100 G   @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD  CHANGE  ALL OCCURRENCES OF 3IQ
)@@G@@.1416 FOR 100 LINES,  I.E.  THE     @B@@@@ CURRENT LINE AND THE 99 WHICHIR
)@@G@@ FOLLOW IT. @[@@@@      @G@@@@     UNLESS INHIBITED BY BRIEF MODE (SEE TIS
)@@G@@HE    ON    COMMAND), THE     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EIT
)@@G@@DITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                2-  5@[@@@@      @[@@@@      IU
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@ NEW  (I.E.   CHANGED) VERSION OF THE LINE WILL BE PRIIV
)@@G@@NTED FOR EACH     @G@@@@ CHANGED LINE.   ONE MAY TAKE ADVANTAGE OF THIS IW
)@@G@@FEATURE TO FIND ALL     @G@@@@ OCCURRENCES  OF  A  GIVEN  STRING  BY CHAIX
)@@G@@NGING IT TO ITSELF.   THE     @]@@@@ COMMANDS   @[@@@@      @ @@@@      IY
)@@G@@                  T     @B@@@@                        C :2*3:2*3: 10000 IZ
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD  CAUSE  ALL LINES CONTAINING THE STRING  2*3  TJA
)@@G@@O BE PRINTED.     @G@@@@ (NOTE:  THIS CAN BE MORE EASILY AND ECONOMICALLJB
)@@G@@Y DONE BY USING THE     @D@@@@ *  OPTION OF THE   LOCATE   COMMAND; SEE JC
)@@G@@BELOW).     @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE POSITION OF THE WINDOW AFTER A JD
)@@G@@CHANGE COMMAND WILL BE AT     @G@@@@ THE  LAST LINE WHICH WAS EXAMINED FJE
)@@G@@OR CHANGES,  REGARDLESS OF WHE-     @G@@@@ THER IT WAS CHANGED OR NOT.  JF
)@@G@@ SINCE THE FIRST LINE EXAMINED IS THE     @A@@@@ 'CURRENT' LINE, THIS MEJG
)@@G@@ANS THAT    @[@@@@      @A@@@@                           C /A/B/ 5@[@@@@JH
)@@G@@      @D@@@@  WILL LEAVE THE WINDOW POSITIONED AS IF ONE HAD TYPED@[@@@@JI
)@@G@@      @A@@@@                             NEXT 4 @[@@@@      @G@@@@      JJ
)@@G@@ IF NO <EDIT STRING> IS GIVEN, (I.E.  ONLY    C    IS TYPED),     @E@@@@JK
)@@G@@ THE EDITOR WILL USE THE <EDIT STRING> FROM THE LAST CHANGE.@[@@@@      JL
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @A@@@@  2. 7.   PRESSING THE PANIC BUTTON @[@@@@      @[@@@@JM
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  2. 7. 1.   USE OF THE 'BREAK' KEY @[@@@@      JN
)@@G@@@G@@@@       IF YOU HAVE DIRECTED THE EDITOR TO PERFORM SOME FUNCTION ANJO
)@@G@@D     @G@@@@ WISH  TO INTERRUPT IT,  YOU SHOULD HIT THE THE 'BREAK' KEY JP
)@@G@@ON YOUR     @D@@@@ TERMINAL.  EXEC 8 WILL THEN RESPOND WITH THE MESSAGE JQ
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @B@@@@                        INTRPT LAST LINE  @[@@@@      JR
)@@G@@@G@@@@ AT  WHICH  TIME  YOU SHOULD HIT CARRIAGE RETURN.   THE EDITOR WILJS
)@@G@@L     @G@@@@ REMAIN  IN  CONTROL;  IF IT HAD DONE ANYTHING PRIOR TO THE JT
)@@G@@TIME IT     @G@@@@ WAS  INTERRUPTED, IT WILL PRINT ANY LEFTOVER OUTPUT AJU
)@@G@@ND THEN STOP.     @G@@@@ THIS  IS  ESPECIALLY  USEFUL  IF  YOU  HAVE INAJV
)@@G@@DVERTENTLY TOLD THE     @G@@@@ EDITOR TO PRINT 1000 LINES INSTEAD OF 10,JW
)@@G@@  AND DO NOT WISH TO WAIT     @G@@@@ FOR IT TO PRINT 1000 LINES.   THE PJX
)@@G@@OSITION OF THE WINDOW IS UNPRE-     @G@@@@ DICTABLE AFTER A BREAK.   IN JY
)@@G@@ADDITION,  THE EDITOR MAY TOGGLE BET-     @G@@@@ WEEN  INPUT  AND OUTPUTJZ
)@@G@@ MODES.   IF SUCH A MODE CHANGE OCCURS,  IT     @G@@@@ WILL  BE SIGNALLEKA
)@@G@@D BY THE WORD    EDIT    OR    INPUT    AS APPRO-     @]@@@@ PRIATE.    KB
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USEKC
)@@G@@R'S GUIDE                2-  6@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@KD
)@@G@@  2. 7. 2.   UNDO(UN)   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     UNDO     COMMANKE
)@@G@@D WILL CAUSE THE EDITOR TO REVERT THE     @G@@@@ TEXT  BEING  EDITED TO KF
)@@G@@WHAT IT WAS AT THE LAST    TOP  ,  IGNORING     @G@@@@ ALL  CHANGES,  INKG
)@@G@@SERTIONS AND DELETIONS MADE SINCE THEN.   CAUTION     @G@@@@ SHOULD  BE KH
)@@G@@EXERCISED SINCE SOME COMMANDS IMPLICITLY DO A    TOP  ;     @G@@@@ THE  KI
)@@G@@STATE  OF THE TEXT WILL BE THAT OF THE LAST    TOP    WHETHER     @G@@@@KJ
)@@G@@ EXPLICIT  OR  IMPLICIT.    THE  NORMAL  DIRECTION OF MOTION OF THE     KK
)@@G@@@G@@@@ EDITING WINDOW IS ALWAYS DOWNWARD THROUGH THE TEXT.  SOME COMMANDKL
)@@G@@S     @G@@@@ WHICH  SEEM  TO  MOVE  THE WINDOW UPWARD ACTUALLY WORK BY DKM
)@@G@@OING AN     @G@@@@ IMPLIED    TOP    AND  THEN  MOVING THE WINDOW DOWN TKN
)@@G@@O THE DESIRED     @D@@@@ POSITION.  THUS ONE SHOULD REALIZE THAT THE COMKO
)@@G@@MAND  @[@@@@      @A@@@@                             NEXT -5@[@@@@      KP
)@@G@@@G@@@@ MAY  SOMETIMES  CAUSE AN IMPLIED    TOP    TO OCCUR;  A SUBSEQUENKQ
)@@G@@T     @G@@@@ UNDO     WOULD CAUSE THE TEXT TO BE RESTORED TO WHAT IT WASKR
)@@G@@ AT THE     @^@@@@ POINT OF THE   NEXT -5.@[@@@@      @A@@@@  2. 7. 3.  KS
)@@G@@ REVERSE CHANGE(RC)     @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     RC     COMMAND KT
)@@G@@ MAY SOMETIMES BE USED TO REVERSE THE     @G@@@@ EFFECTS  OF  A     CHANKU
)@@G@@GE    ;  WHETHER IT WILL DO SO DEPENDS UPON     @G@@@@ EXACTLY WHAT WAS KV
)@@G@@CHANGED.  FOR FURTHER DETAILS, SEE THE SECTION ON     @A@@@@ RC    IN A KW
)@@G@@SUBSEQUENT CHAPTER.     @[@@@@      @^@@@@  2. 7. 4.   ABORT(AB)  @[@@@@KX
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       THE    ABORT    COMMAND  WILL CAUSE THE ENTIRE RESULTKY
)@@G@@ OF THE     @G@@@@ EDITING  SESSION  TO  BE DISCARDED AND TERMINATE THE KZ
)@@G@@EDITOR.   THE     @G@@@@ OBJECT  BEING EDITED WILL REMAIN UNCHANGED FROMLA
)@@G@@ WHAT IT WAS AT THE     @A@@@@ TIME OF THE ORIGINAL   @EDM  .     @[@@@@LB
)@@G@@      @A@@@@  2. 7. 5.   BACK ELEMENT CYCLES    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      LC
)@@G@@ EVEN  AFTER TERMINATING THE EDITOR,  IT IS STILL POSSIBLE TO     @G@@@@LD
)@@G@@ RECOVER  A  PROGRAM  OR  DATA DECK AS IT WAS BEFORE EDITING BEGAN.     LE
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE  EDITOR  AUTOMATICALLY RETAINS UP TO A TOTAL OF FIVE COPIES OLF
)@@G@@F     @G@@@@ EACH DECK,  THE LATEST COPY AND FOUR BACKUP COPIES.  THESE LG
)@@G@@VARIOUS     @G@@@@ COPIES  ARE CALLED 'ELEMENT CYCLES' AND ARE SEQUENTIALH
)@@G@@LLY NUMBERED.     @D@@@@ THE MOST RECENT ELEMENT CYCLE HAS THE HIGHEST NLI
)@@G@@UMBER.@[@@@@      @G@@@@      AFTER COMPLETION OF EDITING,  ONE CAN RECOLJ
)@@G@@VER THE MOST RECENT     @G@@@@ BACKUP  COPY  BY  TYPING  ITS  NAME FOLLOLK
)@@G@@WED BY    -1    IN PAREN-     @F@@@@ THESES.  FOR EXAMPLE, CONSIDER THATLL
)@@G@@ ONE HAS DONE THE FOLLOWING - @[@@@@      @^@@@@              @EDM  PROGLM
)@@G@@@D@@@@              (                                    )  @D@@@@      LN
)@@G@@        (  SOME EDITING OF THE DECK  PROG    )  @D@@@@              (   LO
)@@G@@                                 )  @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM LP
)@@G@@TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                2-  7@[@@@@      @[@@@@LQ
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@              @EOF@[@@@@      @G@@@@ AFTER  HAVILR
)@@G@@NG  DONE  THIS,   ONE WISHES TO GO BACK TO THE PREVIOUS     @B@@@@ VERSILS
)@@G@@ON OF 'PROG' - THIS CAN BE DONE BY  @[@@@@      @B@@@@                  LT
)@@G@@        @EDM  PROG(-1)  @[@@@@      @G@@@@ THE  EDITOR  WILL  THEN ACT ALU
)@@G@@S IF THE FIRST EDITING HAD NEVER BEEN     @G@@@@ DONE, AND ALL TRACES OFLV
)@@G@@ WHAT HAD BEEN DONE AT THE PREVIOUS EDITING     @^@@@@ SESSION WILL BE PLW
)@@G@@URGED.@[@@@@      @G@@@@       FOR  MORE INFORMATION ON ELEMENT CYCLES, LX
)@@G@@ CONSULT THE EXEC 8     @B@@@@ PROGRAMMER'S REFERENCE MANUAL (PRM).     LY
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@  2. 8.   CRASH RECOVERY@[@@@@      @[@@@@LZ
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       @EDM  ALWAYS ATTEMPTS  TO MAINTAIN SUFFICIENT INFORMAMA
)@@G@@TION TO     @G@@@@ ENABLE  IT  TO RECOVER THE RESULTS OF AN EDITING SESSMB
)@@G@@ION WHICH HAS     @G@@@@ BEEN  INTERRUPTED  BY  A SYSTEM FAILURE OR A FAMC
)@@G@@ILURE IN THE EDITOR     @]@@@@ ITSELF.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       UPON MD
)@@G@@ THE FIRST ATTEMPT TO USE @EDM AFTER A FAILURE, IT WILL     @G@@@@ RECOGME
)@@G@@NIZE THAT A FAILURE OCCURRED, RECOVER AS MUCH OF THE PREVIOUS     @G@@@@MF
)@@G@@ EDITING AS POSSIBLE, AND ASK WHETHER THE INITIAL EDITING SHOULD BE     MG
)@@G@@@G@@@@ RESUMED.    IF  ONE  ANSWERS     NO    TO THE EDITOR'S REQUEST FOMH
)@@G@@R     @G@@@@ HELP,  THE OLD EDITING WILL BE DISCARDED, AND EDITING WILL MI
)@@G@@PROCEED     @G@@@@ NORMALLY.    IF  ONE  ANSWERS    YES    ,  THE PREVIOMJ
)@@G@@US EDITING IS     @G@@@@ CONTINUED.  IN THIS CASE, THE OUTPUT OF THE EDIMK
)@@G@@TOR SESSION WILL BE     @G@@@@ WRITTEN IN THE FILE OR ELEMENT SPECIFIED ML
)@@G@@ON THE @EDM COMMAND OF THE    @G@@@@ PREVIOUSLY INTERRUPTED SESSION;  THMM
)@@G@@E NAME TYPED ON THE @EDM COMMAND    @C@@@@ FOR THE CURRENT EDITOR SESSIOMN
)@@G@@N WILL BE IGNORED.@[@@@@      @G@@@@       IN  SOME CASES,  THE OUTPUT FMO
)@@G@@ILE OR ELEMENT MAY NOT BE AVAI-     @G@@@@ LABEL AT THE TIME OF RECOVERYMP
)@@G@@.  IF THIS OCCURS, @EDM WILL PRESERVE     @G@@@@ THE  RESULTS  IN  A FILMQ
