)@@G@@E OF ITS OWN AND TYPE AN INFORMATIONAL MES-     @G@@@@ SAGE.    AFTER  EMR
)@@G@@DITING  TERMINATES,   ONE MAY THEN USE THE NORMAL     @G@@@@ MECHANISMS MS
)@@G@@ OF EXEC 8 (E.G.   FURPUR) TO COPY THE RESULTS FROM THE     @C@@@@ EDITOMT
)@@G@@R'S RECOVERY FILE TO THE CORRECT PLACE.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@      WHEN RMU
)@@G@@ECOVERY OCCURS,  IT IS POSSIBLE THAT THE RESULTS OF THE     @G@@@@ LAST MV
)@@G@@ FEW  COMMANDS  OR  THE  LAST FEW INPUT LINES OF THE ORIGINAL     @G@@@@MW
)@@G@@ INTERRUPTED  EDITOR  SESSION  MAY  HAVE BEEN LOST.   THROUGHOUT AN     MX
)@@G@@@G@@@@ EDITING  SESSION,  @EDM PERIODICALLY CHECKPOINTS THE EDITING WHICMY
)@@G@@H     @G@@@@ HAS  BEEN DONE TO THAT POINT;  RECOVERY IS BACK TO THE LASTMZ
)@@G@@ CHECK-     @G@@@@ POINT.   CHECKPOINTS OCCUR AT EVERY    TOP    (EXPRESNA
)@@G@@S OR IMPLIED)     @G@@@@ AND  WHENEVER THE NUMBER OF CHANGES (INCLUDING NB
)@@G@@INSERTIONS OR DELE-     @G@@@@ TIONS)  TO THE TEXT EXCEEDS FIFTY LINES. NC
)@@G@@  THE FREQUENCY OF CHECK-     @D@@@@ POINTS MAY BE CHANGED WITH THE    AND
)@@G@@UTO    COMMAND.   @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM)NE
)@@G@@ - USER'S GUIDE                2-  8@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      NF
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@  2. 9.   SUMMARY @[@@@@      @[@@@@      NG
)@@G@@@G@@@@       THE  BASIC COMMANDS AS GIVEN ABOVE ARE SUFFICIENT TO DO MOSNH
)@@G@@T     @G@@@@ EDITING.   THERE ARE,  HOWEVER, MORE COMMANDS WHOSE USE CANNI
)@@G@@ CONSI-     @G@@@@ DERABLY  SHORTEN  THE  EDITING  TASK.    THERE  ARE VNJ
)@@G@@ARIATIONS AND     @G@@@@ OPTIONS  ON  THE    CHANGE    AND    LOCATE COMNK
)@@G@@MANDS, FOR EXAMPLE,     @G@@@@ WHICH  ALLOW  MORE  FLEXIBILITY  IN  THEINL
)@@G@@R  USE.   ONE MAY SPECIFY     @G@@@@ SO-CALLED  'MASK'  CHARACTERS  SO  NM
)@@G@@THAT A SEARCH FOR A STRING WILL     @G@@@@ SUCCEED  OR  FAIL  REGARDLESSNN
)@@G@@ OF WHAT THE 'MASKED' CHARACTERS ARE.     @G@@@@ FIND     IS  A COLUMN ONO
)@@G@@RIENTED COMMAND SIMILAR TO    LOCATE    BUT     @G@@@@ FASTER  AND  MORENP
)@@G@@ SPECIFIC.   INLINE    ALLOWS SIMULTANEOUS INSER-     @G@@@@ TION, DELETNQ
)@@G@@ION AND REPLACEMENT OF SEVERAL STRINGS ON A GIVEN LINE.     @G@@@@ THE ENR
)@@G@@DITOR'S MOST POWERFUL COMMAND,     MATCH  , ALLOWS COMPLETELY     @G@@@@NS
)@@G@@ GENERAL  PATTERN  MATCHING  AND STRING REPLACEMENT,  INCORPORATING     NT
)@@G@@@G@@@@ MANY  FEATURES  OTHERWISE  AVAILABLE  ONLY  IN STRING MANIPULATIONU
)@@G@@N     @G@@@@ LANGUAGES  SUCH  AS SNOBOL.   IN ADDITION,  THE EDITOR'S PRNV
)@@G@@OCEDURE     @G@@@@ CAPABILITY ENABLES ENTIRE PROGRAMS WITH LOOPS,  TESTSNW
)@@G@@,  ETC. TO BE     @B@@@@ WRITTEN IN THE EDITOR'S COMMAND LANGUAGE.@[@@@@NX
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       THESE ADDITIONAL COMMANDS AND OPTIONS ARE DISCUSSED BNY
)@@G@@ELOW IN     @G@@@@ THE  SECTION  ON 'ADVANCED FEATURES'.   BECAUSE THESENZ
)@@G@@ FEATURES CAN     @G@@@@ GREATLY  REDUCE  THE EFFORT INVOLVED IN A PARTIOA
)@@G@@CULAR EDITING TASK,     @G@@@@ THEY  SHOULD  BE  MASTERED  AS  SOON AS OOB
)@@G@@NE HAS ACQUIRED A WORKING     @B@@@@ FAMILIARITY WITH THE BASIC COMMANDSOC
)@@G@@.     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUOD
)@@G@@IDE                3-  1@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@  3.  OE
)@@G@@ ALTERNATES TO THE BASIC COMMANDS   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      OF
)@@G@@@G@@@@       THE  FOLLOWING COMMANDS ARE SIMILAR IN FUNCTION TO THE BASIOG
)@@G@@C     @F@@@@ COMMANDS, BUT MAY IN SOME INSTANCE BE MORE CONVENIENT TO USOH
)@@G@@E.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  3. 1.   UP(U) <NUMBER-OF LINES>   OI
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    UP   COMMAND MOVES THE WINDOOJ
)@@G@@W UP THE SPECIFIED NUMBER     @^@@@@ OF LINES.  THE COMMAND @A@@@@      OK
)@@G@@                        UP 6  @[@@@@      @#@@@@ IS EQUIVALENT TO @[@@@@OL
)@@G@@      @A@@@@                             NEXT -6@[@@@@      @G@@@@      OM
)@@G@@ONE MAY LEAVE OUT THE COMMAND NAME FOR BOTH    NEXT    AND UP     @D@@@@ON
)@@G@@ BY ENTERING A SIGNED NUMBER INSTEAD.  FOR EXAMPLE    @[@@@@      @D@@@@OO
)@@G@@               -6                  AND              +7@[@@@@      @G@@@@OP
)@@G@@ ARE EQUIVALENT TO    UP 6   AND    N 7    , RESPECTIVELY.  IF THIS     OQ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ FORM IS USED, THE SIGN IS REQUIRED.  THE ABSENCE OF A LEADING SIGOR
)@@G@@N     @C@@@@ IMPLIES A    GO    COMMAND (SEE CHAPTER 5).    @[@@@@      OS
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @^@@@@  3. 2.   APPEND(AP)    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@OT
)@@G@@      THIS COMMAND PUTS THE EDITOR INTO INPUT MODE AT THE BOTTOM OF     OU
)@@G@@@B@@@@ THE CURRENT TEXT.  IT IS EQUIVALENT TO   @[@@@@      @A@@@@      OV
)@@G@@                       N 10000@C@@@@                (BLANK LINE TO ENTEROW
)@@G@@ INPUT MODE)@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@  3. 3.   OUTPUT(O) <NUMBER-OFOX
)@@G@@-LINES>     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THIS  COMMAND  IS IDENTOY
)@@G@@ICAL TO   PRINT  EXCEPT THAT PRINTING     @G@@@@ STARTS  WITH  THE LINE OZ
)@@G@@AFTER THE CURRENT LINE.   IT IS MOST USEFUL     @G@@@@ AFTER  A     CHANPA
)@@G@@GE     OR     LOCATE    WHEN WHEN ONE HAS ALREADY     @F@@@@ SEEN THE CUPB
)@@G@@RRENT LINE AND DOES NOT WISH TO HAVE IT RE-PRINTED.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@PC
)@@G@@      @ @@@@  3. 4.   INSERT(I) <TEXT>    @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@            PD
)@@G@@  UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                3-  2@[@@@@      PE
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE   INSERT   COMMAND ALLOWS THE IPF
)@@G@@NSERTION OF A SINGLE LINE     @G@@@@ OF  TEXT  IMMEDIATELY  BELOW  THE  PG
)@@G@@CURRENT  LINE WITHOUT HAVING TO     @G@@@@ TOGGLE TO THE INPUT MODE AND PH
)@@G@@THEN BACK TO COMMAND MODE.   THE TEXT     @G@@@@ TYPED IS INSERTED WITH PI
)@@G@@COLUMN 1 OF THE INSERTED LINE CORRESPONDING     @G@@@@ TO THE 1ST CHARACPJ
)@@G@@TER WHICH FOLLOWS THE (MANDATORY) BLANK AFTER THE     @G@@@@ COMMAND  NAPK
)@@G@@ME.    THE  WINDOW WILL BE POSITIONED OVER THE INSERTED     @[@@@@ LINE.PL
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @#@@@@      THE COMMAND @B@@@@                         I THIPM
)@@G@@S IS TEXT   @[@@@@      @#@@@@ IS EQUIVALENT TO @[@@@@      @C@@@@      PN
)@@G@@          (BLANK LINE TO ENTER INPUT MODE)@ @@@@                THIS IS PO
)@@G@@TEXT  @D@@@@                (BLANK LINE TO RETURN TO COMMAND MODE)@[@@@@PP
)@@G@@      @G@@@@      TAB CHARACTERS (IF ANY) ARE EFFECTIVE IN THE INPUT TEXPQ
)@@G@@T.   IF     @G@@@@ THE  COMMAND  NAME (I) IS TYPED BUT NO INPUT <TEXT> IPR
)@@G@@S GIVEN,  THE     @G@@@@ EDITOR  WILL  TOGGLE  TO THE INPUT MODE.   AN EPS
)@@G@@DITOR MODE (THE EOF     @G@@@@ MODE)  EXISTS  IN WHICH AN    I    COMMANPT
)@@G@@D WITHOUT <TEXT> WILL NOT     @G@@@@ CAUSE TOGGLING,  BUT WILL INSTEAD EPU
)@@G@@NTER A BLANK LINE.  FOR FURTHER     @A@@@@ DETAILS, SEE THE    ON    COMPV
)@@G@@MAND. @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@  3. 5.   RETYPE(R) <TEXT>    @[@@@@PW
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    RETYPE    COMMAND CAUSES THE INPUTPX
)@@G@@ TEXT TO COMPLETELY     @G@@@@ REPLACE  THE TEXT OF THE CURRENT LINE.   PY
)@@G@@COLUMN 1 OF THE NEW IMAGE     @G@@@@ WILL CORRESPOND TO THE FIRST CHARACPZ
)@@G@@TER AFTER THE (MANDATORY) BLANK     @C@@@@ WHICH FOLLOWS THE COMMAND NAMQA
)@@G@@E.  THE COMMAND   @[@@@@      @A@@@@                            R <TEXT>QB
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @#@@@@ IS EQUIVALENT TO @ @@@@                            D QC
)@@G@@@A@@@@                            I <TEXT>@[@@@@      @G@@@@       AN  OQD
)@@G@@PTION  ON  THE    RETYPE    COMMAND (DISCUSSED BELOW IN     @G@@@@ 'ADVAQE
)@@G@@NCED  FEATURES')  ALLOWS  SELECTIVE  RETYPING  OF  PARTICULAR     @ @@@@QF
)@@G@@ COLUMNS OF THE CURRENT IMAGE.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@  3. 6.   IBQG
)@@G@@EFORE(IB) <TEXT>  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE   IBEFORE   CQH
)@@G@@OMMAND IS SIMILAR TO   INSERT  ;  IT ALLOWS     @G@@@@ INSERTION  OF  THQI
)@@G@@E  LINE  OF TEXT BEFORE THE CURRENT IMAGE,  WHERE     @G@@@@ INSERT    PQJ
)@@G@@LACES THE TEXT AFTER THE CURRENT IMAGE.   THE   IBEFORE     @[@@@@*****^QK
)@@G@@@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE               QL
)@@G@@ 3-  3@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ COMMAND  IS  UNIQUE IN QM
)@@G@@THAT IT DOES NOT CHANGE THE CONTENTS OF THE     @G@@@@ WINDOW;  AFTER ANQN
)@@G@@   IBEFORE  ,  THE WINDOW CONTAINS THE LINE AFTER     @G@@@@ THE LINE WHQO
)@@G@@ICH WAS INSERTED.   TO VIEW THE INSERTED LINE,  AN   UP     @#@@@@ IS REQP
)@@G@@QUIRED.     @[@@@@      @G@@@@      IF THE COMMAND NAME IS TYPED BUT NO QQ
)@@G@@<TEXT> IS SPECIFIED,  THE     @G@@@@ EDITOR  ENTERS     INSERT BEFORE   QR
)@@G@@ MODE.   IMAGES MAY BE TYPED IN     @G@@@@ DIRECTLY  AS IN INPUT MODE EXQS
)@@G@@CEPT THEY WILL BE INSERTED BEFORE THE     @G@@@@ CURRENT  IMAGE.    ONE QT
)@@G@@RETURNS TO COMMAND MODE BY ENTERING A BLANK     @G@@@@ LINE.  UPON RETURQU
)@@G@@N TO COMMAND MODE THE CONTENTS OF THE WINDOW WILL     @G@@@@ BE  THE LINQV
)@@G@@E WHICH WAS THERE BEFORE THE    IB    MODE WAS ENTERED.     @G@@@@ CAUTIQW
)@@G@@ON:   LOSS  OF  DATA MAY RESULT IF EXIT FROM THE EDITOR (E.G.     @C@@@@QX
)@@G@@ BY AN @ IMAGE) OCCURS WHILE IN    IB    MODE.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      QY
)@@G@@@B@@@@  3. 7.   DNEXT(DN) <NUMBER-OF-LINES>     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      QZ
)@@G@@@G@@@@       THE     DNEXT    COMMAND IS THE SAME AS A    DELETE FOLLOWERA
)@@G@@D     @G@@@@ BY A    NEXT , THUS THE EDITING WINDOW WILL CONTAIN AN IMAGRB
)@@G@@E AFTER     @D@@@@ A    DN    (UNLESS AN END OF FILE CONDITION RESULTS).RC
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@  3. 8.   LAST(LA)@[@@@@      @[@@@@      RD
)@@G@@@G@@@@       THE   LAST   COMMAND MOVES THE WINDOW TO THE VERY LAST IMAGRE
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ IN THE FILE, ENABLING ONE TO EDIT IT.  IF THE WINDOW IS POSRF
)@@G@@ITIONED     @G@@@@ AT THE END OF FILE,  THE EDITOR MAY DO AN IMPLIED    RG
)@@G@@TOP    BEFORE     @ @@@@ MOVING TO THE LAST IMAGE.    @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@RH
)@@G@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                4-  1RI
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @C@@@@  4.   FORMATTING AND OUTPUT CRJ
)@@G@@ONTROL COMMANDS   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@RK
)@@G@@      @ @@@@  4. 1.   THE   TAB   FEATURE @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@RL
)@@G@@       THE  EDITOR    TAB    FEATURE ENABLES THE USER TO DEFINE TAB     RM
)@@G@@@G@@@@ STOPS  AT  SPECIFIC COLUMNS AND THEN USE THEM TO ALIGN THE COLUMNRN
)@@G@@S     @D@@@@ OF TEXT INPUT IN A MANNER SIMILAR TO A TYPEWRITER.   @[@@@@RO
)@@G@@      @G@@@@      WHEN USING THE TAB FEATURE, A PARTICULAR CHARACTER IS RP
)@@G@@DEFINED     @G@@@@ AS THE 'TAB CHARACTER'.  WHENEVER THIS CHARACTER APPERQ
)@@G@@ARS IN A LINE     @G@@@@ OF  INPUT  TEXT,  THE TEXT IS SPACED SUCH THAT RR
)@@G@@THE CHARACTER AFTER     @G@@@@ THE  TAB  CHARACTER  APPEARS  AT  THE NEXRS
)@@G@@T DEFINED TABSTOP COLUMN.     @G@@@@ (NOTE:   THE TERMINAL CARRIER ITSELRT
)@@G@@F IS NOT MOVED; TABBING AFFECTS     @G@@@@ ONLY THE CONSTRUCTED INPUT IMRU
)@@G@@AGE).   THE TAB CHARACTER ITSELF WILL     @G@@@@ NOT APPEAR IN THE INPUTRV
)@@G@@ IMAGE.   AS AN EXAMPLE,  CONSIDER THAT THE     @G@@@@ CHARACTER  #  HASRW
)@@G@@  BEEN DEFINED AS THE TAB CHARACTER,  AND THE TAB     @G@@@@ STOPS ARE SRX
)@@G@@ET AT COLUMNS  11,  21, AND  31.  IF ONE THEN TYPED THE     @ @@@@ FOLLORY
)@@G@@WING LINE IN INPUT MODE:@[@@@@      @A@@@@                             ARZ
)@@G@@#B##C @[@@@@      @G@@@@ THE  RESULTING  IMAGE  INSERTED  IN  THE TEXT WSA
)@@G@@OULD HAVE AN 'A' IN     @D@@@@ COLUMN 1, A 'B' IN COLUMN 11, AND A 'C' ISB
)@@G@@N COLUMN 31.@[@@@@      @G@@@@       SINCE THE TAB CHARACTER ITSELF (# ISC
)@@G@@N THE EXAMPLE ABOVE) DOES     @G@@@@ NOT  APPEAR  IN  THE  FINAL  TEXT, SD
)@@G@@ THE EDITOR ORIGINALLY SIGNS ON     @G@@@@ WITHOUT  A DEFINED TAB CHARACSE
)@@G@@TER AND ALL CHARACTERS ARE ALLOWED AS     @G@@@@ INPUT  INITIALLY.    THSF
)@@G@@E  TAB  CHARACTER  AND TAB STOPS MAY BE SET     @B@@@@ AND/OR RESET AT ASG
)@@G@@NY TIME BY THE COMMAND  @[@@@@      @C@@@@                 TAB <TABCHAR>SH
)@@G@@ <LIST OF COLUMNS>@[@@@@      @F@@@@ TO SET THE TABS AS GIVEN IN THE EXASI
)@@G@@MPLE ABOVE, ONE WOULD TYPE    @[@@@@      @B@@@@                        SJ
)@@G@@TAB  #  11 21 31  @[@@@@      @G@@@@      ONE CAN CHANGE THE TAB CHARACTSK
)@@G@@ER WITHOUT AFFECTING THE COLUMN     @D@@@@ SETTINGS BY OMITTING THE LISTSL
)@@G@@ OF COLUMN NUMBERS, E.G.@[@@@@      @A@@@@                              SM
)@@G@@TAB % @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD  SET  THE  TAB CHARACTER TO A PERCENT SIGSN
)@@G@@N WITHOUT AFFECTING     @#@@@@ THE TAB COLUMNS. @[@@@@      @G@@@@      SO
)@@G@@ SINCE  THE  TAB CHARACTER ITSELF DOES NOT BECOME PART OF THE     @[@@@@SP
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE         SQ
)@@G@@       4-  2@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ FINAL  IMAGE,   OSR
)@@G@@NE MAY USE THIS TO ADVANTAGE FOR ENTERING TOTALLY     @G@@@@ BLANK LINESSS
)@@G@@ WHILE IN INPUT MODE; A BLANK LINE WILL RESULT FROM THE     @D@@@@ INPUTST
)@@G@@ OF A LINE CONSISTING OF ONLY A TAB CHARACTER.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@      SU
)@@G@@ TABBING  IS  EFFECTIVE  IN THE INPUT MODE AND IN ALL COMMAND     @G@@@@SV
)@@G@@ MODE  COMMANDS WHICH ACCEPT INPUT STRINGS OF TEXT, I.E.    INSERT,     SW
)@@G@@@ @@@@ RETYPE    AND    IBEFORE.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      TABBING IS TSX
)@@G@@URNED OFF BY ENTERING ONLY THE COMMAND NAME, I.E.     @[@@@@      @ @@@@SY
)@@G@@                      TAB     @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WILL  TURN TABBING OFF.SZ
)@@G@@   NOTE THAT THE COLUMN SETTINGS OF THE TAB     @G@@@@ STOPS REMAIN UNAFTA
)@@G@@FECTED AND COULD BE REACTIVATED BY DEFINING A NEW     @#@@@@ TAB CHARACTTB
)@@G@@ER.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @D@@@@  4. 2.   SELECTIVE EDITING OF PORTITC
)@@G@@ONS OF THE TEXT   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@  4. 2. 1.  TD
)@@G@@ CLIMIT(CLI) <MARGIN-SPEC>    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     CLIMIT   TE
)@@G@@  COMMAND  IS USED TO DEFINE LEFT AND RIGHT     @G@@@@ COLUMN  MARGINS FTF
)@@G@@OR THE    LOCATE  ,     CHANGE  ,     FIND    AND     @G@@@@ MATCH     CTG
)@@G@@OMMANDS.   <MARGIN-SPEC> MAY BE A SINGLE DECIMAL NUMBER     @G@@@@ OR  TTH
)@@G@@WO  DECIMAL NUMBERS SEPARATED BY AT LEAST ONE BLANK.   IF TWO     @G@@@@TI
)@@G@@ NUMBERS  ARE GIVEN,  THEY SPECIFY THE LEFT AND RIGHT MARGIN COLUMN     TJ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ NUMBERS,  RESPECTIVELY.   IF ONLY ONE NUMBER IS GIVEN, IT IS TAKETK
)@@G@@N     @E@@@@ AS THE RIGHT MARGIN AND THE LEFT MARGIN IS SET TO COLUMN 1.TL
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       ONLY COLUMNS BETWEEN (AND INCLUDING) THE MARGINTM
)@@G@@ COLUMNS WILL     @G@@@@ BE SCANNED FOR 'HITS' DURING    LOCATE  ,    CHTN
)@@G@@ANGE  , FIND  , AND     @G@@@@ MATCH    COMMANDS.   IN ADDITION,  IF STRTO
)@@G@@ING REPLACEMENT IS SPECI-     @G@@@@ FIED  (CHANGE     OR     MATCH),  NTP
)@@G@@O COLUMN AFTER THE RIGHT MARGIN     @G@@@@ COLUMN  WILL  BE ALTERED.   ATQ
)@@G@@NY LENGTHENED IMAGE WILL BE TRUNCATED     @G@@@@ WITHOUT  WARNING  AT  TTR
)@@G@@HE RIGHT MARGIN TO PREVENT CHANGING COLUMNS     @G@@@@ AFTER IT.  AT EDITS
)@@G@@TOR SIGN-ON TIME, THE DEFAULT MARGINS ARE COLUMNS     @]@@@@ 1 AND 72.  TT
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @B@@@@  4. 2. 2.   ALLOW(AL) <COLUMN-NUMBER>    @[@@@@      TU
)@@G@@@G@@@@       THE  EDITOR IS NORMALLY CONDITIONED TO TEXT WHICH REPRESENTTV
)@@G@@S     @G@@@@ CARD  IMAGES,   I.E.  IMAGES OF 80 CHARACTERS OR LESS (ACTUTW
)@@G@@ALLY 84     @G@@@@ CHARACTERS  BECAUSE OF THE 1108 WORD SIZE).   IT SOMETX
)@@G@@TIMES HAPPENS     @G@@@@ THAT ONE WISHES TO HANDLE IMAGES LONGER THAN THTY
)@@G@@IS,  FOR EXAMPLE IN     @G@@@@ DATA  FILES.   THE    ALLOW    COMMAND FITZ
)@@G@@XES THE MAXIMUM LENGTH OF     @#@@@@ AN INPUT IMAGE.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@UA
)@@G@@       THE     ALLOW    LIMIT APPLIES TO ALL IMAGES WHICH ARE INPUT     UB
)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE   UC
)@@G@@             4-  3@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ OR  CHANGEDUD
)@@G@@;   IMAGES WHICH EXCEED THE LIMIT WILL BE TRUNCATED WI-     @G@@@@ THOUTUE
)@@G@@ WARNING.   THE INITIAL    ALLOW    COLUMN IS 80; THE MAXIMUM     @^@@@@UF
)@@G@@ ALLOW    COLUMN IS 132.@[@@@@      @B@@@@  4. 2. 3.   HWINDOW(HW) <STARUG
)@@G@@T> <END>    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     HWINDOW     COMMAND  LIMITSUH
)@@G@@  THE OUTPUT PRINTED TO A     @G@@@@ HORIZONTAL  WINDOW WITH COLUMN BOUNUI
)@@G@@DARIES SPECIFIED BY <START> AND     @G@@@@ <END>.    THE  STARTING AND EUJ
)@@G@@NDING COLUMNS ARE ROUNDED DOWN AND UP     @G@@@@ RESPECTIVELY  TO  THE  UK
)@@G@@NEAREST  WORD BOUNDARY (MULTIPLE OF SIX FOR     @G@@@@ FIELDATA  EDITINGUL
)@@G@@,  FOUR FOR ASCII EDITING).   THIS IS MOST USEFUL     @G@@@@ FOR QUICKLYUM
)@@G@@ SCANNING TEXT WHEN LOOKING FOR SOMETHING SPECIFIC.  IF     @G@@@@ ONLY UN
)@@G@@ ONE  SPECIFICATION  IS  GIVEN,  IT IS TAKEN AS THE RIGHTMOST     @E@@@@UO
)@@G@@ WINDOW BOUNDARY, AND THE LEFT BOUNDARY IS SET TO COLUMN 1. @[@@@@      UP
)@@G@@@G@@@@       THE   HW   COMMAND AFFECTS ONLY THE OUTPUT WHICH IS PRINTEDUQ
)@@G@@;     @G@@@@ THE EDITED TEXT (LIMITS OF THE    CHANGE    COMMAND,  FOR EUR
)@@G@@XAMPLE)     @G@@@@ IS NOT AFFECTED.  IF    QUICKPRINT    IS ON (SEE BELOUS
)@@G@@W), THE IMAGE     @F@@@@ IS TRUNCATED AT THE WINDOW BOUNDARY BEFORE BLANUT
)@@G@@KS ARE REMOVED.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@  4. 2. 4.   VWINDOW(VW)UU
)@@G@@  <START> <END>   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  VERTICAL  WINDOW  COMMANUV
)@@G@@D  RESTRICTS  THE ACTION OF ALL     @G@@@@ EDITOR  COMMANDS TO A WINDOW UW
)@@G@@WHICH STARTS AND ENDS WITH THE SPECI-     @G@@@@ FIED  LINE  NUMBERS.   UX
)@@G@@ WHILE A VERTICAL WINDOW IS IN EFFECT,  THE     @G@@@@ REMAINDER  OF  THUY
)@@G@@E  OBJECT  BEING EDITED IS ESSENTIALLY INVISIBLE.     @G@@@@ ALL  LINE  UZ
)@@G@@NUMBER REFERENCES ARE RELATIVE TO THE BOUNDARIES OF THE     @G@@@@ WINDOVA
)@@G@@W;  THE FIRST LINE IN THE WINDOW BECOMES LINE 1,  ETC.    TOP     @D@@@@VB
)@@G@@ AND    LAST    COMMANDS ARE CONFINED TO THE WINDOW.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@VC
)@@G@@      THE PARAMETERS FOR    VW    ARE ALWAYS RELATIVE TO THE ENTIRE     VD
)@@G@@@G@@@@ OBJECT  BEING EDITED.   IF ONLY ONE SPECIFICATION IS GIVEN ON A VVE
)@@G@@W     @G@@@@ ,  IT IS TAKEN AS THE END LINE,  AND THE START LINE IS SET VF
)@@G@@TO LINE     @#@@@@ 1.  THE COMMAND  @A@@@@                            VWVG
)@@G@@ *    @[@@@@      @C@@@@ WILL THUS EFFECTIVELY CANCEL THE WINDOWING.    VH
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       WARNING:    AT  THE PRESENT TIME THE    COPY   VI
)@@G@@ AND    DCOPY     @G@@@@ COMMANDS  DO NOT RESPECT THE BOUNDARIES OF THE VJ
)@@G@@VERTICAL WINDOW AND     @E@@@@ SHOULD NOT BE USED WHEN A VERTICAL WINDOWVK
)@@G@@ IS IN EFFECT.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  4. 3.   SPECIAL CONTROVL
)@@G@@L CHARACTERS@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      SPECIAL SIGNIFICANCE CANVM
)@@G@@ BE ATTACHED TO SEVERAL CHARACTERS IN     @G@@@@ ADDITION  TO THE TAB CHVN
)@@G@@ARACTERS.   THESE CHARACTERS ARE DEFINED BY     @B@@@@ COMMANDS SPECIFICVO
)@@G@@ TO THEIR FUNCTION.     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR VP
)@@G@@ (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                4-  4@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@VQ
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  4. 3. 1.   MSCHAR(MSC) <CHAR>     @[@@@@      VR
)@@G@@@G@@@@       THE SPECIFIED CHARACTER WILL BE TRANSLATED TO A MASTER SPACVS
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ (@-SIGN)  WHENEVER  IT  APPEARS  IN  COLUMN ONE OF AN INPUTVT
)@@G@@ IMAGE.     @E@@@@ SPECIFYING A BLANK FOR <CHAR> TURNS OFF THIS TRANSLATVU
)@@G@@ION.  @[@@@@      @B@@@@  4. 3. 2.   EXCHAR(EXC) <CHAR>,<VALUE>   @[@@@@VV
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       THE  SPECIFIED CHARACTER WILL BE EXCHANGED FOR THE SPVW
)@@G@@ECIFIED     @G@@@@ NUMERIC  VALUE  WHENEVER  IT APPEARS IN A COMMAND OR VX
)@@G@@LINE OF INPUT     @G@@@@ TEXT EXCEPT WITHIN THE ACTUAL NAME OF A COMMANDVY
)@@G@@.   THIS PROVIDES A     @G@@@@ MEANS FOR INPUTTING CHARACTERS WHICH CANNVZ
)@@G@@OT BE TYPED FROM A PARTI-     @G@@@@ CULAR  TERMINAL.    THE  NUMERIC VAWA
)@@G@@LUE SHOULD BE THE INTERNAL CODE     @G@@@@ (EITHER FIELDATA OR ASCII) FOWB
)@@G@@R THE DESIRED CHARACTER.  NOTICE THAT     @G@@@@ ONCE AN EXCHANGE CHARACWC
)@@G@@TER HAS BEEN DEFINED,  IT WILL BE EXCHANGED     @G@@@@ EVERY TIME IT IS WD
)@@G@@TYPED,  EVEN ON ANOTHER    EXCHAR    COMMAND.  IT     @G@@@@ CAN  THEREFWE
)@@G@@ORE  BE RECOVERED ONLY BY DEFINING A DIFFERENT EXCHANGE     @]@@@@ CHARAWF
)@@G@@CTER. @[@@@@      @B@@@@  4. 3. 3.   OTHER SPECIAL CHARACTERS     @[@@@@WG
)@@G@@      @G@@@@      OTHER SPECIAL FUNCTION CHARACTERS ARE THE TAB CHARACTEWH
)@@G@@R,  THE     @G@@@@ MASK CHARACTER FOR    FIND    AND    LOCATE    COMMANWI
)@@G@@DS,  THE CALL     @G@@@@ SUBSTITUTION  CHARACTER,   AND  VARIOUS  SHIFT WJ
)@@G@@ CHARACTERS USED IN     @G@@@@ FIELDATA  EDITING OF ASCII FILES.   THESEWK
)@@G@@ CHARACTERS ARE DISCUSSED     @ @@@@ ELSEWHERE IN THIS MANUAL.    @[@@@@WL
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @C@@@@  4. 4.   EDITOR 'MODES':    ON    AND    OFF   WM
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      THE EDITOR HAS SEVERAL DIFFERENT MODWN
)@@G@@ES OF OPERATION WHICH ARE     @G@@@@ SET  AND  CLEARED  BY THE    ON    WO
)@@G@@AND    OFF    COMMANDS.   THESE     @^@@@@ COMMANDS HAVE THE FORM @[@@@@WP
)@@G@@      @B@@@@            ON  <NAME1>,<NAME2>, ETC...   @A@@@@ AND        WQ
)@@G@@OFF <NAME1>,<NAME2>,ETC.@[@@@@      @G@@@@ WHERE <NAMEX> IS A KEYWORD INWR
)@@G@@DICATING THE MODE TO BE TURNED ON (OR     @E@@@@ OFF).  THE KEYWORDS ANDWS
)@@G@@ THEIR CORRESPONDING MODES ARE:     @[@@@@      @^@@@@  4. 4. 1.   QUICKWT
)@@G@@(Q)   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  KEYWORD     QUICK    IS USED TO SET WU
)@@G@@OR CLEAR THE QUICK-     @G@@@@ PRINT  MODE.    WHEN    QUICK    IS ON,  WV
)@@G@@EXTRA BLANKS WILL BE COM-     @G@@@@ PRESSED  OUT  OF  ALL IMAGES BEFOREWW
)@@G@@ THE EDITOR PRINTS THEM.   NOTE     @G@@@@ THAT  THIS COMPRESSION TAKES WX
)@@G@@PLACE AFTER THE HORIZONTAL WINDOWING,     @ @@@@ IF ANY, HAS BEEN APPLIEWY
)@@G@@D.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM)WZ
)@@G@@ - USER'S GUIDE                4-  5@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      XA
)@@G@@@G@@@@       A  TEMPORARY  QUICKPRINT  MODE  FOR  A SINGLE COMMAND MAY BXB
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ ESTABLISHED  BY  PREFIXING THE COMMAND NAME WITH THE LETTERXC
)@@G@@    Q ;     @[@@@@ THUS @^@@@@                 QP 5   @[@@@@      @G@@@@XD
)@@G@@ WILL PRINT FIVE LINES IN THE QUICK MODE.   TEMPORARY QUICKPRINT IS     XE
)@@G@@@D@@@@ AVAILABLE FOR ALL COMMANDS WHICH GENERATE OUTPUT.    @[@@@@      XF
)@@G@@@^@@@@  4. 4. 2.   BRIEF(BR)  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    BRIEF    MXG
)@@G@@ODE WILL SURPRESS EDITOR OUTPUT OF LINES OF     @G@@@@ TEXT UNLESS SUCH XH
)@@G@@OUTPUT IS EXPLICITLY REQUESTED (E.G.   WITH THE P     @G@@@@ OR    O    XI
)@@G@@COMMANDS).  IT IS MOST USEFUL WHEN DOING A CHANGE    OF     @G@@@@ MANY XJ
)@@G@@ LINES,   WHEN  WAITING  FOR  EACH OF THE CHANGED LINES TO BE     @ @@@@XK
)@@G@@ ECHOED MIGHT BE INTOLERABLE. @[@@@@      @^@@@@  4. 4. 3.   NUMBER(NUM)XL
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  COMMAND     ON NUM    CAUSES THE EDITOR TOXM
)@@G@@ PRECEDE EACH     @G@@@@ LINE  OF  TEXT  OUTPUT  WITH  ITS  LINE NUMBER;XN
)@@G@@     NUM    MODE IS     @ @@@@ CLEARED BY    OFF NUM    .   @[@@@@      XO
)@@G@@@G@@@@       A  TEMPORARY     NUM    MODE MAY BE ESTABLISHED FOR A SINGLXP
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ COMMAND BY PRECEDING THE COMMAND NAME WITH AN    N    , E.GXQ
)@@G@@.    NL     @G@@@@ WOULD  DO  A    LOCATE    AND PRINT THE LINE NUMBER OXR
)@@G@@F THE LOCATED     @]@@@@ LINE(S).   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE TEMPORAXS
)@@G@@RY    NUM    MODE MAY BE USED IN CONJUNCTION WITH     @G@@@@ THE  TEMPORXT
)@@G@@ARY  QUICK MODE (SEE ABOVE) BY USING THE PREFIX    QN ,     @G@@@@ E.G. XU
)@@G@@     QNF    WILL FIND AN IMAGE,  AND PRINT THE IMAGE WITH ITS     @A@@@@XV
)@@G@@ LINE NUMBER IN THE QUICKPRINT MODE.@[@@@@      @^@@@@  4. 4. 4.   PCNTRXW
)@@G@@L(PCN)@[@@@@      @G@@@@      IN THE PCNTRL MODE, @EDM RECOGNIZES AND PRXX
)@@G@@INTS 'PRINT CONTROL'    @G@@@@ IMAGES.   THESE IMAGES ARE FOUND IN SYMBIXY
)@@G@@ONT (E.G.     PRINT$    )     @G@@@@ FILES.   FOR FURTHER INFORMATION ONXZ
)@@G@@ THEIR USE, SEE THE EXEC 8 PRM.     @[@@@@      @#@@@@  4. 4. 5.   SEQ  YA
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       IN THE  SEQUENCE MODE,  @EDM SIGNALS ITS READINYB
)@@G@@ESS TO ACCEPT     @G@@@@ COMMANDS  BY  PRINTING THE CURRENT LINE NUMBER YC
)@@G@@AS A PROMPT.   WHEN     @D@@@@ SEQUENCE IS OFF, A SINGLE ASTERISK IS USEYD
)@@G@@D AS PROMPT.@[@@@@      @#@@@@  4. 4. 6.   EOF  @[@@@@      @G@@@@      YE
)@@G@@THE    EOF    MODE IS A SPECIAL MODE IN WHICH BLANK LINES MAY     @G@@@@YF
)@@G@@ BE  ENTERED  IN  THE TEXT WITHOUT HAVING TO USE THE TAB CHARACTER.     YG
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WHEN     EOF     MODE  IS  ON,   BLANK LINES DO NOT CAUSE TOGGLINYH
)@@G@@G     @G@@@@ BETWEEN  INPUT AND COMMAND MODES.  IF THE EDITOR IS IN INPUYI
)@@G@@T MODE,     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USEYJ
)@@G@@R'S GUIDE                4-  6@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@YK
)@@G@@ A BLANK LINE IS INSERTED WHEN A CARRIAGE RETURN IS GIVEN;  IN EDIT     YL
)@@G@@@G@@@@ MODE,  THE    I    COMMAND CAUSES BLANK LINE INSERTION.   WHEN EOYM
)@@G@@F     @G@@@@ IS  SET,   TOGGLING BETWEEN INPUT AND COMMAND MODES IS EFFEYN
)@@G@@CTED BY     @A@@@@ ENTERING THE COMMAND    @EOF    .  @[@@@@      @^@@@@YO
)@@G@@  4. 4. 7.   TRACE(TRA) @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    TRACE    MODE ISYP
)@@G@@ EFFECTIVE WHEN EDITOR PROCEDURES ARE     @G@@@@ BEING  EXECUTED  (SEE  YQ
)@@G@@CHAPTER  ON PROCEDURES).  WHEN TRACE IS ON,     @G@@@@ PROCEDURE  LINES YR
)@@G@@ARE ECHOED AS THEY ARE EXECUTED,  WITH THEIR LINE     @ @@@@ NUMBERS IN YS
)@@G@@THE PROCEDURE.    @[@@@@      @#@@@@  4. 4. 8.   MEM  @[@@@@      @G@@@@YT
)@@G@@       IN THE  MEMORY  MODE,  @EDM REMEMBERS THE SETTING OF VARIOUS     YU
)@@G@@@G@@@@ PARAMETERS  THROUGHOUT  SEVERAL  EXECUTIONS  IN  THE SAME TERMINAYV
)@@G@@L     @G@@@@ SESSION.    THE EDITOR INDICATES RECOVERY OF    MEM    INFOYW
)@@G@@RMATION     @G@@@@ BY  PRINTING  THE  WORD    MEM    ON ITS SIGNON LINE.YX
)@@G@@   PARAMETERS     @A@@@@ REMEMBERED IN THE MEMORY MODE ARE: @[@@@@      YY
)@@G@@@G@@@@    (A)  ALL  PARAMETERS WHOSE SETTINGS ARE DISPLAYED BY THE STATUYZ
)@@G@@S     @ @@@@         COMMAND (SEE BELOW). @[@@@@      @F@@@@    (B)  THEZA
)@@G@@ LAST    F  ,    C  ,    L    AND    M    COMMANDS    @[@@@@      @E@@@@ZB
)@@G@@    (C)  THE CURRENT IMAGE IN THE    HOLD    BUFFER, IF ANY.@[@@@@      ZC
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @^@@@@  4. 5.   STATUS(STA)   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ZD
)@@G@@       THE    STATUS    COMMAND IS USED TO DISPLAY THE CONDITION OF     ZE
)@@G@@@B@@@@ VARIOUS EDITOR PARAMETERS.  THE FORM IS  @B@@@@               STAZF
)@@G@@TUS <NAME1>,<NAME2>,... @[@@@@      @^@@@@ WHERE <NAME> MAY BE    @[@@@@ZG
)@@G@@      @G@@@@   (A)  ANY OF THE PARAMETER NAMES ACCEPTABLE TO   ON   OR  ZH
)@@G@@ OFF  ,     @B@@@@        E.G.    SEQ  ,    EOF  , MEM  .   @[@@@@      ZI
)@@G@@@G@@@@   (B)   ANY  OF  THE PARAMETER NAMES    TAB, HW, AL, VW, CLI, CSCZJ
)@@G@@,     @G@@@@       MSC OR MS.   THESE SPECIFY PARAMETERS SET BY THE COMMZK
)@@G@@ANDS OF     @^@@@@       THE SAME NAME.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@ IF NO <NAMEZL
)@@G@@> IS SPECIFIED ON A    STATUS    COMMAND, THE STATUS OF     @ @@@@ ALL QZM
)@@G@@UANTITIES IS DISPLAYED. @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR ZN
)@@G@@ (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                5-  1@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@ZO
)@@G@@      @A@@@@  5.   EDITING USING LINE NUMBERS   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      ZP
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       ALTHOUGH ONE CAN MOVE THROUGHOUT THE TEXT TO ANZQ
)@@G@@Y POINT USING     @G@@@@ THE   LOCATE   AND   NEXT   COMMANDS, IT OFTEN ZR
)@@G@@HAPPENS THAT A MORE     @G@@@@ SPECIFIC  HANDLE  ON  A PROGRAM IS AVAILAZS
)@@G@@BLE,  THE LINE NUMBERS OF     @G@@@@ INDIVIDUAL  LINES.    THIS  IS  ESPZT
)@@G@@ECIALLY THE CASE WHEN ONE HAS A     @G@@@@ BATCH LISTING OF THE PROGRAM ZU
)@@G@@BEING EDITED AT HAND.  SEVERAL EDITOR     @E@@@@ COMMANDS ALLOW ONE TO TZV
)@@G@@AKE ADVANTAGE OF THESE LINE NUMBERS.@[@@@@      @G@@@@      IT SHOULD BEZW
)@@G@@ NOTED THAT LINE NUMBERING IS IMPLICIT, I.E.  THE     @G@@@@ LINE NUMBERZX
)@@G@@ OF A GIVEN LINE IS ITS ORDINAL POSITION IN THE TEXT AT     @G@@@@ ANY GZY
)@@G@@IVEN TIME.  THIS IS DISTINGUISHED FROM SEQUENCE NUMBERING, IN     @G@@@@ZZ
)@@G@@ WHICH  THE  SEQUENCE  NUMBERS  ARE A PART OF THE IMAGES THEMSELVES     AA
)@@G@@@G@@@@ (USUALLY IN COLUMNS 73-80).  EACH TIME A LINE OR LINES IS INSERTEAB
)@@G@@D     @G@@@@ OR  DELETED,   THE LINE NUMBERS OF ALL LINES BELOW THE INSEAC
)@@G@@RTED OR     @ @@@@ DELETED LINE WILL CHANGE.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      AD
)@@G@@THE EDITOR PROVIDES THE ABILITY TO REFERENCE LINES IN TEXT BY     @G@@@@AE
)@@G@@ EITHER  THE  CURRENT  LINE  NUMBERS OR BY THE LINE NUMBERS AS THEY     AF
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WERE  WHEN  EDITING  STARTED.   THIS LATTER FEATURE IS MOST USEFUAG
)@@G@@L     @E@@@@ WHEN WORKING WITH A BATCH LISTING OF THE ORIGINAL TEXT.    AH
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  5. 1.   GOTO(G) <LINE-NUMBER>     @[@@@@AI
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE   GOTO   COMMAND WILL CAUSE THE EDITOAJ
)@@G@@R TO GO IMMEDIATELY     @G@@@@ TO THE SPECIFIED LINE.   NOTE THAT IF THEAK
)@@G@@ SPECIFIED LINE NUMBER IS     @G@@@@ LESS THAN THE 'CURRENT' LINE,  AN IAL
)@@G@@MPLIED   TOP   MAY BE DONE.  IF     @G@@@@ N  EXCEEDS THE NUMBER OF LINEAM
)@@G@@S IN THE TEXT,  AN END OF FILE CONDI-     @G@@@@ TION  WILL RESULT.   THAN
)@@G@@E LINE NUMBERING USED BY   GOTO(G)   IS THE     @F@@@@ SET OF LINE NUMBEAO
)@@G@@RS AS THEY ARE AT THE TIME OF THE   G COMMAND.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@      AP
)@@G@@ IT  IS  NOT  NECESSARY  TO TYPE THE WORD    GO    ;  A    GO     @G@@@@AQ
)@@G@@ COMMAND  IS  IMPLIED  WHENEVER  A  COMMAND STARTS WITH AN UNSIGNED     AR
)@@G@@@#@@@@ DIGIT.  THUS     @A@@@@                            GO 12   @[@@@@AS
)@@G@@      @G@@@@ CAN  BE ACHIEVED BY SIMPLY TYPING    12    .   NOTICE THAT AT
)@@G@@NO SIGN     @G@@@@ APPEARS;  A LEADING + OR - SIGN IMPLIES A    NEXT    AU
)@@G@@OR    UP    .     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@  5. 2.   GI <LINE-NUMBEAV
)@@G@@R>    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     GI     (FOR  GO TO INAW
)@@G@@PUT LINE) COMMAND IS SIMILAR TO     @G@@@@ GOTO     EXCEPT THAT THE LINEAX
)@@G@@ NUMBERS USED ARE THE LINE NUMBERS AS     @G@@@@ THEY WERE  AT  THE ORIGAY
)@@G@@INAL SIGNON OF THE EDITOR (@EDM CARD TIME).     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@      AZ
)@@G@@        UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                5-  2@[@@@@BA
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ THIS  COMMAND  IS  MOST  USEFUL  WHBB
)@@G@@EN  ONE IS WORKING WITH A BATCH     @G@@@@ LISTING, AS THE LINE NUMBERS BC
)@@G@@USED BY    GI    WILL ALWAYS BE THOSE     @G@@@@ WHICH  APPEAR  ON  THE BD
)@@G@@LISTING REGARDLESS OF THE INSERTIONS AND/OR     @A@@@@ DELETIONS WHICH HBE
)@@G@@AVE BEEN DONE.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IF  THE  TEXT BEING EDITED WABF
)@@G@@S CREATED BY THE EDITOR AT THIS     @G@@@@ SESSION (I.E.  DID NOT EXIST BG
)@@G@@BEFORE SIGNING ON), THEN THERE ARE NO     @G@@@@ INPUT  LINE  NUMBERS ANBH
)@@G@@D AN END OF FILE CONDITION WILL RESULT FROM     @G@@@@ ANY  USE  OF   GIBI
)@@G@@ .   IF THE SPECIFIED LINE HAS BEEN DELETED,  THE     @G@@@@ WINDOW  WILBJ
)@@G@@L BE MOVED TO THE FIRST NON-DELETED IMAGE FOLLOWING ITS     @G@@@@ ORIGIBK
)@@G@@NAL POSITION.  NO CHECK IS MADE AS TO WHETHER THE NON-DELETED     @G@@@@BL
)@@G@@ IMAGE  MOVED TO WAS PART OF THE ORIGINAL TEXT;  IT IS POSSIBLE FOR     BM
)@@G@@@A@@@@ IT TO BE A NEWLY INSERTED IMAGE.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @C@@@@BN
)@@G@@  5. 3.   DETERMINING THE CURRENT LINE NUMBERS  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      BO
)@@G@@@G@@@@      AS MENTIONED ABOVE,  THE LINE NUMBERS OF THE TEXT WILL CHANGBP
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ AS LINES ARE INSERTED OR DELETED.   TO ENABLE ONE TO DETERMBQ
)@@G@@INE THE     @G@@@@ CURRENT  LINE  NUMBERS,   MANY  OF  THE BASIC COMMANDBR
)@@G@@ NAMES MAY BE     @G@@@@ PRECEEDED WITH THE LETTER 'N';  ANY PRINTOUT OFBS
)@@G@@ TEXT WHICH RESULTS     @G@@@@ FROM  SUCH A COMMAND WILL HAVE THE CURRENBT
)@@G@@T LINE NUMBERS AFFIXED TO     @G@@@@ THE LEFT OF THE PRINTED IMAGE.   FOBU
)@@G@@R EXAMPLE, TO OBTAIN A    PRINT     @D@@@@ WITH LINE NUMBERS OF THE NEXTBV
)@@G@@ SIX LINES, ONE MAY SAY @[@@@@      @B@@@@                      NPRINT 6BW
)@@G@@   OR   NP 6@[@@@@      @G@@@@       LINE  NUMBERS  MAY BE OUTPUT ON ALLBX
)@@G@@ COMMANDS BY ENTERING THE     @B@@@@ NUM    MODE WITH THE    ON    COMMABY
)@@G@@ND.   @[@@@@      @A@@@@  5. 3. 1.   DISPLAY(DI) <EXPR>     @[@@@@      BZ
)@@G@@@G@@@@       THE    DISPLAY    COMMAND MAY BE USED TO DISPLAY THE CURRENCA
)@@G@@T     @F@@@@ VALUE OF BOTH THE CURRENT AND INPUT LINE NUMBERS.  THE FORMCB
)@@G@@S ARE @[@@@@      @E@@@@             DI LIN           FOR THE CURRENT NUCC
)@@G@@MBER, AND   @E@@@@             DI ILN           FOR THE INPUT LINE NUMBECD
)@@G@@RS.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       DISPLAY     MAY  ALSO BE USED AS A MINI-DCE
)@@G@@ESK CALCULATOR;  IT     @G@@@@ WILL PRINT THE VALUE OF ANY EDITOR ARITHMCF
)@@G@@ETIC EXPRESSION.   EDITOR     @G@@@@ ARITHMETIC  EXPRESSIONS  ARE  DEFINCG
)@@G@@ED  IN  A  SUBSEQUENT  CHAPTER.     @G@@@@ CAUTION:  THE VALUE OF    ILNCH
)@@G@@    MAY BE INVALID AFTER A    COPY  ,     @G@@@@ DCOPY     OR PROCEDURE CI
)@@G@@REFERENCE.   IT WILL BE CORRECT IF A    TOP     @E@@@@ HAS BEEN DONE SINCJ
)@@G@@CE THE LAST    COPY    OR    DCOPY    .   @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@            CK
)@@G@@  UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                6-  1@[@@@@      CL
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  6.   EDITING GROUPS OF IMAGES     @[@@@@CM
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IT  OFTEN  HAPPENS  THAT ONE CN
)@@G@@WISHES TO MOVE A GROUP OF LINES     @G@@@@ FROM  ONE  PLACE TO ANOTHER ICO
)@@G@@N THE TEXT,  OR TO MAKE A COPY OF SE-     @G@@@@ VERAL  LINES  WHICH COUCP
)@@G@@LD LATER BE INSERTED INTO A DIFFERENT DECK.     @G@@@@ THE  COMMANDS  DICQ
)@@G@@SCUSSED IN THIS SECTION ENABLE THIS TO BE QUICKLY     @#@@@@ AND EASILY CR
)@@G@@DONE. @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  COMMANDS  IN  THIS  GROUP CAN OPERATCS
)@@G@@E ON A SINGLE IMAGE     @G@@@@ (HOLD,  DHOLD,  DUP)  OR ON A BLOCK OF IMCT
)@@G@@AGES (BEGIN, COPY, DCOPY,     @^@@@@ ADD, STOP, AND CLOSE). @[@@@@      CU
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @A@@@@  6. 1.   SINGLE IMAGE REPLICATION  @[@@@@      @[@@@@CV
)@@G@@      @G@@@@      THE THREE COMMANDS    HOLD,    DHOLD, AND    DUP    ALCW
)@@G@@LOW FOR     @G@@@@ THE  SAVING OF A SINGLE LINE IMAGE AND ITS PLACEMENT CX
)@@G@@INTO THE TEXT     @G@@@@ AT  ANY  POSITION,  POSSIBLY IN MULTIPLE COPIESCY
)@@G@@.   THIS FEATURE IS     @G@@@@ ESPECIALLY  USEFUL  WHEN  ONE  IS  EDITINCZ
)@@G@@G A PROGRAM AND WISHES TO     @G@@@@ REPRODUCE  TITLES  OR OFFSET COMMENDA
)@@G@@TS BY BOXES OF (SAY) ASTERISKS.     @G@@@@ AN  APPROPRIATE  LINE  NEEDEDDB
)@@G@@  FOR  A  BORDER CAN BE HELD AND THEN     @C@@@@ INSERTED AT APPROPRIATEDC
)@@G@@ PLACES IN THE TEXT.    @[@@@@      @^@@@@  6. 1. 1.   HOLD(HO)   @[@@@@DD
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       THE   HOLD   COMMAND CAUSES THE EDITOR TO MAKE A COPYDE
)@@G@@ OF THE     @G@@@@ CURRENT  WINDOW  CONTENTS  AND  SAVE THIS COPY FOR LADF
)@@G@@TER INSERTION     @G@@@@ INTO  THE TEXT BY A SUBSEQUENT    DUP    COMMANDG
)@@G@@D.   THE TEXT BEING     @G@@@@ EDITED  IS  NOT  CHANGED,   BUT  ANY PREVDH
)@@G@@IOUSLY HELD IMAGE WILL BE     @ @@@@ REPLACED BY THE NEW IMAGE.   @[@@@@DI
)@@G@@      @^@@@@  6. 1. 2.   DHOLD(DH)  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    DHOLDJ
)@@G@@D    COMMAND IS A DESTRUCTIVE   HOLD  ;  THE HELD     @D@@@@ IMAGE WILL DK
)@@G@@BE DELETED FROM THE TEXT BEING EDITED.    @[@@@@      @B@@@@  6. 1. 3.  DL
)@@G@@ DUP(DU) <NUMBER-OF-COPIES>   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    DUP    COMDM
)@@G@@MAND INSERTS THE SPECIFIED NUMBER OF COPIES     @G@@@@ OF  A PREVIOUSLY DN
)@@G@@HELD IMAGE INTO THE TEXT BELOW THE CURRENT WINDOW     @G@@@@ POSITION.  DO
)@@G@@AFTER A   DUP  , THE WINDOW WILL BE POSITIONED OVER THE     @G@@@@ LAST DP
)@@G@@ DUPLICATED  LINE.  IF THE NUMBER OF COPIES IS NOT SPECIFIED,     @^@@@@DQ
)@@G@@ ONE (1) IS ASSUMED.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@  6. 2.   BLOCK MADR
)@@G@@NIPULATION  @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USEDS
)@@G@@R'S GUIDE                6-  2@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@DT
)@@G@@      THE COMMANDS WHICH MANIPULATE BLOCKS OF IMAGES CAN BE SEPARA-     DU
)@@G@@@G@@@@ TED  INTO  TWO  GROUPS:    THOSE  WHICH ARE USED TO DEFINE A BLOCDV
)@@G@@K     @G@@@@ (BEGIN,  COPY,  AND DCOPY), AND THOSE WHICH ARE USED TO MANDW
)@@G@@IPULATE     @C@@@@ AND/OR RE-INSERT A BLOCK (ADD, STOP, CLOSE).   @[@@@@DX
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       THE TOP OF A GROUP OF IMAGES TO MANIPULATED IS DETERMDY
)@@G@@INED BY     @G@@@@ THE  SETTING OF THE 'BEGIN' POINTER (SEE BELOW).   THDZ
)@@G@@E BOTTOM OF A     @G@@@@ BLOCK  IS  DETERMINED BY THE WINDOW POSITION ATEA
)@@G@@ THE TIME OF A COM-     @G@@@@ MAND SPECIFYING THE DISPOSITION OF THE BLEB
)@@G@@OCK (I.E.  COPY  OR DCOPY     @[@@@@ ).   @[@@@@      @^@@@@  6. 2. 1.  EC
)@@G@@ BEGIN(BE)  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     BEGIN    COMMAND IS USED TOED
)@@G@@ SET THE BEGIN POINTER TO     @G@@@@ THE  'CURRENT' IMAGE.   IT MARKS THEE
)@@G@@IS IMAGE AS THE FIRST (TOPMOST)     @G@@@@ IMAGE TO BE COPIED BY A SUBSEEF
)@@G@@QUENT    COPY    OR    DCOPY COMMAND.     @G@@@@ THE     BEGIN     POINTEG
)@@G@@ER  REMAINS  SET  UNTIL  A SUBSEQUENT BEGIN     @G@@@@ COMMAND IS ISSUEDEH
)@@G@@.   INSERTING OR DELETING LINES ABOVE THE SETTING     @G@@@@ OF THE    BEI
)@@G@@EGIN    POINTER WILL INVALIDATE IT;  THE PRUDENT EDITOR     @G@@@@ USER EJ
)@@G@@ SHOULD GUARD AGAINS THIS BY DOING HIS    COPY    OR    DCOPY     @E@@@@EK
)@@G@@ AS SOON AS POSSIBLE AFTER SETTING THE    BEGIN    POINTER. @[@@@@      EL
)@@G@@@B@@@@  6. 2. 2.   COPY(CO) <NAME-OF-BLOCK>     @[@@@@      @G@@@@      EM
)@@G@@ THE     COPY    COMMAND MAKES A COPY OF ALL IMAGES ABOVE THE     @G@@@@EN
)@@G@@ CURRENT  LINE  BACK  TO (AND INCLUDING) THE    BEGIN    LINE;  THE     EO
)@@G@@@G@@@@ CURRENT LINE ITSELF IS NOT COPIED.  THIS COPY IS THEN SAVED EXTEREP
)@@G@@-     @G@@@@ NALLY TO THE TEXT BEING EDITED, AND GIVEN THE SPECIFIED NAMEQ
)@@G@@E.  THE     @G@@@@ <NAME  OF  BLOCK>  FIELD  MAY  BE  ANY  EXEC  8 FILE ER
)@@G@@OR ELEMENT OR     @G@@@@ FILE.ELEMENT NAME.   IF ONE WISHES TO USE THIS ES
)@@G@@BLOCK AFTER EDITING     @G@@@@ HAS  BEEN TERMINATED,  AN ELEMENT (DECK) ET
)@@G@@NAME IS USUALLY GIVEN (12     @G@@@@ OR FEWER CHARACTERS FROM THE SET  AEU
)@@G@@-Z,  0-9,  $ AND  - ).  IN THIS     @G@@@@ CASE  AN  ELEMENT OF SYMBOLICEV
)@@G@@ TEXT BY THE GIVEN NAME WILL BE CREA-     @G@@@@ TED;  IF AN ELEMENT OF EW
)@@G@@THE SAME NAME ALREADY EXISTS,  THE OLD COPY     @^@@@@ WILL BE DESTROYEDEX
)@@G@@.     @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IF  NO  <NAME-OF-BLOCK>  IS GIVEN,  THE EEY
)@@G@@DITOR WILL COPY THE     @G@@@@ DESIRED IMAGES TO A TEMPORARY PLACE OF ITEZ
)@@G@@S OWN CHOOSING; THIS AREA     @G@@@@ CAN  THEN BE ACCESSED (DURING THE SFA
)@@G@@AME EDITING SESSION) BY THE ADD     @G@@@@ COMMAND  (SEE  BELOW),  WITHOFB
)@@G@@UT SPECIFYING A NAME.   IF NO NAME IS     @G@@@@ GIVEN,   THE  PREVIOUS FC
)@@G@@CONTENTS OF THE UNNAMED    COPY    AREA (IF     @^@@@@ ANY) WILL BE DESTFD
)@@G@@ROYED.@[@@@@      @G@@@@      COPY   DOES NOT ALTER THE TEXT OF THE ELEMFE
)@@G@@ENT BEING EDITED IN     @#@@@@ ANY FASHION.     @[@@@@      @B@@@@  6. 2FF
)@@G@@. 3.   DCOPY(DC) <NAME-OF-BLOCK>    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       DCOPY     IFG
)@@G@@S  EQUIVALENT TO    COPY    EXCEPT THAT IT IS DE-     @G@@@@ STRUCTIVE; FH
)@@G@@  THE  COPIED  TEXT  IS  DELETED FROM THE ELEMENT BEING     @[@@@@*****^FI
)@@G@@@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE               FJ
)@@G@@ 6-  3@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @]@@@@ EDITED.    @[@@@@      FK
)@@G@@@A@@@@  6. 2. 4.   ADD(AD) <NAME-OF-BLOCK>@[@@@@      @G@@@@      THE   FL
)@@G@@ADD   COMMAND INSTRUCTS THE EDITOR TO ACCEPT SUBSEQUENT     @G@@@@ TEXT FM
)@@G@@INPUT FROM THE NAMED BLOCK.   THE NAME MAY BE A COMPLETE EXEC     @G@@@@FN
)@@G@@ 8 FILE OR ELEMENT NAME,  OR MAY BE OMITTED.  IF IT IS OMITTED, THE     FO
)@@G@@@G@@@@ EDITOR  WILL USE THE BLOCK CREATED BY THE LAST UNNAMED   COPY   OFP
)@@G@@R     @G@@@@ DCOPY OF THE CURRENT EDITOR SESSION.   A   NEXT   COMMAND AFQ
)@@G@@FTER AN     @G@@@@ ADD    WILL  CAUSE THE EDITOR TO MOVE THE FIRST LINE FR
)@@G@@OF THE ADD'ED     @A@@@@ BLOCK INTO ITS VIEWING WINDOW.     @[@@@@      FS
)@@G@@@G@@@@       THE    ADD    COMMAND  DOES NOT IMMEDIATELY INSERT THE ADDEFT
)@@G@@D     @G@@@@ BLOCK  INTO  THE  TEXT  BEING UPDATED.   INSTEAD,  THESE LIFU
)@@G@@NES ARE     @G@@@@ INSERTED  AS THEY ARE PROCESSED (I.E.   AS THE WINDOWFV
)@@G@@ MOVES ACROSS     @G@@@@ THEM).  THIS FEATURE ALLOWS ONE TO EDIT THE ADDFW
)@@G@@ IMAGES AS THEY ARE     @G@@@@ BEING  INSERTED,  WITHOUT CHANGING THE ORFX
)@@G@@IGINAL COPY OF THE ADD'ED     @G@@@@ TEXT.  ANY COMMAND WHICH WOULD PASSFY
)@@G@@ THE WINDOW OVER ALL THE IMAGES     @G@@@@ OF  THE     ADD'ED     TEXT  FZ
)@@G@@WILL  CAUSE  IT TO BE INCLUDED IN THE     @G@@@@ OBJECT  BEING EDITED;  GA
)@@G@@THUS A   N 999  ,  A   TOP   OR ANY COMMAND     @G@@@@ WHICH  IMPLIES A GB
)@@G@@  TOP   (SUCH AS   UP  ) WILL CAUSE THE REMAINING     @C@@@@ IMAGES OF TGC
)@@G@@HE    ADD'ED    TEXT TO BE INCLUDED.@[@@@@      @G@@@@       SELECTIVE  GD
)@@G@@INCLUSION  OF  THE     ADD'ED    TEXT MAY BE DONE     @G@@@@ USING     SGE
)@@G@@TOP     ;   TOTAL  INCLUSION WITHOUT THE DRASTIC WINDOW     @E@@@@ REPOSGF
)@@G@@ITIONING CAUSED BY   TOP   MAY BE DONE WITH   CLOSE . @[@@@@      @G@@@@GG
)@@G@@       AN    ADD    COMMAND DONE WHILE    ADD'ING    WILL CAUSE THE     GH
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WHOLE OF THE FIRST    ADD'ED    TEXT TO BE INCLUDED BEFORE INITIAGI
)@@G@@-     @ @@@@ TING THE SECOND    ADD   .   @[@@@@      @^@@@@  6. 2. 5.  GJ
)@@G@@ STOP(ST)   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    STOP    COMMAND  INSTRUCTS  GK
)@@G@@THE EDITOR TO DISCONTINUE     @G@@@@ READING  IMAGES  FROM  AN    ADD   GL
)@@G@@ BLOCK AND CONTINUE IN THE MAIN     @G@@@@ TEXT.   IT IS OF PRIMARY ADVAGM
)@@G@@NTAGE WHEN ONE WISHES TO INCLUDE ONLY     @G@@@@ A FEW OF THE IMAGES IN GN
)@@G@@THE   ADD   BLOCK.  AS AN EXAMPLE, CONSIDER     @G@@@@ THAT  AN    ADD  GO
)@@G@@ BLOCK CONTAINS 100 IMAGES,  LINES 5 THROUGH 9 OF     @G@@@@ WHICH  ARE GP
)@@G@@ TO  BE  INSERTED  INTO  THE OBJECT BEING EDITED AT THE     @G@@@@ CURREGQ
)@@G@@NT  WINDOW  POSITION.    THE FOLLOWING COMMANDS WOULD ACHIEVE     @[@@@@GR
)@@G@@ THIS @[@@@@      @B@@@@                           ADD <NAME>     @A@@@@GS
)@@G@@                           DELETE 4 @A@@@@                           NEXGT
)@@G@@T 5   @A@@@@                           STOP     @[@@@@      @G@@@@      GU
)@@G@@ONCE A   STOP   COMMAND HAS BEEN ISSUED ALL PROCESSING OF THE     @G@@@@GV
)@@G@@ ADD   BLOCK IS TERMINATED.  THE WINDOW WILL BE POSITIONED OVER THE     GW
)@@G@@@E@@@@ COPY OF THE LAST LINE INCLUDED FROM THE   ADD   BLOCK.     @[@@@@GX
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE         GY
)@@G@@       6-  4@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@  6. 2GZ
)@@G@@. 6.   CLOSE(CL)  @[@@@@      @G@@@@      THE   CLOSE   COMMAND CAUSES AHA
)@@G@@LL REMAINING IMAGES IN AN   ADD     @G@@@@ BLOCK TO BE INCLUDED IN THE THB
)@@G@@EXT BEING EDITED.  AFTER A   CLOSE  ,     @G@@@@ THE  WINDOW WILL BE EMPHC
)@@G@@TY;  A   NEXT   WOULD MOVE IT DOWN OVER THE     @A@@@@ NEXT IMAGE OF THEHD
)@@G@@ ORIGINAL TEXT.   @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM)HE
)@@G@@ - USER'S GUIDE                7-  1@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      HF
)@@G@@@^@@@@  7.   UTILITY COMMANDS @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@HG
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  7. 1.   TYPE(TY) <LANGUAGE-FLAG>  @[@@@@      HH
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       EXEC  8  HAS  PROVIDED  THE  CAPABILITY FOR ALLHI
)@@G@@ DECKS IN THE     @G@@@@ SYSTEM TO BE IDENTIFIED AS TO THEIR LANGUAGE (IHJ
)@@G@@.E. FORTRAN, COBOL,     @G@@@@ ALGOL, ETC.); IF THE TYPE HAS NOT BEEN SPHK
)@@G@@ECIFIED, THE GENERIC TYPE     @G@@@@ 'SYMBOLIC' IS ASSUMED.   ALTHOUGH IHL
)@@G@@T IS NOT REQUIRED THAT A PARTI-     @G@@@@ CULAR  PROGRAM  DECK  BE  SO HM
)@@G@@TYPED,  MANY SYSTEM PROGRAMS WILL RUN     @G@@@@ FASTER IF THEY ARE,  THHN
)@@G@@US SAVING TIME AND MONEY FOR THE USER.  THE     @F@@@@ EDITOR   INITIALLHO
)@@G@@Y  ASSUMES  THAT  ALL  CREATED  DECKS  ARE  TYPE@G@@@@ 'SYMBOLIC'.    THHP
)@@G@@E  EDITOR COMMAND    TYPE    ALLOWS YOU TO SET OR     @G@@@@ CHANGE THE HQ
)@@G@@LANGUAGE DESIGNATION OF THE TEXT BEING PROCESSED.   THE     @^@@@@ COMMAHR
)@@G@@ND IS ENTERED AS  @[@@@@      @C@@@@                       TYPE <LANGUAGHS
)@@G@@E-FLAG>     @[@@@@      @B@@@@ THE FOLLOWING LANGUAGE FLAGS ARE DEFINED:HT
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @C@@@@                 ASM      ASSEMBLER PROGRAM DECK@C@@@@HU
)@@G@@                 ASMP     ASSEMBLER PROCEDURE   @C@@@@                 FHV
)@@G@@OR      FORTRAN PROGRAM DECK  @C@@@@                 FORP     FORTRAN PRHW
)@@G@@OCEDURE     @C@@@@                 COB      COBOL PROGRAM DECK    @B@@@@HX
)@@G@@                 COBP     COBOL PROCEDURE @C@@@@                 ALG    HY
)@@G@@  ALGOL PROGRAM DECK    @B@@@@                 ELT      DATA ELEMENTS   HZ
)@@G@@@C@@@@                 MAP      COLLECTOR SYMBOLICS   @D@@@@            IA
)@@G@@     DOC      DOCUMENT PROCESSOR SYMBOLICS@C@@@@                 SEC    IB
)@@G@@  SECURE DATA CARDS     @B@@@@                 EDP      EDITOR PROCEDUREIC
)@@G@@@E@@@@                 SSG      SSG PROGRAM (I.E.  'SKELETON')    @C@@@@ID
)@@G@@                 MIM      MIMIC PROGRAM DECK    @C@@@@                 OIE
)@@G@@MN      OMNITAB PROGRAM DECK  @C@@@@                 SNO      SNOBOL PROIF
)@@G@@GRAM DECK   @D@@@@                 CUL      CULL SYMBOLIC CONTROL CARDS IG
)@@G@@@B@@@@                 MAD      MAD PROGRAM DECK@C@@@@                 BIH
)@@G@@AS      BASIC PROGRAM DECK    @[@@@@      @G@@@@ ALTHOUGH THE EDITOR WILII
)@@G@@L ALLOW PROCEDURES TO BE TYPED (ASMP, FORP,     @G@@@@ AND  COBP),   THEIJ
)@@G@@Y  MUST  BE PROCESSED BY THE    @PDP    PROCESSOR     @A@@@@ BEFORE THEYIK
)@@G@@ CAN BE ACTUALLY USED.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IF  THE  UOM  DUM  SYSTIL
)@@G@@EM  IS  BEING  USED (@COMPILE, @LINK,     @G@@@@ @EXECUTE COMMANDS) IT IIM
)@@G@@S NOT NECESSARY TO TYPE ASM, FOR, COB, ALG,     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@      IN
)@@G@@        UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                7-  2@[@@@@IO
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ OR  MAD  PROGRAMS,   AS DUM CAN RECIP
)@@G@@OGNIZE THEM ITSELF.   ASSEMBLER     @G@@@@ PROCEDURE ELEMENTS,  HOWEVER,IQ
)@@G@@ MUST BE TYPED OR DUM WILL TREAT THEM     @G@@@@ AS  ASSEMBLER PROGRAMS.IR
)@@G@@   COBOL AND FORTRAN PROCEDURES NEED NOT BE     @G@@@@ EXPLICITLY  TYPEDIS
)@@G@@.    THE  DUM SYSTEM WILL ALSO AUTOMATICALLY TAKE     @G@@@@ CARE OF @PDIT
)@@G@@P'ING PROCEDURES AS NECESSARY.  IF DUM FAILS TO PROPER-     @G@@@@ LY  DIU
)@@G@@ETERMINE THE LANGUAGE OF A PROGRAM,  THEN THE PROGRAM IN QUE-     @G@@@@IV
)@@G@@ STION MUST BE EDITED,  AND ITS LANGUAGE EXPLICITLY DECLARED BY THE     IW
)@@G@@@#@@@@ TYPE COMMAND.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@  7. 2.   ELEMENT(IX
)@@G@@EL)   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      THIS COMMAND PRINTS THE FILE AIY
)@@G@@ND ELEMENT NAME UNDER WHICH THE     @C@@@@ RESULTS OF THE EDITING SESSIOIZ
)@@G@@N WILL BE FILED.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@  7. 3.   TIME(TI)@[@@@@JA
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       PRINTS  THE EDITOR SIGN-ON LINE,  INCLUDIJB
)@@G@@NG CURRENT TIME AND     @[@@@@ DATE.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@  7. 4JC
)@@G@@.   SEQUENCE(SEQ) @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  SEQUENCE  COJD
)@@G@@MMAND  INSTRUCTS THE EDITOR TO SEQUENCE THE     @G@@@@ TEXT BEING EDITEDJE
)@@G@@ IN COLUMNS 73 THROUGH 80.  THE MOST GENERAL FORM     @#@@@@ OF SEQUENCEJF
)@@G@@ IS:  @[@@@@      @D@@@@                SEQUENCE,<ID> <INCREMENT>,<STARTJG
)@@G@@>     @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE <ID> FIELD (IF GIVEN) WILL START IN CJH
)@@G@@OLUMN 72 AND MAY BE     @G@@@@ UP TO 6 CHARACTERS IN LENGTH.   <INCREMENJI
)@@G@@T> IS THE INCREMENT TO BE     @G@@@@ USED  ON SUCCESSIVE CARDS,  THE DEFJJ
)@@G@@AULT VALUE IS 100.   <START> IS     @G@@@@ THE  DESIRED  STARTING NUMBERJK
)@@G@@; DEFAULT VALUE IS 100 (ONE HUNDRED).     @G@@@@ IF  <ID>  IS  NOT GIVENJL
)@@G@@ THEN THE COMMA PRECEDING IT SHOULD ALSO BE     @G@@@@ OMITTED;   SIMILAJM
)@@G@@RLY  FOR  <START>.    IF  <START> IS GIVEN,  THEN     @A@@@@ <INCREMENT>JN
)@@G@@ MUST ALSO BE SUPPLIED. @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    SEQUENCE    COMMJO
)@@G@@AND IS NOT USABLE IN ASCII (Q-OPTION)     @[@@@@ MODE.@[@@@@      @[@@@@JP
)@@G@@      @ @@@@  7. 5.   AUTO(AU)  <NUM>     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@JQ
)@@G@@       THE     AUTO     COMMAND  ENABLES THE EDITOR USER TO SET THE     JR
)@@G@@@G@@@@ FREQUENCY AT WHICH THE EDITOR TAKES ITS CRASH RECOVERY CHECKPOINTJS
)@@G@@S     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUJT
)@@G@@IDE                7-  3@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ (SEE JU
)@@G@@ CHAPTER  1).    CHECKPOINTS  ARE  ALWAYS  TAKEN  AT A    TOP     @G@@@@JV
)@@G@@ (EXPRESS  OR  IMPLIED).   OTHER CHECKPOINTS ARE TAKEN WHENEVER THE     JW
)@@G@@@G@@@@ NUMBER  OF  LINES  OF  TEXT  WHICH HAVE BEEN CHANGED,  INSERTED OJX
)@@G@@R     @F@@@@ DELETED EXCEEDS THE NUMBER SPECIFIED ON THE    AUTO    COMMJY
)@@G@@AND.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  INITIAL  VALUE  OF     AUTO    AT EDJZ
)@@G@@ITOR SIGNON TIME IS     @G@@@@ FIFTY;  AT THIS FREQUENCY, THE OVERHEAD AKA
)@@G@@SSOCIATED WITH THE CHECK-     @G@@@@ POINTS  IS  ESSENTIALLY  NEGLIGIBLEKB
)@@G@@.   CARE SHOULD BE EXERCISED IN     @G@@@@ SETTING THE FREQUENCY LOWER TKC
)@@G@@HAN THIS,  AS THE ADDITIONAL OVERHEAD     @G@@@@ CAN  BECOME  NOTICEABLEKD
)@@G@@  (AND  EXPENSIVE)  FOR SMALL VALUES OF THE     @^@@@@ CHECKPOINT FREQUEKE
)@@G@@NCY.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@  7. 6.   WAIT(WA)  <TIME-IN-SECONDSKF
)@@G@@>     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     WAIT     COMMAND  CAUKG
)@@G@@SES THE EDITOR TO PAUSE FOR THE     @G@@@@ NUMBER  OF  SECONDS  SPECIFIEKH
)@@G@@D.    IF NO <TIME> IS GIVEN,  A THREE     @^@@@@ SECOND WAIT WILL OCCUR.KI
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  7. 7.   OPERATOR COMMUNICATIONS   @[@@@@KJ
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       TWO COMMANDS ARE PROVIDED FOR COMMUNICATIKK
)@@G@@ON WITH THE CENTRAL     @^@@@@ SITE CONSOLE OPERATOR: @[@@@@      @B@@@@KL
)@@G@@                           OPR <TEXT>     @B@@@@                        KM
)@@G@@   OPN(OP) <TEXT> @[@@@@      @G@@@@ IN  EITHER  CASE,   THE  SPECIFIED KN
)@@G@@ <TEXT>  IS  DISPLAYED  ON  THE     @G@@@@ OPERATOR'S CONSOLE.   OPR   IKO
)@@G@@NDICATES THAT YOU EXPECT A REPLY, AND     @G@@@@ EDITING  WILL  STOP WHIKP
)@@G@@LE THE OPERATOR REPLIES.    OPN   INDICATES     @G@@@@ THAT YOU EXPECT NKQ
)@@G@@O REPLY,  AND EDITING CONTINUES.   THE   OPR COM-     @G@@@@ MAND  MAY  KR
)@@G@@NOT BE ABBREVIATED;  THE ABBREVIATED COMMAND    OP WILL     @C@@@@ RESULKS
)@@G@@T IN AN    OPN    (NO REPLY EXPECTED).    @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@            KT
)@@G@@  UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                8-  1@[@@@@      KU
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@  8.   ADVANCED FEATURES@[@@@@      @[@@@@KV
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  FEATURES DESCRIBED IN THIS SECTION AKW
)@@G@@RE INTENDED FOR USE     @G@@@@ BY THE EXPERIENCED EDITOR USER.   THEY ARKX
)@@G@@E SOMEWHAT MORE COMPLICA-     @G@@@@ TED THAN THE BASIC COMMANDS,  BUT CKY
)@@G@@AN CONSIDERABLY REDUCE THE WORK     @ @@@@ INVOLVED WHEN PROPERLY USED. KZ
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       SEVERAL  OF THE COMMANDS ALLOW FOR AN 'OPTIONS'LA
)@@G@@ FIELD ON THE     @G@@@@ COMMAND  NAME  WHICH  QUALIFY  THE ACTION OF THLB
)@@G@@E COMMAND.   SUCH A     @G@@@@ FIELD  IS SPECIFIED BY FOLLOWING THE COMMLC
)@@G@@AND NAME WITH A COMMA AND     @G@@@@ THEN  TYPING THE SPECIFIC OPTION.  LD
)@@G@@ PRESENTLY THE OPTIONS USED ARE     @G@@@@ EITHER AN ASTERISK (*) OR A SLE
)@@G@@TRING OF DIGITS.   IN CASES WHERE THE     @G@@@@ COLUMNS  IN WHICH THE PLF
)@@G@@ARAMETERS OF A COMMAND ARE TYPED ARE SIGNI-     @G@@@@ FICANT (SUCH AS FLG
)@@G@@OR RETYPE   OR   FIND  ),  THE OPTIONS ARE CONSI-     @G@@@@ DERED  AS  LH
)@@G@@PART  OF THE COMMAND NAME,  AND MUST BE FOLLOWED BY THE     @ @@@@ CUSTOLI
)@@G@@MARY MANDATORY BLANK.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@  8. 1.   FIND(F) LJ
)@@G@@<PATTERN>   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    FIND    COMMAND LK
)@@G@@IS SIMILAR TO    LOCATE    BUT CONSI-     @G@@@@ DERABLY  FASTER,   AND LL
)@@G@@ SOMEWHAT  MORE SPECIFIC.   WHERE    LOCATE     @G@@@@ WILL  GIVE A HIT LM
)@@G@@IF THE DESIRED STRING CAN BE FOUND ANYWHERE IN AN     @G@@@@ IMAGE,     LN
)@@G@@FIND    REQUIRES HITS ON SPECIFIC COLUMNS.  THE PATTERN     @G@@@@ USED LO
)@@G@@ BY  THE     FIND     COMMAND STARTS WITH THE FIRST CHARACTER     @G@@@@LP
)@@G@@ POSITION  AFTER  THE  (MANDATORY)  BLANK WHICH FOLLOWS THE COMMAND     LQ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ NAME.    THIS POSITION IS THEN TESTED AGAINST COLUMN 1 OF THE TEXLR
)@@G@@T     @G@@@@ IMAGES;  THE SECOND POSITION IS TESTED AGAINST COLUMN 2, ETLS
)@@G@@C.  THE     @G@@@@ PATTERN  STOPS  WITH  THE  LAST NON-BLANK CHARACTER OLT
)@@G@@N THE    FIND     @A@@@@ COMMAND.  FOR EXAMPLE, THE COMMAND @[@@@@      LU
)@@G@@@A@@@@                              F XYZ @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD  SEARLV
)@@G@@CH  DOWNWARD  THROUGH THE TEXT FOR AN OCCURRENCE OF THE     @G@@@@ STRINLW
)@@G@@G  XYZ  IN COLUMNS 1 THROUGH 3 ONLY.   IN CONTRAST,    LOCATE     @G@@@@LX
)@@G@@ WOULD SUCCEED IF  XYZ  WERE PRESENT ANYWHERE IN THE TEXT,  EVEN IF     LY
)@@G@@@^@@@@ SEPARATED BY BLANKS.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE BLANK IS A SILZ
)@@G@@GNIFICANT CHARACTER IN THE    FIND COMMAND.     @G@@@@ IN ADDITION TO BEMA
)@@G@@ING A PLACEHOLDER TO MARK SPECIFIC COLUMNS, IT IS     @G@@@@ AN  EXAMPLEMB
)@@G@@ OF WHAT IS CALLED A 'MASK' CHARACTER.   COLUMNS ON THE     @G@@@@ FIND MC
)@@G@@   COMMAND  WHICH  ARE  BLANK  WILL NOT BE TESTED - I.E.  ANY     @G@@@@MD
)@@G@@ CHARACTER IN THE 'MASKED' COLUMNS WILL BE ACCEPTED AS A HIT.   FOR     ME
)@@G@@@^@@@@ EXAMPLE, THE COMMAND   @[@@@@      @B@@@@                        MF
)@@G@@    FIND XY Z     @[@@@@      @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EMG
)@@G@@DITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                8-  2@[@@@@      @[@@@@      MH
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@ (WHERE  THERE IS A SINGLE BLANK BETWEEN THE Y AND Z) MI
)@@G@@WILL FIND THE     @G@@@@ NEXT  IMAGE  WHICH  HAS  AN  X AND Y IN COLUMNSMJ
)@@G@@ 1 AND 2 AND A Z IN     @G@@@@ COLUMN  4 REGARDLESS OF THE CONTENTS OF CMK
)@@G@@OLUMN 3.   THUS TEXT WITH     @G@@@@ XY-Z  OR  XY,Z  OR  XYZZ  IN COLUMNML
)@@G@@S 1 THROUGH 4 WOULD ALL CAUSE A     @^@@@@ FIND    TO SUCCEED.    @[@@@@MM
)@@G@@      @G@@@@      THE TAB CHARACTER IS EFFECTIVE IN THE SEARCH STRING OFMN
)@@G@@ A FIND     @G@@@@ COMMAND;   THE COLUMNS WHICH ARE TABBED OVER ARE ALL MO
)@@G@@CONSIDERED TO     @G@@@@ BE THE MASK CHARACTER,  AND THUS ANYTHING WILL MP
)@@G@@MATCH THEM.  IF ONE     @G@@@@ WANTED  TO FIND THE NEXT OCCURRENCE OF  XMQ
)@@G@@YZ STARTING IN COLUMN 17,     @ @@@@ FOR EXAMPLE, THE STATEMENTS  @[@@@@MR
)@@G@@      @A@@@@                            TAB ; 17@A@@@@                  MS
)@@G@@          F ;XYZ  @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD DO THIS.   OBVIOUSLY,  IF TABMT
)@@G@@S HAVE ALREADY BEEN SET,  IT IS     @A@@@@ NOT NECESSARY TO REDEFINE THEMU
)@@G@@M.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IF NO <PATTERN> IS GIVEN ON A    FIND ,  MV
)@@G@@THE EDITOR WILL USE     @G@@@@ THE  <PATTERN>  FROM THE LAST    FIND    MW
)@@G@@COMMAND.   COLUMN NUMBERS     @D@@@@ MAY BE DETERMINED USING THE    SCALMX
)@@G@@E    COMMAND.     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@  8. 2.   REPEATING A COMY
)@@G@@MMAND @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       AN  OPTIONS  FIELD  MAY  BE  MZ
)@@G@@USED ON THE    FIND ,  LOCATE ,     @G@@@@ CHANGE , AND    MATCH    (SEENA
)@@G@@ BELOW) COMMANDS TO CAUSE THE COMMAND     @G@@@@ TO  BE  REPEATED  A FIXNB
)@@G@@ED OR AN INDEFINITE NUMBER OF TIMES.   WITH     @G@@@@ FIND ,   LOCATE ,NC
)@@G@@ AND    MATCH  , THIS FEATURE ENABLES ONE TO FIND     @D@@@@ MANY OCCURRND
)@@G@@ENCES OF A GIVEN PATTERN.  THE COMMAND    @[@@@@      @A@@@@            NE
)@@G@@              L,13 XYZ  @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WILL REPEAT 13 TIMES (OR UNTINF
)@@G@@L THE END OF FILE), THUS LOCATING THE     @G@@@@ NEXT  13  LINES ON WHICNG
)@@G@@H THE STRING    XYZ    APPEARS.   SINCE THE     @G@@@@ ASTERISK  IN  A  NH
)@@G@@NUMERIC  FIELD  IS  INTERPRETED  AS A 'VERY LARGE     @^@@@@ NUMBER', THNI
)@@G@@E COMMAND   @[@@@@      @ @@@@                      F,* A C @[@@@@      NJ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WOULD  FIND ALL IMAGES BELOW THE CURRENT WINDOW POSITION WHICH HANK
)@@G@@D     @B@@@@ AN 'A' IN COLUMN 1 AND A 'C' IN COLUMN 3.@[@@@@      @G@@@@NL
)@@G@@       OPTIONS  ON  THE     CHANGE     COMMAND  CAUSE ITS ACTION TO     NM
)@@G@@@G@@@@ DIFFER SLIGHTLY FROM THE NO-OPTION CASE.  FOR FURTHER INFORMATIONNN
)@@G@@,     @D@@@@ SEE THE FULL DESCRIPTION OF    CHANGE    GIVEN BELOW.@[@@@@NO
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       WHENEVER A    FIND ,   LOCATE ,   CHANGE ,  OR    MATNP
)@@G@@CH SUC-     @G@@@@ CEEDS,   THE LINE OF TEXT IS PRINTED (UNLESS INHIBITENQ
)@@G@@D BY    BRIEF     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM)NR
)@@G@@ - USER'S GUIDE                8-  3@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      NS
)@@G@@@G@@@@ MODE).    A  DISPLAY  OF  THE  LINE  NUMBERS OF THESE LINES MAY BNT
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ OBTAINED  BY  PREFIXING THE COMMAND NAME WITH THE LETTER 'NNU
)@@G@@', E.G.     @G@@@@ NL    OR    NF  .  THE LINE NUMBERS OBTAINED MAY THENNV
)@@G@@ BE USED IN A     @#@@@@ GO    COMMAND.   @[@@@@      @E@@@@      THE SENW
)@@G@@ARCH ARGUMENT OR PATTERN OF THE LAST    FIND ,  @G@@@@ LOCATE  ,    CHANNX
)@@G@@GE    AND    MATCH    IS ALWAYS REMEMBERED BY THE     @G@@@@ EDITOR,   ANY
)@@G@@ND  MAY BE RECALLED BY TYPING ONLY THE COMMAND NAME AND     @^@@@@ (POSSNZ
)@@G@@IBLY) OPTIONS.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @C@@@@  8. 3.   RETYPING SPECIOA
)@@G@@FIC COLUMNS OF AN IMAGE @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      IN THE INITIOB
)@@G@@AL DISCUSSION OF THE    RETYPE    COMMAND, IT WAS     @G@@@@ STATED  THAOC
)@@G@@T  THE  RETYPED  IMAGE COMPLETELY REPLACES THE ORIGINAL     @G@@@@ IMAGEOD
)@@G@@.   AN OPTION IS AVAILABLE BY WHICH ONLY SELECTED COLUMNS MAY     @G@@@@OE
)@@G@@ BE  RETYPED.  WHEN THE   RETYPE   COMMAND IS GIVEN WITH AN OPTION,     OF
)@@G@@@[@@@@ I.E. @[@@@@      @B@@@@                        R,<COLUMN> <TEXT> OG
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@ THEN  THE  GIVEN TEXT REPLACES THE TEXT OF THE ORIGINOH
)@@G@@AL LINE STAR-     @G@@@@ TING  IN  THE  SPECIFIED  COLUMN.   IN ADDITIONOI
)@@G@@,  ONLY THE COLUMNS     @E@@@@ SPANNED BY THE TYPED <TEXT> WILL BE AFFECOJ
)@@G@@TED.  FOR EXAMPLE @[@@@@      @B@@@@                         RETYPE,12 AOK
)@@G@@B D   @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD CHANGE COLUMN 12 TO A,  COLUMN 13 TO B, COL
)@@G@@OLUMN 14 TO A BLANK     @G@@@@ AND COLUMN 15 TO A D.  COLUMNS 1 THROUGH OM
)@@G@@11 AND 16 THROUGH THE END     @G@@@@ OF  THE IMAGE WOULD BE UNAFFECTED. ON
)@@G@@  AS WITH A NORMAL RETYPE,  THE     @G@@@@ TAB  CHARACTER IS EFFECTIVE IOO
)@@G@@N THE GIVEN TEXT;  ANY COLUMNS TABBED     @G@@@@ OVER  WILL  BE  BLANKEDOP
)@@G@@.   IF  <COLUMN>  EXCEEDS THE IMAGE LENGTH,     @G@@@@ BLANKS  WILL BE UOQ
)@@G@@SED TO FILL TO <COLUMN>.   COLUMN NUMBERS OF TEXT     @G@@@@ BEING  EDITOR
)@@G@@ED  MAY BE DETERMINED WITH THE AID OF THE    SCALE COM-     @[@@@@ MAND.OS
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  8. 4.   SCALE(SC) <COLUMN-NUMBER> @[@@@@OT
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     SCALE    COMMAND IS AN AID TO DETOU
)@@G@@ERMINING THE COLUMN     @G@@@@ NUMBERS  IN  WHICH THE CHARACTERS OF AN IOV
)@@G@@MAGE APPEAR;  IT IS ESPE-     @E@@@@ CIALLY USEFUL IN CONJUNCTION WITH  OW
)@@G@@  FIND    AND    LOCATE.@[@@@@      @G@@@@       SCALE     WILL  CAUSE  OX
)@@G@@THE PRINTOUT OF A REPEATING STRING OF     @G@@@@ DIGITS  STARTING FROM TOY
)@@G@@HE SPECIFIED <COLUMN-NUMBER> AND CONTINUING     @G@@@@ TO  THE PRINT LIMOZ
)@@G@@IT COLUMN.   THIS LINE OF DIGITS MAY THEN BE COM-     @G@@@@ PARED WITH PA
)@@G@@A PRINTED TEXT LINE TO DETERMINE ACTUAL COLUMN NUMBERS.     @G@@@@ IF <CPB
)@@G@@OLUMN-NUMBER> IS NOT GIVEN, THE DIGITS WILL PRINT FROM COLUMN     @[@@@@PC
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE         PD
)@@G@@       8-  4@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@ 1 TO THE PRINT LIPE
)@@G@@MIT.  @[@@@@      @F@@@@      THE    SCALE    COMMAND WILL ALSO ACCEPT TPF
)@@G@@WO FIELDS, E.G.   @[@@@@      @A@@@@                        SC 6 15     PG
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@ IN THIS FORM,  THE FIRST FIELD INDICATES THE STARTINGPH
)@@G@@ COLUMN,  THE     @A@@@@ SECOND INDICATES ENDING COLUMN.    @[@@@@      PI
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @ @@@@  8. 5.   LOCATE STRING (LS)  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      PJ
)@@G@@@G@@@@       IN  THE  BASIC   LOCATE   COMMAND,  BLANKS IN THE TEXT BEINPK
)@@G@@G     @C@@@@ SEARCHED ARE NOT SIGNIFICANT.  THUS THE COMMAND@[@@@@      PL
)@@G@@@A@@@@                              L XYZ @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD SUCCEPM
)@@G@@ED IF IT FOUND THE STRING  X  YZ .  IF THE   LS COMMAND     @G@@@@ IS  UPN
)@@G@@SED INSTEAD,   BLANKS IN THE TEXT BEING SEARCHED ARE SIGNIFI-     @]@@@@PO
)@@G@@ CANT - I.E.@[@@@@      @A@@@@                              LS XYZ@[@@@@PP
)@@G@@      @G@@@@ WOULD SUCCEED ONLY IF IT FOUND THE STRING  XYZ WITHOUT INTEPQ
)@@G@@RVENING     @G@@@@ BLANKS.  IN THE   LS   COMMAND, BLANKS ARE SIGNIFICANPR
)@@G@@T BOTH IN THE     @G@@@@ TEXT  BEING SEARCHED AND IN THE STRING GIVEN ONPS
)@@G@@ THE   LS   COMMAND     @^@@@@ ITSELF.  THE COMMAND   @A@@@@            PT
)@@G@@               LS X YZ  @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD SUCCEED ONLY IF THE 4 CPU
)@@G@@HARACTERS  X, BLANK, Y, Z, WERE FOUND     @G@@@@ IN  THE  TEXT.   NOTE TPV
)@@G@@HAT THE MEANING OF BLANK IN THIS CONTEXT IS     @G@@@@ SIGNIFICANTLY DIFPW
)@@G@@FERENT FROM ITS USE IN THE   FIND   COMMAND.   IN     @G@@@@ FIND  ,   TPX
)@@G@@HE  SEARCH  WOULD  SUCCEED REGARDLESS OF WHAT CHARACTER     @G@@@@ APPEAPY
)@@G@@RED BETWEEN THE X AND Y, BECAUSE   FIND   CONSIDERS THE BLANK     @G@@@@PZ
)@@G@@ TO BE A MASK CHARACTER.     LS ,  HOWEVER, REQUIRES THAT THE FOUND     QA
)@@G@@@D@@@@ STRING ACTUALLY CONTAIN A BLANK IN THIS POSITION.    @[@@@@      QB
)@@G@@@G@@@@      OPTIONS AND VARIATIONS FOR THE   LS   COMMAND ARE THE SAME AQC
)@@G@@S     @G@@@@ FOR    LOCATE    I.E.     NLS    WILL PRINT LINE NUMBERS,  QD
)@@G@@AND THE     @G@@@@ OPTIONS    ,<NUMBER>    OR   ,*   WILL LOCATE THE SPEQE
)@@G@@CIFIED NUMBER     @A@@@@ OR ALL OCCURRENCES OF THE STRING.  @[@@@@      QF
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @^@@@@  8. 6.   MS <CHAR>     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@QG
)@@G@@       THE  CONCEPT OF A MASK CHARACTER HAS ALREADY BEEN INTRODUCED     QH
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WITH  THE    FIND    COMMAND;  IT IS A CHARACTER WHICH SERVES ONLQI
)@@G@@Y     @G@@@@ AS  A PLACEHOLDER IN A STRING.   WHEN USED IN A PATTERN,  TQJ
)@@G@@HE MASK     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USEQK
)@@G@@R'S GUIDE                8-  5@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@QL
)@@G@@ CHARACTER  INDICATES  THAT ONE DOES NOT CARE WHAT IS IN THE SPECI-     QM
)@@G@@@G@@@@ FIED COLUMN,  I.E. ALL POSSIBLE CHARACTERS ARE CONSIDERED TO EQUAQN
)@@G@@L     @^@@@@ THE MASK CHARACTER.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       ALTHOUGH THQO
)@@G@@E BLANK IS DEFINED AS THE MASK CHARACTER FOR FIND     @G@@@@ ,   BLANKS QP
)@@G@@ ARE  SIGNIFICANT  IN     L    AND    C    COMMANDS AND     @G@@@@ NORMAQQ
)@@G@@LLY  WOULD  NOT  BE  USED  AS A MASK.   ONE CAN DEFINE A MASK     @G@@@@QR
)@@G@@ CHARACTER  FOR USE IN THESE COMMANDS BY THE    MS    COMMAND, I.E.     QS
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @A@@@@                              MS &  @[@@@@      @G@@@@QT
)@@G@@ DEFINES THE AMPERSAND AS A MASK CHARACTER TO BE USED IN ALL SUBSE-     QU
)@@G@@@G@@@@ QUENT    L  ,     LS  ,  AND    C    COMMANDS.  THE MASK CHARACTEQV
)@@G@@R     @G@@@@ SO  DEFINED  REMAINS  IN FORCE UNTIL CHANGED BY ANOTHER MS QW
)@@G@@   COM-     @B@@@@ MAND.  MASKING MAY BE INHIBITED BY TYPING@[@@@@      QX
)@@G@@@A@@@@                             MS     @[@@@@      @G@@@@       MASKIQY
)@@G@@NG  WITH  THE    MS    CHARACTER IS NOT SPECIFIC TO ANY     @G@@@@ CLASSQZ
)@@G@@  OF  CHARACTERS.    THE 'MATCH' COMMAND (SEE BELOW) PROVIDES     @G@@@@RA
)@@G@@ MORE GENERAL MASKING,  E.G.   'ALL ALPHABETICS' OR 'ANYTHING WHICH     RB
)@@G@@@#@@@@ IS NOT A DIGIT'. @[@@@@      @A@@@@  8. 6. 1.   MASKING IN    LOCRC
)@@G@@ATE   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IN  THE    LOCATE    COMMAND (AND ITS VARRD
)@@G@@IANTS,   NL ,  LS ,     @G@@@@ AND    NLS ),  THE MASK CHARACTER DEFINEDRE
)@@G@@ BY AN    MS    FUNCTIONS     @G@@@@ IN  A MANNER EQUIVALENT TO THE BLANRF
)@@G@@K IN    FIND  .   ANY CHARACTER     @C@@@@ IS CONSIDERED TO MATCH TO THERG
)@@G@@ MASK CHARACTER.  @[@@@@      @A@@@@  8. 6. 2.   MASKING IN    CHANGE   RH
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    CHANGE    COMMAND USES TWO STRINGS,  THERI
)@@G@@ STRING BEING     @G@@@@ SEARCHED  FOR  (I.E.  THE 'OLD' STRING WHICH APRJ
)@@G@@PEARS ON THE LEFT),     @G@@@@ AND THE STRING WHICH IS TO REPLACE IT (THRK
)@@G@@E 'NEW' STRING).   A MASK     @G@@@@ IN THE OLD STRING FUNCTIONS AS IT DRL
)@@G@@OES IN    LOCATE  ,  I.E.   ANY     @G@@@@ CHARACTER  WILL  BE  EQUAL  TRM
)@@G@@O  THE  MASK CHARACTER.  IN ADDITION,     @G@@@@ HOWEVER,   CHARACTERS  RN
)@@G@@WHICH  APPEAR  UNDER MASK CHARACTERS IN THE     @G@@@@ 'OLD'  STRING  ARRO
)@@G@@E  SAVED  FOR  PLACEMENT IN THE 'NEW' STRING,  IF     @G@@@@ NECESSARY. RP
)@@G@@   A  ONE-TO-ONE CORRESPONDENCE IS MADE WITH THE MASKED     @G@@@@ POSITRQ
)@@G@@IONS IN THE OLD AND NEW STRINGS.  ASSUMING THAT THE 'CURRENT'     @G@@@@RR
)@@G@@ LINE CONTAINS THE CHARACTERS  ABC  AND THE MASK CHARACTER HAS BEEN     RS
)@@G@@@B@@@@ DEFINED AS A COLON, THEN THE COMMAND     @[@@@@      @B@@@@      RT
)@@G@@                     C /A::/:E:/    @[@@@@      @B@@@@ WOULD CHANGE THE RU
)@@G@@STRING 'ABC' TO 'BEC'.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IT IS NOT NECESSARY FORRV
)@@G@@ THE NUMBER OF MASK CHARACTERS ON THE     @G@@@@ LEFT  BE  EQUAL TO THE RW
)@@G@@NUMBER ON THE RIGHT.  IN THE EXAMPLE ABOVE,     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@      RX
)@@G@@        UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                8-  6@[@@@@RY
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @]@@@@ FOR EXAMPLE@B@@@@                  RZ
)@@G@@         C %A::%E:%     @[@@@@      @B@@@@ WOULD CHANGE THE STRING 'ABC'SA
)@@G@@ TO 'EB'.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IF  THE  NUMBER  OF MASK CHARACTERSSB
)@@G@@ ON THE RIGHT EXCEEDS THE     @G@@@@ NUMBER  ON THE LEFT,  THEN THE EXCESC
)@@G@@SS MASK CHARACTERS ARE REPLACED     @G@@@@ WITH WHATEVER THEY WERE AT THSD
)@@G@@E LAST SUCCESSFUL    CHANGE  .   THIS     @G@@@@ FEATURE  MAY BE USED TOSE
)@@G@@ EXTRACT CHARACTERS FROM A STRING AND DEPO-     @E@@@@ SIT THEM INTO SEVSF
)@@G@@ERAL STRINGS ON OTHER LINES OF THE TEXT.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       FOR  SG
)@@G@@EXAMPLE,   CONSIDER  AGAIN THAT ONE WERE EDITING A LINE     @G@@@@ CONTASH
)@@G@@INING 'ABC' AND THE MASK CHARACTER WERE A COLON.  THE COMMAND     @[@@@@SI
)@@G@@      @B@@@@                           C /A::/:E:/    @[@@@@      @G@@@@SJ
)@@G@@ NOT ONLY CHANGES 'ABC' TO 'BEC',  BUT IN ADDITION, THE EDITOR WILL     SK
)@@G@@@G@@@@ RECORD  THE  CHARACTERS  'BC'  AS  MASKED CHANGE CHARACTERS.   THSL
)@@G@@E     @^@@@@ SUBSEQUENT COMMAND     @[@@@@      @B@@@@                  SM
)@@G@@      C ,X,X::, 1000 G  @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD  THEN  CHANGE ALL OCCURSN
)@@G@@RENCES (BELOW THE CURRENT WINDOW,  OF     @ @@@@ COURSE) OF 'X' TO 'XBC'SO
)@@G@@.     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@  8. 7.   ALTERNATE FORMS FOR    CHASP
)@@G@@NGE   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @D@@@@  8. 7. 1.   CONTROLLINGSQ
)@@G@@ THE NUMBER OF CHANGES DONE   @[@@@@      @G@@@@      THE STANDARD FORMSSR
)@@G@@ OF THE    CHANGE    COMMAND AS GIVEN ABOVE     @[@@@@ WERE @C@@@@      SS
)@@G@@              C /<OLD>/<NEW>/ <LINES> G   @C@@@@                    C -<ST
)@@G@@OLD>-<NEW>- <LINES>     @B@@@@       OR           C :<OLD>:<NEW>: G     SU
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@ WHERE  THE  <LINES> FIELD INDICATES THE NUMBER OF LINSV
)@@G@@ES TO BE EXA-     @G@@@@ MINED  FOR  CHANGES  STARTING  WITH THE CURRENTSW
)@@G@@ LINE,  AND    G IF     @G@@@@ PRESENT INDICATES THAT ALL OCCURRENCES ONSX
)@@G@@ A LINE ARE TO BE CHANGED     @A@@@@ (OTHERWISE ONLY THE FIRST IS).     SY
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       IT  IS POSSIBLE TO SPECIFY THE MAXIMUM NUMBER OSZ
)@@G@@F OCCURRENCES     @G@@@@ PER  LINE TO BE CHANGED BY TYPING THAT NUMBER ITA
)@@G@@N PLACE OF    G   -     @[@@@@ I.E. @[@@@@      @B@@@@                  TB
)@@G@@       C /ABC/X/ 10 2   @[@@@@      @G@@@@ MEANS  SCAN  THE  NEXT  10 LITC
)@@G@@NES FOR THE OCCURRENCE OF 'ABC',  AND     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@            TD
)@@G@@  UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                8-  7@[@@@@      TE
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ CHANGE  A  MAXIMUM  OF  2  OCCURRENCES PETF
)@@G@@R LINE FROM 'ABC' TO 'X'.     @G@@@@ OBVIOUSLY IF THE NUMBER OF OCCURRENTG
)@@G@@CES PER LINE IS TO BE SPECIFIED     @E@@@@ IN THIS MANNER, THEN THE NUMBTH
)@@G@@ER OF LINES IS REQUIRED, SINCE@B@@@@                          C &ABC&X& TI
)@@G@@10    @[@@@@      @G@@@@ IS  DEFINED  TO  MEAN CHANGE 1 OCCURRENCE PER LTJ
)@@G@@INE ON THE NEXT TEN     @^@@@@ (10) LINES.  HENCE     @[@@@@      @B@@@@TK
)@@G@@                            C /A/B/ 1 3   @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WILL  CHANGTL
)@@G@@E  THE FIRST THREE OCCURRENCES OF A TO B ON THE CURRENT     @]@@@@ LINE TM
)@@G@@ONLY. @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IN LIEU OF SPECIFYING THE NUMBER OF LINESTN
)@@G@@ TO BE EXAMINED FOR     @G@@@@ CHANGING,  ONE MAY SPECIFY THE NUMBER OF TO
)@@G@@LINES TO BE CHANGED; THIS     @G@@@@ IS  DONE  BY THE OPTION CONSTRUCTIOTP
)@@G@@N USED BY    LOCATE    AND FIND     @#@@@@ .  FOR EXAMPLE   @B@@@@      TQ
)@@G@@                     C,3 *ABC*X*    @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WILL  CAUSE THE ETR
)@@G@@DITOR TO SCAN AS MANY LINES AS NEEDED UNTIL THREE     @G@@@@ HAVE BEEN CTS
)@@G@@HANGED (OR AN END OF FILE RESULTS,  OF COURSE).   SIMI-     @]@@@@ LARLYTT
)@@G@@,     @B@@@@                           C,* @ABC@X@    @[@@@@      @B@@@@TU
)@@G@@ WOULD CHANGE ALL THE REMAINING LINES.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       WHEN TV
)@@G@@ THE  OPTIONS FIELD IS USED,  ONLY ONE FIELD IS ALLOWED     @G@@@@ AFTERTW
)@@G@@ THE LAST DELIMITER, AND THIS SPECIFIES THE MAXIMUM NUMBER OF     @G@@@@TX
)@@G@@ CHANGES PER LINE.   THUS THE COMMANDS ABOVE WOULD CHANGE A MAXIMUM     TY
)@@G@@@D@@@@ OF ONE OCCURRENCE OF 'ABC' PER LINE, THE COMMAND     @[@@@@      TZ
)@@G@@@B@@@@                          C,* +ABC+X+ 3   @[@@@@      @B@@@@ WOULDUA
)@@G@@ CHANGE A MAXIMUM OF THREE, AND     @[@@@@      @B@@@@                  UB
)@@G@@        C,* /ABC/X/ G   @[@@@@      @E@@@@ WOULD CHANGE ALL OCCURRENCES UC
)@@G@@ON ALL OF THE REMAINING LINES.@[@@@@      @A@@@@  8. 7. 2.   REVERSE CHAUD
)@@G@@NGE (RC)    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    RC    COMMAND  IS IDENTICAL UE
)@@G@@TO CHANGE EXCEPT THAT THE     @G@@@@ MEANING OF THE TWO DELIMITED STRINGUF
)@@G@@S IS REVERSED,  I.E. THE SECOND     @G@@@@ STRING IS THE ONE TO BE CHANGUG
)@@G@@ED AND THE FIRST IS THE ONE IT SHOULD     @G@@@@ BE CHANGED TO.   RC IS UH
)@@G@@MOST USEFUL WHEN ONE HAS MADE AN ERROR IN A     @G@@@@ CHANGE  AND WISHEUI
)@@G@@S TO UNDO ITS EFFECTS.   SINCE THE STRING PORTION     @G@@@@ OF  THE  LAUJ
)@@G@@ST  CHANGE  IS ALWAYS REMEMBERED BY THE EDITOR,  TYPING     @G@@@@ RC   UK
)@@G@@  WITHOUT  ANY STRING SPECIFICATIONS WILL OFTEN REPAIR ERRORS     @G@@@@UL
)@@G@@ CAUSED  BY  MISTYPING A CHANGE COMMAND.   NOTICE THAT THIS COMMAND     UM
)@@G@@@G@@@@ DOES  NOT  LITERALLY UNDO THE EFFECTS OF THE PREVIOUS CHANGE,  BUUN
)@@G@@T     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUUO
)@@G@@IDE                8-  8@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ SIMPLUP
)@@G@@Y REVERSES THE FIELDS.  HENCE THERE ARE SOME CIRCUMSTANCES IN     @G@@@@UQ
)@@G@@ WHICH RC WILL NOT CORRECT AN ERROR, BUT MAY RESULT IN GARBLING THE     UR
)@@G@@@G@@@@ IMAGE  EVEN  FURTHER.  FOR THIS REASON,  THE RC  COMMAND SHOULD BUS
)@@G@@E     @^@@@@ USED WITH CAUTION.     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@  8. 8UT
)@@G@@.   INLINE(INL)   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    INLINE    UU
)@@G@@COMMAND ALLOWS FLEXIBLE EDITING OF A SINGLE     @C@@@@ LINE IN PLACE.  SUV
)@@G@@TRINGS OF CHARACTERS MAY BE   @G@@@@ INSERTED/REPLACED/DELETED  AT ANY NUW
)@@G@@UMBER OF SPECIFIED POSITIONS IN     @]@@@@ THE IMAGE. @[@@@@      @G@@@@UX
)@@G@@       UPON  TYPING OF THE    INLINE    COMMAND,  THE CURRENT IMAGE     UY
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WILL BE DISPLAYED UNSQUEEZED AND PRECEDED BY A + SIGN;  THE EDITOUZ
)@@G@@R     @G@@@@ WILL  AWAIT SPECIFIC EDITING COMMANDS FOR THAT LINE.   INLIVA
)@@G@@NE COM-     @G@@@@ MANDS  ARE TYPED DIRECTLY BENEATH THE POINTS IN THE IVB
)@@G@@MAGE TO WHICH     @G@@@@ THEY  APPLY.   COMMANDS  START WITH ONE OF THE VC
)@@G@@LETTERS I, R, OR D.     @G@@@@ EACH COMMAND IS FOLLOWED BY A STRING OF TVD
)@@G@@EXT,  THE END OF WHICH IS     @F@@@@ MARKED BY AN EXCLAMATION POINT (!).VE
)@@G@@  THE INLINE COMMANDS ARE     @[@@@@      @D@@@@        I<STRING>!     <VF
)@@G@@STRING> IS INSERTED AFTER THE @C@@@@                        CHARACTER ABVG
)@@G@@OVE THE I.  @[@@@@      @F@@@@        R<STRING>!     EACH CHARACTER IN <VH
)@@G@@STRING> REPLACES THE    @C@@@@                        CHARACTER ABOVE ITVI
)@@G@@.     @[@@@@      @F@@@@        D<FILLER>!     ALL CHARACTERS BETWEEN THVJ
)@@G@@E D AND THE !     @F@@@@                        ARE DELETED (<FILLER> ISVK
)@@G@@ USED ONLY TO     @F@@@@                        POSITION THE CARRIAGE, AVL
)@@G@@ND IS USUALLY     @A@@@@                        SPACES.)    @[@@@@      VM
)@@G@@@G@@@@       IF  THE ! IS NOT DESIRED AS A STOP CHARACTER,  ANY CHARACTEVN
)@@G@@R     @G@@@@ MAY  BE  DESIGNATED  AS  A  STOP CHARACTER (FOR A SINGLE   VO
)@@G@@ INLINE     @C@@@@ COMMAND) BY TYPING THE COMMAND IN THE FORM     @B@@@@VP
)@@G@@                     INLINE <STOPCHAR>    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@VQ
)@@G@@      @ @@@@  8. 9.   MATCH(M) <PATTERN>  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@VR
)@@G@@      @^@@@@  8. 9. 1.   GENERAL    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    MATCVS
)@@G@@H    COMMAND IS THE MOST POWERFUL EDITOR COMMAND,     @E@@@@ COMBINING AVT
)@@G@@LL OF THE FEATURES OF    FIND  ,    LOCATE  ,   @G@@@@ CHANGE   ,  AND MVU
)@@G@@ANY ELEMENTS OF THE SNOBOL LANGUAGE INTO A SINGLE     @G@@@@ COMMAND.   VV
)@@G@@ THE  USER  OF     MATCH     SPECIFIES  A PATTERN TO BE     @[@@@@*****^VW
)@@G@@@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE               VX
)@@G@@ 8-  9@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ MATCHED;  THIS PATTERN VY
)@@G@@MAY SPECIFY SPECIFIC CHARACTERS, CLASSES OF     @G@@@@ CHARACTERS,   ANDVZ
)@@G@@/OR  STRINGS WHICH MUST CORRESPOND IN THE PATTERN     @G@@@@ AND  THE IMWA
)@@G@@AGE.   THE PATTERN IS COMPARED WITH THE IMAGE CHARACTER     @G@@@@ BY CHWB
)@@G@@ARACTER;  CERTAIN CHARACTERS IN THE PATTERN ALLOW MATCHING OF     @G@@@@WC
)@@G@@ STRINGS  OF INDETERMINATE LENGTH OR IN SPECIFIC COLUMNS.   CHARAC-     WD
)@@G@@@G@@@@ TERS IN PATTERNS ARE OF THREE TYPES,  LITERAL CHARACTERS,  MASKINWE
)@@G@@G     @G@@@@ CHARACTERS  AND  CONTROL  CHARACTERS.    LITERAL CHARACTERSWF
)@@G@@ ALWAYS     @G@@@@ MATCH  THEMSELVES;  MASKING CHARACTERS MATCH A PARTICWG
)@@G@@ULAR CLASS OF     @G@@@@ CHARACTERS  (SUCH AS 'ANY DIGIT'),  AND CONTROLWH
)@@G@@ CHARACTERS QUALIFY     @G@@@@ THE  ACTION  OF OTHER CHARACTERS.   THE LWI
)@@G@@ITERAL CHARACTERS ARE ALL     @G@@@@ THE  LETTERS  AND  DIGITS  (NOTE:  WJ
)@@G@@ DIGITS IN COLUMN SPECIFIERS OR     @G@@@@ LABELED STRING IDENTIFIERS ARWK
)@@G@@E NON-LITERAL).  ALL OTHER CHARACTERS     @F@@@@ ARE RESERVED FOR USE EIWL
)@@G@@THER AS MASKS OR AS CONTROL CHARACTERS.   @[@@@@      @D@@@@  8. 9. 2.  WM
)@@G@@ USING    MATCH    TO SEARCH FOR AN IMAGE.@[@@@@      @G@@@@       IN  IWN
)@@G@@TS  SIMPLEST  FORM,      MATCH    MAY BE USED TO SEARCH     @G@@@@ FORWAWO
)@@G@@RD  IN  THE  TEXT BEING EDITED TO FIND AN IMAGE WHICH MATCHES     @G@@@@WP
)@@G@@ THE  SPECIFIED PATTERN.   AS NOTED ABOVE,  PATTERNS ARE MADE UP OF     WQ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ LITERAL, MASKING AND CONTROL CHARACTERS.  THE MASK CHARACTERS AREWR
)@@G@@:     @[@@@@      @B@@@@             $   MATCHES ANY CHARACTER    @B@@@@WS
)@@G@@             @   MATCHES ANY ALPHABETIC   @A@@@@             #   MATCHESWT
)@@G@@ ANY NUMBER @F@@@@             .   MATCHES ANY SPECIAL CHARACTER (NEITHEWU
)@@G@@R ALPHA-    @A@@@@                 BETIC NOR NUMERIC) @[@@@@      @G@@@@WV
)@@G@@ THE CONTROL CHARACTERS ARE  OF SEVERAL TYPES - LITERAL, ITERATION,     WW
)@@G@@@G@@@@ POSITIONING,   AND   REPLACEMENT.   THE LITERAL CONTROL CHARACTERWX
)@@G@@S     @[@@@@ ARE: @[@@@@      @G@@@@             '   CAUSES  THE  SINGLEWY
)@@G@@  CHARACTER FOLLOWING TO ASSUME     @G@@@@                  ITS LITERAL WZ
)@@G@@VALUE, E.G.  TO MATCH A SINGLE DOLLAR     @E@@@@                  SIGN (XA
)@@G@@RATHER THAN ANY CHARACTER) TYPE '$  @[@@@@      @G@@@@             !   CXB
)@@G@@AUSES THE FOLLOWING LITERAL, COLUMN SPECIFICATION     @G@@@@            XC
)@@G@@      OR NAMED STRING REFERENCE TO BE NOT MATCHED.  FOR     @G@@@@      XD
)@@G@@            EXAMPLE,   !A MATCHES ANYTHING WHICH IS NOT AN A,     @G@@@@XE
)@@G@@                  !#  MATCHES  A NON-NUMERIC,  AND !'@ MATCHES ANY-     XF
)@@G@@@B@@@@                  THING EXCEPT AN AT-SIGN.@[@@@@      @B@@@@ THE IXG
)@@G@@TERATION CONTROL CHARACTERS ARE:    @[@@@@      @F@@@@             *   MXH
)@@G@@ATCHES   ANY   STRING  OF  INDETERMINATE  LENGTH@C@@@@                  XI
)@@G@@(INCLUDING THE NULL STRING)   @[@@@@      @G@@@@             &   MATCHESXJ
)@@G@@ ANY NUMBER OF OCCURRENCES (INCLUDING ZERO)     @G@@@@                  XK
)@@G@@OF  THE  LITERAL  OR  NAMED STRING WHICH FOLLOWS.     @F@@@@            XL
)@@G@@      THUS &X MATCHES ANY STRING OF REPEATED X'S.     @[@@@@      @[@@@@XM
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE         XN
)@@G@@       8- 10@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@         (SPACE) MXO
)@@G@@ATCHES ANY NUMBER OF SPACES (INCLUDING ZERO)    @[@@@@      @D@@@@      XP
)@@G@@POSITIONING AND REPLACEMENT ARE DISCUSSED BELOW.@[@@@@      @B@@@@  8. 9XQ
)@@G@@. 3.   COLUMN POSITONING CONTROL    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       POSITIONINGXR
)@@G@@  CONTROL  IS  USED  TO ASSURE THAT A PATTERN HAS     @G@@@@ MATCHED UP XS
)@@G@@TO A SPECIFIC COLUMN.   A COLUMN NUMBER IS SPECIFIED BY     @G@@@@ ENCLOXT
)@@G@@SING IT IN SLASHES AND, IN EFFECT, MATCHES THE 'HOLE' BETWEEN     @G@@@@XU
)@@G@@ COLUMNS;   THE PATTERN *A/5/B WILL MATCH IF THERE IS AN    A    IN     XV
)@@G@@@A@@@@ COLUMN 4 AND A    B    IN COLUMN 5.@[@@@@      @G@@@@       IT  IXW
)@@G@@S  POSSIBLE TO POSITION COUNTING COLUMNS FROM THE RIGHT     @G@@@@ SIDE XX
)@@G@@OF THE IMAGE.   IN THIS CASE,  THE COLUMN SPECIFIER SHOULD BE     @G@@@@XY
)@@G@@ PRECEDED BY A MINUS SIGN; THE FIRST COLUMN COUNTING FROM THE RIGHT     XZ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ IS  THE  LAST NON-BLANK COLUMN OR THE CLIMIT MARGIN,  WHICHEVER IYA
)@@G@@S     @G@@@@ LESS.    FOR  EXAMPLE,  THE PATTERN    */-1/J    MATCHES ANYB
)@@G@@Y IMAGE     @D@@@@ WHOSE LAST NON-BLANK CHARACTER IS THE LETTER 'J'.    YC
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @ @@@@  8. 9. 4.   NAMING STRINGS   @[@@@@      @G@@@@      YD
