)@@G@@IN COMPLEX PATTERN MATCHING OPERATIONS, IT IS OFTEN DESIRABLE     @G@@@@YE
)@@G@@ TO  BE  ABLE TO SAVE AND/OR LABEL PARTICULAR STRINGS WHICH MATCH A     YF
)@@G@@@G@@@@ PORTION  OF THE PATTERN.  SUCH A CIRCUMSTANCE ARISES, FOR EXAMPLEYG
)@@G@@,     @G@@@@ WHEN  ONE  WISHES TO MATCH IMAGES ON WHICH A STRING IS REPEYH
)@@G@@ATED OR     @G@@@@ TO  EXCHANGE  TWO  STRINGS  ON A MATCHED IMAGE (SEE BYI
)@@G@@ELOW).   IF A     @G@@@@ PORTION  OF  A  PATTERN  IS ENCLOSED IN BRACKETYJ
)@@G@@S,  THEN THE STRING     @G@@@@ WHICH  MATCHES  THE PATTERN IN THE BRACKEYK
)@@G@@TS IS REMEMBERED AND NUM-     @G@@@@ BERED.   SUCH A STRING MAY THEN BE YL
)@@G@@REFERRED TO SUBSEQUENTLY IN THE     @G@@@@ PATTERN  BY  PRECEDING  THE  YM
)@@G@@NUMBER  WITH  A  COLON.   NUMBERS ARE     @G@@@@ ASSIGNED TO SUCH STRINGYN
)@@G@@S IN ORDER OF THEIR OCCURRENCE FROM LEFT TO     @G@@@@ RIGHT STARTING FRYO
)@@G@@OM 1;  UP TO 9 ARE ALLOWED.  IF A NAMED STRING IS     @G@@@@ REFERRED  TYP
)@@G@@O IN THIS MANNER,  THEN THE IMAGE MUST CONTAIN AN EXACT     @E@@@@ LITERYQ
)@@G@@AL MATCH OF THE ORIGINAL STRING.  THUS THE PATTERN    @[@@@@      @ @@@@YR
)@@G@@                     *[$]'#:1Z@[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD MATCH THE IMAGE .YS
)@@G@@..  Q#QZ  ,  BUT NOT..  . Q#XZ  .  BRACKETS     @D@@@@ MAY NOT BE NESTEDYT
)@@G@@; A 'SYNTAX ERROR' WILL RESULT.     @[@@@@      @A@@@@  8. 9. 5.   REPLAYU
)@@G@@CEMENT OF STRINGS @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  REPLACEMENT  FEATURE  OFYV
)@@G@@ THE    MATCH    COMMAND MAY BE     @G@@@@ USED  TO  ACHIEVE  RESULTS  SYW
)@@G@@IMILAR  TO  THOSE  OF  THE     CHANGE     @G@@@@ COMMAND.    ONE  SIGNIFYX
)@@G@@ICANT  DIFFERENCE  IS  THAT  THE     CHANGE     @G@@@@ COMMAND  USUALLY YY
)@@G@@IS USED TO CHANGE THE CURRENT IMAGE,  WHILE MATCH     @G@@@@ DOES NOT AFYZ
)@@G@@FECT THE CURRENT IMAGE (SEE    MC  ,  HOWEVER).   MATCH     @G@@@@ ALWAYZA
)@@G@@S  SEARCHES  FORWARD  IN  AN  ATTEMPT  TO FIND AN IMAGE WHICH     @G@@@@ZB
)@@G@@ MATCHES  THE  GIVEN  PATTERN;   ONCE SUCH AN IMAGE IS FOUND,  THEN     ZC
)@@G@@@C@@@@ REPLACEMENT CAN BE PERFORMED ON THAT IMAGE.    @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@ZD
)@@G@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                8- 11ZE
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       REPLACEMENTZF
)@@G@@  USES NAMED STRINGS;  A NAMED STRING MAY BE REP-     @G@@@@ LACED BY ANZG
)@@G@@Y OTHER STRING (INCLUDING A NULL STRING).   REPLACEMENT     @G@@@@ IS  SZH
)@@G@@PECIFIED  BY  THE PRESENCE OF THE CONTROL CHARACTER =  ;  THE     @G@@@@ZI
)@@G@@ FIRST  (NON-LITERAL)  = SIGN TERMINATES THE PATTERN.   THE GENERAL     ZJ
)@@G@@@B@@@@ FORM OF    MATCH    WITH REPLACEMENT IS: @[@@@@      @C@@@@      ZK
)@@G@@       M <PATTERN>=<R1>=<R2>= . . . =<RN> @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WHERE  THE ZL
)@@G@@<RI> ARE STRINGS WHICH WILL REPLACE THE CORRESPONDINGLY     @G@@@@ NUMBEZM
)@@G@@RED  BRACKETED STRINGS.   A REPLACEMENT STRING MAY CONSIST OF     @G@@@@ZN
)@@G@@ ANY  COMBINATION  OF  LITERALS AND NAMED STRINGS.   WHEN USED IN A     ZO
)@@G@@@G@@@@ REPLACEMENT STRING,  SPECIAL CHARACTERS MUST BE QUOTED; COLONS ARZP
)@@G@@E     @C@@@@ USED TO IDENTIFY NAMED STRINGS.  THE COMMAND   @[@@@@      ZQ
)@@G@@@B@@@@                  M  [A*A][B*B]=:2=:1     @[@@@@      @G@@@@ CAUSEZR
)@@G@@S  TRANSPOSITION OF THE FIRST TWO FIELDS ON A MATCHING IMAGE.     @G@@@@ZS
)@@G@@ THUS  THE  IMAGE     A+AB-B     WOULD BECOME    B-BA+A  .   A MORE     ZT
)@@G@@@A@@@@ PRACTICAL EXAMPLE IS THE COMMAND   @[@@@@      @C@@@@            ZU
)@@G@@   M,* *ENCODE '([*]',[*]')=:2=:1   @[@@@@      @F@@@@ WHICH  WILL  CONVZV
)@@G@@ERT  THE  OLD  STYLE  UNIVAC  FORTRAN     ENCODE@ @@@@ STATEMENTS TO THEZW
)@@G@@ NEW FORMAT.@[@@@@      @A@@@@  8. 9. 6.   REPEATING A PATTERN    @[@@@@ZX
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       THE      MATCH    COMMAND ALLOWS REPEATED APPLICATIONZY
)@@G@@ OF THE     @G@@@@ PATTERN  (AND  ANY SPECIFIED REPLACEMENTS) TO THE SAMZZ
)@@G@@E IMAGE.   IF     @G@@@@ THE  TOTAL NUMBER OF NON-LITERAL EQUAL SIGNS EXAA
)@@G@@CEEDS THE NUMBER OF     @G@@@@ NAMED  STRINGS,   THE  ENTIRE PATTERN ANDAB
)@@G@@ ALL REPLACEMENTS WILL BE     @G@@@@ RE-ITERATED AFTER THE INITIAL PATTEAC
)@@G@@RN MATCH AND REPLACEMENTS.  THE     @G@@@@ RE-ITERATED  PATTERN MATCH WIAD
)@@G@@LL START FROM THE FIRST COLUMN OF THE     @G@@@@ ORIGINAL  IMAGE  WHICH AE
)@@G@@ WAS NOT MATCHED ON THE PREVIOUS ITERATION;     @G@@@@ THIS COLUMN WILL AF
)@@G@@BE TREATED AS IF IT WERE COLUMN ONE OF THE IMAGE.     @]@@@@ FOR EXAMPLEAG
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @A@@@@                         M *[A]=B=  @[@@@@      @B@@@@AH
)@@G@@ WOULD CHANGE ALL OCCURRENCES OF A TO B.  @[@@@@      @A@@@@  8. 9. 7.  AI
)@@G@@ VARIATIONS OF MATCH    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      AS WITH OTHER EDITOR COMAJ
)@@G@@MANDS,     MATCH    ALLOWS AN OPTIONS     @G@@@@ FIELD  IMMEDIATELY  AFTAK
)@@G@@ER  THE  COMMAND  NAME TO SPECIFY NUMBER OF     @G@@@@ LINES TO BE PROCEAL
)@@G@@SSED.   WITHOUT OPTIONS,     MATCH    WILL SEARCH     @G@@@@ FORWARD  TOAM
)@@G@@  FIND  THE  FIRST IMAGE WHICH MATCHES THE PATTERN,  DO     @G@@@@ REPLAAN
)@@G@@CEMENT ON THAT IMAGE IF REQUIRED,  AND STOP.     M,*    WOULD     @G@@@@AO
)@@G@@ CAUSE  THE     MATCH     COMMAND  TO REPEAT UNTIL THE END OF FILE.     AP
)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE   AQ
)@@G@@             8- 12@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ THE  LAST  AR
)@@G@@   MATCH    PATTERN IS REMEMBERED BY THE EDITOR AND MAY     @G@@@@ BE REAS
)@@G@@PEATED SIMPLY BY TYPING THE COMMAND NAME (AND NEW OPTIONS, IF     @]@@@@AT
)@@G@@ DESIRED).  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       AS  WITH     LOCATE     AND    FINDAU
)@@G@@  ,     MATCH    WILL NOT     @G@@@@ ATTEMPT  TO  MATCH  THE  'CURRENT' AV
)@@G@@IMAGE.   A MATCH ON THE CURRENT     @G@@@@ IMAGE  (AND  ONLY THAT IMAGE)AW
)@@G@@ MAY BE DONE WITH THE    MC    (MATCH     @G@@@@ CURRENT)  COMMAND.   THAX
)@@G@@IS FEATURE IS EXTREMELY USEFUL IN DEBUGGING     @G@@@@ COMPLEX PATTERNS AY
)@@G@@TO BE APPLIED TO AN ENTIRE FILE OR ELEMENT.    MC     @G@@@@ MAY BE USEDAZ
)@@G@@ TO TEST THE PATTERN ON A SINGLE IMAGE;  IF IT FAILS TO     @G@@@@ WORK BA
)@@G@@ AS  DESIRED,     UNDO    MAY BE USED TO RESTORE THE ORIGINAL     @G@@@@BB
)@@G@@ IMAGE.    ONCE  THE  PATTERN IS CORRECT,  ONE CAN THEN TYPE    M,*     BC
)@@G@@@G@@@@ (WITHOUT  RETYPING  THE PATTERN,  SINCE IT IS REMEMBERED) TO APPLBD
)@@G@@Y     @G@@@@ THE  COMMAND TO THE ENTIRE FILE.   OPTIONS ON THE    MC    BE
)@@G@@COMMAND     @#@@@@ ARE IGNORED.     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  8.10BF
)@@G@@.   THE    *    (CSF$) COMMAND@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE EBG
)@@G@@DITOR WILL ALLOW THE USER TO EXECUTE ANY CONTROL STATE-     @G@@@@ MENT BH
)@@G@@ ACCEPTABLE  TO  THE     ER CSF$    FEATURE OF EXEC 8 WITHOUT     @G@@@@BI
)@@G@@ LEAVING THE EDITOR.  THESE STATEMENTS ARE    ADD, ASG, BRKPT, CAT,     BJ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ CKPAR,  CKPT,  FREE,  LOG,  MODE, QUAL, RSPAR, RSTRT, START,  SYMBK
)@@G@@,     @G@@@@ AND    USE  .   THEY ARE TYPED IN THE NORMAL EXEC 8 SYNTAX,BL
)@@G@@ EXCEPT     @G@@@@ THAT THE FIRST CHARACTER TYPED SHOULD BE AN ASTERISK,BM
)@@G@@  RATHER THAN     @G@@@@ A MASTER SPACE.   FOR DETAILS ON THE ACTION OF BN
)@@G@@THESE COMMANDS, SEE     @B@@@@ THE APPROPRIATE UNIVAC DOCUMENTATION.    BO
)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE   BP
)@@G@@             9-  1@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@  9.   EDITOBQ
)@@G@@R PROCEDURES@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      WHEN PERFORMBR
)@@G@@ING A COMPLEX EDITING TASK, IT OFTEN HAPPENS THAT     @G@@@@ A  PARTICULBS
)@@G@@AR SEQUENCE OF COMMANDS IS DONE REPETITIVELY.   THE UOM     @G@@@@ TEXT BT
)@@G@@EDITOR PROVIDES A MECHANISM WHERE ONE MAY DECLARE A NUMBER OF     @G@@@@BU
)@@G@@ EDITOR  COMMANDS  TO BE A PROCEDURE,  AND INVOKE THESE COMMANDS BY     BV
)@@G@@@G@@@@ NAME WITH THE    CALL    COMMAND.   TO FACILITATE THE CONSTRUCTIOBW
)@@G@@N     @G@@@@ OF  COMPLEX  PROCEDURES,   SEVERAL EDITOR COMMANDS FOR TRANBX
)@@G@@SFER OF     @G@@@@ CONTROL AND LOOP COUNTING ARE AVAILABLE, AND ARE DESCBY
)@@G@@RIBED IN THIS     @G@@@@ SECTION.    ALTHOUGH  THE  COMMANDS  DISCUSSED BZ
)@@G@@IN THIS SECTION ARE     @G@@@@ PRIMARILY USED IN PROCEDURES, ALL OF THEMCA
)@@G@@ EXCEPT    JUMP    MAY BE     @E@@@@ USED AT ANY TIME.  JUMP    MAY ONLYCB
)@@G@@ APPEAR IN A PROCEDURE. @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@  9. 1.   CALL(CA)CC
)@@G@@ <PROC-NAME>@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE    CALL    COMMAND CD
)@@G@@IS USED TO INVOKE A PROCEDURE.   THIS     @G@@@@ COMMAND  CAUSES  THE NACE
)@@G@@MED PROCEDURE TO BE EXECUTED AS IF THE COM-     @E@@@@ MANDS COMPOSING ICF
)@@G@@T HAD BEEN ENTERED FROM THE TERMINAL.     @[@@@@      @G@@@@      THE COCG
)@@G@@MMANDS MAKING UP A PROCEDURE MUST BE A DECK EXTERNAL TO     @G@@@@ THE TCH
)@@G@@EXT BEING EDITED;  THEY COULD HAVE BEEN CREATED BY A PREVIOUS     @A@@@@CI
)@@G@@ USE OF THE EDITOR, FOR EXAMPLE.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       EDITOR  PROCJ
)@@G@@CEDURES  CAN  BE COMPOSED WITHOUT TERMINATING THE     @G@@@@ CURRENT EDICK
)@@G@@TOR SESSION BY APPROPRIATE USE OF THE    DCOPY COMMAND.     @G@@@@ CONSICL
)@@G@@DER  THAT  ONE  HAS  BEEN  EDITING  AND DISCOVERS THAT HE HAS     @A@@@@CM
)@@G@@ FREQUENT NEED OF THE TWO COMMANDS  @[@@@@      @A@@@@                  CN
)@@G@@         L XYZ    @B@@@@                           C /YZ:/YZR/    @[@@@@CO
)@@G@@      @D@@@@ THEY COULD BE DEFINED AS A PROCEDURE AS FOLLOWS:     @B@@@@CP
)@@G@@       T               (START AT THE TOP) @D@@@@       I L XYZ         (CQ
)@@G@@INSERT THE   LOCATE    COMMAND@A@@@@                           AS TEXT) CR
)@@G@@@D@@@@       BEGIN           (MARK THE CURRENT LINE AS THE  @C@@@@      CS
)@@G@@                     FIRST TO BE COPIED)  @D@@@@       I C /YZ:/YZR/   (CT
)@@G@@NOW INSERT THE    CHANGE  )   @C@@@@       N               (GO DOWN TO NCU
)@@G@@EXT LINE)   @E@@@@       DCOPY CHANGIT   (DESTRUCTIVE COPY OF THE TWO LICV
)@@G@@NES   @F@@@@                           ABOVE TO A PLACE CALLED 'CHANGIT'CW
)@@G@@)     @[@@@@      @G@@@@       HAVING DONE THE ABOVE,  THE TWO COMMANDS CX
)@@G@@THUS SAVED COULD BE     @A@@@@ INVOKED AT ANY TIME BY THE COMMAND @[@@@@CY
)@@G@@      @B@@@@                          CALL CHANGIT    @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@CZ
)@@G@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                9-  2DA
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       WHEN  ALL  DB
)@@G@@STATEMENTS  IN  A    CALL' ED PROCEDURE HAVE BEEN     @G@@@@ EXECUTED,  DC
)@@G@@ THE  EDITOR  RETURNS  CONTROL TO THE USER FOR ITS NEXT     @G@@@@ COMMADD
)@@G@@ND.   THUS PROCEDURES MAY CHAIN TO OTHER PROCEDURES,  BUT THE     @G@@@@DE
)@@G@@ TERMINATION  OF  A  PROCEDURE  DOES  NOT ALLOW FOR A RETURN TO THE     DF
)@@G@@@G@@@@ CALLING  PROCEDURE;   THE  EDITOR  ALWAYS  RETURNS TO THE TERMINADG
)@@G@@L     @G@@@@ REGARDLESS  OF  THE DEPTH OF PROCEDURE CALLS.   ANY EDITOR DH
)@@G@@COMMAND     @G@@@@ (WITH THE ABOVE RESTRICTIONS ON    CALL  ) MAY APPEARDI
)@@G@@ IN AN EDITOR     @G@@@@ PROCEDURE.  ARGUMENTS TO BE SYMBOLICALLY SUBSTIDJ
)@@G@@TUTED IN THE PROCE-     @G@@@@ DURE  BODY  MAY APPEAR ON THE    CALL    DK
)@@G@@LINE;  THEY ARE DISCUSSED     @]@@@@ BELOW.     @[@@@@      @G@@@@      DL
)@@G@@ IF  NO <PROC-NAME> APPEARS ON THE    CALL ,  THE EDITOR WILL     @G@@@@DM
)@@G@@ RE-EXECUTE THE LAST PROCEDURE WHICH WAS SPECIFIED.  IN THE EXAMPLE     DN
)@@G@@@G@@@@ ABOVE,   ONCE  THE  INITIAL    CALL CHANGIT    HAD ESTABLISHED THDO
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ PROCEDURE,  IT COULD THEN BE RE-EXECUTED SIMPLY BY TYPING  DP
)@@G@@  CA  .     @G@@@@ <PROC-NAME>  IS  REQUIRED IN THE FIRST CALL,  OF COURDQ
)@@G@@SE.   IF THIS     @G@@@@ SHORTENED  FROM  IS USED,  THEN THE ARGUMENTS (DR
)@@G@@IF ANY) WILL BE THE     @G@@@@ SAME AS THEY WERE AT THE INITIAL CALL.  TDS
)@@G@@HE ENTIRE COMMAND MUST BE     @C@@@@ RETYPED IF THE ARGUMENTS ARE TO BE DT
)@@G@@RESPECIFIED.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@  9. 2.   EDITOR VARIABLES    DU
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IN ORDER TO ALLOW SELECTIVE CONTROLDV
)@@G@@ OF THE COMMANDS EXECUTED     @G@@@@ IN A PROCEDURE,  VARIOUS NUMERIC VADW
)@@G@@RIABLES HAVE BEEN DEFINED WHICH     @G@@@@ CAN  BE SET AND TESTED BY APPDX
)@@G@@ROPRIATE COMMANDS.   SEVERAL OF THESE     @G@@@@ VARIABLES  (E.G.     CHDY
)@@G@@G    AND     EOF    ) ARE SET BY THE EDITOR     @B@@@@ ITSELF, THE OTHERDZ
)@@G@@S MAY BE SET BY COMMAND.@[@@@@      @C@@@@  9. 2. 1.   CHG ,  MCH ,  LOCEA
)@@G@@    AND    FIN    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      THE VARIABLES    CHG ,   MCH ,EB
)@@G@@  LOC    AND    FIN    INDICATE     @G@@@@ THE SUCCESS/FAIL STATUS OF THEC
)@@G@@E MOST RECENT EXECUTION OF THE CORRE-     @G@@@@ SPONDING  COMMANDS  (I.ED
)@@G@@E.    CHANGE ,  MATCH ,  LOCATE ,  FIND  ).     @G@@@@ IF  THE  COMMAND EE
)@@G@@SUCCEEDS,  THE CORRESPONDING VARIABLE IS SET TO A     @E@@@@ VALUE OF ONEF
)@@G@@E; IF IT FAILS, THE VAIABLE IS RESET TO ZERO.   @[@@@@      @#@@@@  9. 2EG
)@@G@@. 2.   EOF  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  VARIABLE     EOF     IS SET TOEH
)@@G@@ ONE WHENEVER THE VIEWING     @G@@@@ WINDOW  IS POSITIONED AT THE END OFEI
)@@G@@ FILE (I.E.   IS AFTER THE LAST     @ @@@@ LINE), AND IS ZERO OTHERWISE.EJ
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @B@@@@  9. 2. 3.   LIN ,  ILN    AND    LLN     @[@@@@      EK
)@@G@@@G@@@@       LIN    IS THE LINE NUMBER OF THE CURRENT LINE.     ILN    IEL
)@@G@@S     @G@@@@ THE 'INPUT' LINE NUMBER CORRESPONDING TO THE CURRENT LINE (EM
)@@G@@SEE THE     @G@@@@ GI     COMMAND).     LLN    IS THE NUMBER OF THE LASTEN
)@@G@@ LINE.  NOTE:     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM)EO
)@@G@@ - USER'S GUIDE                9-  3@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      EP
)@@G@@@G@@@@ LLN     WILL  BE  UNDEFINED  UNTIL THE FIRST    TOP    (EXPRESS OEQ
)@@G@@R     @^@@@@ IMPLIED) HAS BEEN DONE.@[@@@@      @ @@@@  9. 2. 4.   $    ER
)@@G@@AND    *    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  SPECIAL VARIABLE    $    HAS MES
)@@G@@EANING ONLY WITHIN PROCE-     @G@@@@ DURES.    IT  IS  THE  LINE NUMBER ET
)@@G@@OF THE PROCEDURE LINE CURRENTLY     @G@@@@ BEING  EXECUTED.    IT  MAY BEU
)@@G@@E USED TO EFFECT RELATIVE LINE NUMBER     @G@@@@ JUMPS WITHIN THE BODY OEV
)@@G@@F A PROCEDURE.   THE VARIABLE    *    IS AN     @ @@@@ INDEFINITELY LARGEW
)@@G@@E NUMBER.   @[@@@@      @#@@@@  9. 2. 5.   EOI  @[@@@@      @G@@@@      EX
)@@G@@ THE  VARIABLE    EOI    (END OF INPUT) IS SET IN CONJUNCTION     @G@@@@EY
)@@G@@ WITH  THE    IPR    (INPUT WITH PROMPT) COMMAND,  WHICH IS DEFINED     EZ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ LATER  IN  THIS CHAPTER.  IT IS ZERO IF THE DATA INPUT WAS NORMALFA
)@@G@@,     @G@@@@ ONE  IF THE USER ENTERED AN @EOF IMAGE,  AND TWO IF THE USEFB
)@@G@@R TYPED     @C@@@@ AN EXEC 8 CONTROL STATEMENT OTHER THAN @EOF.   @[@@@@FC
)@@G@@      @ @@@@  9. 2. 6.   USER VARIABLES   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IN  AFD
)@@G@@DDITION  TO THE INTERNALLY SET VARIABLES DEFINED ABOVE,     @G@@@@ THE  FE
)@@G@@EDITOR  HAS TEN VARIABLES NAMED    A    THROUGH    J    WHICH     @G@@@@FF
)@@G@@ CAN  BE  SET  BY  THE USER WITH THE    LET    (SEE BELOW) COMMAND.     FG
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE PRIMARY PURPOSE OF THESE VARIABLES IS TO ALLOW LOOP CONTROL IFH
)@@G@@N     @]@@@@ PROCEDURES.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  9. 3.   ARITHMETFI
)@@G@@IC EXPRESSIONS    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       A  LIMITED  AMOUNFJ
)@@G@@T  OF  INTEGER ARITHMETIC IS ALLOWED BY THE     @G@@@@ EDITOR;   THE  ONFK
)@@G@@LY  ARITHMETIC OPERATIONS ALLOWED ARE ADD (+) AND     @G@@@@ SUBTRACT  (FL
)@@G@@-).    EXPRESSIONS CONSIST OF VARIABLE NAMES AND/OR NU-     @G@@@@ MERICFM
)@@G@@  STRINGS  SEPARATED  BY  OPERATORS.    THUS 'A' AND '16' AND     @G@@@@FN
)@@G@@ '17+A-3'  ARE  ALL  LEGAL  ARITHMETIC  EXPRESSIONS  (EXCLUDING THE     FO
)@@G@@@G@@@@ QUOTES,  OF COURSE).   THE TERMS OF AN EXPRESSION MAY BE SEPARATEFP
)@@G@@D     @G@@@@ BY  ONE  AND  ONLY  ONE OPERATOR.   A UNARY PLUS OR MINUS SFQ
)@@G@@IGN MAY     @D@@@@ APPEAR ONLY AS THE FIRST CHARACTER OF AN EXPRESSION. FR
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@      EXPRESSIONS ARE EVALUATED IN STRICT LEFT-TO-RIGHFS
)@@G@@T ORDER, E.G.     @#@@@@ THE EXPRESSION   @A@@@@                        FT
)@@G@@      A+4-5 @[@@@@      @ @@@@ IS EVALUATED AS IF IT WERE   @A@@@@      FU
)@@G@@                       (A+4)-5@[@@@@      @G@@@@ PARENTHESES,  HOWEVER AFV
)@@G@@RE NOT ALLOWED.   BLANKS ARE FORBIDDEN; THE     @D@@@@ FIRST BLANK TERMIFW
)@@G@@NATES THE SCAN OF AN EXPRESSION.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@      FX
)@@G@@        UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                9-  4@[@@@@FY
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      WITH MINOR EXCEPTIONS, EDITOR FZ
)@@G@@EXPRESSIONS MAY APPEAR WHEREVER     @E@@@@ A NUMERIC VALUE IS NORMALLY EGA
)@@G@@XPECTED.  THUS THE COMMANDS:  @[@@@@      @A@@@@                        GB
)@@G@@LET A=3     @ @@@@                        GO A+5@[@@@@      @ @@@@ WILL GC
)@@G@@HAVE THE SAME EFFECT AS @[@@@@      @ @@@@                        GO 8  GD
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@ EDITOR EXPRESSIONS MAY NOT APPEAR ON A    CHANGE COMMGE
)@@G@@AND EXCEPT IN     @G@@@@ THE  OPTIONS  FIELD.   IN ADDITION,  IF THE SHOGF
)@@G@@RT FORM OF    GO IS     @G@@@@ USED (I.E.  COMMAND NAME OMITTED) THEN THGG
)@@G@@E COMMAND MUST START WITH     @#@@@@ A NUMERIC, E.G.  @[@@@@      @D@@@@GH
)@@G@@                5+A                IS ACCEPTABLE, BUT @B@@@@            GI
)@@G@@    A+5                IS NOT.@[@@@@      @G@@@@      SINCE THE SHORT FOGJ
)@@G@@RMS OF    NEXT    AND    UP    START WITH A     @C@@@@ SIGN, THIS RESTRIGK
)@@G@@CTION DOES NOT APPLY THERE.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@  9. 4.   LEGL
)@@G@@T     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     LET    COMMAND IS USEGM
)@@G@@D TO SET THE VALUES OF THE USER     @F@@@@ VARIABLES 'A' THROUGH 'J'.  TGN
)@@G@@HE GENERAL FORM OF    LET    IS     @[@@@@      @B@@@@                  GO
)@@G@@      LET <NAME>=<EXPR> @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WHERE  <NAME>  IS  ONE  OF THGP
)@@G@@E SINGLE CHARACTER USER VARIABLES 'A'     @E@@@@ THROUGH 'J' AND <EXPR> GQ
)@@G@@IS AN EDITOR ARITHMETIC EXPRESSION. @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     LETGR
)@@G@@     COMMAND  IS USEFUL IN INCREMENTING VARIABLES     @A@@@@ USED AS LOOGS
)@@G@@P COUNTERS, FOR EXAMPLE @[@@@@      @B@@@@                            LEGT
)@@G@@T A=A+1     @[@@@@      @G@@@@ COULD  BE USED TO INCREASE THE VALUE OF TGU
)@@G@@HE VARIABLE 'A' EACH TIME     @#@@@@ THROUGH A LOOP.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@GV
)@@G@@       THE  VALUES  OF  THE    LET    VARIABLES ARE CLEARED TO ZERO     GW
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WHEN THE EDITOR SIGNS ON, BUT NOT BETWEEN    CALL'S.  THIS ENABLEGX
)@@G@@S     @B@@@@ VALUES TO BE PASSED BETWEEN PROCEDURES.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@GY
)@@G@@      @ @@@@  9. 5.   JUMP <LINE-SPEC>    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@GZ
)@@G@@       THE     JUMP     COMMAND CAUSES A TRANSFER OF CONTROL WITHIN     HA
)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE   HB
)@@G@@             9-  5@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ THE  PROCEDHC
)@@G@@URE TO THE LINE INDICATED BY <LINE-SPEC>.   <LINE-SPEC>     @F@@@@ MAY BHD
)@@G@@E ANY VALID EDITOR ARITHMETIC EXPRESSION.  FOR EXAMPLE,     @[@@@@      HE
)@@G@@@B@@@@                              JUMP $+3    @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULDHF
)@@G@@  TRANSFER  CONTROL TO THE THIRD COMMAND AFTER THE    JUMP  ;     @#@@@@HG
)@@G@@ THE STATEMENTS   @A@@@@                            LET A=6 @A@@@@      HH
)@@G@@                      JUMP A-3@[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD  CAUSE A TRANSFERHI
)@@G@@ OF CONTROL TO LINE THREE OF THE PROCEDURE.     @[@@@@      @G@@@@      HJ
)@@G@@ LABELS ON PROCEDURE LINES ARE NOT ALLOWED.   A JUMP PAST THE     @C@@@@HK
)@@G@@ END OF A PROCEDURE CAUSES PROCEDURE EXIT, E.G. @[@@@@      @A@@@@      HL
)@@G@@                      JUMP *  @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WOULD  CAUSE  THE  EDITHM
)@@G@@OR  TO  RETURN TO THE TERMINAL FOR ITS NEXT     @G@@@@ COMMAND.    AN  AHN
)@@G@@TTEMPT TO JUMP TO A LINE PRECEDING THE FIRST WILL     @ @@@@ RESULT IN AHO
)@@G@@N ERROR MESSAGE.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@  9. 6.   TEST    @[@@@@HP
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      THE    TEST    COMMAND IS USED TO CONTROL HQ
)@@G@@THE ORDER OF EXECU-     @G@@@@ TION OF AN EDITOR PROCEDURE BY TESTING THHR
)@@G@@E RELATION BETWEEN ANY OF     @G@@@@ THE  USER VARIABLES OR INTERNAL VARHS
)@@G@@IABLES AND AN EDITOR ARITHMETIC     @C@@@@ EXPRESSION.  THE GENERAL FORMHT
)@@G@@ OF THE COMMAND IS@[@@@@      @C@@@@                    TEST <NAME><RELAHU
)@@G@@TION><EXPR> @[@@@@      @E@@@@ <NAME> IS ONE OF THE EDITOR INTERNAL VARIHV
)@@G@@ABLES (E.G.    EOF@G@@@@ OR     CHG   ),   OR  ONE OF THE SINGLE CHARACTHW
)@@G@@ER USER VARIABLES A     @G@@@@ THROUGH    J  .  <RELATION> MAY BE ONE OFHX
)@@G@@ THE FOLLOWING:  = ,    >     @E@@@@ , OR    <  .  <EXPR> IS AN EDITOR AHY
)@@G@@RITHMETIC EXPRESSION.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@      IF THE RELATION IS FALSEHZ
)@@G@@ THE NEXT EDITOR PROCEDURE COMMAND IS     @G@@@@ EXECUTED.   IF  THE RELIA
)@@G@@ATION IS TRUE THE NEXT COMMAND  IS SKIPPED.     @G@@@@ TYPICALLY  THE  NIB
)@@G@@EXT  INSTRUCTION  IS A    JUMP    COMMAND THEREBY     @G@@@@ ALLOWING COIC
)@@G@@NTROLLED LOOPS.   FOR EXAMPLE,  THE FOLLOWING PROCEDURE     @G@@@@ WILL ID
)@@G@@ DELETE  ALL  OCCURRENCES  OF     @FOR    FROM THE TEXT BEING     @]@@@@IE
)@@G@@ EDITED.    @[@@@@      @^@@@@                  F @FOR@ @@@@            IF
)@@G@@      TEST EOF=0  @^@@@@                  JUMP *@^@@@@                  IG
)@@G@@D     @ @@@@                  JUMP $-4    @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@            IH
)@@G@@  UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE                9-  6@[@@@@      II
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@  9. 7.   INPUT WITH PROMPT(IPR) <TEXT>   IJ
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     IPR    COMMAND ALLOWS THE AIK
)@@G@@UTHOR OF AN EDITOR PROCE-     @G@@@@ DURE  TO  EFFECT  A TYPE AND READ OIL
)@@G@@PERATION AT THE TERMINAL.   THE     @G@@@@ <TEXT> ON THE    IPR    IMAGEIM
)@@G@@ WILL BE PRINTED AT THE TERMINAL AS A     @G@@@@ PROMPT;  THE CARRIER WIIN
)@@G@@LL REMAIN POSITIONED AT THE END OF THE TEXT     @G@@@@ ENABLING  THE  TEIO
)@@G@@RMINAL USER TO TYPE INPUT ON THE SAME LINE.   THE     @G@@@@ INPUT  TYPEIP
)@@G@@D  BY THE TERMINAL USER WILL BE INSERTED IN THE TEXT AS     @ @@@@ PER AIQ
)@@G@@ NORMAL INPUT COMMAND.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@      ORDINARILY,  TRAILING BLIR
)@@G@@ANKS WILL BE STRIPPED FROM THE <TEXT>     @G@@@@ STRING  WHEN  IT IS PRIIS
)@@G@@NTED.   IF THE FIRST NON-BLANK CHARACTER OF     @G@@@@ <TEXT> MATCHES THIT
)@@G@@E LAST NON-BLANK CHARACTER, HOWEVER, THIS CHARAC-     @G@@@@ TER  WILL BIU
)@@G@@E INTERPRETED AS A DELIMITER,  AND ALL TEXT BETWEEN THE     @D@@@@ STARTIV
)@@G@@ING AND ENDING DELIMITER WILL BE TRANSMITTED.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@      IW
)@@G@@ THE EDITOR INTERNAL VARIABLE    EOI    WILL BE SET DEPENDING     @G@@@@IX
)@@G@@ ON THE USER'S RESPONSE TO THE THE REQUEST FOR INPUT.   IF THE USER     IY
)@@G@@@G@@@@ ENTERS  AN  @EOF  IMAGE,   THEN THE    EOF    SENTINAL (OR A BLANIZ
)@@G@@K     @G@@@@ LINE) WILL BE INSERTED INTO THE TEXT AS THE INPUT DATA, ANDJA
)@@G@@    EOI     @G@@@@ WILL  BE  SET  TO  ONE.  NORMAL DATA INPUT SETS    EOJB
)@@G@@I    TO ZERO,     @G@@@@ WHILE  AN  EXEC  8 CONTROL IMAGE OTHER THAN @EOJC
)@@G@@F SETS    EOI    TO     @[@@@@ TWO. @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@  9. 8JD
)@@G@@.   ABR <COMMAND-SPEC>  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     ABRJE
)@@G@@    COMMAND CAUSES THE SPECIFIED COMMAND TO MAGI-     @G@@@@ CALLY APPEAJF
)@@G@@R AS THE CURRENT LINE OF TEXT (AS IF THE USER HAD TYPED     @D@@@@ IT ASJG
)@@G@@ INPUT).  SPECIFICATIONS FOR    ABR    ARE:     @[@@@@      @D@@@@      JH
)@@G@@ CHG          THE LAST    CHANGE    COMMAND.    @D@@@@       LOC        JI
)@@G@@  THE LAST    LOCATE    COMMAND.    @D@@@@       MCH          THE LAST  JJ
)@@G@@  MATCH     COMMAND.    @D@@@@       FIN          THE LAST    FIND      JK
)@@G@@COMMAND.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@  9. 9.   CAD     JL
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE     CAD    COMMAND CAUSES THE CJM
)@@G@@URRENT LINE OF TEXT TO BE     @G@@@@ EXECUTED AS A COMMAND,  AS IF IT HAJN
)@@G@@D BEEN TYPED IN BY THE TERMINAL     @G@@@@ USER.    A    DELETE AND NEXTJO
)@@G@@ (DN)    COMMAND WILL BE PERFORMED TO     @G@@@@ EFFECTIVELY  REMOVE  THJP
)@@G@@E  COMMAND  LINE FROM THE TEXT BEFORE IT IS     @]@@@@ EXECUTED.  @[@@@@JQ
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM)JR
)@@G@@ - USER'S GUIDE                9-  7@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      JS
)@@G@@@ @@@@  9.10.   TRACING PROCEDURES  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      JT
)@@G@@ THE     TRACE     MODE  IS  PROVIDED  AS A DEBUGGING AID FOR     @G@@@@JU
)@@G@@ PROCEDURES.  TRACE MODE IS SET AND CLEARED BY THE    ON    AND OFF     JV
)@@G@@@]@@@@ COMMANDS.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       WHEN  THE  TRACE IS ON,  ALL JW
)@@G@@COMMANDS IN A PROCEDURE WILL BE     @G@@@@ PRINTED ON THE TERMINAL AS THJX
)@@G@@EY ARE EXECUTED.  THE LINE NUMBERS OF     @F@@@@ THE COMMANDS WITHIN THEJY
)@@G@@ PROCEDURE ARE ECHOED WITH EACH COMMAND.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@JZ
)@@G@@  9.11.   COMMENTS@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IMAGES WITH A PERKA
)@@G@@IOD-BLANK IN COLUMNS 1 AND 2 ARE TREATED AS     @G@@@@ COMMENT CARDS.  TKB
)@@G@@HEY ARE IGNORED BY THE EDITOR (BUT ARE PRINTED IN     @A@@@@ THE OUTPUT KC
)@@G@@IF    TRACE    IS ON).  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @C@@@@  9.12.   ERRORS IKD
)@@G@@N COMMANDS IN A PROCEDURE     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      IF AN KE
)@@G@@ERROR (E.G.  ILLEGAL COMMAND SYNTAX) IS DETECTED DURING     @G@@@@ THE  KF
)@@G@@PROCESSING OF A PROCEDURE,  THE BAD COMMAND WILL BE ECHOED TO     @G@@@@KG
)@@G@@ THE TERMINAL AND PROCESSING OF THE PROCEDURE WILL TERMINATE.   THE     KH
)@@G@@@G@@@@ EDITOR  WILL  WAIT  FOR  ITS  NEXT  COMMAND TO BE ENTERED FROM THKI
)@@G@@E     @]@@@@ TERMINAL.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@  9.13.   PROCEDURKJ
)@@G@@E ARGUMENTS @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IT  IS POSSIBLE TO SUPPKK
)@@G@@LY ARGUMENTS TO A PROCEDURE BY TYPING     @G@@@@ THEM ON THE    CALL    KL
)@@G@@LINE AFTER THE PROCEDURE NAME.  ON THE CALL     @G@@@@ LINE,   THESE ARGKM
)@@G@@UMENTS ARE SEPARATED FROM ONE ANOTHER BY AT LEAST     @]@@@@ ONE BLANK. KN
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       WITHIN  THE  BODY OF A DEFINED PROCEDURE,  ARGUKO
)@@G@@MENTS ARE RE-     @G@@@@ FERRED  TO  BY THE SPECIAL SYMBOLS    %1    THRKP
)@@G@@OUGH    %9    WHERE     @G@@@@ %1     CORRESPONDS  TO  THE  FIRST FIELD KQ
)@@G@@AFTER THE PROCEDURE NAME,     @G@@@@ ETC.  THE CHARACTER STRINGS ON THE KR
)@@G@@   CALL    LINE ARE SYMBOLICAL-     @G@@@@ LY  SUBSTITUTED INTO THE BODYKS
)@@G@@ OF THE PROCEDURE BEFORE IT IS EXECU-     @C@@@@ TED, REPLACING THE SPECKT
)@@G@@IAL SYMBOLS    %N    .  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE PARAMETER    %*    KU
)@@G@@IN A PROCEDURE BODY REPRESENTS 'ALL';     @G@@@@ BLANKS IN THE    CALL  KV
)@@G@@  LINE ARE IGNORED AND THE ENTIRE CALL LINE     @G@@@@ (AFTER  THE  PROCKW
)@@G@@EDURE  NAME  AND OPTIONS) REPLACES THE    %*    .     @G@@@@ THIS  ENABLKX
)@@G@@ES  ONE  TO PASS ARGUMENTS WHICH INCLUDE BLANKS SUCH AS     @G@@@@ SEARCKY
)@@G@@H  TARGETS  FOR     LOCATE     OR  PATTERNS  FOR THE    MATCH     @[@@@@KZ
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE         LA
)@@G@@       9-  8@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @]@@@@ COMMAND.   @[@@@@LB
)@@G@@      @A@@@@  9.13. 1.   CSCHAR(CSC) <CHAR>     @[@@@@      @G@@@@      LC
)@@G@@THE    CSC    COMMAND ENABLES THE USER TO REDEFINE THE CHARA-     @G@@@@LD
)@@G@@ CTER  USED TO FLAG PROCEDURE ARGUMENTS.   AS NOTED ABOVE,  THE DE-     LE
)@@G@@@G@@@@ FAULT  VALUE OF THE SO-CALLED 'CALL SUBSTITUTION CHARACTER' IS THLF
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ PERCENT  SIGN (%).   NOTE THAT STANDARD LIBRARY PROCEDURES LG
)@@G@@MAY NOT     @D@@@@ FUNCTION CORRECTLY IF THIS CHARACTER IS REDEFINED.   LH
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@  9.14.   DEFINING NEW COMMANDS     @[@@@@LI
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IT  IS NOT NECESSARY TO TYPE THE WORD    LJ
)@@G@@CALL    IN ORDER TO     @G@@@@ INVOKE  AN  EDITOR  PROCEDURE;  THE PROCELK
)@@G@@DURE NAME ALONE IS SUFFI-     @G@@@@ CIENT.    WHENEVER THE FIRST FIELD LL
)@@G@@OF AN EDITOR COMMAND IS NOT ONE     @G@@@@ OF THE PREDEFINED COMMAND NAMLM
)@@G@@ES,  THE EDITOR ASSUMES THAT A PROCE-     @G@@@@ DURE  OF  THAT  NAME  ILN
)@@G@@S  BEING INVOKED;  IT WILL THEN SEARCH MASS     @G@@@@ STORAGE  FOR A PRLO
)@@G@@OCEDURE BY THAT NAME AND,  IF NO SUCH PROEDURE IS     @G@@@@ FOUND,  GIVLP
)@@G@@E AN    UNKNOWN COMMAND    DIAGNOSTIC.   IF THE COMMAND     @G@@@@ NAME LQ
)@@G@@ WAS TYPED IN FILE.ELEMENT NOTATION,  ONLY THE SPECIFIED FILE     @G@@@@LR
)@@G@@ IS  SEARCHED.   OTHERWISE,  THE EDITOR SEARCHES FOR THE COMMAND IN     LS
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE TPF$ FOR THE RUN AND THEN THE SYSTEM LIBRARY (SYS$*RLIB$).  ILT
)@@G@@N     @G@@@@ ADDITION,   IF  THERE  IS A FILE ASSIGNED TO THE RUN WHOSE LU
)@@G@@NAME IS     @G@@@@ ED$PF  (OR  IF  A @USE RELATION FOR ED$PF EXISTS),  TLV
)@@G@@HEN THE ED$PF     @G@@@@ FILE  WILL  BE  ASIGNED (IF NECESSARY) AND SEARLW
)@@G@@CHED AFTER TPF$ BUT     @#@@@@ BEFORE RLIB$.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      LX
)@@G@@@A@@@@  9.15.   EXAMPLES OF PROCEDURES    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@LY
)@@G@@      THE USER OF EDITOR PROCEDURES IS ADVISED TO USE THE POCEDURES     LZ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ IN  THE LIBRARY (SYS$*LIB$) AS MODELS FOR CONSTRUCTING PROCEDURESMA
)@@G@@.     @D@@@@ THESE PROCEDURES ARE DEFINED IN THE NEXT CHAPTER.    @[@@@@MB
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE         MC
)@@G@@      10-  1@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@ 10.   LIBRARY PROMD
)@@G@@CEDURES     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       SEVERAL EDIME
)@@G@@TOR PROCEDURES HAVE BEEN PREDEFINED AND ARE AVAI-     @G@@@@ LABLE IN THMF
)@@G@@E SYSTEM LIBRARY (SYS$*RLIB$).  FOR THE MOST PART, THEY     @G@@@@ MAY  MG
)@@G@@BE USED AS IF THEY WERE BUILT-IN COMMANDS.   BECAUSE THEY ARE     @E@@@@MH
)@@G@@ PROCEDURES, SOME SPECIAL CONSIDERATIONS APPLY TO THEIR USE:@[@@@@      MI
)@@G@@@G@@@@   (1)  ELEMENTS  IN TPF$ WHOSE NAMES ARE THE SAME AS THE PROCEDURMJ
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@        NAMES  WILL  BE  USED  AS  PROCEDURES  IN PREFERENCEMK
)@@G@@ TO THE     @G@@@@        LIBRARY  COPIES.    THE  EDITOR  SEARCHES THE ML
)@@G@@LIBRARY FOR A     @E@@@@        PROCEDURE ONLY WHEN IT CANNOT FIND IT ANMM
)@@G@@YWHERE ELSE.@G@@@@   (2)  THE  EXECUTION  TIME  OF  THE PROCEDURES MAY BMN
)@@G@@E LONGER THAN     @^@@@@        NORMAL COMMANDS.@G@@@@   (3)  SOME PROCEMO
)@@G@@DURES USE THE EDITOR VARIABLES INTERNALLY,  HENCE     @D@@@@        THE MP
)@@G@@VALUES OF THESE VARIABLES MAY CHANGE.     @G@@@@   (4)  LIKE  ALL  PROCEMQ
)@@G@@DURES,   THE  LIBRARY PROCEDURES CHANGE THE     @G@@@@        CONTENTS  MR
)@@G@@OF  THE 'CALL' BUFFER.   HENCE A    CA    COMMAND     @G@@@@        AFTEMS
)@@G@@R  PROCEDURE  EXECUTION WILL CAUSE THAT PROCEDURE TO BE     @^@@@@      MT
)@@G@@  RE-EXECUTED.    @G@@@@   (5)  IF ONE OF YOUR OWN PROCEDURES USES A LIBMU
)@@G@@RARY PROCEDURE,  IT     @G@@@@        MAY  NOT  TERMINATE CORRECTLY.   TMV
)@@G@@HE LIBRARY PROCEDURE WILL     @G@@@@        EXIT BACK TO THE DESK CALCULMW
)@@G@@ATOR MODE, POSSIBLY CAUSING THE     @E@@@@        LAST LINES OF THE USERMX
)@@G@@ PROCEDURE TO BE IGNORED.     @G@@@@   (6)  LEADING  N'S  AND  Q'S ARE CMY
)@@G@@ONSIDERED PART OF THE PROCEDURE     @G@@@@        NAME  INSTEAD  OF  BEIMZ
)@@G@@NG USED TO ESTABLISH TEMPORARY NUM OR     @^@@@@        QUICK MODES.    NA
)@@G@@@G@@@@   (7)  ABBREVIATIONS ARE NOT APPLICABLE; THE ENTIRE PROCEDURE NAMNB
)@@G@@E     @C@@@@        MUST BE ENTERED WHEN USED AS A COMMAND. @G@@@@   (8)NC
)@@G@@  SOME  PROCEDURES  MAY  CHANGE  MASK  CHARACTERS SUCH AS THE     @ @@@@ND
)@@G@@        EXCHANGE CHARACTER.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WHERE  A  PROCEDURE  CHNE
)@@G@@ANGES  EDITOR VARIABLES OR MASK CHARACTERS,     @F@@@@ THAT FACT IS NOTENF
)@@G@@D BELOW IN THE DESCRIPTION OF THE PROCEDURE.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      NG
)@@G@@@ @@@@ 10. 1.   DITTO <START> <END> @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      NH
)@@G@@ ALL  LINES  FROM  <START>  THROUGH <END> ARE INSERTED AT THE     @G@@@@NI
)@@G@@ PRESENT WINDOW POSITION.  THE ORIGINAL IMAGES ARE NOT DELETED.  IF     NJ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ ONLY ONE PARAMETER IS GIVEN,  THAT SINGLE LINE IS INSERTED.  SINCNK
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ THE  LINE  NUMBERS  USED MUST BE THE 'CURRENT' LINE NUMBERSNL
)@@G@@ (WHICH     @G@@@@ ARE OFTEN UNKNOWN),  THIS COMMAND MUST BE USED WITH CNM
)@@G@@AUTION; IT IS     @G@@@@ RECOMMENDED THAT THE    BEGIN ,  COPY    AND   NN
)@@G@@ ADD    COMMANDS BE     @#@@@@ USED INSTEAD.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      NO
)@@G@@THE  DITTO  PROCEDURE USES THE EDITOR VARIABLES A AND B, SETS     @G@@@@NP
)@@G@@ THE BEGIN MARKER, TURNS BRIEF MODE OFF, AND CHANGES THE LAST MATCH     NQ
)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE   NR
)@@G@@            10-  2@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@ COMMAND BUFNS
)@@G@@FER.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@ 10. 2.   MOVE <START> <END>  @[@@@@NT
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      THIS PROCEDURE IS IDENTICAL TO    DITTO   NU
)@@G@@ ,  EXCEPT THAT THE     @G@@@@ IMAGES  MOVED ARE THEN DELETED FROM THEIRNV
)@@G@@ ORIGINAL POSITION IN THE     @G@@@@ TEXT.    THE  PREFERRED  ALTERNATIVNW
)@@G@@E  TO  THIS  COMMAND  IS TO USE     @A@@@@ BEGIN  ,  DCOPY    AND    ADDNX
)@@G@@    . @[@@@@      @G@@@@      THE  MOVE  PROCEDURE USES THE EDITOR VARIANY
)@@G@@BLES A AND B,  SETS     @G@@@@ THE BEGIN MARKER, TURNS BRIEF MODE OFF, ANZ
)@@G@@ND CHANGES THE LAST MATCH     @#@@@@ COMMAND BUFFER.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@OA
)@@G@@      @ @@@@ 10. 3.   PUNCH  <START> <END>@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@OB
)@@G@@       THIS  PROCEDURE IS USED TO PUNCH PAPER TAPE ON APPROPRIATELY     OC
)@@G@@@F@@@@ EQUIPPED TERMINALS.  WHEN THE PROCEDURE IS EXECUTED, THE MESSAGE OD
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @A@@@@                      TURN ON PUNCH @[@@@@      @G@@@@OE
)@@G@@ IS DISPLAYED.   A SHORT WAIT FOLLOWS,  GIVING ONE TIME TO TURN THE     OF
)@@G@@@G@@@@ APROPRIATE  DEVICE ON AND MANUALLY CREATE AN APPROPRIATE LEADER OOG
)@@G@@F     @G@@@@ RUBOUTS.  AFTER THE DELAY, ALL LINES FROM <START> TO <END> OH
)@@G@@WILL BE     @G@@@@ PRINTED AND PUNCHED.  ANOTHER PAUSE AT THE END ENABLEOI
)@@G@@S THE USER TO     @^@@@@ TURN THE PUNCH OFF.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      OJ
)@@G@@IF ONLY ONE SPECIFICATION IS GIVEN, THAT NUMBER OF LINES WILL     @G@@@@OK
)@@G@@ BE  OUTPUT,  STARTING FROM THE CURRENT LINE.   THE PUNCH PROCEDURE     OL
)@@G@@@F@@@@ USES THE EDITOR VARIABLES A AND B, AND TURNS BRIEF MODE OFF.     OM
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ 10. 4.   CPUNCH  <START> <END>     @[@@@@ON
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THIS  PROCEDURE  GENERATES  A CARD DECK TOO
)@@G@@O BE PUNCHED ON THE     @G@@@@ ONSITE  CARD PUNCH.   THE FIELDS ARE AS FOP
)@@G@@OR <PUNCH>.   THE COMMAND     @G@@@@ WILL  SOLICIT  A MESSAGE TO BE DISPOQ
)@@G@@LAYED ON THE OPERATOR'S CONSOLE     @B@@@@ PRIOR TO THE ACTUAL PUNCHING OR
)@@G@@BY TYPING   @[@@@@      @A@@@@                             MSG?   @[@@@@OS
)@@G@@      @G@@@@ THIS  MESSAGE  SHOULD  IDENTIFY  HOW  THE  PUNCHED OUTPUT IOT
)@@G@@S TO BE     @B@@@@ HANDLED (E.G.  WHO SHOULD RECEIVE IT).   @[@@@@      OU
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @ @@@@ 10. 5.   SITE  <START> <END> @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@      OV
)@@G@@        UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE               10-  3@[@@@@OW
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THIS OX
)@@G@@ PROCEDURE  DIRECTS  OUTPUT  TO AN ONSITE PRINTER;  THE     @G@@@@ SYNTAOY
)@@G@@X  IS  IDENTICAL  TO  THAT  OF    PUNCH    .     SITE    WILL     @G@@@@OZ
)@@G@@ SOLICIT  A  HEADING  FOR THE OUTPUT (BY TYPING    HDG?     ) AND A     PA
)@@G@@@D@@@@ MESSAGE FOR THE OPERATOR (BY TYPING    MSG?    ).    @[@@@@      PB
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @ @@@@ 10. 6.   NSITE  <START> <END>@[@@@@      @[@@@@      PC
)@@G@@@G@@@@       IDENTICAL TO    SITE    ,  EXCEPT THAT THE LINES OUTPUT WILPD
)@@G@@L     @A@@@@ BE PRECEDED BY THEIR LINE NUMBERS. @[@@@@      @[@@@@      PE
)@@G@@@#@@@@ 10. 7.   DOC     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      PF
)@@G@@@^@@@@ 10. 8.   DTL  <STRING> @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  PG
)@@G@@   DTL    (DELETE THROUGH LOCATE) PROCEDURE DELETES ALL     @G@@@@ LINESPH
)@@G@@  FROM  THE CURRENT WINDOW POSITION DOWNWARD UNTIL IT LOCATES     @G@@@@PI
)@@G@@ AN  IMAGE WHICH MATCHES <STRING>.   THE LOCATED IMAGE IS NOT DELE-     PJ
)@@G@@@D@@@@ TED.  THE DTL PROCEDURE CHANGES THE BEGIN MARKER.    @[@@@@      PK
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @^@@@@ 10. 9.   DTF  <STRING> @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@PL
)@@G@@       THE     DTF     (DELETE  THROUGH FIND) PROCEDURE DELETES ALL     PM
)@@G@@@G@@@@ LINES  FROM  THE  CURRENT  WINDOW POSITION UNTIL IT    FINDS    APN
)@@G@@N     @G@@@@ IMAGE  WHICH  MATCHES  <STRING>.   THE FOUND IMAGE IS NOT DPO
)@@G@@ELETED.     @C@@@@ THE DTF PROCEDURE CHANGES THE BEGIN MARKER.    @[@@@@PP
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@ 10.10.   PTL  <STRING> @[@@@@      @[@@@@      PQ
)@@G@@@G@@@@       THE     PTL     (PRINT  THROUGH LOCATE) PROCEDURE PRINTS ALPR
)@@G@@L     @G@@@@ IMAGES  FROM THE CURRENT WINDOW POSITION DOWNWARD UNTIL IT PS
)@@G@@LOCATES     @G@@@@ AN  IMAGE  WHICH  MATCHES  <STRING>.    THE PTL PROCEPT
)@@G@@DURE USES THE     @D@@@@ EDITOR VARIABLES A AND B, AND TURNS BRIEF MODE PU
)@@G@@OFF.  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@ 10.11.   PTF  <STRING> @[@@@@      PV
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USEPW
)@@G@@R'S GUIDE               10-  4@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@PX
)@@G@@       THE     PTF     (PRINT  THROUGH  FIND)  PROCEDURE PRINTS ALL     PY
)@@G@@@G@@@@ IMAGES FROM THE CURRENT WINDOW POSITION DOWNWARD UNTIL IT    FINDPZ
)@@G@@S     @G@@@@ AN  IMAGE  WHICH  MATCHES  <STRING>.    THE PTF PROCEDURE UQA
)@@G@@SES THE     @D@@@@ EDITOR VARIABLES A AND B, AND TURNS BRIEF MODE OFF.  QB
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@ 10.12.   LB  <STRING>  @[@@@@      @[@@@@QC
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       THE    LB    (LOCATE BACKWARD) PROCEDURE IS IDENTICALQD
)@@G@@ TO THE     @G@@@@ LOCATE     COMMAND  EXCEPT THAT IT SEARCHES UPWARD INQE
)@@G@@ THE TEXT FOR     @G@@@@ AN APPROPRIATE IMAGE.   THE LB PROCEDURE USES TQF
)@@G@@HE EDITOR VARIABLES     @B@@@@ A, B, AND C, AND TURNS BRIEF MODE OFF.   QG
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@ 10.13.   FB  <STRING>  @[@@@@      @[@@@@QH
)@@G@@      @G@@@@       THE     FB     (FIND BACKWARD) PROCEDURE IS IDENTICALQI
)@@G@@ TO THE     @G@@@@ FIND     COMMAND EXCEPT THAT IT SEARCHES UPWARD IN THQJ
)@@G@@E TEXT FOR AN     @G@@@@ APPROPRIATE  IMAGE.  THE FB PROCEDURE USES THE QK
)@@G@@EDITOR VARIABLES A,     @A@@@@ B, AND C, AND TURNS BRIEF MODE OFF.@[@@@@QL
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE         QM
)@@G@@      11-  1@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@ 11.   ASCII EDITIQN
)@@G@@NG    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@QO
)@@G@@ 11. 1.   GENERAL @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE UOM  @EDM  PRQP
)@@G@@OCESSOR ENABLES THE USER TO EDIT FULL ASCII     @G@@@@ FILES  REGARDLESSQQ
)@@G@@  OF  WHETHER  THE  TERMINAL  BEING USED HAS FULL     @G@@@@ UPPER-LOWERQR
)@@G@@  CASE  CAPABILITY  OR  NOT.    TWO OPTIONS ARE USED TO     @G@@@@ CONTRQS
)@@G@@OL  THE CODES USED (FIELDATA OR ASCII),  THEY ARE    P    AND     @]@@@@QT
)@@G@@ Q    .     @[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  Q-OPTION CONDITIONS THE EDITORQU
)@@G@@ TO ACCEPT BOTH UPPER AND     @G@@@@ LOWER  CASE INPUT,  WHILE NO Q-OPTIQV
)@@G@@ON INDICATES THE TERMINAL INPUT     @G@@@@ IS  TO BE TREATED AS MONOCASEQW
)@@G@@.   NOTE THAT IF THE EDITOR IS IN THE     @G@@@@ MONOCASE MODE,  INPUT FQX
)@@G@@ROM A TERMINAL WILL BE 'FOLDED' (SEE BELOW)     @G@@@@ ONTO  THE  FIELDAQY
)@@G@@TA  SET  EVEN IF THE TERMINAL ITSELF CAN GENERATE     @ @@@@ BOTH UPPER QZ
)@@G@@AND LOWER CASE.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@       NORMALLY,   THE  FINAL OUTPUTRA
)@@G@@ OF THE EDITOR WILL BE THE SAME     @G@@@@ MODE  AS  THAT  OF  THE  TERMRB
)@@G@@INAL,  E.G.   IF THE Q-OPTION IS USED     @G@@@@ (INDICATING  THAT  THE RC
)@@G@@ TERMINAL  HAS UPPER-LOWER CASE) THE OUTPUT     @G@@@@ WOULD BE UPPER ANRD
)@@G@@D LOWER CASE FULL ASCII.   THE P-OPTION INDICATES     @G@@@@ THAT  A  CORE
)@@G@@DE TRANSLATION OF THE OUTPUT ELEMENT SHOULD TAKE PLACE.     @]@@@@ FOR ERF
)@@G@@XAMPLE@[@@@@      @ @@@@                   @EDM,P     @[@@@@      @G@@@@RG
)@@G@@ INDICATES THAT THE TERMINAL IS MONOCASE,  BUT THE OUTPUT SHOULD BE     RH
)@@G@@@A@@@@ TRANSLATED TO FULL ASCII, WHILE    @[@@@@      @ @@@@            RI
)@@G@@       @EDM,QP    @[@@@@      @G@@@@ INDICATES  THAT  THE  TERMINAL  MAYRJ
)@@G@@  GENERATE BOTH UPPER AND LOWER     @B@@@@ CASE, BUT THE OUTPUT SHOULD BRK
)@@G@@E FIELDATA. @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@ 11. 2.   CODE TRANSLATION    RL
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       REGARDLESS  OF THE CODE OF THE FINARM
)@@G@@L EDITOR OUTPUT,  EDITING     @G@@@@ TAKES  PLACE IN THE CODE SPECIFIED RN
)@@G@@BY THE TERMINAL,  I.E.   IF THE     @G@@@@ TERMINAL  IS  MONOCASE,   EDIRO
)@@G@@TING TAKES PLACE IN FIELDATA;  IF THE     @G@@@@ TERMINAL  IS FULL ASCIIRP
)@@G@@,  EDITING TAKES PLACE IN FULL ASCII.   THE     @G@@@@ EDITOR  AUTOMATICRQ
)@@G@@ALLY  TAKES  CARE  OF  CODE TRANSLATIONS BOTH FOR     @G@@@@ INPUT  (EITRR
)@@G@@HER  SOURCE  OR INCLUDED VIA THE    ADD    COMMAND) AND     @G@@@@ OUTPURS
)@@G@@T (NORMAL OR GENERATED BY THE    COPY    COMMAND).  TWO TYPES     @[@@@@RT
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE         RU
)@@G@@      11-  2@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ OF CODE TRANSLATIRV
)@@G@@ON CAN OCCUR, CASE-PRESERVING OR NON-CASE PRESER-     @#@@@@ VING (FOLDIRW
)@@G@@NG).  @[@@@@      @^@@@@ 11. 2. 1.   FOLDING    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      RX
)@@G@@ IF CODE TRANSLATION IS DONE BY FOLDING,  THE UPPER AND LOWER     @G@@@@RY
)@@G@@ CASE PROPERTIES OF ASCII DATA ARE LOST.   THE UPPER QUARTER OF THE     RZ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ ASCII  CODE  TABLE  (CONTAINING  THE  LOWER  CASE  CHARACTERS)  ISA
)@@G@@S     @G@@@@ 'FOLDED' OVER THE THIRD QUARTER OF THE TABLE.  CONSEQUENTLYSB
)@@G@@, UPPER     @G@@@@ AND  LOWER CASE ASCII ALPHABETICS BECOME UPPER CASE FSC
)@@G@@IELDATA,  AND     @G@@@@ FIELDATA ALPHABETICS TRANSLATE INTO UPPER CASE SD
)@@G@@ASCII.   FOLDING IS     @E@@@@ THE METHOD GENERALLY USED BY THE EXEC 8 SSE
)@@G@@YSTEM ITSELF.     @[@@@@      @B@@@@ 11. 2. 2.   CASE-PRESERVING TRANSLASF
)@@G@@TION  @[@@@@      @G@@@@      IN THE CASE-PRESERVING TRANSLATION,  THE USG
)@@G@@PPER AND LOWER CASE     @G@@@@ PROPERTIES  OF  AN  ASCII ELEMENT ARE RETSH
)@@G@@AINED WHEN THE ELEMENT IS     @G@@@@ TRANSLATED  TO FIELDATA BY THE INSESI
)@@G@@RTION OF EXTRA FIELDATA CHARAC-     @G@@@@ TERS  WHICH  INDICATE  CASE SSJ
)@@G@@WITCHES.   WHEN A FIELDATA ELEMENT IS     @G@@@@ CONVERTED TO ASCII,  THSK
)@@G@@ESE CHARACTERS ARE USED TO RE-CONSTRUCT THE     @E@@@@ ORIGINAL TEXT.  TSL
)@@G@@HE TRANSLATION SCHEME IS THE FOLLOWING:   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @F@@@@SM
)@@G@@    ............................................................  @F@@@@SN
)@@G@@    :     ASCII                    :    FIELDATA               :  @F@@@@SO
)@@G@@    :..............................:...........................:  @F@@@@SP
)@@G@@    :                              :                           :  @F@@@@SQ
)@@G@@    :  ALL CONTROL CODES           :      ?                    :  @F@@@@SR
)@@G@@    :     EXCEPT BACKSPACE         :                           :  @F@@@@SS
)@@G@@    :                              :                           :  @F@@@@ST
)@@G@@    :  SPACE  "  $  (  )  *        : THE SAME GRAPHICS, SHIFT  :  @F@@@@SU
)@@G@@    :     +  ,  -  .  /  :         :     INDEPENDENT           :  @F@@@@SV
)@@G@@    :     ;  <  =  >               :                           :  @F@@@@SW
)@@G@@    :     AND ALL DIGITS           :                           :  @F@@@@SX
)@@G@@    :                              :                           :  @F@@@@SY
)@@G@@    :  @, LOWER CASE A-Z, [,       : @, A-Z, [, \, ],          :  @F@@@@SZ
)@@G@@    :     \, ], CIRCUMFLEX         :    ^ (UNSHIFTED)          :  @F@@@@TA
)@@G@@    :                              :                           :  @F@@@@TB
)@@G@@    :  GRAVE ACCENT, UPPER-        : @, A-Z, [, \, ],          :  @F@@@@TC
)@@G@@    :     CASE A-Z, LEFT           :    ^ (SHIFTED)            :  @F@@@@TD
)@@G@@    :     BRACE, OR, RIGHT         :                           :  @F@@@@TE
)@@G@@    :     BRACE, NOT               :                           :  @F@@@@TF
)@@G@@    :..............................:...........................:  @[@@@@TG
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       SIX OF THE ASCII CHARACTERS HTH
)@@G@@AVE SPECIAL SIGNIFICANCE IN THE     @G@@@@ TRANSLATION AND ARE USED AS CTI
)@@G@@ONTROLS WHEN THEY APPEAR ALONE.  WHEN     @G@@@@ THESE CHARACTERS ARE TOTJ
)@@G@@ REPRESENT THEMSELVES, THEY ARE PRECEDED BY     @G@@@@ A (SINGLE) QUOTATTK
)@@G@@ION MARK.   THESE CHARACTERS (AND THEIR INTERPRE-     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@TL
)@@G@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE               11-  3TM
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ TATION IN FIELDATA IMAGES) ARTN
)@@G@@E:    @[@@@@      @A@@@@     !                  BACKSPACE   @B@@@@     %TO
)@@G@@                  ASCII UNDERLINE   @G@@@@     ?                  ASCII TP
)@@G@@ CONTROL  CODE  OTHER  THAN UNDERLINE     @G@@@@                        TQ
)@@G@@     (BECOMES  AN ASCII BELL IN FIELDATA TO     @C@@@@                  TR
)@@G@@           ASCII CONVERSION). @G@@@@     #                  MULTI-CHARACTS
)@@G@@TER  CASE SWITCH.   CHANGES THE     @G@@@@                             NTT
)@@G@@ORMAL  CASE  OF  THE REMAINDER OF THE     @A@@@@                        TU
)@@G@@     IMAGE. @G@@@@     &                  SINGLE-CHARACTER  CASE SWITCH.TV
)@@G@@   THE SINGLE     @G@@@@                             CHARACTER     WHICHTW
)@@G@@     FOLLOWS     IS     @G@@@@                             CASE-REVERSEDTX
)@@G@@  FROM THE NORMAL MODE OF     @G@@@@                             THE IMATY
)@@G@@GE (ESTABLISHED BY THE LAST #).     @G@@@@     '                  PREFIXTZ
)@@G@@  FOR  OTHER CONTROLS INDICATING THEY     @G@@@@                        UA
)@@G@@     REPRESENT THEMSELVES.   FOR EXAMPLE, A     @G@@@@                  UB
)@@G@@           NUMBER  SIGN (#) IS TRANSLATED AS '# ,     @D@@@@            UC
)@@G@@                 AND AN AMPERSAND IS '&  .@[@@@@      @G@@@@      IN THEUD
)@@G@@ CASE-PRESERVING TRANSLATION, ALL IMAGES ARE ASSUMED TO     @G@@@@ STARTUE
)@@G@@ UNSHIFTED (I.E.   ALPHABETICS ARE LOWER CASE).   EACH NUMBER     @G@@@@UF
)@@G@@ SIGN  (#) CAUSES A SWITCH OF THE PREVIOUS MODE OF THE GIVEN IMAGE.     UG
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @A@@@@ 11. 2. 3.   TRANSLATION SUMMARY    @[@@@@      @G@@@@UH
)@@G@@       REGARDLESS  OF  THE CODES OF THE INPUTS OR OUTPUTS,  EDITING     UI
)@@G@@@G@@@@ TAKES  PLACE IN THE MODE OF THE TERMINAL;  CODE TRANSLATIONS OCCUUJ
)@@G@@R     @G@@@@ WHEN THE INPUT IS INITIALLY ACCEPTED AND WHEN THE OUTPUT ISUK
)@@G@@ FINAL-     @G@@@@ LY  WRITTEN.   IF THE TERMINAL IS MONOCASE AND THE OUUL
)@@G@@TPUT IS TO BE     @G@@@@ ASCII,  THEN ALL CONVERSIONS ARE CASE PRESERVINUM
)@@G@@G.   OTHERWISE, ALL     @A@@@@ CONVERSIONS ARE DONE BY FOLDING.   @[@@@@UN
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ ...............................................UO
)@@G@@...................     @G@@@@ : TERMINAL MODE :INPUT : INPUT :EDITING: UP
