)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @^@@@@ 11. 3.   Q-MODE EDITING@[@@@@VF
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       WHEN THE Q-OPTION IS SPECIFIED,  THE EDITVG
)@@G@@OR WILL ACCEPT FULL     @G@@@@ ASCII  INPUT FROM THE TERMINAL.   THE AVAVH
)@@G@@ILABILITY OF THIS FEATURE     @G@@@@ IS EXEC-DEPENDENT.   ON LEVEL 27 ANVI
)@@G@@D EARLIER SYSTEMS, THE UOM FULL     @G@@@@ ASCII  CHANGES  MUST HAVE BEEVJ
)@@G@@N INSTALLED.   IN LEVEL 30 AND HIGHER     @G@@@@ SYSTEMS,  THE AREAD$ CAVK
)@@G@@PABILITY OF EXEC 8 WILL BE USED, BUT EDITOR     @G@@@@ SUPPORT  FOR THISVL
)@@G@@ FEATURE HAS NOT YET BEEN IMPLEMENTED.   THE DIS-     @G@@@@ CUSSIONS  BVM
)@@G@@ELOW  APPLY  TO EXEC 8 LEVELS 27 AND BELOW IN WHICH THE     @C@@@@ UOM FVN
)@@G@@ULL ASCII FEATURE HAS BEEN IMPLEMENTED.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@      SIGNONVO
)@@G@@ TO THE EDITOR IN FULL ASCII MODE IS EFFECTED BY TYPING     @^@@@@ THE QVP
)@@G@@-OPTION, E.G.     @[@@@@      @B@@@@                       @EDM,Q  <NAMEVQ
)@@G@@>     @[@@@@      @G@@@@ THE  EDITOR WILL THEN REQUEST THAT YOU INFORM TVR
)@@G@@HE EXEC 8 SYSTEM OF     @D@@@@ YOUR INTENTION TO USE FULL ASCII BY TYPINVS
)@@G@@G THE IMAGE @[@@@@      @A@@@@                       @TABSET,A    @[@@@@VT
)@@G@@      @G@@@@ AND  TRANSMITTING THE ASCII SHIFT OUT (CONTROL N) CHARACTERVU
)@@G@@.   (IF     @G@@@@ @TABSET,A HAS ALREADY BEEN DONE, ONLY SHIFTOUT IS NECVV
)@@G@@ESSARY).  ONE     @G@@@@ THEN  PROCEEDS TO USE THE EDITOR IN THE NORMAL VW
)@@G@@FASHION (EXCEPT FOR     @G@@@@ INPUT LINE EDITING, SEE BELOW).  TERMINATVX
)@@G@@ION OF THE EDITOR MUST BE     @ @@@@ BY EXPLICIT COMMAND, EITHER  @[@@@@VY
)@@G@@      @C@@@@               EXIT           OR         ABORT  @[@@@@      VZ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ AS  IMAGES WITH @-SIGNS IN COLUMN 1 WILL NOT BE RECOGNIZED AS EXEWA
)@@G@@C     @G@@@@ 8 CONTROL CARDS.   ONCE THE EDITOR HAS TERMINATED,  ONE MUSWB
)@@G@@T ENTER     @G@@@@ THE  ASCII  CHARACTER SHIFT-IN (CONTROL-O) TO LEAVE AWC
)@@G@@SCII MODE AND     @G@@@@ REESTABLISH NORMAL COMMUNICATION WITH THE SYSTEWD
)@@G@@M.   IF THIS IS NOT     @#@@@@ DONE, THE MESSAGE@[@@@@      @B@@@@      WE
)@@G@@      DATA IGNORED IN CONTROL MODE  @[@@@@      @G@@@@ WILL  BE PRINTED WF
)@@G@@AND EXEC 8 CONTROL IMAGES WILL NOT BE RECOGNIZED.     @G@@@@ NOTE:   ASCWG
)@@G@@II EDITING DEPENDS UPON UOM CHANGES TO THE EXEC 8 TELE-     @D@@@@ TYPE WH
)@@G@@HANDLER AND MAY NOT BE AVAILABLE AT OTHER SITES.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      WI
)@@G@@@^@@@@ 11. 4.   LINE EDITING  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      WHEN OWJ
)@@G@@PERATING IN THE FULL ASCII MODE,  THE USUAL CONVENTIONS     @G@@@@ FOR  WK
)@@G@@LINE  DELETE (QUESTION MARK) AND CHARACTER DELETE (BACKARROW)     @G@@@@WL
)@@G@@ ARE  NOT  EFFECTIVE.    THE EDITOR ADHERES TO WHAT IS KNOWN AS THE     WM
)@@G@@@G@@@@ 'RULE OF VISUAL FIDELITY'.  THIS RULE STATES THAT THE IMAGE ACCEPWN
)@@G@@-     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUWO
)@@G@@IDE               11-  5@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ TED  WP
)@@G@@BY  THE  EDITOR  IS INPUT AS IT IS SEEN BY THE TERMINAL USER,     @G@@@@WQ
)@@G@@ REGARDLESS OF THE ORDER IN WHICH HE MAY HAVE CONSTRUCTED THE LINE.     WR
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE SPACE BAR AND THE ASCII BACKSPACE CHARACTER MAY BE FREELY USEWS
)@@G@@D     @G@@@@ TO  POSITION THE PRINTING ELEMENT OR CURSOR OF THE TERMINALWT
)@@G@@ TO THE     @G@@@@ RIGHT  OR LEFT.   SPACES OR BACKSPACES GENERATED TO MWU
)@@G@@OVE THE PRINT     @G@@@@ ELEMENT  WILL  NOT  BECOME  PART  OF THE IMAGE WV
)@@G@@UNLESS NECESSARY TO     @G@@@@ PRESERVE  THE  ACTUAL APPEARANCE OF THE LWW
)@@G@@INE.   CONSEQUENTLY IT IS     @G@@@@ POSSIBLE TO CONTRUCT AN IMAGE BY SPWX
)@@G@@ACING TO THE FAR RIGHT,  TYPING     @G@@@@ SOME INPUT, BACKSPACING TO THWY
)@@G@@E LEFT AND TYPING SOME MORE, AND THEN     @G@@@@ HITTING THE RETURN KEY.WZ
)@@G@@   THE LINE WILL BE INTERNALLY STORED AS IT     @ @@@@ APPEARED AT THE TXA
)@@G@@ERMINAL.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      ERASURE OF ALL OR PART OF A LINE BEFXB
)@@G@@ORE IT HAS BEEN COMPLETED     @G@@@@ IS EFFECTED THROUGH THE USE OF THE XC
)@@G@@'LINE FEED' KEY.   POSITION THE     @G@@@@ CARRIER  TO  THE  POINT  OF  XD
)@@G@@THE ERROR USING SPACE OR BACKSPACE AS     @G@@@@ NEEDED,  AND HIT 'LINE XE
)@@G@@FEED'.  ALL CHARACTERS FROM THE POSITION OF     @G@@@@ THE  LINE  FEED  XF
)@@G@@TO THE END OF THE IMAGE WILL THEN BE ERASED.   AN     @E@@@@ ENTIRE LINEXG
)@@G@@ IS DELETED BY DOING A LINE FEED IN COLUMN 1.   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      XH
)@@G@@@^@@@@ 11. 5.   OVERSTRIKING  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       ARBITXI
)@@G@@RARY  OVERSTRIKES ARE ALLOWED BY THE EDITOR;  IT IS NOT     @G@@@@ RESRIXJ
)@@G@@CTED  TO  (FOR EXAMPLE) UNDERLINES.   OVERSTRIKES ARE HANDLED     @G@@@@XK
)@@G@@ INTERNALLY IN SUCH A WAY AS TO MAKE THE ORDER IN WHICH THE CHARAC-     XL
)@@G@@@G@@@@ TERS  OF  AN  OVERSTRIKE  WERE TYPED IRRELEVANT.   THUS THE LOCATXM
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ AND     CHANGE     COMMANDS  MAY BE USED TO FIND IMAGES CONXN
)@@G@@TAINING     @G@@@@ OVERSTRIKES  WITHOUT  REGARD  TO  THE MANNER IN WHICHXO
)@@G@@ THESE IMAGES     @G@@@@ WERE ORIGINALLY TYPED.   (NOTE:  AT THE PRESENTXP
)@@G@@ TIME, THIS FEATURE     @G@@@@ IS  EFFECTIVE  ONLY  IF  THE  ORIGINAL  TXQ
)@@G@@EXT WAS INPUT THROUGH THE     @G@@@@ EDITOR.    LOCATE     AND     CHANGXR
)@@G@@E     MAY FAIL TO LOCATE IMAGES     @G@@@@ CONTAINING  OVERSTRIKES  WHICXS
)@@G@@H  WERE ORIGINALLY CREATED BY ANOTHER     @G@@@@ PROCESSOR.)   WHEN OVERXT
)@@G@@STRIKES ARE USED,  THE MAXIMUM LENGTH OF AN     @G@@@@ IMAGE  IS RESTRICXU
)@@G@@TED.   IMAGES CONTAINING NO OVERSTRIKES MAY BE UP     @G@@@@ TO  132 CHAXV
)@@G@@RACTERS LONG.   IMAGES IN WHICH EACH PRINT POSITION HAS     @G@@@@ BEEN XW
)@@G@@ OVERSTRUCK ONCE (FOR EXAMPLE A LINE OF TEXT ALL POSITIONS OF     @G@@@@XX
)@@G@@ WHICH  ARE  UNDERLINED)  WILL BE TRUNCATED AT ABOUT FORTY COLUMNS.     XY
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE  EXACT  POINT  AT WHICH AN IMAGE IS TRUNCATED DEPENDS UPON THXZ
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ NUMBER  OF  COLUMNS WHICH ARE OVERSTRUCK AND THE NUMBER OF YA
)@@G@@CHARAC-     @A@@@@ TERS OVERSTRUCK AT EACH POSITION.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@YB
)@@G@@       EXTREME CAUTION SHOULD BE USED WHEN DOING GLOBAL    CHANGE'S     YC
)@@G@@@G@@@@ OF  A  SINGLE  CHARACTER.   THE    CHANGE    COMMAND WILL CHANGE YD
)@@G@@A     @G@@@@ SINGLE CHARACTER EVEN THOUGH IT MAY BE PART OF AN OVERSTRIKYE
)@@G@@E.  THE     @G@@@@ DELETION  OF  A SINGLE CHARACTER THROUGH A GLOBAL    YF
)@@G@@CHANGE    CAN     @G@@@@ RESULT  IN GARBLING OF LINES IN WHICH THAT CHARYG
)@@G@@ACTER IS PART OF AN     @]@@@@ OVERSTRIKE.@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@            YH
)@@G@@  UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE               12-  1@[@@@@      YI
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @ @@@@ 12.   INTERFACING WITH EXEC 8@[@@@@      YJ
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IN  THE PRECEDING DISCUSSION,  WE HYK
)@@G@@AVE ATTEMPTED TO SIMPLIFY     @G@@@@ MATTERS  FOR  THE NOVICE USER BY NOYL
)@@G@@T MENTIONING SOME OF THE EDITOR     @G@@@@ FEATURES  WHICH REQUIRE A KNOYM
)@@G@@WLEDGE OF EXEC 8 AND ITS FILE SYSTEM.     @G@@@@ THE  EXEC  8  SYSTEM  PYN
)@@G@@ROVIDES A GREAT DEAL OF FLEXIBILITY FOR THE     @G@@@@ USER;  MUCH  OF TYO
)@@G@@HIS FLEXIBILITY IS NOT NEEDED BY THE CASUAL USER,     @E@@@@ HOWEVER, ANYP
)@@G@@D HENCE WE HAVE NOT PREVIOUSLY DISCUSSED IT.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      YQ
)@@G@@@ @@@@ 12. 1.   FILES AND ELEMENTS  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      YR
)@@G@@ THE  EXEC  8 SYSTEM PROVIDES TWO BASIC KINDS OF FILES,  DATA     @G@@@@YS
)@@G@@ FILES AND PROGRAM FILES (THERE ARE OTHER FORMATS, BUT THEY ARE NOT     YT
)@@G@@@A@@@@ OF CONCERN TO THE EDITOR USER).    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       DATA YU
)@@G@@ FILES ARE SEQUENTIALLY ORGANIZED,  AND USUALLY CONTAIN     @G@@@@ CARD YV
)@@G@@ OR LINE IMAGES.   INCLUDED IN THE CATEGORY OF DATA FILES ARE     @G@@@@YW
)@@G@@ SDF  (STANDARD DATA FORMAT) FILES PRODUCED BY THE    @DATA PROCES-     YX
)@@G@@@G@@@@ SOR,     PRINT$    FILES PRODUCED BY    @BRKPT , AND FILES WRITTEYY
)@@G@@N     @G@@@@ WITH FORTRAN FORMATTED OUTPUT STATEMENTS.   SINCE A DATA FIYZ
)@@G@@LE IS A     @G@@@@ CONTINOUS  SEQUENCE  OF IMAGES (POSSIBLY INTERSPERSEDZA
)@@G@@ WITH CONTROL     @G@@@@ INFORMATION  DEPENDING  ON  FILE TYPE),  ONE OBZB
)@@G@@TAINS ACCESS TO THE     @D@@@@ CONTENTS OF THE FILE MERELY BY SPECIFYINGZC
)@@G@@ ITS NAME.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@       PROGRAM  FILES CAN,  IN A SENSE,  BZD
)@@G@@E CONSIDERED TO BE 'SUPER     @G@@@@ FILES'.   A  PROGRAM  FILE MAY CONTZE
)@@G@@AIN NOT JUST ONE SET OF IMAGES,     @G@@@@ BUT  MANY,  AND EACH SET OF IZF
)@@G@@MAGES IS INDIVIDUALLY NAMED.   IF THE     @G@@@@ SO-CALLED  'ELEMENTS'  ZG
)@@G@@OF  SUCH  A  FILE  ARE  SYMBOLIC DECKS (SEE     @G@@@@ BELOW), THEN THEYZH
)@@G@@ MAY EACH INDIVIDUALLY BE TREATED AS IF THEY WERE     @G@@@@ A  DATA FILZI
)@@G@@E UNTO THEMSELVES.   IN FACT,  THE FORMAT OF A SYMBOLIC     @G@@@@ ELEMEZJ
)@@G@@NT WITHIN A PROGRAM FILE IS NEARLY IDENTICAL TO THE FORMAT OF     @G@@@@ZK
)@@G@@ AN  SDF FORMAT FILE.   IT IS IN THIS SENSE THAT A PROGRAM FILE MAY     ZL
)@@G@@@G@@@@ BE  VIEWED AS A 'SUPER FILE';  A PROGRAM FILE CAN BE CONSIDERED TZM
)@@G@@O     @G@@@@ BE  A  COLLECTION OF INDIVIDUAL SYMBOLIC DATA FILES,  EACH ZN
)@@G@@INDIVI-     @G@@@@ DUALLY NAMED.  OBVIOUSLY, THEN, WHEN ONE WISHES TO REZO
)@@G@@FER TO A DECK     @G@@@@ IN A PROGRAM FILE,  ONE MUST SPECIFY BOTH THE NZP
)@@G@@AME OF THE FILE AND     @C@@@@ THE NAME OF THE DECK (ELEMENT) WITHIN THEZQ
)@@G@@ FILE.@[@@@@      @G@@@@      IN FACT,  A PROGRAM FILE IS EVEN MORE ELEGZR
)@@G@@ANT THAN THE SIMPLE     @G@@@@ COLLECTION  OF SYMBOLIC DECKS DESCRIBED AZS
)@@G@@BOVE.   THE ELEMENTS OF A     @F@@@@ PROGRAM FILE MAY BE RELOCATABLE PROZT
)@@G@@GRAM DECKS OR ABSOLUTE PRO-   @G@@@@ GRAMS,   IN ADDITION TO SYMBOLIC TEZU
)@@G@@XT.   EACH ELEMENT IN A PROGRAM     @G@@@@ FILE  IS  MARKED  AS  TO ITS ZV
)@@G@@TYPE - CONSEQUENTLY IT IS POSSIBLE TO     @G@@@@ HAVE  A  SYMBOLIC  ELEMZW
)@@G@@ENT,  A RELOCATABLE ELEMENT AND AN ABSOLUTE     @G@@@@ ELEMENT  ALL  WITZX
)@@G@@H THE SAME NAME IN THE SAME PROGRAM FILE.   SINCE     @G@@@@ THE  EDITORZY
)@@G@@ ONLY OPERATES ON SYMBOLIC TEXT,  HOWEVER,  WE WILL NOT     @[@@@@*****^ZZ
)@@G@@@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE               AA
)@@G@@12-  2@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@ DISCUSS RELOCATABLE OR AB
)@@G@@ABSOLUTE ELEMENTS.@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ 12. 2.   FILE AND ELEMEAC
)@@G@@NT NAMING   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IN THE PRECEDING CHAPTEAD
)@@G@@RS,  WE HAVE TACITLY ASSUMED THAT ONE     @G@@@@ WOULD  ALWAYS  BE  EDITAE
)@@G@@ING  NAMED SYMBOLIC ELEMENTS IN THE PROGRAM     @G@@@@ FILE   TPF$  .   AF
)@@G@@THIS FILE IS A FILE AUTOMATICALLY GIVEN TO A USER     @G@@@@ WHEN HE SIGAG
)@@G@@NS ON,  AND DOES NOT NEED TO BE EXPLICITLY NAMED.   THE     @G@@@@ TIME-AH
)@@G@@SHARING USER CAN CONSIDER THAT HE HAS A 'WORKSPACE'; I.E.  AN     @G@@@@AI
)@@G@@ AREA OF DRUM STORAGE GIVEN TO HIM WHEN HE SIGNS ON, AND WHICH WILL     AJ
)@@G@@@F@@@@ DISAPPEAR WHEN HE SIGNS OFF; THE FILE TPF$ IS THAT WORKSPACE.    AK
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       ALL  OF  THE  EDITOR COMMANDS WHICH REFER TO NAAL
)@@G@@MED 'OBJECTS'     @G@@@@ (SUCH AS    ADD ,   COPY ,   CALL , ETC.), CAN AM
)@@G@@REFER TO ANY EXEC 8     @G@@@@ DATA  FILE,   OR TO SYMBOLIC ELEMENTS IN AN
)@@G@@A PROGRAM FILE;  ONE NEED     @D@@@@ ONLY SPECIFY THE NAME IN THE APPROPAO
)@@G@@RIATE NOTATION,   @[@@@@      @^@@@@ 12. 2. 1.   NOTATION   @[@@@@      AP
)@@G@@@G@@@@      A FILE NAME,  QUALIFIER (SEE BELOW),  ELEMENT NAME OR VERSIOAQ
)@@G@@N     @G@@@@ NAME (SEE BELOW) IS A STRING OF FROM ONE TO TWELVE CHARACTEAR
)@@G@@RS FROM     @G@@@@ THE SET  A-Z, 0-9, $ AND - (NOTE:  $   SHOULD NOT BE AS
)@@G@@USED TO AVOID     @G@@@@ CONFLICTS WITH NAMES USED BY THE SYSTEM).  THESAT
)@@G@@E NAMES ARE DISTIN-     @G@@@@ GUISHED  FROM ONE ANOTHER BY THE CONTEXT AU
)@@G@@IN WHICH THEY APPEAR.   A     @G@@@@ FILE  NAME  SHOULD  ALWAYS  BE  FOLAV
)@@G@@LOWED BY A PERIOD, FOR EXAMPLE,     @F@@@@ WHILE AN ELEMENT NAME NEVER HAW
)@@G@@AS A TRAILING PERIOD (SEE NOTE 1).  @[@@@@      @A@@@@                  AX
)@@G@@             ABC  @[@@@@      @D@@@@ IS AN ELEMENT NAME (IT HAS NO TRAILAY
)@@G@@ING PERIOD), WHILE@[@@@@      @A@@@@                              ABC.  AZ
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @A@@@@ IS THE NAME OF A FILE.  THE NAME   @[@@@@      @A@@@@BA
)@@G@@                             XYZ.ABC@[@@@@      @D@@@@ REFERS TO ELEMENTBB
)@@G@@ 'ABC' IN THE PROGRAM FILE 'XYZ'.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@ *****************BC
)@@G@@*********************************************** @G@@@@ NOTE  1:    IN  SBD
)@@G@@OME  CASES  THE TRAILING PERIOD ON A FILE NAME IS     @G@@@@ OPTIONAL, BBE
)@@G@@UT THE USER IS WARNED AGAINST ATTEMPTING TO TAKE ADVAN-     @G@@@@ TAGE BF
)@@G@@OF THESE EXCEPTIONS.  IN ONLY ONE CASE (THE   @BRKPT CARD) IS     @A@@@@BG
)@@G@@ THE PERIOD ACTUALLY FORBIDDEN.     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM BH
)@@G@@TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE               12-  3@[@@@@      @[@@@@BI
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      TO ALLOW FOR UNIQUENESS AMONG DIFFERENT USBJ
)@@G@@ERS OF THE COMPUTER     @G@@@@ (SEVERAL  OF  WHOM  MIGHT HAVE A FILE NAMBK
)@@G@@ED   DATA., FOR EXAMPLE),     @G@@@@ FILE NAMES ARE ACTUALLY TWO-PART NABL
)@@G@@MES,  THE FIRST OF WHICH IS THE     @G@@@@ 'QUALIFIER'.  IF THE QUALIFIEBM
)@@G@@R IS UNSPECIFIED (AS ABOVE), THEN THE     @G@@@@ SYSTEM USES THE PROJECTBN
)@@G@@ FIELD FROM THE EXEC 8    @RUN    CARD.  IF     @G@@@@ ONE  DOES  NOT  WBO
)@@G@@ANT  THIS,   THEN THE QUALIFIER MAY BE EXPLICITLY     @G@@@@ SPECIFIED. BP
)@@G@@  WHEN THE QUALIFIER IS GIVEN, IT IS SEPARATED FROM THE     @A@@@@ FILE BQ
)@@G@@NAME BY AN ASTERISK, E.G.     @[@@@@      @B@@@@                        BR
)@@G@@ SMITH*DATAFILE.  @B@@@@                         JONES*DATAFILE.  @[@@@@BS
)@@G@@      @G@@@@ ARE  TWO DISTINCT FILES.  THEY COULD BE PROGRAM FILES, DATABT
)@@G@@ FILES,     @G@@@@ OR ANY OTHER ARBITRARY TYPE OF FILE; THE NAME OF A FIBU
)@@G@@LE CONVEYS NO     @D@@@@ INFORMATION AS TO THE DATA CONTAINED IN THE FILBV
)@@G@@E.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IF THE FILE NAMED  PFILE.   WERE A PROGRABW
)@@G@@M FILE,  CONTAINING     @G@@@@ (SAY) FORTRAN SYMBOLIC DECKS FOR THE PROGBX
)@@G@@RAMS    MAIN    AND SUB ,     @F@@@@ THEN THESE DECKS WOULD BE ACCESSED BY
)@@G@@BY SPECIFYING THEIR NAMES AS  @[@@@@      @E@@@@                     JSMBZ
)@@G@@ITH*PFILE.MAIN                 AND  @B@@@@                     JSMITH*PFCA
)@@G@@ILE.SUB     @[@@@@      @G@@@@       IF THE 'PROJECT' FIELD OF YOUR    @CB
)@@G@@RUN    CARD HAD INDICATED     @G@@@@ THAT  YOU  WERE    JSMITH  ,  HOWEVCC
)@@G@@ER,  THE QUALIFIER WOULD NOT BE     @]@@@@ NEEDED.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@CD
)@@G@@       EXEC  8  ALSO  ADMITS AN EXTRA PART TO THE ELEMENT NAME,  IF     CE
)@@G@@@G@@@@ DESIRED.   THIS IS CALLED THE 'VERSION' NAME AND IS SEPARATED FROCF
)@@G@@M     @A@@@@ THE ELEMENT NAME BY A SLASH.  THUS @[@@@@      @B@@@@      CG
)@@G@@                       MAIN/OLD     @B@@@@    AND                      MCH
)@@G@@AIN/NEW     @[@@@@      @B@@@@ ARE DISTINCT ELEMENTS IN A PROGRAM FILE. CI
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  EXEC  8  SYSTEM PROVIDES MECHANISMS WHEREBCJ
)@@G@@Y ACCESS TO A     @G@@@@ FILE MAY BE RESTRICTED IN VARIOUS WAYS BY THE CCK
)@@G@@REATOR OF THE FILE;     @G@@@@ IT  ALSO  PROVIDES FOR THE MAINTENANCE OFCL
)@@G@@ SEVERAL COPIES OF A FILE     @G@@@@ WITH  THE  SAME  NAME USING SO-CALLCM
)@@G@@ED FILE CYCLES.   THE READER IS     @G@@@@ REFERRED  TO  THE  EXEC  8  PCN
)@@G@@RM FOR A COMPLETE DISCUSSION OF THESE     @]@@@@ FEATURES.  @[@@@@      CO
)@@G@@@#@@@@ 12. 2. 2.   USAGE@[@@@@      @F@@@@      THE EDITOR    ADD ,   COCP
)@@G@@PY ,   DCOPY , AND    CALL    COM-  @G@@@@ MANDS  ALL  ALLOW  FOR THE BLCQ
)@@G@@OCK OF TEXT TO BE USED TO HAVE A NAME     @G@@@@ (AND  AN  INITIAL     CCR
)@@G@@ALL    REQUIRES THE NAME).   THE CONVENTION     @G@@@@ GIVEN  IN  THE  DCS
)@@G@@ISCUSSION OF THESE COMMANDS IS THAT OF AN ELEMENT     @G@@@@ NAME.  SINCCT
)@@G@@E NO FILE NAME WAS GIVEN IN THE EXAMPLES, THE WORKSPACE     @[@@@@*****^CU
)@@G@@@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE               CV
)@@G@@12-  4@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ FILE  TPF$  WOULD AUTOMCW
)@@G@@ATICALLY BE USED.  IN THE GENERAL CASE, ANY     @G@@@@ FILE  NAME  OR  ECX
)@@G@@LEMENT  NAME  MAY BE USED IN THESE COMMANDS.   IN     @G@@@@ ADDITION,  CY
)@@G@@ A  FULLY  QUALIFIED  FILE OR FILE.ELEMENT NAME IS ALSO     @G@@@@ ALLOWCZ
)@@G@@ED  ON  THE INITIAL   @EDM    CARD.   THE PREFERRED METHOD OF     @G@@@@DA
)@@G@@ OPERATION FOR THE TIMESHARING USER, HOWEVER, IS TO ALWAYS USE TPF$     DB
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WHEN  ACTIVELY CONVERSING WITH THE COMPUTER,  AND COPY THE RESULTDC
)@@G@@S     @G@@@@ TO A CATALOGUED FILE WHEN THE TERMINAL SESSION IS COMPLETEDDD
)@@G@@.   THE     @G@@@@ USE  OF  TPF$  PROTECTS THE USER AGAINST ACCIDENTAL DDE
)@@G@@ESTRUCTION OF     @G@@@@ VALID  DATA  AND ALSO RESULTS IN FASTER EXECUTIDF
)@@G@@ON TIMES (AND LOWER     @]@@@@ CHARGES).  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@DG
)@@G@@ 12. 3.   THE PROCESSOR CALL CARD   @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      DH
)@@G@@ THE 'PROCESSOR CALL CARD' IS THE IMAGE ONE TYPES TO INITIATE     @#@@@@DI
)@@G@@ EDITING, E.G.    @[@@@@      @B@@@@                           @EDM <NAMDJ
)@@G@@E>    @[@@@@      @G@@@@ THE  FORM  ABOVE  IS  RECOMMENDED  FOR  THE TIMDK
)@@G@@ESHARING USER;  THE     @C@@@@ GENERAL FORM (MORE SUITABLE FOR BATCH RUNDL
)@@G@@S) IS:@C@@@@                  @EDM,<OPTIONS> <SPEC1>,<SPEC2>@[@@@@      DM
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE    ,<OPTIONS>    FIELD IS A SET OF LETTERS WHICH ALLOW VARIOUDN
)@@G@@S     @G@@@@ EDITOR  OPTIONS,   AND <SPEC1> IS THE NAME OF THE INPUT DATDO
)@@G@@A TO BE     @G@@@@ EDITED.  <SPEC1> MAY BE ANY FILE OR FILE.ELEMENT NAMEDP
)@@G@@.  IF <SPEC2>     @G@@@@ IS GIVEN (IT MAY ALSO BE ANY FILE OR FILE.ELEMEDQ
)@@G@@NT NAME),  THEN THE     @G@@@@ EDITED  TEXT  WILL BE SAVED WITH THAT NAMDR
)@@G@@E,  AND THE ORIGINAL TEXT     @C@@@@ <SPEC1> WILL NOT BE CHANGED BY THE DS
)@@G@@EDITOR.     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @#@@@@ 12. 4.   OPTIONS @[@@@@      DT
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       THE  OPTIONS  FIELD FOLLOWS IMMEDIATELY AFTER TDU
)@@G@@HE   @EDM SE-     @G@@@@ PARATED  FROM  IT  BY A COMMA.   THE INDIVIDUALDV
)@@G@@ OPTION LETTERS MAY     @C@@@@ APPEAR IN ANY ORDER (NO INTERVENING BLANKDW
)@@G@@S)    @[@@@@      @A@@@@ 12. 4. 1.   DISPOSITION OF THE TEXT@[@@@@      DX
)@@G@@@F@@@@    I      THE   I   (INSERT) OPTION CONDITIONS THE EDITOR TO     DY
)@@G@@@F@@@@           INSERT A NEW ELEMENT.  IF AN ELEMENT BY THE NAME GIVEN DZ
)@@G@@@E@@@@           IN <SPEC1> ALREADY EXISTS, IT WILL BE SUPERCEDED @E@@@@EA
)@@G@@           (UNLESS THE EDITOR SESSION IS TERMINATED BY AN   @ @@@@      EB
)@@G@@     ABORT    COMMAND). @[@@@@      @F@@@@    U      THE   U   OPTION INEC
)@@G@@DICATES THAT AN EXISTING ELEMENT IS @E@@@@           TO BE UPDATED.  IF ED
)@@G@@NO SUCH ELEMENT (AS GIVEN BY  @E@@@@           <SPEC1>) EXISTS, THE EDITEE
)@@G@@OR TERMINATES IN ERROR. @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR EF
)@@G@@ (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE               12-  5@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@EG
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ IF  NEITHER    I    NOR   U   IS GIVEN,  THE EDEH
)@@G@@ITOR WILL DETERMINE     @G@@@@ WHETHER  THE OBJECT NAMED IN <SPEC1> EXISEI
)@@G@@TS ALREADY AND ACT ACCOR-     @]@@@@ DINGLY.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      EJ
)@@G@@@A@@@@ 12. 4. 2.   BATCH ORIENTED OPTIONS @[@@@@      @G@@@@    A      AEK
)@@G@@LLOW  THE  REMAINDER OF THE RUN TO CONTINUE EVEN IF THE     @G@@@@      EL
)@@G@@     EDITOR DETECTS ERRORS (I.E.  DO NOT TAKE    ERR$    EXIT     @F@@@@EM
)@@G@@           ON NON-FATAL ERRORS SUCH AS ILLEGAL COMMAND SYNTAX).   @[@@@@EN
)@@G@@      @G@@@@    L      FULL LISTING.  COMMANDS ARE ECHOED ON THE BATCH PEO
)@@G@@RINTOUT     @G@@@@           AS THEY ARE EXECUTED.  THIS OPTION SHOULD AEP
)@@G@@LWAYS BE USED     @ @@@@           IN BATCH RUNS.     @[@@@@      @D@@@@EQ
)@@G@@ 12. 4. 3.   OPTIONS AFFECTING INITIAL PARAMETERS     @[@@@@      @G@@@@ER
)@@G@@      SEVERAL OPTIONS MAY BE USED TO PRESET EDITOR PARAMETERS WHICH     ES
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WOULD  OTHERWISE  BE  SET  BY  EXPLICIT COMMANDS (E.G.   THE    OET
)@@G@@N     @^@@@@ COMMAND).  THESE ARE:  @[@@@@      @G@@@@      D    SET    EU
)@@G@@ CLIMIT  ,   ALLOW    COLUMN AND RIGHT    HWINDOW     @G@@@@           BEV
)@@G@@OUNDARY  TO COLUMN 132.   THIS IS PRIMARILY FOR EDITING     @G@@@@      EW
)@@G@@     DATA  AND  PRINT  FILES  WHICH MAY CONTAIN IMAGES LONGER     @ @@@@EX
)@@G@@           THAN 80 CHARACTERS.@[@@@@      @C@@@@      N    ASSUME THE COEY
)@@G@@MMAND    ON BRIEF    .  @[@@@@      @C@@@@      T    PRESET THE TABS AS EZ
)@@G@@PER THE COMMAND   @[@@@@      @A@@@@                    TAB ; 11 21 39  FA
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@           THIS IS PRIMARILY OF USE WHEN EDITING 1100 FB
)@@G@@SERIES ASSEM-     @ @@@@           BLER SOURCE CODE.  @[@@@@      @ @@@@FC
)@@G@@ 12. 4. 4.   MISCELLANEOUS    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      B    ASSME  BATCH FD
)@@G@@ CONVENTIONS EVEN IF INPUT IS FROM A DEMAND     @G@@@@           TERMINAFE
)@@G@@L.    PRIMARILY,  THIS INHIBITS THE PROMPT AT THE     @ @@@@           SFF
)@@G@@TART OF EACH LINE.@[@@@@      @G@@@@      Q,P  FOR MIXED MODE (ASCII-FIEFG
)@@G@@LDATA) EDITING.  SEE CHAPTER ON     @ @@@@           ASCII EDITING.     FH
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@      R    DO NOT WRITE IN OUTPUT ELEMENT.  THIS OPTIOFI
)@@G@@N IS RETAINED     @G@@@@           PRIMARILY FOR COMPATIBILITY.  NOTE THFJ
)@@G@@AT ALTHOUGH WRITING     @G@@@@           IN  THE  OUTPUT  ELEMENT IS INHFK
)@@G@@IBITED,  OTHER EDITOR I/O     @G@@@@           WILL PROCEED NORMALLY.  TFL
)@@G@@HE 'Z' OPTION (SEE BELOW) IS TO     @^@@@@           BE PREFERRED.@[@@@@FM
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE         FN
)@@G@@      12-  6@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@      FO
)@@G@@X    TERMINATE ON ANY ERROR.  @[@@@@      @F@@@@      Z    DO  NO  UNNECFP
)@@G@@ESSARY  INPUT/OUTPUT.    THIS  IS  A  TRUE@G@@@@           'READ-ONLY'  FQ
)@@G@@MODE;  THE EDITOR WILL RUN FROM TWO TO FOUR     @G@@@@           TIMES  FR
)@@G@@FASTER WITH THIS OPTION THAN WITHOUT IT.   IT CAN     @G@@@@           OFS
)@@G@@NLY  BE USED FOR EXAMINING TEXT.   NONE OF THE COMMANDS     @G@@@@      FT
)@@G@@     WHICH WOULD CHANGE THE TEXT (E.G.     CHANGE  ,   DELETE     @G@@@@FU
)@@G@@           ,    INSERT     )  ARE EFFECTIVE, NOR ARE THE    COPY  ,     FV
)@@G@@@F@@@@           ADD      OR     DCOPY     COMMANDS.    BECAUSE  OF  THEFW
)@@G@@@G@@@@           INCREASED  SPEED  AND  CONSEQUENT BETTER RESPONSE,  THIFX
)@@G@@S     @G@@@@           OPTION  IS  TO  BE  PREFERRED TO THE 'R' OPTION FFY
)@@G@@OR MOST     @#@@@@           USES.  @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM FZ
)@@G@@TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE               13-  1@[@@@@      @[@@@@GA
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @C@@@@ 13.   APPENDIX    COMPARISON WITH OTHER EDITORSGB
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@       SEVERAL  OTHER  EDITORSGC
)@@G@@ ARE IN USE ON UNIVAC 1100 SERIES SY-     @G@@@@ STEMS.   OF THESE THE MGD
)@@G@@AIN ONES ARE (A)  OLDER VERSIONS OF THE UOM     @G@@@@ EDITOR;  (B)  THEGE
)@@G@@ UNIVAC @ED  PROCESSOR AND (C) THE @EDQ PROCESSOR     @G@@@@ OF DR.  M. GF
)@@G@@ D. GODFREY.  A SUMMARY OF DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE CUR-     @E@@@@ RENT GG
)@@G@@UOM EDITOR (LEVEL 28) AND THESE OTHER EDITORS FOLLOWS:@[@@@@      @[@@@@GH
)@@G@@      @A@@@@ 13. 1.   OLDER VERSIONS OF UOM @EDM@[@@@@      @[@@@@      GI
)@@G@@@G@@@@       MANY  IMPROVEMENTS IN THE SYNTAX AND NAMING OF COMMANDS HAVGJ
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ TAKEN PLACE AS UOM @EDM HAS DEVELOPED;  THESE EVOLUTIONARY GK
)@@G@@CHANGES     @G@@@@ HAVE  RESULTED IN NEW COMMANDS WHICH SUPERCEDE OLD ONGL
)@@G@@ES.   IN MOST     @G@@@@ CASES  THE 'OLD' COMMANDS HAVE NOT ACTUALLY BEEGM
)@@G@@N REMOVED,  BUT ARE     @G@@@@ NO  LONGER  DOCUMENTED OR SUPPORTED IN THGN
)@@G@@EIR OLD FORM.   THESE OLD     @G@@@@ COMMANDS MAY BE REMOVED AT ANY TIMEGO
)@@G@@,  AND USERS ARE URGED TO START     @G@@@@ USING THE NEW ALTERNATIVES ASGP
)@@G@@ QUICKLY AS POSSIBLE.   THE UNSUPPOR-     @#@@@@ TED COMMANDS ARE:@[@@@@GQ
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@     OLD FEATURE          NEW ALTERNATIVE @#@@@@GR
)@@G@@       OR COMMAND @[@@@@      @B@@@@   BR, V              ON BRIEF, OFF GS
)@@G@@BRIEF @B@@@@   TRACE ON/OFF       ON TRACE, OFF TRACE @B@@@@   SQ, EX, UGT
)@@G@@S, UNS    ON QUICK, OFF QUICK @B@@@@   MEM                ON MEM, OFF MEGU
)@@G@@M     @F@@@@   PC ON/OFF          ALREADY REMOVED.  USE   ON PCN, OFF PCGV
)@@G@@N     @A@@@@   SPLIT              COPY, DCOPY   @D@@@@   OLD            GW
)@@G@@    GI (GO TO INPUT LINE NUMBER)    @D@@@@   SET                USE    TGX
)@@G@@AB    TO SET TAB STOPS  @A@@@@   OLI                DISPLAY ILN   @C@@@@GY
)@@G@@   OLN                THE VARIABLE    OLN   IS  @E@@@@                  GZ
)@@G@@    NOW    ILN    (INPUT LINE NUMBER)     @A@@@@   LIN                DIHA
)@@G@@SPLAY LIN   @^@@@@   PL                 HW@E@@@@   BOTTOM             THHB
)@@G@@IS COMMAND HAS ALREADY BEEN REMOVED.@B@@@@                      USE    AHC
)@@G@@PPEND    .  @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USEHD
)@@G@@R'S GUIDE               13-  2@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@HE
)@@G@@      @[@@@@      @A@@@@ 13. 2.   COMPARISON WITH UNIVAC @ED@[@@@@      HF
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       EXCEPT  AS  NOTED BELOW, ALL COMMANDS OF THE UNHG
)@@G@@IVAC @ED  ARE     @G@@@@ IDENTICAL  IN UOM @EDM, ALTHOUGH SOME MAY NOT BHH
)@@G@@E DOCUMENTED IN THE     @D@@@@ STANDARD UOM EDITOR DOCUMENTATION (E.G.  HI
)@@G@@OMIT  ).    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @C@@@@ UNIVAC @ED FEATURE      UOM @HJ
)@@G@@EDM IMPLEMENTATION@#@@@@    OR COMMAND    @[@@@@      @G@@@@ LOCATE '<STHK
)@@G@@RING>' THE  UOM     LS     (LOCATE STRING) COMMAND PER-     @G@@@@      HL
)@@G@@               FORMS THE SAME FUNCTION.  ENCLOSING QUOTES ARE     @C@@@@HM
)@@G@@                     NOT NEEDED IN    LS    .   @E@@@@ LCH              HN
)@@G@@ SEE    LOCATE '<STRING>'    , ABOVE.     @G@@@@ TCH               UNIMPHO
)@@G@@LEMENTED.    THE    MATCH    COMMAND MAY BE     @A@@@@                  HP
)@@G@@   USED INSTEAD.  @A@@@@ CCH               UNIMPLEMENTED.   @A@@@@ MAIL HQ
)@@G@@             UNIMPLEMENTED.   @A@@@@ ON LOOK           SEE    MAIL    . HR
)@@G@@@G@@@@ ADD               UOM     ADD     COMMAND ALLOWS EDITING OF IMAGEHS
)@@G@@S     @G@@@@                     AS THEY ARE    ADD 'ED.   HENCE, NORMALHT
)@@G@@ EDITOR     @G@@@@                     COMMANDS  SUCH AS PRINT,  DELETE,HU
)@@G@@  NEXT MAY BE     @F@@@@                     USED  TO  ACCOMPLISH  SELECHV
)@@G@@TIVE  PRINTING  OF@A@@@@                     ADD 'ED TEXT.  @C@@@@ ON XBHW
)@@G@@RIEF         UNNECESSARY.  SEE    ADD    .@G@@@@ SPLIT             THE  HX
)@@G@@COMMANDS     COPY    AND    DCOPY    SUPER-     @G@@@@                  HY
)@@G@@   CEDE  THIS.    NOTE THAT THEY DO NOT START CO-     @G@@@@            HZ
)@@G@@         PYING AT THE FIRST LINE, BUT ALLOW THE USER TO     @F@@@@      IA
)@@G@@               SPECIFY THE START POINT USING     BEGIN    . @D@@@@ ON DSIB
)@@G@@PLIT         UNNECESSARY.  SEE    SPLIT    .    @G@@@@ ON UMODE         IC
)@@G@@ UNIMPLEMENTED.   IT IS UNCLEAR WHAT THIS COMMAND     @B@@@@            ID
)@@G@@         IS SUPPOSED TO DO.   @G@@@@ Q, LNQ, LNP       UNNECESSARY.    AIE
)@@G@@LL  COMMANDS WHICH CAUSE OUTPUT     @G@@@@                     CAN  BE  IF
)@@G@@PREFIXED WITH 'Q' TO OBTAIN TEMPORARY     @G@@@@                     QUIIG
)@@G@@CK MODE OUTPUT;  THUS THE EQUIVALENT OF THE     @G@@@@                  IH
)@@G@@   UNIVAC Q IS QP.  LINE NUMBERS MAY BE SIMILARLY     @G@@@@            II
)@@G@@         OBTAINED  BY PREFIXING THE COMMAND NAME WITH N     @G@@@@      IJ
)@@G@@               (E.G.   NP IS EQUIVALENT TO UNIVAC'S LNP).  IF     @G@@@@IK
)@@G@@                     BOTH  QUICK MODE AND LINE NUMBERS ARE DESIRED,     IL
)@@G@@@G@@@@                     THE PREFIX QN IS USED; E.G.  QNP IS EQUIVALENIM
)@@G@@T     @ @@@@                     TO LNQ.  @G@@@@ <COMMAND>!        THE EIN
)@@G@@FFECT OF P! AND SIMILAR COMMANDS IS ACCOMP-     @G@@@@                  IO
)@@G@@   LISHED  BY USING AN * (MEANING AN INDEFINITELY     @G@@@@            IP
)@@G@@         LARGE  NUMBER)  WHEREVER A NUMBER WOULD OTHER-     @G@@@@      IQ
)@@G@@               WISE  APPEAR.    THUS    P *    WILL PRINT ALL     @G@@@@IR
)@@G@@                     LINES  TO THE END OF THE TEXT.   REPOSITIONING     IS
)@@G@@@G@@@@                     TO  THE  TOP OF THE FILE BEFORE SUCH AN OPERAIT
)@@G@@-     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIU
)@@G@@IDE               13-  3@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @D@@@@      IV
)@@G@@               TION MUST BE DONE EXPLICITLY.    @G@@@@ FC, LC           IW
)@@G@@ UNNECESSARY.    THE  OPTION  * ACHIEVES THE SAME     @G@@@@            IX
)@@G@@         EFFECT ON ANY COMMAND OF THIS TYPE,  E.G.  F,*     @G@@@@      IY
)@@G@@               OR L,*.  THIS OPTION IS EXTENDED TO CHANGE AND     @D@@@@IZ
)@@G@@                     MATCH ALSO, E.G.  C,* OR M,*.    @D@@@@ CSF        JA
)@@G@@       THE UOM * COMMAND IS EQUIVALENT.   @G@@@@ UP                UNIMPJB
)@@G@@LEMENTED.    CAUTION:  UOM EDITOR HAS AN UP     @F@@@@                  JC
)@@G@@   WHOSE MEANING IS DIFFERENT FROM UNIVAC'S.    @A@@@@ CPT              JD
)@@G@@ UNIMPLEMENTED.   @G@@@@ RP                UNIMPLEMENTED.  THE EFFECT OFJE
)@@G@@ RP CAN EFFECTIVELY     @E@@@@                     BE ACHIEVED WITH UOM JF
)@@G@@   DUP COMMAND.   @F@@@@ MAX               THE UOM    ALLOW    COMMAND IJG
)@@G@@S EQUIVALENT.     @G@@@@ INP,I,IB          INP IS UNNECESSARY.   WHEN EOJH
)@@G@@F MODE IS SET,  THE     @G@@@@                     @EOF  IS  USED  TO SWJI
)@@G@@ITCH MODES IN BOTH DIREC-     @G@@@@                     TIONS  (I.E.   JJ
)@@G@@EDIT  TO INPUT AND VICE VERSA).     @G@@@@                     UOM  HAS JK
)@@G@@ EXTENDED  THE     IB     COMMAND  BY     @C@@@@                     DEFJL
)@@G@@INING THE    IB    MODE.@E@@@@ CHANGE ... ALL    EQUIVALENT UOM COMMAND JM
)@@G@@IS    C,* ... G   @G@@@@ OPR,OPR*          UOM EQUIVALENT COMMANDS ARE OJN
)@@G@@PN, OPR.  NOTE THAT     @D@@@@                     THE MEANING OF OPR ISJO
)@@G@@ REVERSED.  @F@@@@ LAST              UOM EDITOR ALLOWS EDITING OF THE LAJP
)@@G@@ST LINE.    @G@@@@ DELETE            UOM  EDITOR  DOES  NOT GO TO PREVIOJQ
)@@G@@US LINE AFTER     @F@@@@                     DELETION,    BUT  INSTEAD  JR
)@@G@@LEAVES  AN  'EMPTY@G@@@@                     WINDOW'.   THE UNIVAC D+ COJS
)@@G@@MMAND IS EQUIVALENT     @D@@@@                     TO UOM DN (DELETE ANDJT
)@@G@@ NEXT).     @G@@@@ STATUS            STATUS HAS BEEN ENHANCED IN UOM @EDJU
)@@G@@;  ALL STATUS     @G@@@@                     VARIABLES  MAY  BE  REQUESTJV
)@@G@@ED ON AN INDIVIDUAL     @C@@@@                     BASIS, E.G.  TAB SETTJW
)@@G@@INGS. @G@@@@ AUTO              IMPLEMENTATION  DIFFERS  SLIGHTLY FROM UNJX
)@@G@@IVAC'S,     @G@@@@                     SEE  DISCUSSION  OF    AUTO    COJY
)@@G@@MMAND IN THIS     @ @@@@                     MANUAL.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@JZ
)@@G@@      SEVERAL COMMANDS OF THE UNIVAC EDITOR ARE AVAILABLE AS PROCE-     KA
)@@G@@@G@@@@ DURES  IN  THE  LIBRARY, BUT ARE NOT BUILT INTO THE EDITOR ITSELFKB
)@@G@@.     @G@@@@ THUS  THEY  ARE  AVAILABLE IF THE UOM LIBRARY OF EDITOR PROKC
)@@G@@CEDURES     @G@@@@ HAS  BEEN PLACED IN THE SYSTEM LIBRARY,  RLIB$.   THEKD
)@@G@@SE PROCEDURES     @C@@@@ ARE DOC, PUN, SIT, CPU, LNSIT, DITTO AND MOVE. KE
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@       SEVERAL  COMMANDS  IN  THE  UNIVAC  EDITOR ALLOKF
)@@G@@W THE USER TO     @G@@@@ SPECIFY A RANGE OF LINE NUMBERS ON WHICH THE COKG
)@@G@@MMAND IS TO OPERATE     @G@@@@ (E.G.    PRINT)  OR A STARTING LINE NUMBEKH
)@@G@@R (INLINE).   SINCE THESE     @G@@@@ LINE  NUMBERS  CHANGE  DURING  EDITKI
)@@G@@ING  AND  ARE USUALLY NOT KNOWN     @G@@@@ ANYWAY,  THIS FEATURE IS NOT KJ
)@@G@@AVAILABLE IN THE UOM EDITOR.  THE UOM     @G@@@@ @EDM USER  WHO  FEELS AKK
)@@G@@ SIGNIFICANT NEED FOR COMMANDS OF THIS TYPE     @G@@@@ CAN  EASILY  CREAKL
)@@G@@TE  HIS  OWN BY USING THE EDITOR'S ARITHMETIC AND     @D@@@@ PROCEDURE CKM
)@@G@@APABILITIES.  FOR EXAMPLE, THE COMMANDS   @[@@@@      @ @@@@            KN
)@@G@@             GO %1@A@@@@                         P %2-%1+1  @[@@@@      KO
)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@              UOM TEXT EDITOR  (EDM) - USER'S GUIDE   KP
)@@G@@            13-  4@[@@@@      @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@ COMPRISE  TKQ
)@@G@@HE BODY OF A PROCEDURE WHICH WOULD HAVE THE SAME EFFECT     @G@@@@ AS  SKR
)@@G@@PECIFYING  START  AND  END  LINE NUMBERS ON A UNIVAC    PRINT     @G@@@@KS
)@@G@@ COMMAND.    FREQUENTLY  USED  PROCEDURES  CAN BE SAVED IN ONES OWN     KT
)@@G@@@G@@@@ PRIVATE     ED$PF     LIBRARY  AND USED AT EACH EDITOR SESSION WIKU
)@@G@@-     @^@@@@ THOUT REDEFINITION.    @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @B@@@@ 13. 3KV
)@@G@@.   COMPARISON WITH GODFREY'S @EDQ  @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @G@@@@      KW
)@@G@@BOTH  @EDQ  AND  @EDM HAVE A PROCEDURE CAPABILITY, BUT PROCE-     @G@@@@KX
)@@G@@ DURES ARE DEFINED AND INVOKED DIFFERENTLY.  @EDQ USERS WHO WISH TO     KY
)@@G@@@G@@@@ CONVERT  TO  UOM @EDM  SHOULD  CHECK THE SECTION OF THIS MANUAL OKZ
)@@G@@N     @A@@@@ PROCEDURES FOR FURTHER DETAILS.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      LA
)@@G@@ THE  TABLE BELOW GIVES FEATURES OF @EDQ AND THEIR CORRESPON-     @ @@@@LB
)@@G@@ DING UOM IMPLEMENTATION.     @[@@@@      @[@@@@      @D@@@@ @EDQ FEATURLC
)@@G@@E                    UOM IMPLEMENTATION   @#@@@@   OR COMMAND     @[@@@@LD
)@@G@@      @A@@@@ SAVE          SUPERCEDED BY CLI    @ @@@@ PM            UNILE
)@@G@@MPLEMENTED  @D@@@@ RP            SEE COMMENTS REGARDING UNIVAC'S RP.    LF
)@@G@@@G@@@@ LL            THE DESIRED EFFECT OF LL MAY BE ACHIEVED BY ESTABLILG
)@@G@@-     @E@@@@                  SHING A VERTICAL WINDOW (VW COMMAND).     LH
)@@G@@@G@@@@ CL            UNIMPLEMENTED.   THE FURPUR COMMAND @CYCLE SHOULD BLI
)@@G@@E     @A@@@@                  USED INSTEAD.     @D@@@@ LC,FC         SEELJ
)@@G@@ COMMENT REGARDING UNIVAC'S LC, FC  @G@@@@ LD,FD         IMPLEMENTED AS LK
)@@G@@LIBRARY PROCEDURES WITH THE NAMES DTL     @G@@@@                  (DELETLL
)@@G@@E  THROUGH  LOCATE) AND DTF (DELETE THROUGH     @^@@@@                  LM
)@@G@@FIND).@G@@@@ LP, FP        IMPLEMENTED AS LIBRARY PROCEDURES WITH THE NALN
)@@G@@MES PTL     @G@@@@                  (PRINT  THROUGH  LOCATE)  AND  PTF (LO
)@@G@@PRINT THROUGH     @^@@@@                  FIND).@ @@@@ LCD, FCD      UNILP
)@@G@@MPLEMENTED. @ @@@@ PG            UNIMPLEMENTED  @E@@@@ IG,IP         EQULQ
)@@G@@IVALENT UOM COMMANDS ARE HOLD AND DUP.    @A@@@@ BR,V          USE ON ANLR
)@@G@@D OFF BRIEF.@G@@@@ ECHO, NOECHO  USE ON AND OFF TRACE.  UOM TRACE MODE DLS
)@@G@@IFFERS SLIGH-     @G@@@@                  TLY  FROM  @EDQ  ECHO.   TRACELT
)@@G@@ OCCURS ONLY WITHIN     @G@@@@                  PROCEDURES  AND  OUTPUTSLU
)@@G@@  THE  LINE NUMBER IN THE     @B@@@@                  PROCEDURE BEING TRLV
)@@G@@ACED. @D@@@@ LN            EQUIVALENT UOM COMMAND - DISPLAY LIN.  @G@@@@LW
)@@G@@ LNON          UNNECESSARY.    LINE  NUMBERS  ARE OBTAINED FROM ANY     LX
)@@G@@@F@@@@                  COMMAND BY PREFIXING THE COMMAND NAME WITH 'N'. LY
)@@G@@@B@@@@ LAON          USE    ON NUM    INSTEAD.  @E@@@@ UP            SEELZ
)@@G@@ COMMENTS REGARDING UNIVAC'S    UP    .   @G@@@@ ND            UNNECESSAMA

)@@G@@*[@@@@*SDFF*@F@@@@THIS FILE CONTAINS LENGTHY NEWS ITEMS SUCH AS MANUALS.JU
)@@G@@  SINCE     @E@@@@ALL THESE ITEMS ARE 'ARCHIVE' ITEMS, THE O-OPTION MUSTJV
)@@G@@ BE   @D@@@@USED (AS WELL AS THE M-OPTION) TO REFERENCE THEM.     @[@@_@JW
)@@G@@******@[@@_@      @F@@_@THIS FILE CONTAINS LENGTHY NEWS ITEMS SUCH AS MAJX
)@@G@@NUALS.  SINCE     @E@@_@ALL THESE ITEMS ARE 'ARCHIVE' ITEMS, THE O-OPTIOJY
)@@G@@N MUST BE   @D@@_@USED (AS WELL AS THE M-OPTION) TO REFERENCE THEM.     JZ
)@@G@@___DDOC(HES)CDMC*)^9[EL#D[DE1 ^8)DDOC(HES?^[OD[ ^[J (JE[ODDJD0)D(PETO^[]KA
)@@G@@*[@@@@*SDFF*@G@@@@THE LONG VERSION OF THIS ITEM IS A CONCISE DESCRIPTIONKB
)@@G@@ OF EDN COMMANDS. @[@@@@******@G@@@@ EDN IS A REENTRANT TEXT EDITOR FOR KC
)@@G@@THE UNIVAC 1100 SERIES COMPUTERS    @G@@@@ DEVELOPED BY THE NEW YORK UNIKD
)@@G@@VERSITY SYSTEMS DEVELOPMENT STAFF.  EDN   @G@@@@ PROVIDES A WIDE AND VARKE
)@@G@@IED COMMAND REPERTOIRE WITH A SMALL UTILIZATION @G@@@@ OF CORE MEMORY.  KF
)@@G@@(THE EDN IBANK IS ABOUT 5K., AND THE DBANK IS UNDER   @G@@@@ 4K.  BECAUSKG
)@@G@@E EDN IS A REENTRANT PROCESSOR, IN MANY CASES ONLY THE DATA @G@@@@ PORTIKH
)@@G@@ON NEED BE LOADED, AND ITS SMALL SIZE WILL CAUSE THE USER TO EX-  @G@@@@KI
)@@G@@ PERIENCE QUITE FAST EXECUTION.)  EDN WAS CONCEIVED AS AN ENHANCEMENT   KJ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ TO EXISTING EDITORS BY COMBINING THE BEST OF THEIR COMMANDS, PLUSKK
)@@G@@ SOME @G@@@@ NEW ONES, AND BY PROVIDING AN ERROR RECOVERY MECHANISM WHICKL
)@@G@@H WILL SAVE @G@@@@ THE USER THE AGGRAVATION OF HAVING TO DUPLICATE AN EDKM
)@@G@@ITING SESSION BE- @E@@@@ CAUSE OF A TELETYPE TRANSMISSION ERROR OR A MISKN
)@@G@@TYPE.       @[@@@@      @E@@@@ THE EDN PROCESSOR CALL STATEMENT HAS THE KO
)@@G@@FOLLOWING FORM:   @[@@@@      @D@@@@                      @EDN[,OPTIONS]KP
)@@G@@ SPEC1[,SPEC2]    @[@@@@      @G@@@@ 'SPEC1' NAMES THE INPUT DATAFILE ORKQ
)@@G@@ SYMBOLIC ELEMENT, AND MUST ALWAYS  @G@@@@ APPEAR.  'SPEC2' IS OPTIONAL,KR
)@@G@@ AND NAMES THE OUTPUT DATAFILE OR SYM-    @F@@@@ BOLIC ELEMENT.  IF THE KS
)@@G@@EDITED TEXT IS TO BE FILED INTO THE SAME  @G@@@@ FILE OR ELEMENT AS THE KT
)@@G@@INPUT, 'SPEC2' MAY BE OMITTED.  EITHER 'SPEC1'  @G@@@@ OR 'SPEC2' MAY NAKU
)@@G@@ME A FILE OR ELEMENT; THUS, AN ELEMENT MAY BE EDITED  @G@@@@ INTO A DATAKV
)@@G@@FILE, OR A DATAFILE MAY BE EDITED INTO AN ELEMENT.  EDN     @G@@@@ WILL KW
)@@G@@MAKE THE NECESSARY INTERNAL ADJUSTMENTS.  IF 'SPEC1' NAMES AN     @G@@@@KX
)@@G@@ ELEMENT WHICH IS NOT FOUND IN THE INPUT PROGRAM FILE, EDN WILL CREATE  KY
)@@G@@@G@@@@ AN ELEMENT WITH THIS NAME.  LIKEWISE, IF 'SPEC1' NAMES AN EMPTY FKZ
)@@G@@ILE,  @F@@@@ WITH NO ELEMENT NAME SPECIFIED, THE DATAFILE WILL BE INITIALA
)@@G@@LIZED.@G@@@@ IF EDN IS CALLED UPON TO CREATE AN ELEMENT OR INITIALIZE A LB
)@@G@@DATAFILE,   @G@@@@ AND 'SPEC2' IS GIVEN, IT IS IGNORED.  IF 'SPEC2' (OR LC
)@@G@@'SPEC1' IF IT IS  @G@@@@ THE ONLY SPECIFICATION) NAMES A FILE THAT IS RELD
)@@G@@AD ONLY, OR THAT HAS    @G@@@@ A WRITE KEY WHICH WAS NOT SPECIFIED, EDN LE
)@@G@@ENTERS READ ONLY MODE, AND    @G@@@@ WILL IN NO CASES ATTEMPT TO FILE ANLF
)@@G@@Y OUTPUT.  IF THE OUTPUT FILE IS    @G@@@@ READ ONLY TO EDN, AND THE ELELG
)@@G@@MENT SPECIFIED DOES NOT EXIST, OR THE     @F@@@@ DATAFILE IS EMPTY, EDN LH
)@@G@@TERMINATES WITH AN APPROPRIATE MESSAGE.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@ EDN RECOGNILI
)@@G@@ZES AND REACTS TO SIX OPTION LETTERS, NONE OF WHICH ARE     @]@@@@ REQUILJ
)@@G@@RED.  @[@@@@      @G@@@@ THE 'A' OPTION IS USEFUL AFTER A SYSTEM FAILURELK
)@@G@@, WHEN EDN HAS NOT BEEN @G@@@@ ABLE TO FILE THE EDITED TEXT.  IF A 'SAVELL
)@@G@@' COMMAND WAS EXECUTED (SEE   @F@@@@ BELOW), THE 'A' OPTION TELLS EDN TOLM
)@@G@@ RECOVER THE EDITED TEXT FOUND@G@@@@ IN ITS INTERNAL FILE 'SPLIT$'.  THILN
)@@G@@S ALLOWS THE USER TO RECOVER ALL    @G@@@@ CHANGES MADE UP TO THE TIME OLO
)@@G@@F THE 'SAVE'.  'SPLIT$' IS A CATALOGUED   @F@@@@ FILE, AND IS AUTOMATICALP
)@@G@@LLY ASSIGNED BY EDN DURING INITIALIZATION.@[@@@@      @G@@@@ THE 'B' OPTLQ
)@@G@@ION CAUSES EDN TO ENTER BRIEF MODE INITIALLY.  IN BRIEF     @B@@@@ MODE LR
)@@G@@ONLY REQUESTED PRINTING IS DONE.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@ THE 'D' OPTION CALS
)@@G@@USES EDN TO TREAT AN ELEMENT NAMED IN 'SPEC1' AS A    @F@@@@ DATAFILE INLT
)@@G@@SOFAR AS IMAGE LENGTH IS CONCERNED, THUS ALLOWING     @G@@@@ AN ELEMENT LU
)@@G@@WITH IMAGES LONGER THAN 14 WORDS TO BE EDITED WITHOUT RE-   @G@@@@ QUIRILV
)@@G@@NG THE EXECUTION OF A 'PLM' AND/OR 'SAV' COMMAND (SEE BELOW).     @E@@@@LW
)@@G@@ THE 'D' OPTION IS ASSUMED IF THE INPUT FILE IS A DATAFILE. @[@@@@      LX
)@@G@@@F@@@@ THE 'I' OPTION INSTRUCTS EDN TO ENTER INPUT MODE AT LINE 0 AFTER LY
)@@G@@@#@@@@ INITIALIZATION.  @[@@@@      @B@@@@ THE 'L' OPTION SETS LINE NUMBLZ
)@@G@@ERING MODE. @@@@@@@E@@@@ THE 'P' OPTION TURNS ON PROMPTING.  SEE 'PON' CMA
)@@G@@OMMAND.     @@@@@@@G@@@@ THE 'R' OPTION CAUSES EDN TO ENTER 'FALSE' READMB
)@@G@@ ONLY MODE.  THIS MEANS @G@@@@ THAT UNLESS A 'ROFF' COMMAND IS EXECUTED,MC
)@@G@@ NO OUTPUT WILL BE FILED.     @F@@@@ THIS OPTION IS ASSUMED AND MAY NOT MD
)@@G@@BE OVERRIDEN IF THE OUTPUT    @^@@@@ FILE IS READ ONLY.     @[@@@@      ME
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE 'S' OPTION SETS SQUEEZE MODE FOR PRINTING.  SEE 'SQON' COMMANMF
)@@G@@D.    @@@@@@@G@@@@ THE 'Y' OPTION CAUSES EDN TO INITIALLY ENTER LINE NUMMG
)@@G@@BERING AND SQUEEZE@C@@@@ MODES. (COMBINATION OF 'L' AND 'S' OPTIONS.)   MH
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@ A SPECIAL FEATURE OF EDN IS ITS ABILITY TO LINK TO COMI
)@@G@@NFERENCE REP OF   @F@@@@ NYU'S CONFERENCE SYSTEM.  THIS IS AVAILABLE IF MJ
)@@G@@THE WORD 'CONFR'  @G@@@@ APPEARS ON EDN'S SIGN ON LINE, FOLLOWING THE ELMK
)@@G@@EMENT CYCLE INFORMATION.@ @@@@ SEE THE 'CONFR' COMMAND.     @@@@@@@G@@@@ML
)@@G@@ THE FOLLOWING PARAGRAPHS DEFINE 10 BROAD CATEGORIES OF EDN COMMANDS,   MM
)@@G@@@ @@@@ AND DESCRIBE EACH COMMAND.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@ THE SYNTAX OF EDNMN
)@@G@@ IS SIMILAR TO THAT OF MOST OTHER EDITORS, NOTABLY    @G@@@@ UNIVAC'S EDMO
)@@G@@.  THEREFORE, IN THE FOLLOWING DESCRIPTIONS, SYNTAX WILL    @G@@@@ NOT BMP
)@@G@@E DISCUSSED UNLESS IT DIFFERS FROM 'NORMAL', OR UNLESS THE COM-   @ @@@@MQ
)@@G@@ MAND IS ONE UNIQUE TO EDN.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@ NOTE: IN THE FOLLOWING MR
)@@G@@PARAGRAPHS, A NUMBER MEANS ANY STRING OF  @G@@@@ DIGITS, OPTIONALLY PRECMS
)@@G@@EDED BY A '+' OR '-', IF THE SYNTAX REQUIRES.   @F@@@@ ADDITIONALLY, A NMT
)@@G@@UMERIC FIELD SUCH AS 66+3-22 IS VALID.  HOWEVER,@G@@@@ PLUS AND MINUS ARMU
)@@G@@E THE ONLY AVAILABLE OPERATORS.  NUMERIC FIELDS MAY BE@G@@@@ SEPARATED BMV
)@@G@@Y BLANKS OR COMMAS.  IF THE COMMAND IN QUESTION ALLOWS MORE @G@@@@ THAN MW
)@@G@@ONE FIELD AND A PRECEDING FIELD IS TO BE OMITTED, THE INCLUDED    @E@@@@MX
)@@G@@ FIELD(S) MUST BE PRECEDED BY COMMA(S) TO AVOID CONFUSION.  @@@@@@@@@@@@MY
)@@G@@@@@@@@@ @@@@  1.      LINE CURSOR CONTROL @[@@@@      @G@@@@ G        THMZ
)@@G@@E 'G' COMMAND INSTRUCTS EDN TO GO TO A LINE WHOSE NUMBER    @G@@@@      NA
)@@G@@    IS GIVEN.  IF THE NUMBER IS LARGER THAN THE CURRENT TEXT SIZE,@F@@@@NB
)@@G@@          EDN SAYS SO AND PERFORMS AN AUTOMATIC TOP.  IF A NUMBER @F@@@@NC
)@@G@@          OR SPACE STARTS AN EDN COMMAND, IT IS ASSUMED TO BE 'G'.@@@@@@ND
)@@G@@@G@@@@ N        THE 'N' COMMAND CAUSES THE LINE POINTER TO BE ADVANCED TNE
)@@G@@O     @G@@@@          THE NEXT NTH LINE.  IF THE NUMBER GIVEN IS NEGATIVNF
)@@G@@E, THE LINE @G@@@@          CURSOR IS BACKED UP OVER THAT NUMBER OF LINENG
)@@G@@S.  IF THE CHAR-  @G@@@@          ACTER '+' APPEARS IN COLUMN 1 OF AN EDNH
)@@G@@N COMMAND, THE COMMAND  @A@@@@          IS ASSUMED TO BE 'N'.     @[@@@@NI
)@@G@@      @F@@@@ U        THE 'U' COMMAND BEHAVES LIKE THE 'N' COMMAND WITH NJ
)@@G@@A     @F@@@@          NEGATIVE NUMBER SPECIFIED.  LIKEWISE, IF THE NUMBENK
)@@G@@R     @G@@@@          SPECIFIED ON THE 'U' COMMAND LINE IS NEGATIVE, THENL
)@@G@@ COMMAND    @G@@@@          BEHAVES LIKE A NORMAL COMMAND.  THE CHARACTENM
)@@G@@R '-' IN COL-     @F@@@@          UMN 1 IS THE SAME AS A 'U'.  NOTE: 'U'NN
)@@G@@ AND 'N' WITH A   @G@@@@          NEGATIVE NUMBER CAUSE AN AUTOMATIC TOPNO
)@@G@@ THEREBY FILING ANY     @C@@@@          CHANGES MADE SINCE THE LAST TOP.NP
)@@G@@)     @[@@@@      @G@@@@ T        THE 'T' COMMAND CAUSES EDN TO GO TO LINQ
)@@G@@NE 0. 'G 0', AND '0'    @C@@@@          ARE EQUIVALENT.  CHANGES ARE FILNR
)@@G@@ED.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@ X        'X' CAUSES EDN TO GO TO LINE 0, BUT CHNS
)@@G@@ANGES MADE SINCE THE    @F@@@@          LAST TOP WAS PERFORMED ARE FORGONT
)@@G@@TTEN.  IF YOU MAKE SOME @G@@@@          ERRONEOUS CHANGES AND WISH TO DINU
)@@G@@SCARD THEM, THE 'X' COMMAND   @ @@@@          IS VERY USEFUL.     @[@@@@NV
)@@G@@      @F@@@@ E        THE 'E' COMMAND SENDS EDN TO THE LAST LINE OF TEXTNW
)@@G@@.     @B@@@@          THE EDITOR REMAINS IN EDIT MODE.@[@@@@      @@@@@@NX
)@@G@@@@@@@@@^@@@@  2.      INPUT MODE    @[@@@@      @G@@@@          IN INPUTNY
)@@G@@ MODE, EDN ACCEPTS INPUT IMAGES AS DATA RATHER THAN   @G@@@@          ASNZ
)@@G@@ COMMANDS, AND INSERTS THEM INTO THE TEXT MUCH AS THE 'ELT' @G@@@@      OA
)@@G@@    OR 'DATA' PROCESSORS DO.  TO ENTER INPUT MODE FROM EDIT MODE, @F@@@@OB
)@@G@@          SIMPLY ENTER A BLANK LINE.  TO RETURN TO EDIT MODE FROM @C@@@@OC
)@@G@@          INPUT MODE, ENTER ANOTHER BLANK LINE. @[@@@@      @F@@@@      OD
)@@G@@    IN ADDITION, THE 'B' COMMAND CAUSES EDN TO GO TO THE END@F@@@@      OE
)@@G@@    OF TEXT AND ENTER INPUT MODE, ALLOWING INPUT IMAGES TO  @ @@@@      OF
)@@G@@    APPEND THE TEXT.    @[@@@@      @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@  3.      TERMINATOG
)@@G@@ION OF EDITING    @[@@@@      @E@@@@ FILE     'FILE' CAUSES EDN TO FILE OH
)@@G@@ANY OUTPUT, IF NOT IN   @F@@@@          READ ONLY MODE, AND TERMINATE.  OI
)@@G@@THE NUMBER OF LINES     @ @@@@          FILES IS DISPLAYED. @[@@@@      OJ
)@@G@@@F@@@@ END      'END' CAUSES EDN TO TERMINATE OMITTING ANY CHANGES.     OK
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@          IN ADDITION, IF AN EXEC 8 CONTROL CARD OR @EOL
)@@G@@OF CARD     @G@@@@          IS ENTERED IN EDIT OR INPUT MODE, EDN WILL TOM
)@@G@@ERMINATE, FILING  @C@@@@          THE OUTPUT IF NOT IN READ ONLY MODE.  ON
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @@@@@@@@@@@@@^@@@@  4.      LINE EDITING  @[@@@@      @F@@@@OO
)@@G@@ I        INSERT A LINE INTO THE TEXT FOLLOWING THE CURRENT LINE. @[@@@@OP
)@@G@@      @F@@@@ IB       INSERT A LINE INTO THE TEXT BEFORE THE CURRENT LINOQ
)@@G@@E.    @[@@@@      @C@@@@ R        REPLACE THE CURRENT LINE WITH ANOTHER.OR
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @E@@@@ A        OVERLAY THE CURRENT LINE WITH AN IMAGE PROVIOS
)@@G@@DED.  @E@@@@          ANY POSITION CONTAINING THE 'A' COMMAND'S TRANS-  OT
)@@G@@@D@@@@          PARENT CHARACTER (INITIALLY '@') WILL NOT BE@#@@@@      OU
)@@G@@    ALTERED.@@@@@@@F@@@@ S        SAVE (FILE) THE CURRENT, THEN PERFORM OV
)@@G@@AN 'A' COMMAND    @E@@@@          OPERATION.  'S' WITH NO IMAGE SPECIFIEOW
)@@G@@D WILL DUP- @E@@@@          LICATE THE CURRENT LINE.  THE 'A' COMMAND TROX
)@@G@@ANS-  @B@@@@          PARENT CHARACTER IS MEANINGFUL. @[@@@@      @F@@@@OY
)@@G@@ CN       CONCATENATE THE CURRENT LINE WITH THE IMAGE PROVIDED.   @@@@@@OZ
)@@G@@@F@@@@ CTC      CUT THE CURRENT LINE AT (DISCARD ALL CHARACTERS AFTER)  PA
)@@G@@@F@@@@          THE COLUMN POSITION SPECIFIED AS THE FIRST NUMBER.  IF  PB
)@@G@@@G@@@@          A SECOND NUMBER APPEARS ON THE COMMAND, CONTINUE FOR THAPC
)@@G@@T     @A@@@@          NUMBER MINUS 1 LINES.     @[@@@@      @F@@@@ CT   PD
)@@G@@    GENERAL LINE CUTTER.  'CT' ACCEPTS TWO COLUMN NUMBERS:  @F@@@@      PE
)@@G@@    THE FIRST SPECIFIES THE NUMBER OF COLUMNS TO DELETE     @G@@@@      PF
)@@G@@    FROM THE BEGINNING OF THE LINE, THE SECOND SPECIFIES THE NUM- @G@@@@PG
)@@G@@          BER OF COLUMNS TO TAKE OFF THE END OF THE LINE.  IF A THIRD   PH
)@@G@@@G@@@@          NUMBER IS GIVEN, CONTINUES FOR THAT NUMBER MINUS 1 LINESPI
)@@G@@.     @F@@@@          IF EITHER OF THE FIRST TWO NUMBERS ARE OMITTED OR PJ
)@@G@@0,    @D@@@@          THE RESPECTIVE END OF THE LINE IS UNCHANGED.@[@@@@PK
)@@G@@      @E@@@@ D        DELETE THE NUMBER OF LINES SPECIFIED, STARTING    PL
)@@G@@@D@@@@          WITH THE CURRENT LINE.  IF A SECOND FIELD IS@E@@@@      PM
)@@G@@    GIVEN, DELETE THE N1TH LINE THROUGH THE N2TH LINE,@B@@@@          REPN
)@@G@@LATIVE TO THE CURRENT LINE.   @@@@@@@E@@@@ C        CHANGE - THE FORMAT PO
)@@G@@OF THE CHANGE COMMAND IS:     @[@@@@      @ @@@@          C /STRING1/STRPP
)@@G@@ING2/ @[@@@@      @G@@@@          THE '/' IS A GENERAL DELIMITER, AND MAPQ
)@@G@@Y BE REPLACED BY ANY    @E@@@@          CHARACTER NOT APPEARING IN 'STRIPR
)@@G@@NG1' OR 'STRING2'.@F@@@@          IF THE LETTER 'G' FOLLOWS THE THIRD DEPS
)@@G@@LIMITER, ALL OC-  @F@@@@          CURRANCES OF 'STRING1' IN THE CURRENT PT
)@@G@@LINE ARE CHANGED  @F@@@@          'STRING2'.  IF A NUMBER FOLLOWS THE THPU
)@@G@@IRD DELIMITER, THE@F@@@@          CHANGE COMMAND CONTINUES FOR THAT NUMBPV
)@@G@@ER MINUS 1 LINES. @E@@@@          IN ADDITION, 'G' MAY FOLLOW A NUMBER SPW
)@@G@@O SPECIFIED.@F@@@@          IF THE LETTER 'A' FOLLOWS THE THIRD DELIMITEPX
)@@G@@R, EDN PER- @F@@@@          FORMS A TOP, THEN CHANGES ALL OCCURRANCES OFPY
)@@G@@ 'STRING1'  @B@@@@          TO 'STRING2' IN THE ENTIRE TEXT.@[@@@@      PZ
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@          ADDITIONAL INFORMATION ON THE 'I', 'IB', 'R', 'A' QA
)@@G@@AND 'S'     @G@@@@          COMMANDS:  THE FORMAT 'COMMAND+NUMBER' CAUSEQB
)@@G@@S THE NEW CHAR-   @E@@@@          ACTERS (LINE) TO BE STORED STARTING ATQC
)@@G@@ THE COLUMN @G@@@@          NUMBER SPECIFIED.  THUS, 'I+5 ABC' CAUSES THQD
)@@G@@E STRING 'ABC' TO @F@@@@          BE INSERTED AS A NEW LINE OF TEXT, STAQE
)@@G@@RTING AT COLUMN 5.@@@@@@@@@@@@@[@@@@      @^@@@@  5.      BLOCK EDITING QF
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @E@@@@ SPL      THE NUMBER OF LINES SPECIFIED ARE COPIED INTQG
)@@G@@O AN  @F@@@@          INTERNAL FILE.  THEY MAY BE ADDED LATER.  THE TEXTQH
)@@G@@ IS   @^@@@@          UNCHANGED.    @[@@@@      @E@@@@ SPD      THE NUMBQI
)@@G@@ER OF LINES SPECIFIED ARE COPIED AS IN    @F@@@@          THE CASE OF 'SQJ
)@@G@@PL', HOWEVER, THEY ARE ALSO DELETED FROM  @^@@@@          THE TEXT.     QK
)@@G@@@@@@@@@E@@@@ SPL!     A TOP IS PERFORMED, AND THE ENTIRE TEXT IS COPIED.QL
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@ SAVE     SAME AS 'SPL!', EXCEPT THE EDITOR RETURNS TOQM
)@@G@@ THE LINE THAT    @F@@@@          THAT WAS BEING EDITED WHEN THE 'SAVE' QN
)@@G@@WAS EXECUTED.     @@@@@@@G@@@@ AUTO     SPECIFIES THE NUMBER OF CORRECTIQO
)@@G@@ONS TO BE APPLIED BEFORE AN   @G@@@@          AUTOMATIC SAVE OF THE EDITQP
)@@G@@ED TEXT IS PERFORMED, AS IF A 'SAVE'@G@@@@          COMMAND HAD BEEN EXEQQ
)@@G@@CUTED.  IF THE NUMBER SPECIFIED IS LESS   @G@@@@          THAN OR EQUAL QR
)@@G@@TO ZERO, AUTO MODE IS TURNED OFF.  IT IS RECOM- @G@@@@          MENDED TQS
)@@G@@HAT BLOCK EDITING VIA 'SPL' TYPE COMMANDS NOT BE USED @G@@@@          IFQT
)@@G@@ IN AUTO MODE, AS THE SAME FILE ('SPLIT$') IS USED FOR BOTH.@G@@@@      QU
)@@G@@    IF IN INPUT MODE, AN AUTO SAVE IS DONE AFTER THE GIVEN NUMBER @G@@@@QV
)@@G@@          OF LINES HAS BEEN INPUT.  AUTO MODE IS SUSPENDED IF IN AN @ADDQW
)@@G@@@#@@@@          FILE.   @@@@@@@F@@@@ ADD      THE LAST BLOCK SPLIT FROM QX
)@@G@@THE TEXT IS INSERTED INTO     @G@@@@          THE TEXT FOLLOWING THE CURQY
)@@G@@RENT LINE.  THE NUMBER OF LINES     @F@@@@          ADDED IS DISPLAYED. QZ
)@@G@@ THE 'A' OPTION ON THE EDN CALL CARD@G@@@@          CAUSES AN 'ADD' COMMRA
)@@G@@AND TO BE FORCED DURING INITIALIZATION.   @F@@@@          THUS, IF DURINRB
)@@G@@G EDITING AN 'SAVE' IS EXECUTED SAVING    @G@@@@          THE EDITED TEXRC
)@@G@@T AND THE SYSTEM CRASHES, THE EDITED TEXT MAY   @G@@@@          BE RESTORD
)@@G@@RED WITH ONLY THOSE CHANGES MADE AFTER THE 'SAVE'     @ @@@@          HARE
)@@G@@VING BEEN LOST.   @]@@@@            @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@  6.      SAVING IRF
)@@G@@NDIVIDUAL LINES   @[@@@@      @E@@@@ HL       SAVES THE CURRENT LINE IN RG
)@@G@@AN INTERNAL EDN ARRAY.  @F@@@@          THE LINE MAY BE REENTERED LATER RH
)@@G@@ANYWHERE IN THE TEXT.   @[@@@@      @G@@@@ HD       SAME AS 'HL', BUT THRI
)@@G@@E LINE IS ALSO DELETED FROM THE TEXT.     @[@@@@      @E@@@@ EH       ENRJ
)@@G@@TERS A LINE INTO THE HOLD AREA FROM THE COMMAND,@A@@@@          RATHER TRK
)@@G@@HAN FROM THE TEXT.@@@@@@@D@@@@ PH       DISPLAYS ON THE TERMINAL THE LASRL
)@@G@@T LINE HELD.@[@@@@      @E@@@@ IH       INSERTS THE LAST LINE HELD INTO RM
)@@G@@THE TEXT FOLLOWING@ @@@@          THE CURRENT LINE.   @[@@@@      @D@@@@RN
)@@G@@ IHB      INSERTS A HELD LINE BEFORE THE CURRENT LINE.@[@@@@      @D@@@@RO
)@@G@@ RH       REPLACES THE CURRENT LINE WITH A HELD LINE. @[@@@@      @E@@@@RP
)@@G@@ AH       PERFORMS AN 'A' OPERATION ON THE CURRENT LINE WITH@ @@@@      RQ
)@@G@@    THE LAST LINE HELD. @[@@@@      @E@@@@ CH       CONCATENATES THE CURRR
)@@G@@RENT LINE WITH THE LINE IN THE@^@@@@          HOLD AREA.    @[@@@@      RS
)@@G@@@G@@@@          IF A NUMBER APPEARS ON THE 'IH', 'IHB', 'RH', OR 'AH COMRT
)@@G@@MANDS,@G@@@@          THE REQUESTED OPERATION WILL START AT THE COLUMN SRU
)@@G@@O SPECIFIED.@[@@@@      @@@@@@@@@@@@@^@@@@  7.      TEXT SEARCHING@[@@@@RV
)@@G@@      @G@@@@          THE COMMANDS 'L' AND 'F' ARE THE BASIC TEXT SEARCHRW
)@@G@@ING COM-    @G@@@@          ANDS. EACH SCANS ALL LINES FOLLOWING THE CURRX
)@@G@@RENT LINE FOR A   @G@@@@          MATCH ON THE STRING APPEARING ON THE CRY
)@@G@@OMMAND LINE.  THE DIF-  @G@@@@          FERENCE BETWEEN THE TWO IS THAT RZ
)@@G@@'L' WILL FIND THE SUBJECT     @G@@@@          STRING ANYWHERE IN THE TEXSA
)@@G@@T, WHILE 'F' MUST MATCH STARTING AT @G@@@@          THE COLUMN NUMBER ONSB
)@@G@@ THE COMMAND RELATIVE TO THE END OF THE   @ @@@@          OPERATION FIELSC
)@@G@@D.    @[@@@@      @#@@@@          EXAMPLE:@[@@@@      @#@@@@          L SD
)@@G@@1234  @[@@@@      @G@@@@          WILL FIND THE STRING '1234' ANYWHERE ISE
)@@G@@N THE TEXT.  ON THE     @^@@@@          OTHER HAND:   @[@@@@      @#@@@@SF
)@@G@@          F 1234  @[@@@@      @G@@@@          WILL FIND '1234' ONLY IF ISG
)@@G@@T STARTS IN COLUMN 1.  FURTHERMORE, @[@@@@      @#@@@@          F   1234SH
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @G@@@@          WILL FIND '1234' ONLY AT COLUMN 3.  THE FORMSI
)@@G@@AT 'F+NUMBER' IS  @G@@@@          LEGAL, AND WILL FIND THE STRING STARTISJ
)@@G@@NG AT THE COLUMN NUMBER @F@@@@          GIVEN.  THIS DISTINCTION HOLDS TSK
)@@G@@RUE FOR ALL SEARCHES.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@          IF THE SEARCH COMMANSL
)@@G@@D OPERATION FIELD IS TERMINATED WITH@F@@@@          A PERIOD, OR THE OPESM
)@@G@@RATION AND OPTIONAL NUMERIC FIELD   @G@@@@          FOR THE 'F' TYPE COMSN
)@@G@@MANDS, THE SEARCH WILL SUCCEED AT THE     @E@@@@          FIRST LINE NOTSO
)@@G@@ CONTAINING THE SUBJECT STRING.     @@@@@@@#@@@@          EXAMPLE:@@@@@@SP
)@@G@@@#@@@@          F 1234  @@@@@@@F@@@@          AS ABOVE, FINDS THE FIRST SQ
)@@G@@OCCURANCE OF '1234' AT COLUMN @^@@@@          ONE, WHILE:   @@@@@@@#@@@@SR
)@@G@@          F.1234  @@@@@@@G@@@@          FINDS THE FIRST LINE NOT CONTAINSS
)@@G@@ING '1234' STARTING AT COLUMN @G@@@@          ONE.  TO FIND THE FIRST BLST
)@@G@@ANK LINE FOLLOWING THE CURRENT LINE,@@@@@@@#@@@@          F.@     @@@@@@SU
)@@G@@@G@@@@          WILL WORK, AS LONG AS '@' RETAINS ITS INITIAL PROPERTY ASV
)@@G@@S THE @E@@@@          TRANSPARENT CHARACTER FOR 'F' AND 'L' COMMANDS.   SW
)@@G@@@G@@@@          LIKEWISE, TO FIND THE FIRST NON-OCCURANCE OF A BLANK IN SX
)@@G@@COL-  @F@@@@          UMN ONE (AN ASSEMBLY LANGUAGE LABEL, FOR INSTANCE)SY
)@@G@@,     @@@@@@@#@@@@          F. @    @@@@@@@^@@@@          WILL WORK.    SZ
)@@G@@@@@@@@@F@@@@          ** NOTE **  WHEN THE OPERATION FIELD IS TERMINATEDTA
)@@G@@ WITH @G@@@@          A PERIOD, THE PERIOD IS IN PLACE OF THE SPACE USUATB
)@@G@@LLY USED    @G@@@@          TO TERMINATE THE COMMAND FIELD.  THUS 'F.123TC
)@@G@@4' AND F. 1234'   @G@@@@          ARE NOT EQUIVALENT--THE FIRST FINDS THTD
)@@G@@E FIRST NON-OCCURANCE OF@H@@@@          '1234' AT COLUMN ONE, AND THE SETE
)@@G@@COND FINDS THE FIRST NON-OCCUR-     @G@@@@          ANCE OF '1234' AT COTF
)@@G@@LUMN TWO, WITH A BLANK IN COLUMN ONE.     @@@@@@@F@@@@ LP       LOCATE TTG
)@@G@@HE STRING GIVEN, PRINTING ALL LINES EXCEPT THE  @D@@@@          CURRENT TH
)@@G@@UP TO AND INCLUDING THE FOUND LINE. @[@@@@      @D@@@@ FP       SAME AS TI
)@@G@@'LP', WITH DISTINCTIONS NOTED ABOVE.@[@@@@      @G@@@@ LD       SIMILAR TJ
)@@G@@TO 'LP', BUT INSTEAD OF PRINTING THE LINES SCANNED,   @G@@@@          DETK
)@@G@@LETE THEM.  THE CURRENT LINE IS DELETED, THE FOUND LINE IS  @F@@@@      TL
)@@G@@    NOT.  THE SCAN STOPS AT THE LAST LINE EVEN IF NO FIND   @F@@@@      TM
)@@G@@    IS MADE, ALLOWING THE CHANGES TO BE UNDONE BY 'X'.  THE @A@@@@      TN
)@@G@@    SAME HOLDS TRUE FOR 'FD'. @[@@@@      @B@@@@ FD       SAME DISTINCTITO
)@@G@@ON AS NOTED ABOVE.@[@@@@      @G@@@@ LC       LOCATE ALL OCCURANCES OF TTP
)@@G@@HE GIVEN STRING FROM THE CURRENT    @A@@@@          LINE TO THE END OF TTQ
)@@G@@EXT.  @[@@@@      @^@@@@ FC       AS ABOVE.     @[@@@@      @F@@@@ LX   TR
)@@G@@    SAME AS 'LC', BUT THE FOUND LINES ARE DELETED.  'LX' AND@G@@@@      TS
)@@G@@    'FX' STOP AT THE LAST LINE, ALLOWING THE CHANGES TO BE UNDONE @B@@@@TT
)@@G@@          BY EXECUTING AN 'X' COMMAND.    @[@@@@      @^@@@@ FX       ASTU
)@@G@@ ABOVE.     @[@@@@      @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@  8.      PRINTING THE TEXT   TV
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @E@@@@ P        PRINT THE NUMBER OF LINES REQUESTED STARTINGTW
)@@G@@ WITH @F@@@@          THE CURRENT LINE.  IF A SECOND FIELD IS GIVEN, PRITX
)@@G@@NT    @F@@@@          FROM THE N1TH THROUGH THE N2TH LINE, RELATIVE TO TTY
)@@G@@HE    @^@@@@          CURRENT LINE. @[@@@@      @C@@@@ P!       DOES A TTZ
)@@G@@OP AND PRINTS THE ENTIRE TEXT.@[@@@@      @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@  9.      COUA
)@@G@@NTROL FUNCTIONS   @[@@@@      @G@@@@ MSG      THIS COMMAND SENDS A MESSAUB
)@@G@@GE TO THE 1108 CONSOLE, WITHOUT     @ @@@@          WAITING FOR A REPLY.UC
)@@G@@@@@@@@@F@@@@MSG*      THIS FORM OF THE MESSAGE COMMAND SENDS THE REQUESTUD
)@@G@@ED    @F@@@@          MESSAGE, BUT ALSO GETS A REPLY FROM THE OPERATOR. UE
)@@G@@ YOU  @G@@@@          CAN CONTINUE EDITING WHILE THE OPERATOR IS THINKINUF
)@@G@@G OF SOME-  @F@@@@          THING TO SAY--YOU WILL GET THE ANSWER WHEN IUG
)@@G@@T IS READY. @G@@@@          HOWEVER, IF YOUR LAST MESSAGE REMAINS UNANSWUH
)@@G@@ERED WHEN YOU TRY @G@@@@          TO TERMINATE EDN, YOU WILL GET A MESSAUI
)@@G@@GE SAYING THAT YOU ARE  @G@@@@          WAITING ON AN OUTSTANDING CONSOLUJ
)@@G@@E MESSAGE.  THE OPERATOR ALSO @G@@@@          GETS A MESSAGE ASKING HIM UK
)@@G@@TO ANSWER YOU.  YOU WILL TERMINATE  @C@@@@          NORMALLY WHEN THE MEUL
)@@G@@SSAGE IS ANSWERED.@@@@@@@A@@@@ @@X C   REMOTE BREAK CONTINGENCY   @E@@@@UM
)@@G@@          THE TERMINAL USER CAN REGAIN CONTROL DURING LONG  @F@@@@      UN
)@@G@@    SEQUENCES OF PRINTING (AN 'LP' THAT WAS MISTYPED, FOR   @F@@@@      UO
)@@G@@    INSTANCE) OR DURING AN ABNORMALLY LONG SPLIT, OR JUST   @F@@@@      UP
)@@G@@    WHEN SWAPPED OUT BY TYPING  @@X C  ON HIS TERMINAL.     @G@@@@      UQ
)@@G@@    WHEN EDN RECEIVES THE INTERRUPT, IT SAYS 'INTRPT RECEIVED.',  @G@@@@UR
)@@G@@          AND AS SOON AS IT IS SAFE TO DO SO, INTERRUPTS THE CURRENT    US
)@@G@@@E@@@@          COMMAND AND RETURNS CONTROL TO EDIT MODE, AFTER   @E@@@@UT
)@@G@@          TELLING YOU WHAT LINE YOU ARE AT.  IF THE MESSAGE,@F@@@@      UU
)@@G@@    'OPERATOR INTRPT.' APPEARS, THE OPERATOR HAS II'D YOUR  @E@@@@      UV
)@@G@@    RUN -- THIS USUALLY MEANS HE WANTS TO GET IN TOUCH@^@@@@          WIUW
)@@G@@TH YOU.     @[@@@@      @G@@@@          IF A REMOTE BREAK INTERRUPT OCCUUX
)@@G@@RS WHEN EDN IS PROCESSING     @F@@@@          INPUT AS A RESULT OF AN @AUY
)@@G@@DD CONTROL STATEMENT, THE     @E@@@@          REMOTE BREAK MESSAGE APPEAUZ
)@@G@@RS, AND THE REMAINDER OF@E@@@@          THE @ADD'D FILE IS DISCARDED, WIVA
)@@G@@TH AN APPROPRIATE @#@@@@          MESSAGE.@[@@@@      @G@@@@ INIT     THVB
)@@G@@E INIT COMMAND CAUSES EDN TO DISCARD ALL EDITING DONE SINCE @F@@@@      VC
)@@G@@    THE INITIAL CALL ON THE EDITOR.  IF THE 'A' OPTION WAS  @F@@@@      VD
)@@G@@    SPECIFIED, SPLIT$ IS NOT RECOVERED.  RATHER, THE TEXT   @G@@@@      VE
)@@G@@    SPECIFIED IN 'SPEC1' IS USED TO REINITIALIZE.  THIS FEATURE   @G@@@@VF
)@@G@@          YOU TO START EDITING AGAIN WITHOUT THE NEED TO TERMINATE VIA  VG
)@@G@@@G@@@@          'END' (OR 'RON' + CONTROL CARD) IF TOO MANY ERRONEOUS CHVH
)@@G@@ANGES @G@@@@          WERE MADE.  LIKEWISE, IF RECOVERY WAS SPECIFIED ANVI
)@@G@@D THE LAST  @G@@@@          SAVE WAS NO GOOD BECAUSE THE SYSTEM CRASHED VJ
)@@G@@WHILE DOING IT,   @G@@@@          YOU CAN GO BACK TO THE ORIGINAL TEXT WVK
)@@G@@ITHOUT RELOADING EDN.   @@@@@@@#@@@@ CSF$ PROCESSING  @F@@@@          CEVL
)@@G@@RTAIN EXEC 8 CONTROL STATEMENTS MAY BE SUBMITTED TO   @F@@@@          CSVM
)@@G@@F$ FOR PROCESSING -- THESE INCLUDE FACILITY STATEMENTS@E@@@@          ANVN
)@@G@@D A FEW OTHERS.  REFER TO THE PRM FOR DETAILS.  @F@@@@          EDN IS IVO
)@@G@@NSTRUCTED TO PRESENT A STATEMENT TO CSF$ BY     @A@@@@          TYPING AVP
)@@G@@ COMMAND AS SUCH: @[@@@@      @A@@@@          *COMMAND,OPTIONS  SPECS   VQ
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@          THE FORMAT IS THE SAME AS AN ORDINARY CONTROVR
)@@G@@L STATE-    @F@@@@          MENT SUBMITTED FROM THE RUNSTREAM WITH THE EVS
)@@G@@XCEPTION    @F@@@@          OF THE '*' IN COLUMN 1 REPLACING THE '@'.  EVT
)@@G@@DN SAYS     @E@@@@          'READY' IF THE STATEMENT WAS ACCEPTED, OTHERVU
)@@G@@WISE  @F@@@@          THE STATUS IS RETURNED.  IF A STATUS OF '777777777VV
)@@G@@777'  @E@@@@          IS RETURNED, EITHER THERE IS A SYNTAX ERROR IN THEVW
)@@G@@@F@@@@          STATEMENT, OR THE COMMAND CANNOT BE PROCESSED BY CSF$.  VX
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@ CC       THE COMMAND 'CC' TELLS YOU HOW MANY CHARACTEVY
)@@G@@RS ARE IN   @ @@@@          THE CURRENT LINE.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@ WHAT VZ
)@@G@@    'WHAT' TELLS YOU THE NAME OF YOUR OUTPUT FILE (ELEMENT) @ @@@@      WA
)@@G@@    IN CASE YOU FORGOT. @[@@@@      @B@@@@ LN       PRINTS THE CURRENT LWB
)@@G@@INE NUMBER. @[@@@@      @C@@@@ NL       PRINTS THE CURRENT SIZE OF THE TWC
)@@G@@EXT.  @[@@@@      @D@@@@ SC       PRINTS THE NUMBER OF LINES REMAINING TWD
)@@G@@O EOF.@[@@@@      @F@@@@ TD       REPRINTS THE EDN CALL LINE, WITH THE CWE
)@@G@@URRENT TIME/DATE. @[@@@@      @G@@@@ CS       PRINTS A COLUMN NUMBER SCAWF
)@@G@@LE.  YOU SPECIFY HOW LONG AND AT    @G@@@@          WHAT COLUMN YOU WISHWG
)@@G@@ IT TO START.  NO SPECIFICATION GIVES A   @D@@@@          A SCALE OF 72 WH
)@@G@@COLUMNS, STARTING AT COLUMN 1.@[@@@@      @F@@@@ TYPE     IF A TYPE IS GWI
)@@G@@IVEN, SETS THE SYMBOLIC SUB-TYPE OF THE   @F@@@@          OUTPUT ELEMENTWJ
)@@G@@.  IF NO TYPE IS GIVEN, DISPLAYS THE TYPE @F@@@@          THAT WILL BE UWK
)@@G@@SED WHEN THE OUTPUT IS FILED.  MEANINGLESS@C@@@@          IF THE OUTPUT WL
)@@G@@IS GOING TO A DATAFILE. @[@@@@      @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 10.      OTHER COWM
)@@G@@NTROL FUNCTIONS   @[@@@@      @E@@@@ TAB      SETS THE CHARACTER SPECIFIWN
)@@G@@ED AS THE TAB CHARACTER.@[@@@@      @F@@@@ SET      ACCEPTS UP TO TEN NUWO
)@@G@@MERIC FIELDS -- SETS TAB STOPS.     @D@@@@          TABS ARE ACTIVE ON TWP
)@@G@@HE FOLLOWING COMMANDS:  @F@@@@          'I', 'R', 'IB', 'A', 'S', AND THWQ
)@@G@@E CORRESPONDING HOLD    @E@@@@          COMMANDS, IF THE CURRENT TAB CHAWR
)@@G@@RACTER IS IN THE  @^@@@@          HELD LINE.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@      WS
)@@G@@    THE DEFAULT TAB CHARACTER IS ';'.  THE DEFAULT SETTINGS ARE   @^@@@@WT
)@@G@@          11, 21, 37.   @@@@@@@E@@@@ PON      TURN ON PROMPT MODE.  SAMEWU
)@@G@@ EFFECT AS 'P' OPTION.  @F@@@@          INPUT TO EDN IS SOLICITED WITH TWV
)@@G@@HE CURRENT POSITION OF  @F@@@@          THE LINE POINTER.  THE NUMBER ISWW
)@@G@@ AFFIXED WITH A ':' IF  @E@@@@          IN EDIT MODE, AND WITH A '*' IF WX
)@@G@@IN INPUT MODE.    @@@@@@@A@@@@ POFF     TURN OFF PROMPT MODE.     @@@@@@WY
)@@G@@@G@@@@ CONFR    ENTER THE CONFERENCE SYSTEM.  THE 'CONFR' COMMAND CAUSESWZ
)@@G@@ EDN  @G@@@@          TO SUSPEND THE CURRENT EDITING SESSION.  WHEN THE XA
)@@G@@CONFERENCE  @G@@@@          SYSTEM IS EXITED, EDITING RESUMES WHERE IT LXB
)@@G@@EFT OFF.  THIS    @G@@@@          FEATURE MAY NOT BE UNIVERSALLY AVAILABXC
)@@G@@LE:  IF NOT, EDN SAYS   @D@@@@          SO, AND IMMEDIATELY RETURNS TO EXD
)@@G@@DIT MODE.   @@@@@@@F@@@@ CHG      THIS COMMAND CAUSES EDN TO TELL YOU IFXE
)@@G@@ THE TEXT HAS BEEN@E@@@@          CHANGED AT ALL DURING THE CURRENT EDITXF
)@@G@@ING SESSION.@@@@@@@G@@@@ CHGT     CAUSES EDN TO TELL YOU IF THE TEXT HASXG
)@@G@@ BEEN CHANGED SINCE THE @A@@@@          LAST TOP WAS PERFORMED.   @@@@@@XH
)@@G@@@A@@@@ RON      TURN ON THE 'R' OPTION.   @@@@@@@A@@@@ ROFF     TURN OFFXI
)@@G@@ THE 'R' OPTION.  @[@@@@      @E@@@@ TCHA     SET THE TRANSPARENT CHARACXJ
)@@G@@TER FOR THE 'A' AND 'S' @E@@@@          COMMANDS.  THE TRANSPARENT CHARAXK
)@@G@@CTER FOR 'AH' IS  @C@@@@          BLANK (' '), AND IS UNCHANGEABLE.     XL
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @F@@@@ TCHF     SET THE TRANSPARENT CHARACTER FOR THE 'F' COXM
)@@G@@MMANDS.     @C@@@@          IT IS INITIALLY THE 'AT' SIGN ('@').  @[@@@@XN
)@@G@@      @E@@@@ TCHC     SPECIFY THAT A TRANSPARENT CHARACTER IS TO BE USEDXO
)@@G@@@F@@@@          ON THE 'C' COMMAND, AND SET IT TO THE CHARACTER GIVEN.  XP
)@@G@@@[@@@@      @E@@@@ TCHCX    TURN OFF USE OF THE TRANSPARENT CHARACTER FOXQ
)@@G@@R 'C'.@[@@@@      @F@@@@ TCHL     SPECIFY THAT THE TRANSPARENT CHARACTERXR
)@@G@@ FOR 'F' COMMANDS @B@@@@          IS TO BE USED FOR 'L' COMMANDS. @[@@@@XS
)@@G@@      @E@@@@ TCHLX    DISCONTINUE USE OF A TRANSPARENT CHARACTER FOR 'L'XT
)@@G@@@^@@@@          COMMANDS.     @[@@@@      @F@@@@ MSP      SET THE CHARACXU
)@@G@@TER TO BE TRANSLATED TO '@' IF APPEARING  @G@@@@          IN COLUMN 1 INXV
)@@G@@ A LINE ENTERED IN INPUT MODE.  INITIALLY '.'.  @[@@@@      @ @@@@ BR   XW
)@@G@@    SET BRIEF MODE.     @[@@@@      @C@@@@ V        SET VERIFY MODE -- NXX
)@@G@@ORMAL PRINTING.   @[@@@@      @E@@@@ SQON     SET SQUEEZE MODE -- NONSIGXY
)@@G@@NIFICANT BLANKS ARE     @C@@@@          SQUEEZED OUT OF LINES TO BE PRINXZ
)@@G@@TED.  @[@@@@      @B@@@@ SQOFF    TURN OFF THE 'SQON' COMMAND.    @[@@@@YA
)@@G@@      @F@@@@ LNON     LINE NUMBERING MODE -- PREFIX EACH LINE PRINTED WIYB
)@@G@@TH    @ @@@@          ITS LINE NUMBER.    @[@@@@      @C@@@@ LNOFF    TUYC
)@@G@@RNS OFF 'LNON' LINE NUMBERING MODE. @[@@@@      @G@@@@ COL      ACCEPTS YD
)@@G@@TWO NUMERIC FIELDS.  THE FIRST DEFINES THE COLUMN     @G@@@@          POYE
)@@G@@SITION TO START SCANNING FOR ALL 'L' AND THE 'C' COMMANDS.  @F@@@@      YF
)@@G@@    THE SECOND FIELD SETS THE COLUMN NUMBER AT WHICH TO     @G@@@@      YG
)@@G@@    STOP THE SCAN.  IF EITHER FIELD IS OMITTED, THE CORRESPONDING @A@@@@YH
)@@G@@          PARAMETER IS UNCHANGED.   @[@@@@      @F@@@@ IDLE     ALLOWS TYI
)@@G@@HE USER TO LEAVE THE TERMINAL FOR A FEW MOMENTS @G@@@@          WITHOUT YJ
)@@G@@FEAR OF TIMING OUT AND LOSING HIS WORK.  ANY LINE IN- @D@@@@          PUYK
)@@G@@T OR @EOF WILL RETURN EDN TO EDIT MODE.   @[@@@@      @E@@@@ PLM      SEYL
)@@G@@TS THE MAXIMUM NUMBER OF WORDS TO PRINT WHEN A  @A@@@@          LINE IS YM
)@@G@@TO BE PRINTED.    @[@@@@      @G@@@@ SAV      SPECIFIES THE MAXIMUM WORDYN
)@@G@@ SIZE TO WHICH A LINE MAY EXPAND    @ @@@@          DURING EDITING.     YO
)@@G@@@@@@@@@#@@@@ 11.      NOTES   @@@@@@@F@@@@       A. EDN PROVIDES ERROR RYP
)@@G@@ECOVERY FOR CSF$ SYNTAX ERRORS, ALL @G@@@@          SYMBIONT ERRORS, ANDYQ
)@@G@@ NON-CRITICAL I/O ERRORS, FOR INSTANCE,   @F@@@@          ON THE FILE 'SYR
)@@G@@PLIT$'.  SHOULD EDN ENCOUNTER AN ERROR    @F@@@@          FROM WHICH IT YS
)@@G@@CANNOT RECOVER, EDITING IS TERMINATED IM- @G@@@@          MEDIATELY WITHYT
)@@G@@OUT FILING ANY CHANGES.  THE NAME OF THE LAST   @G@@@@          INPUT SCYU
)@@G@@RATCH FILE IS DISPLAYED, HOWEVER, AND ALL CHANGES UP  @G@@@@          TOYV
)@@G@@ THE TIME THAT A TOP WAS LAST PERFORMED CAN BY RECOVERED BY @E@@@@      YW
)@@G@@    ENTERING THE FOLLOWING CONTROL CARD SEQUENCE:     @[@@@@      @G@@@@YX
)@@G@@          @COPY EDN$$F.,SPLIT$.   (WHERE 'EDN$$F' IS THE NAME GIVEN.)   YY
)@@G@@@A@@@@          @EDN,A SPECIFICATIONS     @@@@@@@E@@@@       B. WHEN A LYZ
)@@G@@INE IS DELETED FROM THE TEXT, OR WHEN THE @F@@@@          CURRENT LINE IZA
)@@G@@S LINE 0, THE LINE CURSOR IS AT A 'HOLE'  @G@@@@          IN THE TEXT.  ZB
)@@G@@WHEREAS SOME EDITORS WILL NOT ALLOW AN 'R' TYPE @F@@@@          COMMAND ZC
)@@G@@AT THIS TIME, EDN DOES, AND WILL CHANGE IT OR AN@E@@@@          'RH' COMZD
)@@G@@MAND TO THE APPROPRIATE INSERT COMMAND.   @@@@@@@F@@@@       C. ONLY THEZE
)@@G@@ 'FILE' COMMAND WILL CAUSE EDN TO FILE AN EMPTY @G@@@@          TEXT, I.ZF
)@@G@@E., ONE WITH NUMBER OF LINES = 0.  EXITING FROM EDN   @G@@@@          VIZG
)@@G@@A @EOF OR AN EXEC 8 CONTROL STATEMENT WILL NOT FILE 0 LINES.@G@@@@      ZH
)@@G@@    THIS IS USEFUL IN CASE A MISTYPE OR MISSPELLING OF THE 'SPEC1'@F@@@@ZI
)@@G@@          ELEMENT NAME WOULD CAUSE EDN TO CREATE A NEW ELEMENT.   @G@@@@ZJ
)@@G@@          MERELY RETYPING THE @EDN STATEMENT WILL NOT INSERT AN EMPTY   ZK
)@@G@@@B@@@@          ELEMENT INTO YOUR PROGRAM FILE. ___IC FIELDS -- SETS TABZL
)@@G@@ STOPS.     @D@@@@      *[@@@@*SDFF*@F@@@@       THE LONG VERSION OF THIZM
)@@G@@S ITEM IS A USER'S GUIDE FOR NPL.   @[@@@@******@[@@@@*****^@@@@@@@@@@@@ZN
