)@@G@@+ 1 +                                                   +   @F@@@@      XG
)@@G@@    .+---------+---------+---------+---------+---------+.   @F@@@@      XH
)@@G@@0.0E+ 0   1.0E+ 0   2.0E+ 0   3.0E+ 0   4.0E+ 0   5.0E+ 0   @[@@@@*****^XI
)@@G@@@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       XJ
)@@G@@12-  3@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ AS ILLUSTRATED IN THE EXAMPLEXK
)@@G@@,  THE POINTS PLOTTED ARE REPRESENTED     @G@@@@ BY  ASTERISKS  ('*').  XL
)@@G@@ A POINT MAY ALSO BE REPRESENTED AS A POUND     @G@@@@ SIGN  ('#').    TXM
)@@G@@HIS OCCURS WHEN THE POINT IN QUESTION HAS ALREADY     @G@@@@ BEEN PLOTTEXN
)@@G@@D,  AND IS A SIGNAL THAT THE GRAPH INTERSECTS ITSELF AT     @#@@@@ THIS XO
)@@G@@LOCATION.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@C@@@@ THE SAME RESULT COULD HAVE BEEN OBTAINED XP
)@@G@@BY:   @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@               PLOT X,Y,16,5,3,'SPEC'     @@@@@@XQ
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF X(17) = 0.00,  X(18) = 1.00 (UNITS/INCH),  Y(17) = -100.XR
)@@G@@0,  AND     @ @@@@ Y(18) = 20.0 (UNITS/INCH).   @@@@@@@@@@@@@^@@@@ 12. 4XS
)@@G@@.   LINE SPACING  @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'PLOT'  STATEMENT  SPACES  ONEXT
)@@G@@  LINE BEFORE THE GRAPH AND ONE     @G@@@@ AFTER IT,  BUT DOES NOT PERFOXU
)@@G@@RM A PAGE RESTORE.   THUS THE PROGRAM     @G@@@@ EXECUTING THE 'PLOT' STXV
)@@G@@ATEMENT CAN LABEL THE GRAPH AT BOTH TOP AND     @]@@@@ BOTTOM.    @[@@@@XW
)@@G@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23 XX
)@@G@@      13-  1@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@ 13.   COMPILER/INTERPRETER INTERFACXY
)@@G@@E     @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 13. 1.   THE EVAL STATEMENT  XZ
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE 'EVAL' STATEMENT PROVIDES A MEANS FOR A PROGRAM TYA
)@@G@@O CALL ON THE     @G@@@@ NPL  COMPILER TO ENCODE A STRING EXPRESSION ANDYB
)@@G@@ THE INTERPRETER TO     @G@@@@ EVALUATE THE RESULT OF THIS COMPILATION, YC
)@@G@@RETURNING A NUMERIC VALUE     @G@@@@ THAT  IS  ASSIGNED  TO  A  SPECIFIEYD
)@@G@@D VARIABLE.   THE FORMAT OF THE     @^@@@@ 'EVAL' STATEMENT IS:   @@@@@@YE
)@@G@@@@@@@@@B@@@@                EVAL <VARIABLE> = <STRING>@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@YF
)@@G@@ <STRING>   IS  ANY  STRING  OR  STRING  EXPRESSION  WHICH,    UPON     YG
)@@G@@@G@@@@ COMPILATION, CAN BE EVALUATED AS A NUMERIC EXPRESSION.  THE STRINYH
)@@G@@G     @G@@@@ IS  COMPILED  AND EVALUATED,  AND THE RESULT OF THE SCAN ISYI
)@@G@@ STORED     @G@@@@ INTO  <VARIABLE>,   WHICH  MAY  BE  ANY  VARIABLE,  SYJ
)@@G@@UBSCRIPTED OR     @E@@@@ UNSUBSCRIPTED.  MIXED MODE IS HANDLED AUTOMATICYK
)@@G@@ALLY BY NPL.@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'EVAL'  STATEMENT  GIVES  A PROGRAM YL
)@@G@@THE ABILITY TO FORMAT AND     @G@@@@ EXECUTE  THE  EQUIVALENT  OF  AN ASYM
)@@G@@SIGNMENT STATEMENT AT EXECUTION     @G@@@@ TIME.    THE  EXPRESSION EVALYN
)@@G@@UATED IN THIS WAY CAN BE INPUT TO THE     @G@@@@ PROGRAM, OR CREATED BY YO
)@@G@@THE PROGRAM ITSELF USING THE VARIOUS STRING     @A@@@@ MANIPULATION FACIYP
)@@G@@LITIES OF NPL.    @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING YQ
)@@G@@LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       14-  1@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 14.   STACKYR
)@@G@@ AND QUEUE MANIPULATION @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@#@@@@ 14. 1.   GEYS
)@@G@@NERAL @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ NPL PROVIDES TWO SETS OF STATEMENTS FOR THE HANYT
)@@G@@DLING OF STACKS AND     @G@@@@ QUEUES:   THE 'PUSH' AND 'PUSHQ' STATEMENYU
)@@G@@TS, WHICH ADD ELEMENTS TO     @G@@@@ A  STACK OR QUEUE,  RESPECTIVELY,  YV
)@@G@@AND THE CORRESPONDING 'POP' AND     @G@@@@ 'POPQ'  STATEMENTS,  WHICH REYW
)@@G@@MOVE THE NEXT ELEMENT FROM A STACK OR     @]@@@@ QUEUE.     @@@@@@@@@@@@YX
)@@G@@@G@@@@ FOR PURPOSES OF IMPROVING READABILITY, AND TO HELP DISTINGUISH THYY
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ STACK  OPERATIONS  FROM  THE  QUEUE  OPERATIONS,  'PUSHS' HYZ
)@@G@@AS BEEN     @G@@@@ PROVIDED  AS  A  SYNONYM  FOR 'PUSH',  AND 'POPS' AS ZA
)@@G@@A SYNONYM FOR     @]@@@@ 'POP'.     @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@ 14. 2.   THE PUSHZB
)@@G@@ AND PUSHQ STATEMENTS   @@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@ THE FORMAT OF THE 'PUSH' AND ZC
)@@G@@'PUSHQ' STATEMENTS IS:  @@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@             PUSH <EXPR>,<STACZD
)@@G@@K>[.<QUAL>][,<OVERFLOW>]@E@@@@             PUSHQ <EXPR>,<QUEUE>[.<QUAL>]ZE
)@@G@@[,<OVERFLOW>]     @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ <EXPR> IS A NUMERIC EXPRESSION, WHIZF
)@@G@@CH, WHEN EVALUATED, WILL BE THE     @G@@@@ VALUE  OF THE ITEM TO BE PUSHZG
)@@G@@ED ONTO THE STACK OR QUEUE.  <STACK>,     @G@@@@ OR  <QUEUE>,   EITHER  ZH
)@@G@@OF WHICH MAY BE QUALIFIED,  IS THE STACK OR     @G@@@@ QUEUE NAME.   (THZI
)@@G@@E STACK OR QUEUE POINTER, WHICH WILL BE BITS 17-0     @G@@@@ OF THE BASEZJ
)@@G@@ ADDRESS OF THE ARRAY,  MAY NOT BE QUALIFIED.)  FOR THE     @G@@@@ 'PUSHZK
)@@G@@Q' STATEMENT, THE ADDRESS <QUEUE> MUST BE THE BASE ADDRESS OF     @G@@@@ZL
)@@G@@ THE  ARRAY.    FOR  'PUSH',  <STACK> IS THE BASE ADDRESS,  AND THE     ZM
)@@G@@@G@@@@ ADDRESS OF <STACK> PLUS ONE IS THE ADDRESS OF THE FIRST DATA WORDZN
)@@G@@.     @G@@@@ IF A STACK OVERFLOW OCCURS, CONTROL WILL BE GIVEN TO THE STZO
)@@G@@ATEMENT     @G@@@@ LABELED <OVERFLOW>.   IF THIS LABEL IS OMITTED, NPL AZP
)@@G@@SSUMES THAT A     @G@@@@ STATEMENT LABELED 'OVRFL' HAS BEEN INCLUDED IN ZQ
)@@G@@THE PROGRAM,    AND     @A@@@@ CONTROL WILL BE TRANSFERRED TO IT. @@@@@@ZR
)@@G@@@@@@@@@B@@@@ 14. 3.   THE POP AND POPQ STATEMENTS     @@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@ZS
)@@G@@ THE FORMAT OF THE 'POP' AND 'POPQ' STATEMENTS IS:    @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@ZT
)@@G@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       14-  2ZU
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@E@@@@        POP [<ITEM>[.<QUAL>]],<STACKZV
)@@G@@>[.<QUAL>][,<UNDERFLOW>]@F@@@@        POPQ [<ITEM>[.<QUAL>]],<QUEUE>[.<QZW
)@@G@@UAL>][,<UNDERFLOW>]     @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  TOP  OF <STACK>,  OR THEZX
)@@G@@ FRONT OF <QUEUE> IS POPPED,  AND THE     @G@@@@ VALUE FOUND THERE IS STZY
)@@G@@ORED INTO <ITEM>, IF PRESENT.  IF <ITEM> IS     @G@@@@ OMITTED, THE STACZZ
)@@G@@K OR QUEUE IS POPPED AND THE VALUE DISCARDED.  IF     @G@@@@ THE  STACK AA
)@@G@@ OR  QUEUE  IS  EMPTY,   CONTROL  IS TRANSFERRED TO THE     @G@@@@ STATEAB
)@@G@@MENT  LABELED  <UNDERFLOW>.    IF THIS LABEL IS OMITTED,  NPL     @#@@@@AC
)@@G@@ ASSUMES 'UNDFL'. @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  POINTER  TO THE FRONT OF THE QAD
)@@G@@UEUE IS IN THE BASE CELL OF THE     @^@@@@ ARRAY, IN BITS 35-18.  @@@@@@AE
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF  EITHER THE STACK POINTER OR THE QUEUE POINTERS ARE NEGAAF
)@@G@@TIVE OR     @A@@@@ OUT OF RANGE, AN ERROR WILL RESULT.@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@AG
)@@G@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       15-  1AH
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@#@@@@ 15.   SUBROUTINES@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@AI
)@@G@@@ @@@@ 15. 1.   THE BRANCH STATEMENT@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'BRANCH'  STAJ
)@@G@@ATEMENT  IS  USED TO ENTER AN ALTERNATE EXECUTION     @G@@@@ PATH  IN A AK
)@@G@@PROGRAM,  SAVING THE RETURN POINT SO THAT EXECUTION CAN     @G@@@@ RESUMAL
)@@G@@E  LATER WHERE IT LEFT OFF.   THE 'BRANCH' STATEMENT IS CODED     @[@@@@AM
)@@G@@ AS:  @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@                    BRANCH <IDENT>  @@@@@@@@@@@@AN
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WHERE  <IDENT>  IS THE LABEL OF A STATEMENT TO WHICH CONTROL IS TAO
)@@G@@O     @G@@@@ BE  GIVEN.    NO  ARGUMENTS  MAY  BE  PASSED,   BUT FOR SUBAP
)@@G@@ROUTINE     @G@@@@ REFERENCES  NOT  REQUIRING  THE  PASSING OF ARGUMENTSAQ
)@@G@@ THE 'BRANCH'     @G@@@@ STATEMENT  INVOLVES  CONSIDERABLY  LESS OVERHEAAR
)@@G@@D THAN THE USE OF A     @ @@@@ PROGRAM AS A SUBROUTINE.     @@@@@@@@@@@@AS
)@@G@@@ @@@@ 15. 2.   THE RETURN STATEMENT@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'RETURN'  STAT
)@@G@@ATEMENT  IS  USED TO TRANSFER CONTROL BACK TO THE     @G@@@@ STATEMENT  AU
)@@G@@ IMMEDIATELY  FOLLOWING  THE  LAST  'BRANCH'  STATEMENT     @G@@@@ EXECUAV
)@@G@@TED.    IF  NO  'BRANCH'  STATEMENT  HAD  BEEN EXECUTED,  THE     @A@@@@AW
)@@G@@ 'RETURN' STATEMENT IS IGNORED.     @@@@@@@@@@@@@]@@@@ FORMAT:    @@@@@@AX
)@@G@@@@@@@@@ @@@@                    RETURN    @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 15. 3.   COAY
)@@G@@NTINGENCY HANDLING@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ NPL PROVIDES USER PROGRAMS A MEANS AZ
)@@G@@OF PROCESSING ERRORS,  BOTH NPL     @G@@@@ AND EXEC8 CONTINGENCIES,  THABA
)@@G@@T MIGHT OCCUR DURING THE EXECUTION OF     @G@@@@ A PROGRAM.  CONTINGENCYBB
)@@G@@ PROCESSING IS CONSIDERED A SPECIAL KIND OF     @G@@@@ SUBROUTINE.    TOBC
)@@G@@  SPECIFY  THAT ERRORS ARE TO BE PROCESSED BY THE     @E@@@@ CURRENTLY EBD
)@@G@@XECUTING PROGRAM, THE 'TRAP' STATEMENT IS USED. @@@@@@@@@@@@@[@@@@*****^BE
)@@G@@@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       BF
)@@G@@15-  2@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ FORMAT OF THE 'TRAP' STATEMENT IS: @@@@@@BG
)@@G@@@@@@@@@A@@@@                    TRAP <IDENT>[*] @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ WHEREBH
)@@G@@  <IDENT>  IS THE LABEL OF A STATEMENT WHERE CONTROL IS TO BE     @G@@@@BI
)@@G@@ GIVEN  IN  THE  EVENT  OF AN ERROR OR CONTINGENCY.   THE STATEMENT     BJ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WHOSE  LABEL  IS <IDENT> AND THE STATEMENTS FOLLOWING ARE EXECUTEBK
)@@G@@D     @G@@@@ AS  IF  A  'BRANCH'  STATEMENT  HAD  BEEN EXECUTED.   THUS,BL
)@@G@@  AFTER     @G@@@@ PROCESSING THE ERROR, THE PROGRAM CAN RETURN TO THE NBM
)@@G@@EXT STATEMENT     @G@@@@ THAT  WOULD  HAVE  BEEN  EXECUTED  HAD  THE  ERBN
)@@G@@ROR NOT OCCURRED BY     @G@@@@ EXECUTING A 'RETURN'.  IF AN ERROR OCCURSBO
)@@G@@ DURING ERROR PROCESSING,     @ @@@@ STANDARD ACTION IS TAKEN.    @@@@@@BP
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF THE OPTIONAL ASTERISK APPEARS,  ALL ERRORS WILL BE TRAPPBQ
)@@G@@ED.  IF     @E@@@@ THE ASTERISK IS ABSENT, ONLY FATAL ERRORS ARE TRAPPEDBR
)@@G@@.     @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ INFORMATION   CONCERNING   THE  ERROR  THAT  WABS
)@@G@@S  TRAPPED  CAN  BE     @G@@@@ REFERENCED  BY  INSPECTING  THE IMPLICIT BT
)@@G@@ARRAY 'ERR'.   'ERR' IS A     @A@@@@ FOUR WORD ARRAY WHOSE FORMAT IS    BU
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@C@@@@                ERR(0)   H1 -  STATEMENT NUMBER.@C@@@@BV
)@@G@@                         S4 -  PROGRAM LEVEL.   @B@@@@                  BW
)@@G@@       T3 -  ERROR CODE.@E@@@@                ERR(1)   THE ITEM IN ERRORBX
)@@G@@, IF APPROPRIATE. @E@@@@                ERR(2)   FIRST WORD OF THE EXEC8BY
)@@G@@ CONTINGENCY@E@@@@                         PACKET - MEANINGFUL ONLY IF TBZ
)@@G@@HE    @C@@@@                         ERROR WAS CODE 18.     @E@@@@      CA
)@@G@@          ERR(3)   SECOND WORD OF THE CONTINGENCY     @A@@@@            CB
)@@G@@             PACKET.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ REFER TO THE 1108 EXEC8 PRM FCC
)@@G@@OR DETAILS CONCERNING THE CONTENTS OF     @G@@@@ ERR(2)  AND ERR(3).   RCD
)@@G@@EFER TO APPENDIX C 'NPL ERROR CODES' FOR AN     @B@@@@ EXPLANATION OF THCE
)@@G@@E CONTENTS OF ERR(0).   @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF  ERROR PROCESSING IS TO BECF
)@@G@@ TURNED OFF,  THE 'TRAP' STATEMENT IS     @C@@@@ EXECUTED WITH NOTHING ICG
)@@G@@N THE <IDENT> FIELD:    @@@@@@@@@@@@@^@@@@                    TRAP@@@@@@CH
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ ANY  SUBSEQUENT  ERRORS  CAUSE  PROGRAM TERMINATION AS IF ACI
)@@G@@ 'TRAP'     @A@@@@ STATEMENT HAD NEVER BEEN EXECUTED. @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@CJ
)@@G@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       15-  3CK
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ EACH PROGRAM IN A SET OF NESTED PROCL
)@@G@@GRAMS CAN SPECIFY ITS OWN ERROR     @G@@@@ SUBROUTINE,   BUT  IF A PROGRCM
)@@G@@AM IS CALLED THAT DOES NOT SPECIFY AN     @G@@@@ ERROR ROUTINE AND AN ERCN
)@@G@@ROR OCCURS, ALL PROGRAMS NESTED AND STACKED     @G@@@@ ARE  TERMINATED, CO
)@@G@@  EVEN  IF  ONE  OR  MORE  OF  THEM DO HAVE ERROR     @]@@@@ ROUTINES.  CP
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 15. 4.   THE SUBEND STATEMENT@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  CQ
)@@G@@SUBEND  STATEMENT  IS  USED  TO  TELL  THE INTERPRETER THAT A     @G@@@@CR
)@@G@@ SUBROUTINE  OR  ERROR  ROUTINE  IS FINISHED,  BUT DOES NOT WANT TO     CS
)@@G@@@G@@@@ RETURN TO ITS REENTRY POINT.  THE EFFECT OF THE 'SUBEND' STATEMENCT
)@@G@@T     @G@@@@ IS  TO  EXECUTE  THE  REMAINDER OF THE SUBROUTINE OR ERROR CU
)@@G@@ROUTINE     @G@@@@ CALL  AS IF THE 'GO' DIRECTIVE WERE EXECUTED GIVING CCV
)@@G@@ONTROL TO IT.     @G@@@@ SUBSEQUENT  EXECUTION OF A 'RETURN' STATEMENT WCW
)@@G@@ILL CAUSE RETURN TO     @G@@@@ THE  PREVIOUSLY SAVED REENTRY POINT,  OR,CX
)@@G@@  IF NO OTHER SUBROUTINES     @A@@@@ HAD BEEN ENTERED, WILL BE IGNORED. CY
)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   RCZ
)@@G@@EV.23       16-  1@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 16.   TRANSFER OF CONTROL    DA
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 16. 1.   THE GO (GOTO) STATEMENT   DB
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'GO'  STATEMENT IS USED TO CAUSE A PROGRAM BRANCDC
)@@G@@H.   THE 'GO'     @A@@@@ STATEMENT HAS THE FOLLOWING FORMAT:@@@@@@@@@@@@DD
)@@G@@@ @@@@                    GO <IDENT>@A@@@@                    GOTO <IDENDE
)@@G@@T>    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ WHERE  <IDENT>  IS  A  DEFINED  LABEL  IN  THE DF
)@@G@@CURRENTLY EXECUTING     @G@@@@ PROGRAM.    THE 'GO' STATEMENT MAY NOT BEDG
)@@G@@ USED TO TRANSFER CONTROL     @G@@@@ TO A STATEMENT WITHIN THE BODY OF ADH
)@@G@@NOTHER PROGRAM.  A PROGRAM CALL     @G@@@@ WITH NONSTANDARD ENTRY MUST BDI
)@@G@@E EXECUTED TO ACCOMPLISH THIS.   'GO'     @ @@@@ AND 'GOTO' ARE SYNONOMODJ
)@@G@@US.   @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NDK
)@@G@@PL   REV.23       17-  1@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 17.   CONDITIONAL STATEDL
)@@G@@MENTS @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@#@@@@ 17. 1.   GENERAL @@@@@@@@@@@@DM
)@@G@@@G@@@@ NPL  RECOGNIZES  FOUR  KINDS OF CONDITIONAL STATEMENTS.   THE MOSDN
)@@G@@T     @G@@@@ GENERAL  ARE  THE  'IF'  AND  'UNLESS'  STATEMENTS.   THE 'DO
)@@G@@ON' AND     @G@@@@ 'ROUTE'  STATEMENTS  ARE SPECIAL CONDITIONALS.   ALL DP
)@@G@@ARE DISCUSSED     @#@@@@ SEPARATELY BELOW.@@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@ 17. 2.   THDQ
)@@G@@E IF AND UNLESS STATEMENTS    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  FORMAT OF THE 'IF'DR
)@@G@@ ('WHEN' IS AN ACCEPTABLE SYNONYM FOR 'IF')     @B@@@@ AND 'UNLESS' STATDS
)@@G@@EMENTS IS AS FOLLOWS:   @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@                    IF <EXPR>,DT
)@@G@@ <STATEMENT>@C@@@@                    UNLESS <EXPR>, <STATEMENT>  @@@@@@DU
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'IF' STATEMENT SUCCEEDS AND EXECUTES <STATEMENT> IF <EDV
)@@G@@XPR> IS     @G@@@@ TRUE.   THE 'UNLESS' PERFORMS THE REVERSE,  AND IS EQDW
)@@G@@UIVALENT TO A     @G@@@@ STATEMENT  OF  THE  FORM  'IF  NOT(EXPR),...'. DX
)@@G@@  FOR EXAMPLE,  THE     @G@@@@ FOLLOWING  TWO  COMPOUND CONDITIONALS BOTDY
)@@G@@H RESULT IN A TRANSFER TO     @]@@@@ 'LABEL':   @@@@@@@@@@@@@E@@@@      DZ
)@@G@@       IF BOOL(A) = TRUE, UNLESS B ! C, GOTO LABEL    @E@@@@            EA
)@@G@@ IF (BOOL(A) = TRUE) & NOT(B ! C), GOTO LABEL   @@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@ ASSUMEB
)@@G@@ING A IS NONZERO AND B AND C ARE BOTH ZERO.     @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF  EEC
)@@G@@ITHER CONDITIONAL FAILS,  <STATEMENT> IS BYPASSED AND CONTROL     @G@@@@ED
)@@G@@ PASSES  TO THE NEXT STATEMENT INLINE.  <STATEMENT> MAY BE LABELED,     EE
)@@G@@@G@@@@ HOWEVER,   THE  ENTIRE  COMPOUND  CONDITIONAL MAY HAVE AT MOST ONEF
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ LABEL.    AS  THE  EXAMPLE  ILLUSTRATES,   NESTING  OF CONDEG
)@@G@@ITIONAL     @G@@@@ STATEMENTS  IS  ALLOWED,   AND  MAY  CONTINUE TO AS MEH
)@@G@@ANY LEVELS AS     @]@@@@ DESIRED.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ <EXPR> MAY BE A NEI
)@@G@@UMERIC EXPRESSION OR A STRING EXPRESSION.   IF IT     @G@@@@ IS  A  NUMEEJ
)@@G@@RIC  EXPRESSION,   THE  EXECUTION  OF  THE  CONDITIONAL     @[@@@@*****^EK
)@@G@@@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       EL
)@@G@@17-  2@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ STATEMENT  IS  EXACTLY  AS OUTLINED ABOVEEM
)@@G@@.   IF <EXPR> IS A STRING     @G@@@@ EXPRESSION, THE STATEMENT SUCCEEDS,EN
)@@G@@ GIVING CONTROL TO <STATEMENT>,     @G@@@@ ONLY IF ALL PATTERN MATCHES IEO
)@@G@@N THE STRING EXPRESSION SUCCEED.   IF     @G@@@@ THE  STRING  EXPRESSIONEP
)@@G@@  DOES  NOT  HAVE ANY PATTERN MATCHES,  THE     @G@@@@ CONDITIONAL STATEEQ
)@@G@@MENT WILL SUCCEED OR FAIL DEPENDING ON THE RESULT     @G@@@@ OF  THE LASER
)@@G@@T PATTERN MATCH EXECUTED PRIOR TO EXECUTION OF THE 'IF'     @^@@@@ OR 'UES
)@@G@@NLESS' STATEMENT. @@@@@@@@@@@@@]@@@@ EXAMPLE:   @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@      ET
)@@G@@              IF 'ABC', GO LABEL    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ SINCE  'ABC'  DOEEU
)@@G@@S  NOT CALL FOR A PATTERN MATCH,  CONTROL WILL BE     @G@@@@ TRANSFERREDEV
)@@G@@  TO  'LABEL'  ONLY IF THE LAST PATTERN MATCH PERFORMED     @G@@@@ SUCCEEW
)@@G@@EDED.  IN THE FOLLOWING EXAMPLE CONTROL IS NOT TRANSFERRED TO     @B@@@@EX
)@@G@@ 'TAG' BECAUSE THE PATTERN MATCH FAILS:   @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@            EY
)@@G@@        IF 'ABC'='ACB', GO TAG@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  NUMERIC VALUE CAUSEZ
)@@G@@ING CONDITIONAL EXECUTION OF <STATEMENT> IN     @G@@@@ A  CONDITIONAL  SFA
)@@G@@TATEMENT  TESTING  PATTERN  MATCHING IS THE VALUE     @G@@@@ FOUND IN BIFB
)@@G@@TS 35-18 OF 'MATCH' (ALTERNATION COMPONENT).   THUS, IF     @G@@@@ 'MATCFC
)@@G@@H'  IS  RETURNED FROM A PATTERN MATCH WITH THE VALUE -1,  THE     @G@@@@FD
)@@G@@ VALUE  OF  MATCH.H1  IS  -0  (ALL  BITS SET),  AND THE CONDITIONAL     FE
)@@G@@@G@@@@ STATEMENT  FAILS.   ANOTHER MEANS OF USING A CONDITIONAL STATEMENFF
)@@G@@T     @G@@@@ TO  TEST  ON  THE  RESULT OF A PATTERN MATCH IS ILLUSTRATEDFG
)@@G@@ IN THE     @D@@@@ DISCUSSION OF THE 'ROUTE' STATEMENT, WHICH FOLLOWS.  FH
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 17. 3.   THE ON STATEMENT    @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@ THE FFI
)@@G@@ORMAT OF THE 'ON' STATEMENT IS:     @@@@@@@@@@@@@C@@@@                  FJ
)@@G@@  ON <EXPR>, LAB1,LAB2,LAB3   @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ <EXPR>  MUST  BE  A NUMFK
)@@G@@ERIC EXPRESSION, NEVER A STRING EXPRESSION,     @D@@@@ AND CONTROL IS TRFL
)@@G@@ANSFERRED ACCORDING TO THE RULE:    @@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@                  FM
)@@G@@  IF <EXPR> < 0  TRANSFER TO 'LAB1' @D@@@@                    IF <EXPR> FN
)@@G@@= 0  TRANSFER TO 'LAB2' @D@@@@                    IF <EXPR> > 0  TRANSFEFO
)@@G@@R TO 'LAB3' @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAFP
)@@G@@GE   NPL   REV.23       17-  3@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ ANY OFQ
)@@G@@F 'LAB1',  'LAB2' OR 'LAB3' MAY BE BE OMITTED:   CONTROL WILL     @C@@@@FR
)@@G@@ TRANSFER TO THE NEXT STATEMENT IN SEQUENCE.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 17. 4FS
)@@G@@.   THE ROUTE STATEMENT @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'ROUTE'  STATEMENT  IS  FT
)@@G@@ANALOGOUS  TO  THE  COMPUTED  GOTO IN     @ @@@@ FORTRAN.  ITS FORMAT ISFU
)@@G@@:     @@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@                    ROUTE <EXPR>, LAB1, LAB2, ..FV
)@@G@@.     @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF <EXPR> EVALUATES TO ZERO, CONTROL GOES TO THFW
)@@G@@E NEXT STATEMENT IN     @G@@@@ SEQUENCE.  OTHERWISE, IF THE VALUE OF <EXFX
)@@G@@PR> IS N, CONTROL GOES TO     @G@@@@ THE  STATEMENT  WHOSE  LABEL  IS  TFY
)@@G@@HE  NTH  LABEL SPECIFIED ON THE     @G@@@@ 'ROUTE' STATEMENT.   IF THE NFZ
)@@G@@TH LABEL FIELD IS VOID,  CONTROL GOES     @G@@@@ TO THE NEXT STATEMENT. GA
)@@G@@  IF N IS GREATER THAN THE NUMBER OF LABELS     @C@@@@ GIVEN BY MORE THAGB
)@@G@@N ONE, AN ERROR WILL RESULT.  @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF <EXPR> IN THE 'ROUTEGC
)@@G@@' STATEMENT IS A STRING EXPRESSION,     THE     @G@@@@ VALUE USED FOR DEGD
)@@G@@TERMINING THE BRANCH TO TAKE IS THE VALUE OF BITS     @G@@@@ 35-18 IN THGE
)@@G@@E KEYWORD 'MATCH' (ALTERNATION COMPONENT).  THUS IF THE     @G@@@@ FOURTGF
)@@G@@H ALTERNATIVE PATTERN MATCHES,  CONTROL WILL GO TO THE FOURTH     @A@@@@GG
)@@G@@ LABEL IN THE LIST, AND SO FORTH.   @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVEGH
)@@G@@RSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       18-  1@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@GI
)@@G@@@#@@@@ 18.   DO LOOPS   @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@#@@@@ 18. 1.   GEGJ
)@@G@@NERAL @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  DO  LOOP  IS USED TO CAUSE EXECUTION OF A GK
)@@G@@PARTICULAR BLOCK OF     @G@@@@ STATEMENTS  A  SPECIFIED  NUMBER OF TIMESGL
)@@G@@.   EACH PASS THROUGH THE     @G@@@@ RANGE  OF  THE  DO  LOOP  IS  CALLEGM
)@@G@@D AN ITERATION.   THE NUMBER OF     @G@@@@ ITERATIONS  TO EXECUTE AND THGN
)@@G@@E RANGE OF A DO LOOP ARE SPECIFIED BY     @ @@@@ EXECUTING THE 'DO' STATGO
)@@G@@EMENT.@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 18. 2.   THE DO STATEMENT    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@GP
)@@G@@ THE  'DO'  STATEMENT (OPTIONALLY,  'THRU',  THEY ARE SYNONYMS) HAS     GQ
)@@G@@@E@@@@ THREE FORMATS:  (A COMMA MAY FOLLOW <LABEL> IF DESIRED)    @@@@@@GR
)@@G@@@@@@@@@B@@@@                    DO <LABEL> <VAR>=<END>@@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@GS
)@@G@@                    DO <LABEL> <VAR>=<START>,<END>    @@@@@@@@@@@@@E@@@@GT
)@@G@@                    DO <LABEL> <VAR>=<START>,<END>,<INCR>   @@@@@@@@@@@@GU
)@@G@@@G@@@@ <START>,   <END> AND <INCR> ARE ANY NUMERIC EXPRESSIONS.   IN EACGV
)@@G@@H     @G@@@@ CASE,   <LABEL>  DEFINES  THE  RANGE  OF THE DO LOOP,  AND GW
)@@G@@MUST BE     @G@@@@ DEFINED  WITHIN  THE PROGRAM BEING EXECUTED.   THE NUGX
)@@G@@MBER OF TIMES     @G@@@@ THAT  THE  STATEMENTS BETWEEN THE 'DO' STATEMENGY
)@@G@@T AND THE STATEMENT     @G@@@@ WHOSE  LABEL IS SPECIFIED IS DEFINED BY TGZ
)@@G@@HE RELATIVE VALUES OF THE     @A@@@@ <START>, <END> AND <INCR> FIELDS.  HA
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ <VAR> NAMES ANY VARIABLE, NATURAL OR NPL KEYWORD.  <VHB
)@@G@@AR> IS CALLED     @G@@@@ THE  LOOP  INDUCTION  VARIABLE,   AND ASSUMES SHC
)@@G@@UCCESSIVE VALUES AS     @G@@@@ DEFINED BY THE LOOP CONTROL PARAMETERS.  HD
)@@G@@THERE ARE NO RESTRICTIONS     @G@@@@ CONCERNING  USE  OF  THE INDUCTION HE
)@@G@@VARIABLE WITHIN THE LOOP.   THE     @G@@@@ USER PROGRAM MAY REFERENCE ITHF
)@@G@@ AS IT WOULD ANY OTHER VARIABLE,  AND     @D@@@@ IT MAY BE CHANGED AT WIHG
)@@G@@LL WITHIN OR WITHOUT THE LOOP.@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE FIRST FORMAT STARTSHH
)@@G@@ A LOOP WITH <VAR> ASSUMING THE VALUES 0 TO     @G@@@@ <END>,  IF <END> HI
)@@G@@IS GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO +0, OR -0 TO <END> IF     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@HJ
)@@G@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       18-  2HK
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ <END>  IS  LESS  THAN OR EQUAL TO -0.   THE INCHL
)@@G@@REMENT USED WILL BE     @G@@@@ PLUS OR MINUS ONE, DETERMINED BY NPL.  THHM
)@@G@@E SECOND FORMAT DEFINES A     @G@@@@ DO  LOOP  IN  WHICH  <VAR> TAKES ONHN
)@@G@@ VALUES RANGING FROM <START> TO     @G@@@@ <END>  IN  INCREMENTS  OF  PLHO
)@@G@@US  OR MINUS 1,  DEPENDING ON WHETHER     @G@@@@ <START>  IS GREATER THAHP
)@@G@@N OR LESS THAN <END>.   THE THIRD FORMAT IS     @G@@@@ SIMILAR  TO  THE HQ
)@@G@@ SECOND,  EXCEPT THAT <INCR> EXPLICITLY NAMES THE     @G@@@@ VALUE  TO BHR
)@@G@@E USED FOR THE INCREMENT, AND CAN BE ANY NONZERO VALUE.     @G@@@@ NPL  HS
)@@G@@DOES NOT CHECK ON THE SENSE OF AN EXPLICITLY NAMED INCREMENT,     @G@@@@HT
)@@G@@ AND  IF  THE  SENSE IS WRONG,  ONLY ONE ITERATION OF THE LOOP WILL     HU
)@@G@@@]@@@@ OCCUR.     @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ AS  MANY  DO  LOOPS  AS  DESIRED  MHV
)@@G@@AY TERMINATE ON THE SAME LABEL.     @G@@@@ EXECUTION   PROCEEDS   WITH  HW
)@@G@@THE  INNERMOST  NESTED  'DO'  TO  THE     @G@@@@ OUTERMOST.   HOWEVER, AHX
)@@G@@ TRANSFER TO A STATEMENT DEFINING THE RANGE     @G@@@@ OF  THE  'DO' MUSHY
)@@G@@T BE TO THE LABEL APPEARING ON THE 'DO' STATEMENT     @G@@@@ WHOSE  LOOPHZ
)@@G@@  IS  TO  BE  ITERATED.   A TRANSFER TO A LABEL CAUSING     @G@@@@ EXECUIA
)@@G@@TION  OF  THIS STATEMENT,  BUT NOT THE LABEL APPEARING ON THE     @E@@@@IB
)@@G@@ 'DO' STATEMENT, WILL NOT CAUSE THE LOOP TO BE ITERATED.    @@@@@@@@@@@@IC
)@@G@@@G@@@@ AN  OPTIONAL  FORMAT FOR THE 'DO' STATEMENT PROVIDES A LITTLE MORID
)@@G@@E     @ @@@@ CONTROL OVER LOOP ITERATION: @@@@@@@@@@@@@F@@@@            IE
)@@G@@ DO <LOOP PARAMETERS> \ WHILE <BOOLEAN EXPRESSION>    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@IF
)@@G@@ LOOP ITERATION IS HANDLED IN THE MANNER ALREADY DESCRIBED,  EXCEPT     IG
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THAT  WHEN  AN  ITERATION  IS  PERFORMED,  <BOOLEAN EXPRESSION> IIH
)@@G@@S     @E@@@@ EVALUATED, AND THE LOOP IS NOT ITERATED IF IT IS FALSE.    II
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 18. 3.   THE LOOP STATEMENT  @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE 'IJ
)@@G@@LOOP' STATEMENT IS USED AS A DO LOOP TERMINATOR IF THE USE OF     @G@@@@IK
)@@G@@ ANY  OTHER STATEMENT IS INAPPROPRIATE.   NORMALLY,  ANY EXECUTABLE     IL
)@@G@@@G@@@@ STATEMENT  CAN  BE  USED  TO  TERMINATE  A  DO  LOOP,  BUT IN SOMIM
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ INSTANCES  DIFFERENT  EXECUTION  PATHS  WHICH HAVE NO STATEIN
)@@G@@MENT IN     @G@@@@ COMMON  STILL  ARE TO BE TERMINATED AT THE LOOP TERMIIO
)@@G@@NATION POINT.     @G@@@@ THE  'LOOP'  STATEMENT  IS  PROVIDED TO HANDLE IP
)@@G@@THESE CASES.   IF A     @G@@@@ 'LOOP'  STATEMENT  THAT DOES NOT HAVE AN IQ
)@@G@@ACTIVE DO LOOP ASSOCIATED     @G@@@@ WITH  IT IS EXECUTED, IT WILL HAVE IR
)@@G@@NO EFFECT, AND WILL BE IGNORED.     @F@@@@ LIKEWISE, A 'LOOP' STATEMENT IS
)@@G@@WITHOUT A LABEL WILL BE IGNORED.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ FORMAT OF THE 'LOIT
)@@G@@OP' STATEMENT IS: @@@@@@@@@@@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY IU
)@@G@@PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       18-  3@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@IV
)@@G@@                    LABEL:  LOOP    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ UPON EXPIRATION OIW
)@@G@@F THE DO LOOP, THE INDUCTION VARIABLE RETAINS THE     @B@@@@ VALUE OF <EIX
)@@G@@ND> FROM THE 'DO' STATEMENT.  @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 18. 4.   DO LOOP EXAMPLIY
)@@G@@ES    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  FIRST  SAMPLE  DO  LOOP  WILL  EXECUTE FIVIZ
)@@G@@E ITERATIONS OF THE     @G@@@@ STATEMENTS  IN  THE  RANGE OF THE LOOP FOJA
)@@G@@R VALUES OF THE INDUCTION     @D@@@@ VARIABLE H4 RANGING FROM -3 TO 9 INJB
)@@G@@ INCREMENTS OF +3:@@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@                    DO LOOPE H4=-3,9JC
)@@G@@,3    @ @@@@                         .    @ @@@@                        JD
)@@G@@ .    @ @@@@                         .    @B@@@@                   (STATJE
)@@G@@EMENTS TO EXECUTE)@ @@@@                         .    @ @@@@            JF
)@@G@@             .    @ @@@@                         .    @^@@@@           LJG
)@@G@@OOPE:   LOOP@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE NEXT EXAMPLE ILLUSTRATES THE IMPLICITJH
)@@G@@ INCREMENT.  LOOPING WILL     @G@@@@ OCCUR  12  TIMES  FOR  VALUES  OF KJI
)@@G@@8 RANGING FROM TEN TO -1.   THE     @B@@@@ INCREMENT WILL BE -1, CALCULAJJ
)@@G@@TED BY NPL: @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@                    THRU LOOP, K8=10,-1   JK
)@@G@@@ @@@@                         .    @ @@@@                         .    JL
)@@G@@@ @@@@                         .    @C@@@@                    (STATEMENTJM
)@@G@@S TO EXECUTE)     @ @@@@                         .    @ @@@@            JN
)@@G@@             .    @ @@@@                         .    @^@@@@          LOJO
)@@G@@OP:     LOOP@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ NOTE  THAT THE LABEL DEFINING THE RANGE OJP
)@@G@@F THE DO LOOP ('LOOP') IS     @G@@@@ THE SAME AS THE NAME AS AN NPL DIREJQ
)@@G@@CTIVE.  THIS IS PERMISSIBLE AND     @C@@@@ WILL NOT CAUSE CONFUSION TO TJR
)@@G@@HE INTERPRETER.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 18. 5.   NESTING OF DO LOOPS @@@@@@JS
)@@G@@@@@@@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NJT
)@@G@@PL   REV.23       18-  4@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ DO  LOOPS MAY BE NESTEDJU
)@@G@@ TO ANY DEPTH DESIRED.   THERE ARE NO RULES     @G@@@@ CONCERNING THE NEJV
)@@G@@STING OF DO LOOPS.   FOR INSTANCE, THE RANGE OF A     @G@@@@ NESTED  LOOJW
)@@G@@P  DOES NOT HAVE TO BE ENTIRELY WITHIN THE RANGE OF THE     @G@@@@ DO LOJX
)@@G@@OP IN WHICH IT IS NESTED.   LIKEWISE,  THE LABEL DEFINING THE     @G@@@@JY
)@@G@@ RANGE  OF  A  LOOP  DOES  NOT  HAVE  TO PHYSICALLY FOLLOW THE 'DO'     JZ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ STATEMENT  WHICH  INITIATED  THE  LOOP.    PROPER  USE OF THE 'GOKA
)@@G@@'     @G@@@@ DIRECTIVE  AND  THE  'DO' STATEMENT ALLOWS FOR MUCH FLEXIBIKB
)@@G@@LITY IN     @ @@@@ THE DEFINITIONS OF LOOPS.    @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEKC
)@@G@@W YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       19-  1@@@@@@KD
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 19.   OPERATING SYSTEM INTERFACE   @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@KE
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 19. 1.   THE EXEC STATEMENT  @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE 'KF
)@@G@@EXEC' STATEMENT IS USED TO PASS FACILITIES CONTROL STATEMENTS     @G@@@@KG
)@@G@@ TO  THE  EXEC8 OPERATING SYSTEM FOR DYNAMIC FACILITIES REFERENCES.     KH
)@@G@@@G@@@@ ANY STATEMENT VALID FOR PROCESSING BY CSF$ (REFER TO THE EXEC8 PRKI
)@@G@@M     @E@@@@ FOR DETAILS) MAY BE SUBMITTED VIA THE 'EXEC' STATEMENT.    KJ
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@ THE FORMAT OF THE 'EXEC' STATEMENT IS:   @@@@@@@@@@@@KK
)@@G@@@A@@@@                    EXEC <STRING>   @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ <STRING>  IKL
)@@G@@N THE EXAMPLE IS ANY STRING OR STRING EXPRESSION.   THE     @G@@@@ CANDIKM
)@@G@@DATE  FOR  CSF$  PROCESSING IS SUBMITTED TO THE EXEC8 SYSTEM.     @G@@@@KN
)@@G@@ THE  FACILITY  STATUS  BITS RETURNED BY THE EXEC ARE STORED IN THE     KO
)@@G@@@G@@@@ KEYWORD  'EXEC',  AND MAY BE INTERROGATED TO DETERMINE THE SUCCESKP
)@@G@@S     @G@@@@ OR  FAILURE  OF  THE  REQUEST.   IF THE STATEMENT SUBMITTEDKQ
)@@G@@ TO THE     @G@@@@ EXEC8  SYSTEM  IS  NOT A VALID STATEMENT FOR CSF$ PROKR
)@@G@@CESSING,  THE     @F@@@@ STATUS WORD STORED IN 'EXEC' IS A WORD OF -0 (AKS
)@@G@@LL BITS SET).     @@@@@@@@@@@@@]@@@@ EXAMPLES:  @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@      KT
)@@G@@              EXEC '@ASG,A MYFILE'  @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ ASSUMING  THAT  'KU
)@@G@@G$'  IS  A STRING VARIABLE ASSIGNED THE NAME OF A     @G@@@@ FILE  TO  BKV
)@@G@@E REFERENCED,  THE FOLLOWING TWO STATEMENT PROGRAM WILL     @G@@@@ ASSIGKW
)@@G@@N  THE  FILE  NAMED  BY  'G$'  AND  START  A  BATCH RUN WHOSE     @E@@@@KX
)@@G@@ RUNSTREAM RESIDES IN AN ELEMENT NAMED 'RUN1' IN THAT FILE: @@@@@@@@@@@@KY
)@@G@@@B@@@@                    EXEC '@ASG,A '+G$     @C@@@@                  KZ
)@@G@@  EXEC '@START '+G$+'.RUN1'   @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ REFER  TO  THE  EXEC8  LA
)@@G@@PRM FOR INFORMATION CONCERNING THE TYPES OF     @F@@@@ STATEMENTS THAT MLB
)@@G@@AY BE PROCESSED DYNAMICALLY (THROUGH CSF$).     @@@@@@@@@@@@@[@@@@*****^LC
)@@G@@@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       LD
)@@G@@19-  2@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 19. 2.   THE ER STATEMENT    @@@@@@@@@@@@LE
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE  'ER'  STATEMENT  PROVIDES  A USER PROGRAM WITH THE ABILITY TLF
)@@G@@O     @G@@@@ EXECUTE  'EXECUTIVE  RETURN'  INSTRUCTIONS,  NORMALLY RESERLG
)@@G@@VED FOR     @G@@@@ ASSEMBLY  LANGUAGE  PROGRAMMING.     EFFECTIVE  USE  LH
)@@G@@OF  THE  'ER'     @G@@@@ STATEMENT  REQUIRES  ON THE PART OF THE USER SOLI
)@@G@@ME KNOWLEDGE OF THE     @G@@@@ OVERALL   EXEC8   SYSTEM   AND  ITS  INTELJ
)@@G@@RNALS.     KNOWLEDGE  AND     @G@@@@ UNDERSTANDING OF THE 'ER' MECHANISMLK
)@@G@@ IS NOT,  HOWEVER, NECESSARY TO     @ @@@@ MAKE EFFICIENT USE OF NPL.   LL
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@ THE FORMAT OF THE 'ER' STATEMENT IS:     @@@@@@@@@@@@LM
)@@G@@@E@@@@            ER [\]<FUNCTION>[\][,INITIALIZATION] [\,RETURN] @@@@@@LN
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ <FUNCTION> MAY BE THE ER MNEMONIC,  OR, IF CODED WITH THE OLO
)@@G@@PTIONAL     @G@@@@ DELIMITERS ('\'),  WILL BE SCANNED AS AN EXPRESSION WLP
)@@G@@HOSE VALUE IS     @G@@@@ THE ER FUNCTION CODE.  THE OPTIONAL FIELD 'INITLQ
)@@G@@IALIZATION' CAN, IF     @G@@@@ PRESENT,  HAVE  FROM  ONE TO THREE SUBFIELR
)@@G@@LDS, SEPARATED BY COMMAS.     @G@@@@ THE  VALUE  IN  THE  1ST SUBFIELD ILS
)@@G@@S LOADED INTO REGISTER A0,  THE     @G@@@@ VALUE IN THE 2ND IS LOADED INLT
)@@G@@TO REGISTER A1,  AND THE VALUE IN THE     @G@@@@ 3RD SUBFIELD IS LOADED LU
)@@G@@INTO REGISTER A2, BEFORE THE ER INSTRUCTION     @G@@@@ IS  EXECUTED.    LV
)@@G@@THE OPTIONAL FIELD 'RETURN' IS CODED IN A SIMILAR     @G@@@@ MANNER TO TLW
)@@G@@HE 'INITIALIZATION' FIELD, AND NAMES THE VARIABLES INTO     @G@@@@ WHICHLX
)@@G@@ THE VALUES OF REGISTERS A0,  A1 AND A2 ARE TO BE STORED UPON     @A@@@@LY
)@@G@@ RETURN FROM THE ER INSTRUCTION.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE   'INITIALIZALZ
)@@G@@TION'   SUBFIELDS   MAY   BE  NUMERIC  OR  STRING     @G@@@@ EXPRESSIONSMA
)@@G@@.    IF NUMERIC,  THE VALUE OF THE EXPRESSION IS LOADED     @G@@@@ INTO MB
)@@G@@THE APPROPRIATE CONTROL REGISTER BEFORE THE ER INSTRUCTION IS     @G@@@@MC
)@@G@@ PERFORMED.     IF  A  PARTICULAR  FIELD  IS  A  STRING  OR  STRING     MD
)@@G@@@G@@@@ EXPRESSION,  THE ADDRESS OF THE FIRST WORD OF THE STRING IS LOADEME
)@@G@@D     @G@@@@ INTO  THE  MODIFIER  PORTION (BITS 17-0) OF THE REGISTER,  MF
)@@G@@AND THE     @G@@@@ LENGTH OF THE STRING IN WORDS IS LOADED INTO THE INCRMG
)@@G@@EMENT PORTION     @G@@@@ (BITS  35-18).   USE OF THE 'ER' STATEMENT WITHMH
)@@G@@ STRING EXPRESSIONS     @G@@@@ IN  THIS  MANNER  FACILITATES EXECUTING SMI
)@@G@@UCH ER'S AS PRTCN$, CSF$,     @[@@@@ ETC. @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ AN  EXAMPLEMJ
)@@G@@  OF  AN  'ER'  STATEMENT  THAT  ISSUES A REQUEST FOR A     @G@@@@ PROGRMK
)@@G@@AM  FILE TABLE OF CONTENTS ENTRY IS AS FOLLOWS (ASSUMING THAT     @F@@@@ML
)@@G@@ THE ARRAY P$ HAS BEEN PROPERLY INITIALIZED FOR THE ER PFS$):     @@@@@@MM
)@@G@@@@@@@@@B@@@@                    ER PFS$,P$.U\,C3,C4   @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@MN
)@@G@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       19-  3MO
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ EXPLANATION:   THE ARRAY P$ HAS BEEN INITIALIZEMP
)@@G@@D AS A PFS$ PACKET.     @G@@@@ THE  'U'  PARTIAL WORD DESIGNATOR SPECIFIMQ
)@@G@@ES THAT REGISTER A0 IS TO     @G@@@@ BE LOADED WITH THE ADDRESS OF P$(0)MR
)@@G@@, RATHER THAN WITH THE CONTENTS     @G@@@@ OF THAT WORD.  THERE ARE NO IMS
)@@G@@NITIALIZATION VALUES FOR REGISTERS A1     @G@@@@ OR A2.   UPON RETURN FRMT
)@@G@@OM THE EXEC ENTRY, THE CONTENTS OF REGISTER     @G@@@@ A0 ARE DISCARDED.MU
)@@G@@  THE CONTENTS OF REGISTER A1 ARE STORED INTO THE     @G@@@@ VARIABLE  NMV
)@@G@@AMED C3,  AND THE CONTENTS OF REGISTER A2 ARE STORED IN     @ @@@@ THE CMW
)@@G@@ELL ADDRESSED AS C4.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF  THE  ER  MNEMONIC 'MSCON$MX
)@@G@@' IS SPECIFIED, THE SUBFUNCTION NAME,     @A@@@@ SUCH AS 'DREAD$', MAY BMY
)@@G@@E CODED AS: @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@                 ER MSCON$/DREAD$...@@@@@@MZ
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  CORRECT  SUBFUNCTION CODE WILL BE STORED IN THE FIRST NA
)@@G@@WORD OF     @G@@@@ THE  PACKET  WHOSE  ADDRESS  IS  EXPECTED TO BE IN THNB
)@@G@@E A0 REGISTER     @^@@@@ INITIALIZATION FIELD.  @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 19. 3NC
)@@G@@.   THE GETDRC STATEMENT@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'GETDRC'  STATEMENT  IS ND
)@@G@@USED TO RETRIEVE INFORMATION FROM THE     @G@@@@ SYSTEM  MASTER  FILE DINE
)@@G@@RECTORY CONCERNING AN INDIVIDUAL FILE.  THE     @B@@@@ FORMAT OF THE 'GENF
)@@G@@TDRC' STATEMENT IS:     @@@@@@@@@@@@@E@@@@         GETDRC <UNIT>,<ITEM>,NG
)@@G@@<ARRAY>,[<START>][,<COUNT>]   @E@@@@         GETDRC <UNIT>,*<EXPR>,<ARRANH
)@@G@@Y>,[<START>][,<COUNT>]  @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ <UNIT>  IS THE FILE UNIT INDENI
)@@G@@X ASSIGNED VIA THE 'FILES' STATEMENT.     @G@@@@ <ITEM>  IS  EITHER  THENJ
)@@G@@ DESCRIPTIVE NAME OF THE ITEM WITH WHICH TO     @G@@@@ START TRANSFERRINNK
)@@G@@G INFORMATION (LEAD, MAIN OR GRAN),  OR A NUMERIC     @G@@@@ INDEX OF THNL
)@@G@@E START ITEM (0=LEAD, 1=MAIN, 2=GRAN).   TO SPECIFY THE     @G@@@@ <ITEMNM
)@@G@@>  FIELD  AS  A  NUMERIC EXPRESSION, AN ASTERISK PRECEDES IT.     @G@@@@NN
)@@G@@ <ARRAY> NAMES A DIMENSIONED STRING OR ARITHMETIC ARRAY AT LEAST 28     NO
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WORDS IN LENGTH.  THE OPTIONAL <START> FIELD SPECIFIES STARTING ANP
)@@G@@T     @G@@@@ OTHER THAN SECTOR ZERO OF THE DESIRED ITEM.   THE OPTIONAL NQ
)@@G@@<COUNT>     @G@@@@ FIELD  DEFINES  THE  NUMBER OF SECTORS OF DIRECTORY INR
)@@G@@NFORMATION TO     @G@@@@ TRANSFER.  THE DEFAULT VALUE FOR <START> IS ZERNS
)@@G@@O,  AND FOR <COUNT>     @G@@@@ IS  THE  MAXIMUM  AMOUNT  OF DATA THAT WINT
)@@G@@LL FIT INTO <ARRAY>.  THE     @G@@@@ ACTUAL NUMBER OF SECTORS RETURNED BNU
)@@G@@Y THE OPERATING SYSTEM IS FOUND     @E@@@@ IN DRCCON(4).T2 (SEE BELOW FONV
)@@G@@R AN EXPLANATION OF 'DRCCON').@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ TWO  KEYWORDS ASSOCIATENW
)@@G@@D WITH THE 'GETDRC' STATEMENT ARE 'DRCCON',     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NENX
)@@G@@W YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       19-  4@@@@@@NY
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ WHICH IS THE CONTROL PACKET FOR THE ER MSCON$ WHICH RNZ
)@@G@@EFERENCES THE     @G@@@@ MASTER FILE DIRECTORY,  AND 'GETDRC' WHICH IS TOA
)@@G@@HE STATUS WORD FROM     @G@@@@ THE  OPERATING  SYSTEM,  AND  INDICATES COB
)@@G@@OMPLETION OR ERROR OF THE     @G@@@@ REQUEST.    REFER  TO  THE EXEC8 PROC
)@@G@@OGRAMMER'S REFERENCE MANUAL FOR     @D@@@@ FURTHER INFORMATION CONCERNINOD
)@@G@@G THE FILE DIRECTORY.   @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAOE
)@@G@@MMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       20-  1@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@^@@@@ 20.  OF
)@@G@@ INPUT/OUTPUT     @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@#@@@@ 20. 1.   GENERAL OG
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@F@@@@ THE GENERAL FORMAT FOR INPUT/OUTPUT OPERATIONS IS AS OH
)@@G@@FOLLOWS:    @@@@@@@@@@@@@E@@@@               OPERATION (PARAMETER LIST) OI
)@@G@@VARIABLE LIST     @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@ INPUT/OUTPUT MAY BE FORMATTED OR BIOJ
)@@G@@NARY. @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@ 20. 2.   ASSIGNING INPUT/OUTPUT UNITS    @@@@@@OK
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'FILES'  STATEMENT  IS USED TO ASSIGN I/O UNITS TO NPLOL
)@@G@@.   THE     @A@@@@ FORMAT OF THE 'FILES' STATEMENT IS:@@@@@@@@@@@@@C@@@@OM
)@@G@@                    FILES <EXPR>,[<STRING>],... @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  ON
)@@G@@'ATTACH' STATEMENT HAS EXACTLY THE SAME SYNTAX AS THE 'FILES'     @G@@@@OO
)@@G@@ STATEMENT EXCEPT THAT THE 'FILES' STATEMENT INSISTS THAT THE FILES     OP
)@@G@@@G@@@@ NAMED BE CATALOGUED, WHILE THE 'ATTACH' STATEMENT WILL ASSIGN AS OQ
)@@G@@A     @D@@@@ TEMPORARY FILE ANY FILE NAMED THAT IS NOT CATALOGUED.@@@@@@OR
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ WHERE  <EXPR>  MUST  EVALUATE  TO  A  LEGAL  I/O UNIT NUMBEOS
)@@G@@R,  AND     @G@@@@ <STRING>  IS  A  STRING  OR  STRING  EXPRESSION  REPROT
)@@G@@ESENTING  THE     @G@@@@ EXTERNAL  (OR  INTERNAL)  NAME  OF THE FILE TO OU
)@@G@@BE REFERENCED.   IF     @G@@@@ <STRING> IS OMITTED,  ANY I/O UNIT ASSOCIOV
)@@G@@ATION WITH UNIT <EXPR> IS     @G@@@@ RELEASED.    IF  THE 'FILES' STATEMOW
)@@G@@ENT FAILS,  THE FACILITY STATUS     @G@@@@ BITS  RETURNED  BY  THE  EXECOX
)@@G@@8  SYSTEM MAY BE FOUND IN THE KEYWORD     @]@@@@ 'EXEC'.    @@@@@@@@@@@@OY
)@@G@@@G@@@@ IF  A 'FILES' STATEMENT IS EXECUTED WHICH SPECIFIES A UNIT ALREADOZ
)@@G@@Y     @G@@@@ ASSIGNED,   IT  IS  RELEASED,   ANY  OUTSTANDING I/O IS ALLPA
)@@G@@OWED TO     @G@@@@ COMPLETE,   FORMATTED UNIT BUFFERS ARE DRAINED AND REPB
)@@G@@LEASED TO THE     @G@@@@ STORAGE  POOL,   AND  THE  NEW  ASSOCIATION  ISPC
)@@G@@  MADE.   LIKEWISE,     @G@@@@ OUTSTANDING  I/O  IS  WAITED  UPON  FOR  PD
)@@G@@ANY  OPEN  UNITS WHEN NPL     @G@@@@ TERMINATES,   AND THE FILES ARE RETPE
)@@G@@URNED TO THE ASSIGN STATUS THEY     @A@@@@ HAD BEFORE BEING REFERENCED BPF
)@@G@@Y NPL.@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPG
)@@G@@PL   REV.23       20-  2@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ A  'FILES' PH
)@@G@@STATEMENT IS NOT NECESSARY TO ASSIGN A FORMATTED OUTPUT     @G@@@@ UNIT PI
)@@G@@ TO  NPL  IF A TEMPORARY FILE WILL DO.   UPON THE FIRST WRITE     @G@@@@PJ
)@@G@@ REQUEST  TO A UNIT OTHER THAN THE PRINTER,  PUNCH OR CONSOLE,  NPL     PK
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WILL  ASSIGN A TEMPORARY FILE WHOSE QUALIFIER IS THE PROJECT ID OPL
)@@G@@F     @G@@@@ THE  RUN  EXECUTING  NPL  AND  WHOSE INTERNAL NAME IS THE IPM
)@@G@@/O UNIT     @G@@@@ INDEX  REFERENCED.   THIS  IS ALSO TRUE FOR THE 'CLOSPN
)@@G@@E' STATEMENT,     @G@@@@ WHERE,  IF A UNIT NOT ASSIGNED IS REFERENCED,  PO
)@@G@@A TEMPORARY FILE IS     @E@@@@ ASSIGNED, AND AN END OF FILE MARK IS IMMEPP
)@@G@@DIATELY WRITTEN.  @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 20. 3.   I/O UNIT ADDRESSING @@@@@@PQ
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'SETADR'  STATEMENT  IS  USED  TO SPECIFY THE STARTINGPR
)@@G@@ SECTOR     @D@@@@ ADDRESS FOR FORMATTED I/O UNITS.  THE FORMAT IS:     PS
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@C@@@@                    SETADR <EXPR1>,<EXPR2>...   @@@@@@PT
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ <EXPR1> NAMES THE UNIT BEING REFERENCED, AND <EXPR2> SPECIFPU
)@@G@@IES THE     @G@@@@ SECTOR  ADDRESS AT WHICH THE UNIT IS TO BE OPENED IF PV
)@@G@@REFERENCED BY     @ @@@@ THE FORMATTED I/O HANDLER.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@PW
)@@G@@ 20. 4.   FORMATTED INPUT/OUTPUT    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ FORMATTED  I/O  IPX
)@@G@@S  SPECIFIED  BY  EXECUTING  THE 'READ', 'WRITE',     @G@@@@ 'PRINT',   PY
)@@G@@'DECODE'  OR  'ENCODE' STATEMENTS.   THE LIST FOR THESE     @A@@@@ STATEPZ
)@@G@@MENTS HAS THE GENERAL FORMAT: @@@@@@@@@@@@@C@@@@                    <LISQA
)@@G@@T ITEM> . <FORMAT>,...  @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ <LIST ITEM> NAMES A SUBSCRIPTQB
)@@G@@ED OR UNSUBSCRIPTED VARIABLE, WITH OR     @G@@@@ WITHOUT  QUALIFICATION QC
)@@G@@ DESIGNATOR,   FOR THE 'READ',  'INPUT' AND     @G@@@@ 'DECODE'  STATEMEQD
)@@G@@NTS.    FOR THE FORMATTED OUTPUT STATEMENTS,  THE     @G@@@@ <LIST  ITEMQE
)@@G@@> FIELD CAN BE ANY NUMERIC OR STRING EXPRESSION.   THIS     @G@@@@ FIELDQF
)@@G@@  MUST  BE  A  NUMERIC  EXPRESSION  IN  THE  FORMATTED  INPUT     @G@@@@QG
)@@G@@ STATEMENTS  IF USED WITH THE FORMAT CODE 'X' OR 'T'.   <FORMAT> IS     QH
)@@G@@@ @@@@ DEFINED IN THE NEXT SECTION. @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF  <FORMAT> IS OQI
)@@G@@MITTED,  AND <LIST ITEM> IS A STRING,  THE FORMAT     @G@@@@ CODE 'L' ISQJ
)@@G@@ ASSUMED.   IF <LIST ITEM> IS NUMERIC,  THE FORMAT CODE     @F@@@@ 'I' OQK
)@@G@@R 'G', DEPENDING ON THE MODE OF <LIST ITEM>, IS ASSUMED.    @[@@@@*****^QL
)@@G@@@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       QM
)@@G@@20-  3@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 20. 4. 1.   FORMAT CODES     @@@@@@QN
)@@G@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 20. 4. 1. 1.   AN - ALPHANUMERIC   @@@@@@@G@@@@ INPUT:    TQO
)@@G@@HE  NEXT  N  CHARACTERS  IN  THE  IMAGE  ARE SCANNED AS     @G@@@@ ALPHAQP
)@@G@@NUMERIC.   IF N IS OMITTED,  THE STRING OF CHARACTERS UP TO A     @G@@@@QQ
)@@G@@ SPACE,  COMMA OR END OF IMAGE ARE SCANNED.   THE SPACE OR COMMA IS     QR
)@@G@@@F@@@@ CONSUMED.  THE WORD IS STORED LEFT JUSTIFIED AND SPACE FILLED.   QS
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ OUTPUT:   THE  LEFTMOST  N CHARACTERS ARE INSERTED INTO THEQT
)@@G@@ IMAGE.     @G@@@@ IF  N IS OMITTED,  THE WHOLE WORD IS EDITED WITH BLANQU
)@@G@@KS AND MASTER     @^@@@@ SPACES SQUEEZED OUT.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 20. 4QV
)@@G@@. 1. 2.   RN - ALPHANUMERIC   @@@@@@@G@@@@ INPUT:    SAME  AS  'A',   EXQW
)@@G@@CEPT  THAT  THE  WORD IS STORED RIGHT     @ @@@@ JUSTIFIED AND ZERO FILLQX
)@@G@@ED.   @@@@@@@G@@@@ OUTPUT:   SAME AS 'A',  EXCEPT THAT THE RIGHTMOST N CQY
)@@G@@HARACTERS ARE     @]@@@@ EDITED.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 20. 4. 1. 3.   LNQZ
)@@G@@ - LITERAL  @@@@@@@G@@@@ INPUT:  THE NEXT N CHARACTERS FROM THE INPUT IMRA
)@@G@@AGE ARE SCANNED AND     @G@@@@ STORED  IN  THE  ITEM  AS  A  STRING.   IRB
)@@G@@F FEWER THAN N CHARACTERS     @G@@@@ REMAIN,  THE REMAINDER OF THE IMAGERC
)@@G@@ IS SCANNED.  IF N WOULD EXCEED     @G@@@@ THE  MAXIMUM  ITEM SIZE,  IT RD
)@@G@@IS TRUNCATED.   IF N IS OMITTED,  THE     @G@@@@ REMAINDER OF THE IMAGE RE
)@@G@@OR THE MAXIMUM SIZE OF THE ITEM,  WHICHEVER     @ @@@@ IS SMALLER, WILL RF
)@@G@@BE SCANNED. @@@@@@@G@@@@ OUTPUT:    SAME  AS  FOR  INPUT,   EXCEPT  THATRG
)@@G@@ THE CHARACTERS ARE     @C@@@@ TRANSFERRED FROM THE ITEM TO THE OUTPUT IRH
)@@G@@MAGE. @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 20. 4. 1. 4.   KN - LITERAL  @@@@@@@D@@@@ INPUTRI
)@@G@@:  SAME AS 'L', EXCEPT WILL STOP AT A COMMA.    @@@@@@@ @@@@ OUTPUT:  IDRJ
)@@G@@ENTICAL TO 'L'.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 20. 4. 1. 5.   BN - BOOLEAN  @@@@@@RK
)@@G@@@G@@@@ INPUT:   THE IMAGE IS SCANNED FOR AN 'A' TYPE FIELD,  THEN AS MANRL
)@@G@@Y     @G@@@@ CHARACTERS AS WERE SCANNED FROM THE WORD ARE COMPARED TO A RM
)@@G@@SIMILAR     @G@@@@ NUMBER  OF  CHARACTERS  FROM  THE WORDS 'TRUE' AND 'FRN
)@@G@@ALSE'.   IF A     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING RO
)@@G@@LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       20-  4@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@E@@@@ MATCH IS MARP
)@@G@@DE, THE VALUE 1 OR 0 IS STORED, AS APPROPRIATE. @@@@@@@G@@@@ OUTPUT:    RQ
)@@G@@THE  N  CHARACTERS FROM THE WORDS 'TRUE' OR 'FALSE' ARE     @G@@@@ INSERRR
)@@G@@TED INTO THE OUTPUT IMAGE, DEPENDING ON THE VALUE OF THE ITEM     @G@@@@RS
)@@G@@ IN QUESTION.  IF THE ITEM IS NONZERO, IT IS 'TRUE', IF IT IS ZERO,     RT
)@@G@@@ @@@@ IT IS CONSIDERED 'FALSE'.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 20. 4. 1. 6.   INRU
)@@G@@ - INTEGER  @@@@@@@G@@@@ INPUT:   A  DECIMAL FIELD OF WIDTH N IS SCANNEDRV
)@@G@@.  IF N IS OMITTED,     @G@@@@ SCAN  WILL  STOP  AT  A  BLANK  OR  COMMARW
)@@G@@.   THE COMMA OR BLANK IS     @]@@@@ CONSUMED.  @@@@@@@G@@@@ OUTPUT:   ARX
)@@G@@  DECIMAL FIELD OF WIDTH N IS EDITED.  IF N IS OMITTED,     @B@@@@ THE FRY
)@@G@@IELD WILL BE OF VARIABLE WIDTH.     @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 20. 4. 1. 7.   ZNRZ
)@@G@@ - INTEGER  @@@@@@@ @@@@ INPUT:  IDENTICAL TO 'I'.    @@@@@@@G@@@@ OUTPUSA
)@@G@@T:    SAME AS 'I',  EXCEPT THAT THE FIELD WILL BE ZERO FILLED     @F@@@@SB
)@@G@@ INSTEAD OF BLANK FILLED IF THE WIDTH IS GREATER THAN NECESSARY.  @@@@@@SC
)@@G@@@@@@@@@C@@@@ 20. 4. 1. 8.   GW$N - GENERAL FLOATING POINT   @@@@@@@G@@@@SD
)@@G@@ INPUT:    A  FLOATING  POINT FIELD OF WIDTH W IS DECODED.   THE $N     SE
)@@G@@@G@@@@ FIELD IS IGNORED.  LEADING AND TRAILING BLANKS ARE PERMITTED.  THSF
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ FLOATING  POINT  NUMBER  MAY  BE AN INTEGER,  INTEGER WITH SG
)@@G@@DECIMAL     @G@@@@ FRACTION, OR EITHER WITH AN EXPONENT SCALE, I.E., 1.2SH
)@@G@@E5, 1.2E+5 OR     @G@@@@ 1.2E-5.    IF  THE EXPONENTIAL FORM IS USED,  BSI
)@@G@@LANKS ARE PERMITTED     @G@@@@ BETWEEN THE 'E' (OR THE SIGN) AND THE SCASJ
)@@G@@LE FACTOR.  OTHERWISE, NO     @G@@@@ BLANKS IMBEDDED IN THE FLOATING POISK
)@@G@@NT NUMBER ARE ALLOWED.  IF W IS     @F@@@@ OMITTED, A FLOATING POINT FIESL
)@@G@@LD OF VARIABLE WIDTH IS DECODED.    @@@@@@@G@@@@ OUTPUT:    A FLOATING PSM
)@@G@@OINT NUMBER IS EDITED INTO A FIELD OF WIDTH     @G@@@@ W, WITH N CHARACTSN
)@@G@@ERS EDITED TO THE RIGHT OF THE DECIMAL POINT.  AN     @G@@@@ ATTEMPT  ISSO
)@@G@@  MADE TO SHIFT THE DECIMAL POINT AMONG THE SIGNIFICANT     @G@@@@ DIGITSP
)@@G@@S  IN A WAY THAT WILL MAKE THE CHARACTERISTIC GO TO ZERO,  IN     @A@@@@SQ
)@@G@@ WHICH CASE IT IS EDITED AS SPACES. @@@@@@@@@@@@@E@@@@ 20. 4. 1. 9.   EWSR
)@@G@@$N - SCIENTIFIC FORMAT FLOATING POINT     @@@@@@@A@@@@ INPUT:  NOT AVAILSS
)@@G@@ABLE FOR INPUT.   @@@@@@@G@@@@ OUTPUT:  THE FLOATING POINT NUMBER IS EDIST
)@@G@@TED WITH ONE DIGIT TO THE     @G@@@@ LEFT  OF  THE  DECIMAL  POINT  INTOSU
)@@G@@  A  FIELD  OF WIDTH W,  WITH N     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVESV
)@@G@@RSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       20-  5@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@SW
)@@G@@@G@@@@ CHARACTERS  EDITED  TO  THE  LEFT  OF  THE  DECIMAL POINT,  AND ASX
)@@G@@N     @G@@@@ EXPONENTIAL  SCALE  FACTOR  SPECIFYING  THE ACTUAL POSITIONSY
)@@G@@ OF THE     @#@@@@ DECIMAL POINT.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 20. 4. 1.10.   FWSZ
)@@G@@$N - FIXED POINT  @@@@@@@A@@@@ INPUT:  NOT AVAILABLE FOR INPUT.   @@@@@@TA
)@@G@@@G@@@@ OUTPUT:  THE FLOATING POINT NUMBER IS EDITED INTO A FIELD OF WIDTTB
)@@G@@H     @D@@@@ W, WITH N DIGITS TO THE RIGHT OF THE DECIMAL POINT.  @@@@@@TC
)@@G@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 20. 4. 1.11.   ON - OCTAL    @@@@@@@E@@@@ INPUT:  SAME AS 'TD
)@@G@@I', EXCEPT AN OCTAL FIELD IS SCANNED.     @@@@@@@E@@@@ OUTPUT:  SAME AS TE
)@@G@@'I', EXCEPT THAT AN OCTAL FIELD IS EDITED.@@@@@@@G@@@@ NOTE:    OVERFLOWTF
)@@G@@  TO  THE  RIGHT CAN OCCUR IF THE SPECIFIED FIELD     @G@@@@ WIDTH IS NOTG
)@@G@@T LARGE ENOUGH TO HOLD THE EDITED NUMBER WHEN THE I, G,     @C@@@@ E, F,TH
)@@G@@ OR O FORMAT CODES ARE USED FOR OUTPUT.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@^@@@@ 20. 4. 1.12TI
)@@G@@.   D - DATE@@@@@@@G@@@@ INPUT:    A DATE FIELD OF THE FORMAT  MM/DD/YY,TJ
)@@G@@  WHERE THE SLASHES     @G@@@@ MAY  BE RESET TO ANY DESIRED CHARACTER BYTK
)@@G@@ ASSIGNING A VALUE TO THE     @G@@@@ LOWER  18  BITS OF TDSEP,  IS SCANNTL
)@@G@@ED.   THE RESULT IS A HALF WORD     @A@@@@ CORRESPONDING TO TDATE$ FORMATM
)@@G@@T.    @@@@@@@G@@@@ OUTPUT:   SIMILAR TO INPUT,  THE SEPARATOR CHARACTER TN
)@@G@@IS TPKEN FROM     @ @@@@ THE LOWER 18 BITS OF TDSEP.  @@@@@@@G@@@@ TDATETO
)@@G@@$ FORMAT WORD:   S1 = MONTH, S2 = DAY, S3 = YEAR MOD 64; H2 =     @A@@@@TP
)@@G@@ TIME IN SECONDS SINCE MIDNIGHT.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@^@@@@ 20. 4. 1.13.   C TQ
)@@G@@- TIME@@@@@@@E@@@@ INPUT:  ANALOGOUS TO 'D', EXCEPT THAT A TIME IS EDITETR
)@@G@@D.    @@@@@@@E@@@@ OUTPUT:  EDITS A TIME IN TDATE$ FORMAT.  ANALOGOUS TOTS
)@@G@@ 'D'. @@@@@@@G@@@@ TDATE$ FORMAT WORD:   S1 = MONTH, S2 = DAY, S3 = YEARTT
)@@G@@ MOD 64; H2 =     @A@@@@ TIME IN SECONDS SINCE MIDNIGHT.    @@@@@@@@@@@@TU
)@@G@@@^@@@@ 20. 4. 1.14.   X - SKIP@@@@@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVETV
)@@G@@RSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       20-  6@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@TW
)@@G@@@G@@@@ INPUT:      SKIPS  THE  NUMBER  OF  COLUMNS  IN  THE  INPUT  IMAGTX
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ CORRESPONDING  TO THE VALUE OF <VAR>.  IF <VAR> IS LESS THATY
