)@@G@@UT, SKIPS FORWARDS OR BACKWARDS.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@^@@@@ 20. 4. 1.15.   T UA
)@@G@@- TAB @@@@@@@F@@@@ INPUT:  TABS TO THE COLUMN CORRESPONDING TO THE VALUEUB
)@@G@@ OF <VAR>.  @@@@@@@D@@@@ OUTPUT:  SIMILAR TO INPUT, TABS TO A GIVEN COLUUC
)@@G@@MN.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 20. 4. 1.16.   P - POSITION  @@@@@@@G@@@@ INPUTUD
)@@G@@:    STORES  AS THE VALUE OF THE FIELD THE NUMBER OF THE NEXT     @E@@@@UE
)@@G@@ COLUMN TO BE SCANNED.  DOES NOT CAUSE THE SCANNER TO MOVE. @@@@@@@A@@@@UF
)@@G@@ OUTPUT:  NOT AVAILABLE FOR OUTPUT. @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 20. 4. 1.17.   FCUG
)@@G@@ - FORMS CONTROL  @@@@@@@A@@@@ INPUT:  NOT MEANINGFUL FOR INPUT.  @@@@@@UH
)@@G@@@G@@@@ OUTPUT:    SETS  THE  LINE  SPACING INCREMENT FOR THE RECORD TO BUI
)@@G@@E     @]@@@@ WRITTEN.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 20. 4. 1.18.   ! - NEW RECORDUJ
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ NEW  RECORD.    MAY  APPEAR IN A FIELD BY ITSELF OR AS ONE UK
)@@G@@OR MORE     @G@@@@ OCCURRENCES  AT  THE  BEGINNING OF ANY FIELD.   CAUSEUL
)@@G@@S THE CURRENT     @G@@@@ IMAGE  TO  BE  WRITTEN  AND  A NEW IMAGE TO BE UM
)@@G@@STARTED.  ON INPUT,     @G@@@@ CAUSES A REQUEST FOR THE NEXT IMAGE FROM UN
)@@G@@THE SPECIFIED UNIT.   NEW     @G@@@@ RECORD WORKS FOR ENCODE AND DECODE:UO
)@@G@@   FOR ENCODE,  CAUSES THE EDIT     @G@@@@ TO  BE  RESTARTED,   THE  LASUP
)@@G@@T  IMAGE ONLY IS STORED IN THE USER'S     @F@@@@ BUFFER.  FOR DECODE, THUQ
)@@G@@E EFFECT IS THAT OF A TAB TO COLUMN 1.    @@@@@@@B@@@@ 20. 4. 2.   IMPLIUR
)@@G@@ED DO LOOP IN I/O LIST  @@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  FOLLOWING  IS A SAMPLE OF THE US
)@@G@@CODING OF AN IMPLIED DO LOOP IN     @^@@@@ AN I/O LIST FIELD:     @@@@@@UT
)@@G@@@@@@@@@D@@@@             \<VAR>=<INIT>,<FINAL>[,<INCR>]\<LIST>\   @@@@@@UU
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ <VAR>  NAMES THE LOOP INDUCTION VARIABLE,  AND TAKES ON SUCUV
)@@G@@CESSIVE     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAUW
)@@G@@GE   NPL   REV.23       20-  7@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ VALUES  RANGING  UX
)@@G@@FROM <INIT> TO <FINAL> IN STEPS OF <INCR> (+-1 IF     @G@@@@ OMITTED,   UY
)@@G@@DEPENDING  ON  THE SENSE).   <LIST> WILL BE REPEATED AN     @G@@@@ APPROUZ
)@@G@@PRIATE  NUMBER  OF  TIMES,  AND  MAY  BE A COMPLETE I/O LIST,     @D@@@@VA
)@@G@@ EXCEPT THAT NO NESTING OF IMPLIED LOOPS IS PERMITTED.@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@VB
)@@G@@ THE  PARAMETER LIST DIFFERS FOR EACH TYPE OF STATEMENT,  DESCRIBED     VC
)@@G@@@]@@@@ BELOW.     @@@@@@@@@@@@@^@@@@ 20. 5.   I/O UNITS     @@@@@@@@@@@@VD
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE  UNIT  INDICES  0-13  ARE  CURRENTLY AVAILABLE AS INPUT/OUTPUVE
)@@G@@T     @G@@@@ UNITS.    UNIT  TEN  IS  THE  CARD  READER/LINE PRINTER (ORVF
)@@G@@ DEMAND     @G@@@@ TERMINAL),   UNIT  11  IS  THE OPERATOR'S CONSOLE,  UVG
)@@G@@NIT 12 IS THE     @ @@@@ PUNCH, AND UNIT 13 IS REREAD.@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@VH
)@@G@@ 20. 6.   THE READ STATEMENT  @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@ THE FORMAT OF THE 'READVI
)@@G@@' STATEMENT IS:   @@@@@@@@@@@@@C@@@@                READ (UNIT,END[,'MESVJ
)@@G@@SAGE']) LIST@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ WHERE  'UNIT'  IS THE I/O UNIT NUMBER,  'VK
)@@G@@END' OPTIONALLY NAMES THE     @G@@@@ LABEL OF A STATEMENT TO GET CONTROLVL
)@@G@@ IF AN END OF FILE CONDITION IS     @G@@@@ MET  (THE  LABEL  'EOF'  IS  VM
)@@G@@ASSUMED  IF THIS IS ABSENT),  AND THE     @G@@@@ OPTIONAL 'MESSAGE' WILLVN
)@@G@@,  IF PRESENT, BE USED TO PROMPT INPUT.  IF     @G@@@@ THE I/O UNIT NUMBVO
)@@G@@ER IS NOT 10 OR 11, 'MESSAGE' IS IGNORED.  IF THE     @G@@@@ UNIT  NUMBEVP
)@@G@@R  IS 11 (CONSOLE) AND 'MESSAGE' IS OMITTED,  THE INPUT     @C@@@@ WILL VQ
)@@G@@BE PROMPTED WITH THE MESSAGE 'INPUT?'.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF  THE PARVR
)@@G@@AMETER LIST IS OMITTED ON THE 'READ' STATEMENT,  A CARD     @G@@@@ WILL VS
)@@G@@ BE READ FROM UNIT 10,  THE LABEL 'EOF' IS ASSUMED FOR END OF     @E@@@@VT
)@@G@@ FILE CONDITION, AND NO PROMPT MESSAGE WILL BE DISPLAYED.   @@@@@@@@@@@@VU
)@@G@@@G@@@@ WHEN  READING  FROM  UNITS 0 TO 9 INCLUSIVE,  THE 'READ' STATEMENVV
)@@G@@T     @G@@@@ WILL PASS TO THE USER PROGRAM ONLY THOSE IMAGES WHOSE CONTRVW
)@@G@@OL WORD     @G@@@@ IS  POSITIVE,  THAT IS,  NON-CONTROL IMAGES.   IF IT VX
)@@G@@IS DESIRED TO     @G@@@@ RECEIVE  SDFF  CONTROL  IMAGES  ON  INPUT,  THEVY
)@@G@@ USE OF THE 'INPUT'     @^@@@@ STATEMENT IS INDICATED.@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@VZ
)@@G@@ 20. 7.   THE INPUT STATEMENT @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY WA
)@@G@@PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       20-  8@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@WB
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'INPUT' STATEMENT IS IDENTICAL TO THE 'READ' STATEMENTWC
)@@G@@ IN ALL     @G@@@@ RESPECTS BUT ONE:   IF THE I/O UNIT SPECIFIED IS IN TWD
)@@G@@HE RANGE 0 TO     @G@@@@ 9,   THE  'INPUT' STATEMENT WILL PASS AS DATA IWE
)@@G@@MAGES ALL IMAGES IN     @G@@@@ THE  FILE,   RATHER THAN JUST NON-CONTROLWF
)@@G@@ (DATA) IMAGES.   THIS IS     @G@@@@ USEFUL  FOR  READING  AND  HANDLINGWG
)@@G@@  PRINTFILES.    THE  EXEC8 PRM     @G@@@@ CONTAINS A CHAPTER ON SDFF FIWH
)@@G@@LE HANDLING.  REFER THERE FOR FURTHER     @#@@@@ INFORMATION.     @@@@@@WI
)@@G@@@@@@@@@B@@@@ 20. 8.   THE PRINT AND WRITE STATEMENTS  @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@WJ
)@@G@@                    PRINT <LIST>    @@@@@@@C@@@@               WRITE (UNWK
)@@G@@IT,[FS][,TYPE]) <LIST>  @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'PRINT'  STATEMENT  ASSUWL
)@@G@@MES UNIT 10 AND SINGLE SPACING.   THE     @G@@@@ 'WRITE'  STATEMENT  IS WM
)@@G@@USED TO WRITE TO OTHER THAN THE PRIMARY I/O     @D@@@@ DEVICE, OR TO SPEWN
)@@G@@CIFY OTHER THAN SINGLE SPACING.     @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'FS' FIELD IWO
)@@G@@S AN IDENTIFIER OR NUMERIC EXPRESSION (EXPRESSION     @G@@@@ IN THE FORMWP
)@@G@@ \N\).   IF THE CONSTRUCTION \N\ IS USED,  THE VALUE OF     @G@@@@ THE EWQ
)@@G@@XPRESSION 'N',  TRUNCATED TO 6 BITS, IS USED AS THE NUMBER OF     @G@@@@WR
)@@G@@ LINES TO SKIP BEFORE WRITING.  IF THE FIRST FORM IS USED, THE 'FS'     WS
)@@G@@@A@@@@ FIELD HAS THE FOLLOWING MEANINGS:  @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@            WT
)@@G@@  N  - NO SPACING @D@@@@              S  - SINGLE SPACE, ASSUMED IF ABSEWU
)@@G@@NT    @A@@@@              D  - DOUBLE SPACE     @A@@@@              T  -WV
)@@G@@ TRIPLE SPACE     @A@@@@              PR - PAGE RESTORE     @@@@@@@@@@@@WW
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE  'TYPE'  FIELD  IS  USED  TO DEFINE AN OUTPUT FILE AS EITHER WX
)@@G@@A     @G@@@@ STANDARD PRINT FILE OR SYSTEM FORMAT DATA FILE.   THE 'TYPEWY
)@@G@@' FIELD     @G@@@@ CAN BE 'P',  TO CREATE A PRINT FILE,  OR 'S', TO CREAWZ
)@@G@@TE A STANDARD     @G@@@@ DATA  FILE.   IN  EITHER  CASE, THE FORMS CONTRXA
)@@G@@OL SPECIFICATION IS     @G@@@@ WRITTEN  INTO  EACH  IMAGE CONTROL WORD, XB
)@@G@@AND THE FILE THUS CREATED     @A@@@@ CAN BE PRINTED WITHOUT OVERPRINT.  XC
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IT IS ALSO POSSIBLE TO OUTPUT SDFF CONTROL IMAGES TO XD
)@@G@@UNITS 0 TO 9,     @G@@@@ INCLUSIVE.   SETTING IOP(10,UNIT).S1 TO THE PARXE
)@@G@@TICULR CONTROL CODE     @G@@@@ DESIRED  BEFORE  EXECUTING  A  'WRITE' STXF
)@@G@@ATEMENT TO THAT UNIT WILL     @#@@@@ ACCOMPLISH THIS. @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@XG
)@@G@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       20-  9XH
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 20. 9.   THE PUNCH STATEMENT @@@@@@XI
)@@G@@@@@@@@@A@@@@                    PUNCH <LIST>    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  XJ
)@@G@@'PUNCH'  STATEMENT  HAS  A  FORMAT  IDENTICAL  TO THAT OF THE     @G@@@@XK
)@@G@@ 'PRINT'  STATEMENT,   AND  IS  ENTIRELY  EQUIVALENT  TO  A 'WRITE'     XL
)@@G@@@C@@@@ STATEMENT SPECIFYING UNIT 12 (CARD PUNCH).     @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@XM
)@@G@@ 20.10.   CLOSING I/O UNITS   @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ FORMATTED  I/O  UNITS  XN
)@@G@@ARE  CLOSED  (AND  OUTPUT  BUFFERS DRAINED)     @G@@@@ WHENEVER  THE UNIXO
)@@G@@T IS RELEASED VIA THE 'FILES' STATEMENT,  OR WHEN     @G@@@@ NPL  TERMINXP
)@@G@@ATES.    ADDITIONALLY,   INPUT  UNITS ARE AUTOMATICALLY     @G@@@@ CLOSEXQ
)@@G@@D  WHEN  THE END OF FILE IS REACHED.   UNITS ARE CLOSED,  BUT     @G@@@@XR
)@@G@@ BUFFERS  ARE  NOT  DRAINED,  IF A 'RESTORE' DIRECTIVE IS EXECUTED.     XS
)@@G@@@G@@@@ HOWEVER, IT IS OFTEN NECESSARY TO CLOSE A UNIT AT OTHER THAN THESXT
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ TIMES,  AND  THE  'CLOSE'  STATEMENT  IS PROVIDED FOR THIS XU
)@@G@@REASON.     @G@@@@ EXECUTION  OF  A  'CLOSE'  STATEMENT  CLOSES  AND DRAXV
)@@G@@INS THE UNITS     @G@@@@ SPECIFIED,   ALLOWING FOR A CHANGE IN I/O MODE XW
)@@G@@(INPUT TO OUTPUT OR     @G@@@@ VICE  VERSA) OR FOR AVAILABILITY TO THE BXX
)@@G@@INARY I/O ROUTINES.   THE     @A@@@@ FORMAT OF THE 'CLOSE' STATEMENT IS:XY
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@                    CLOSE <UNIT1>,<UNIT2>,...,<UNITN> XZ
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@ 20.11.   THE ENCODE AND DECODE STATEMENTS@@@@@@@@@@@@YA
)@@G@@@]@@@@ FORMAT:    @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@                    ENCODE (BUFFER) YB
)@@G@@<LIST>@@@@@@@B@@@@                    DECODE (BUFFER) <LIST>@@@@@@@@@@@@YC
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE  'ENCODE'  AND  'DECODE' STATEMENTS ARE USED TO MAKE FORMATTEYD
)@@G@@D     @G@@@@ DATA  TRANSFERS.     THEY  BEHAVE  LIKE  THE  'WRITE'  AND YE
)@@G@@ 'READ'     @G@@@@ STATEMENTS,   RESPECTIVELY.    'BUFFER' NAMES THE IMAYF
)@@G@@GE INTO WHICH     @G@@@@ ITEMS ARE ENCODED,  OR OUT OF WHICH THEY ARE DEYG
)@@G@@CODED.  IF 'BUFFER'     @G@@@@ IS A STRING VARIABLE,  THE MAXIMUM NUMBERYH
)@@G@@ OF CHARACTERS FOR DECODE     @G@@@@ IS  THE  LENGTH OF THE CURRENT ASSIYI
)@@G@@GNMENT.   THE MAXIMUM NUMBER OF     @G@@@@ CHARACTERS  OUTPUT BY ENCODE YJ
)@@G@@TO A STRING VARIABLE IS DETERMINED BY     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORKYK
)@@G@@ UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       20- 10@@@@@@@@@@@@YL
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  DIMENSION  LIMIT.  IF 'BUFFER' IS A SIMPLE ARRAY OR VAYM
)@@G@@RIABLE,     @G@@@@ IN  EITHER CASE,  THE MAXIMUM TRANSFER WILL BE SIX CHYN
)@@G@@ARACTERS (FOR     @G@@@@ UNDIMENSIONED  VARIABLES) OR THE REMAINING SPACYO
)@@G@@E IN THE ARRAY FROM     @D@@@@ THE ADDRESS SPECIFIED FOR DIMENSIONED VARYP
)@@G@@IABLES.     @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF  THE  'ENCODE' STATEMENT IS USED TO ENYQ
)@@G@@CODE A STRING ARRAY,  THE     @G@@@@ COUNT  OF  CHARACTERS PRODUCED IS SYR
)@@G@@TORED INTO ARRAY(0).  REMEMBER,     @G@@@@ APPLYING  A  SUBSCRIPT  TO  AYS
)@@G@@ STRING VARIABLE NAME CAUSES IT TO BE     @C@@@@ TREATED AS ARITHMETIC IYT
)@@G@@N THE GIVEN CONTEXT.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 20.12.   MAXIMUM BUFFER SIZE YU
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  MAXIMUM  BUFFER  SIZE FOR A FORMATTED WRITE TO PYV
)@@G@@RINTER IS 132     @G@@@@ CHARACTERS.    FOR  WRITE TO THE CONSOLE,  50 CYW
)@@G@@HARACTERS,  AND FOR     @G@@@@ WRITE TO ANY OTHER UNIT,  378 CHARACTERS YX
)@@G@@(63 WORDS).   THE MAXIMUM     @G@@@@ INPUT  SIZE FOR 'DECODE' IS UNLIMITYY
)@@G@@ED,  BUT IMAGES READ WILL NEVER     @G@@@@ BE  FROM  ANY  UNIT  WILL  NEYZ
)@@G@@VER BE GREATER THAN 378 CHARACTERS IN     @G@@@@ LENGTH,  AND IMAGES ACCZA
)@@G@@EPTED FROM THE CONSOLE WILL NEVER EXCEED 50     @]@@@@ CHARACTERS.@@@@@@ZB
)@@G@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 20.13.   I/O PACKET REFERENCE@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  INTRINZC
)@@G@@SIC  PSEUDO-FUNCTION  'IOP'  ADDRESSES NPL I/O PACKETS.     @G@@@@ 'IOP'ZD
)@@G@@ EXPECTS TWO ARGUMENTS, THE FIRST IS THE RELATIVE WORD NUMBER     @G@@@@ZE
)@@G@@ WITHIN THE PACKET TO BE REFERENCED, AND THE SECOND IS THE I/O UNIT     ZF
)@@G@@@^@@@@ NUMBER IN QUESTION.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  LAST  I/O  STATUS ZG
)@@G@@ IS  FOUND  IN  S1 OF THE THIRD WORD IN THE     @G@@@@ PACKET.   THE  LAZH
)@@G@@ST  IMAGE  CONTROL  WORD  (A0 RETURN FOR UNIT 10,     @G@@@@ PKT.H2 FOR ZI
)@@G@@UNIT 11) IS FOUND IN THE TENTH WORD OF THE PACKET.   IF     @G@@@@ IOP(1ZJ
)@@G@@0,10)  IS  NEGATIVE,   NO  FURTHER INPUT IS POSSIBLE FROM THE     @^@@@@ZK
)@@G@@ PRIMARY I/O DEVICE.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@^@@@@ 20.14.   BINARY I/O    @@@@@@ZL
)@@G@@@@@@@@@C@@@@ THE 'IOW' STATEMENT HAS THE FOLLOWING FORMAT:  @@@@@@@@@@@@ZM
)@@G@@@E@@@@              IOW (UNIT,COUNT,ADDR,FUNC) BUFFER [,TARGET]   @@@@@@ZN
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ WHERE 'UNIT' IS AS DESCRIBED PREVIOUSLY,  'COUNT' IS THE NUZO
)@@G@@MBER OF     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAZP
)@@G@@GE   NPL   REV.23       20- 11@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ WORDS TO TRANSFERZQ
)@@G@@,  'ADDR' IS THE UNIT ADDRESS,  AND 'FUNC' IS THE     @G@@@@ I/O FUNCTIOZR
)@@G@@N CODE.   'COUNT' AND/OR 'ADDR' MAY BE OMITTED IF THEIR     @G@@@@ PRESEZS
)@@G@@NCE  IS   NOT  REQUIRED  FOR  THE  PARTICULAR  I/O  OPERATION     @G@@@@ZT
)@@G@@ SELECTED.    THE  'FUNC'  FIELD  HAS  TWO  FORMATS:   IT MAY BE AN     ZU
)@@G@@@G@@@@ IDENTIFIER,   IN  WHICH CASE IT IS TAKEN TO REPRESENT THE STANDARZV
)@@G@@D     @G@@@@ ABBREVIATION   FOR   I/O  FUNCTIONS  AS  DEFINED  IN  THE  ZW
)@@G@@ELEMENT     @G@@@@ SYS$*RLIB$.ERU$.   IT MAY BE A NUMERIC EXPRESSION IN ZX
)@@G@@THE FORM \N\,     @G@@@@ WHERE  THE  LOW  ORDER  6  BITS  OF  THE  EVALUZY
)@@G@@ATED  RESULT OF THE     @G@@@@ EXPRESSION ARE USED AS THE FUNCTION CODE.ZZ
)@@G@@   IF 'N' EVALUATES TO -0     @G@@@@ OR  IF THE 'FUNC' FIELD IS OMITTED,AA
)@@G@@  THE LAST I/O FUNCTION FOR THE     @G@@@@ UNIT  IN  QUESTION IS USED.  AB
)@@G@@ IF ANY FIELD IS OMITTED,  THE PROPER     @A@@@@ NUMBER OF COMMAS IS STIAC
)@@G@@LL REQUIRED.@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ 'BUFFER'  NAMES  THE I/O BUFFER,  AND MUSAD
)@@G@@T BE LARGE ENOUGH TO HOLD     @G@@@@ THE  ENTIRE  TRANSFER COUNT.   'TARAE
)@@G@@GET' IS OPTIONAL AND IS USED TO     @E@@@@ SPECIFY THE SEARCH TARGET FORAF
)@@G@@ DEVICE SEARCH OPERATIONS.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ NOTE:    THE VALUE IN HAG
)@@G@@2 OF 'COUNT' BECOMES THE VALUE IN H1 OF THE     @G@@@@ ACW  FOR  THE  I/AH
)@@G@@O  OPERATION.    FOR  THIS  REASON,   A 'G' FIELD     @G@@@@ (INCREMENTAAI
)@@G@@TION  OR DECREMENTATION CONTROL) MAY BE SPECIFIED,  AND     @G@@@@ WILL AJ
)@@G@@ TREATED PROPERLY BY NPL.   THE FORMAT OF THE I/O ACW (ACCESS     @G@@@@AK
)@@G@@ CONTROL WORD) IS BEYOND THE SCOPE OF THIS MANUAL,  AND, AGAIN, THE     AL
)@@G@@@E@@@@ READER CAN REFER TO THE EXEC8 PRM FOR PERTINENT DETAILS.   @@@@@@AM
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE I/O STATUS MAY BE REFERENCED IN IOP(3,UNIT).S1,  WHERE AN
)@@G@@UNIT IS     @C@@@@ THE I/O UNIT NUMBER FROM THE 'IOW' STATEMENT.  @@@@@@AO
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ OPTIONALLY,    THE  DIRECTIVE  'IOW'  MAY  BE  REPLACED  BYAP
)@@G@@  'IO'.     @G@@@@ EXECUTING  AN  'IO' STATEMENT CAUSES THE I/O REQUEST AQ
)@@G@@TO BE ISSUED,     @G@@@@ BUT THE PROGRAM DOES NOT WAIT FOR I/O COMPLETIOAR
)@@G@@N.  SYNCHRONIZATION     @G@@@@ CAN  BE EFFECTED BY EXECUTING A 'WAIT' STAS
)@@G@@ATEMENT, WHOSE FORMAT IT:     @@@@@@@@@@@@@C@@@@                    WAITAT
)@@G@@ <UNIT1>,<UNIT2>,...    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ WHERE  THE  <UNITS> ARE I/O UAU
)@@G@@NIT NUMBERS TO WHICH ASYNCHRONOUS I/O     @^@@@@ HAS BEEN PERFORMED.    AV
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ EXECUTING  A  'WAIT'  STATEMENT  SPECIFYING  AN  I/O AW
)@@G@@UNIT OPEN FOR     @G@@@@ FORMATTED I/O IS NOT RECOMMENDED, AS IT WILL DEAX
)@@G@@FEAT THE PURPOSE OF     @G@@@@ THE DOUBLE BUFFERING SCHEME USED TO INCREAY
)@@G@@ASE THE EFFICIENCY OF THE     @G@@@@ FORMATTED I/O ROUTINES.   HOWEVER, AZ
)@@G@@IF NECESSARY FOR SOME REASON IN     @G@@@@ THE  COURSE OF EXECUTION,  A BA
)@@G@@'WAIT' STATEMENT CAN BE USED FOR THIS     @ @@@@ PURPOSE WITH NO ILL EFFBB
)@@G@@ECTS. @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NBC
)@@G@@PL   REV.23       20- 12@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ I/O  COMPLEBD
)@@G@@TION  IS  ALWAYS  WAITED ON IF ANY OTHER I/O REQUEST IS     @^@@@@ MADE BE
)@@G@@TO THE SAME UNIT. @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING BF
)@@G@@LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       21-  1@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 21.   MISCEBG
)@@G@@LLANEOUS STATEMENTS     @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 21. 1.   HIBH
)@@G@@GH SPEED SEARCH   @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 21. 1. 1.   THE SEARCH STATEMBI
)@@G@@ENT   @@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'SEARCH'  STATEMENT  IS  PROVIDED AS A MEANS OF BJ
)@@G@@UTILIZING THE     @G@@@@ HIGH SPEED HARDWARE SEARCH FEATURE OF THE 1100 BK
)@@G@@SERIES CPU'S.   THE     @B@@@@ FORMAT OF THE 'SEARCH' STATEMENT IS:     BL
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@F@@@@       SEARCH <EXPR>,<ARRAY>,<COUNT>,<FLAG>[,[<INCR>],BM
)@@G@@[<TYPE>]]   @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ WHERE  <EXPR>  IS ANY NUMERIC EXPRESSION BN
)@@G@@AND IS THE SEARCH TARGET,     @G@@@@ <ARRAY>  IS  THE  ARRAY TO SEARCH FBO
)@@G@@OR AN OCCURRENCE OF THE TARGET,     @G@@@@ <COUNT>  IS  THE  NUMBER  OF BP
)@@G@@WORDS OF <ARRAY> TO BE SEARCHED,  AND     @G@@@@ <INCR>,   WHICH  IS  OPBQ
)@@G@@TIONAL,   IS  THE INCREMENT TO BE USED WHEN     @G@@@@ INDEXING  THROUGHBR
)@@G@@  <ARRAY>.    <ARRAY> MAY HAVE APPENDED A PARTIAL     @G@@@@ WORD  DESIGBS
)@@G@@NATOR,  AND ONLY THOSE PARTIAL WORDS IN <ARRAY> WILL BE     @F@@@@ SEARCBT
)@@G@@HED.  IF <INCR> IS OMITTED, THE ASSUMED VALUE WILL BE ONE.  @@@@@@@@@@@@BU
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE  OPTIONAL  <TYPE>  FIELD CAN BE USED TO SPECIFY A SEARCH OTHEBV
)@@G@@R     @G@@@@ THAN A SEARCH EQUAL.   IT IS CODED AS AN IDENTIFIER,  AND CBW
)@@G@@AN HAVE     @A@@@@ ONE OF THE FOLLOWING LEGAL VALUES: @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@BX
)@@G@@                 SE   - SEARCH EQUAL@B@@@@                 SNE  - SEARCHBY
)@@G@@ NOT EQUAL  @D@@@@                 SLE  - SEARCH LESS THAN OR EQUAL     BZ
)@@G@@@C@@@@                 SG   - SEARCH GREATER THAN     @@@@@@@E@@@@ ADDITCA
)@@G@@IONALLY, THE FOLLOWING MASKED SEARCHES ARE AVAILABLE: @@@@@@@A@@@@      CB
)@@G@@    MSE  - MASKED SEARCH EQUAL@B@@@@          MSNE - MASKED SEARCH NOT ECC
)@@G@@QUAL  @D@@@@          MSLE - MASKED SEARCH LESS THAN OR EQUAL     @C@@@@CD
)@@G@@          MSG  - MASKED SEARCH GREATER THAN     @F@@@@          MASL - MCE
)@@G@@ASKED ALPHANUMERIC SEARCH LESS THAN OR EQUAL    @E@@@@          MASG - MCF
)@@G@@ASKED ALPHANUMERIC SEARCH GREATER THAN    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ 'SE'  IS  ACG
)@@G@@SSUMED  IF  THE <TYPE> FIELD IS OMITTED AND THE PARTIAL     @[@@@@*****^CH
)@@G@@@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       CI
)@@G@@21-  2@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ WORD  FIELD  IS NOT 'M'.    'MSE' IS THE CJ
)@@G@@DEFAULT TYPE FOR A MASKED     @G@@@@ SEARCH.    IF THE PARTIAL WORD DESICK
)@@G@@GNATOR IS OMITTED OR 'W',   AND     @G@@@@ <TYPE> SPECIFIES A MASKED SEACL
)@@G@@RCH,   'M' IS ASSUMED FOR THE PARTIAL     @#@@@@ WORD DESIGNATOR. @@@@@@CM
)@@G@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  ALPHANUMERIC  SEARCHES  ('MASL' AND 'MASG')  DIFFER  FCN
)@@G@@ROM THE     @G@@@@ OTHERS IN THAT THE SIGN BIT IS IGNORED WHEN COMPARINGCO
)@@G@@ LESS THAN OR     @G@@@@ EQUAL OR GREATER THAN.    THE SEARCH TARGET ANDCP
)@@G@@ THE WORDS SEARCHED     @D@@@@ ARE TREATED AS UNSIGNED (POSITIVE) 36 BITCQ
)@@G@@ INTEGERS.  @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ EXAMPLE:   TO  SEARCH EVERY THIRD WORD INCR
)@@G@@ THE ARRAY 'A$' OF LENGTH     @G@@@@ 100  FOR  THE  FIRST  OCCURRENCE  OCS
)@@G@@F ZERO IN THE FIFTH SIXTH,  THE     @C@@@@ FOLLOWING 'SEARCH' STATEMENT CT
)@@G@@WOULD BE EXECUTED:@@@@@@@@@@@@@C@@@@                SEARCH 0, A$.S5, 100CU
)@@G@@, S0, 3     @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  RESULTS  OF THE SEARCH OPERATION ARECV
)@@G@@ COMMUNICATED THROUGH THE     @C@@@@ VARIABLE S0, WHOSE FORMAT WOULD BE CW
)@@G@@AS FOLLOWS: @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@          <FLAG>.H1 0 IF THE SEARCH FAILEDCX
)@@G@@@C@@@@                    1 IF THE SEARCH SUCCEEDED   @@@@@@@@@@@@@E@@@@CY
)@@G@@          <FLAG>.H2 THE RELATIVE POSITION WITHIN <ARRAY>    @D@@@@      CZ
)@@G@@              AT WHICH THE SEARCH SUCCEEDED.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@ IF, FDA
)@@G@@OR INSTANCE, A SEARCH STATEMENT WERE CODED AS   @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@      DB
)@@G@@          SEARCH 'ABC',B$(10),11,S0 @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  NUMERIC LITEDC
)@@G@@RAL 'ABC' (RIGHT JUSTIFIED,  ZERO FILLED) WILL BE     @G@@@@ SEARCHED FODD
)@@G@@R IN B$,  STARTING AT B$(10).   THE SEARCH WILL STOP AT     @G@@@@ B$(20DE
)@@G@@) (11 WORDS FROM B$(10),  INCLUSIVE).  IF THE SEARCH SUCCEEDS     @E@@@@DF
)@@G@@ AT, SAY, B$(15), THE VALUE IN S0, BITS 17-0, WILL BE 6.    @@@@@@@@@@@@DG
)@@G@@@A@@@@ 21. 2.   RANDOM NUMBER GENERATOR   @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 21. 2DH
)@@G@@. 1.   THE RNDMZE STATEMENT   @@@@@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVEDI
)@@G@@RSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       21-  3@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@DJ
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE  'RNDMZE' STATEMENT IS USED (IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE INTRINSIDK
)@@G@@C     @G@@@@ FUNCTION  'RND') TO INITIALIZE NPL'S INTERNAL PSEUDO-RANDOMDL
)@@G@@ NUMBER     @D@@@@ GENERATOR.  THE FORMAT OF THE 'RNDMZE' STATEMENT IS: DM
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@                       RNDMZE @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF 'RDN
)@@G@@ND' IS CALLED WITH NO ARGUMENTS,  OR AN ARGUMENT OF ZERO, THE     @G@@@@DO
)@@G@@ RANDOM  NUMBER  RETURNED WILL RANGE IN VALUE FROM 0 TO THE HIGHEST     DP
)@@G@@@G@@@@ VALUE  STORABLE.   IF AN ARGUMENT IS SPECIFIED,  THE RANDOM NUMBEDQ
)@@G@@R     @G@@@@ RETURNED  WILL  RANGE IN VALUE FROM 0 TO THE VALUE OF THE ADR
)@@G@@RGUMENT     @G@@@@ MINUS  ONE.    IF  THE  ARGUMENT  IS  NEGATIVE,  THE DS
)@@G@@RANDOM NUMBER     @ @@@@ RETURNED WILL BE NEGATIVE.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@DT
)@@G@@ 21. 3.   STRING SIZE REDEFINITION  @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 21. 3. 1.  DU
)@@G@@ THE RESIZE STATEMENT   @@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'RESIZE'  STATEMENT  IS USED TDV
)@@G@@O REDEFINE THE LENGTH OF STRING     @G@@@@ VARIABLES BY REMOVING THE COUDW
)@@G@@NT OF TRAILING BLANKS FROM THE STORED     @B@@@@ LENGTH OF THE STRING.  DX
)@@G@@ITS FORMAT IS:    @@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@             RESIZE <STRINGVAR1>,<STDY
)@@G@@RINGVAR2>,...     @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ AS  MANY  STRING NAMES AS DESIRED MDZ
)@@G@@AY BE SPECIFIED IN ONE 'RESIZE'     @]@@@@ STATEMENT. @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@EA
)@@G@@ 21. 4.   REAL TIME CLOCK     @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 21. 4. 1.   THE CEB
)@@G@@LOCK STATEMENT    @@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'CLOCK' STATEMENT PROVIDES A MEANS FEC
)@@G@@OR NPL PROGRAMS TO START,     @G@@@@ STOP,  READ  AND RESET AN INTERNAL ED
)@@G@@REAL TIME CLOCK.    THE KEYWORD     @G@@@@ 'CLOCK'  CONTAINS  THE  TIME EE
)@@G@@IN MILLISECONDS ACCUMULATED BETWEEN A     @G@@@@ CLOCK  START  AND A CLOEF
)@@G@@CK STOP REQUEST.  THE FORMAT OF THE 'CLOCK'     @#@@@@ STATEMENT IS:    EG
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@E@@@@             CLOCK <REQUEST1> <REQUEST2> ... <REQUESTNEH
)@@G@@>     @@@@@@@@@@@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING EI
)@@G@@LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       21-  4@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@F@@@@ WHERE THE 'EJ
)@@G@@REQUEST' PARAMETERS ARE FROM THE FOLLOWING TABLE:     @@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@EK
)@@G@@                START      STARTS THE REAL TIME CLOCK.@@@@@@@E@@@@      EL
)@@G@@          STOP       STOPS  THE  REAL  TIME  CLOCK AND@E@@@@            EM
)@@G@@               ADDS  THE INCREMENTAL TIME TO THE@E@@@@                  EN
)@@G@@         TOTAL TIME ACCUMULATED AND STORES@B@@@@                        EO
)@@G@@   IT IN 'CLOCK'. @@@@@@@E@@@@                READ       DISPLAYS THE TIEP
)@@G@@ME ACCUMULATED.   @@@@@@@E@@@@                RESET      RESETS  THE  ACEQ
)@@G@@CUMULATED  TIME TO@E@@@@                           ZERO WITHOUT STOPPINGER
)@@G@@ THE CLOCK. @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAES
)@@G@@GE   NPL   REV.23       22-  1@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 22.   DIAGNOSTIC ET
)@@G@@FACILITIES  @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 22. 1.   STATEMENT TRACEU
)@@G@@E     @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF A NONZERO VALUE IS ASSIGNED TO THE KEYWORD 'EV
)@@G@@TRACE', A STATEMENT     @G@@@@ BY  STATEMENT  TRACE OF THE EXECUTING PROEW
)@@G@@GRAM IS PRODUCED WITH THE     @^@@@@ FOLLOWING INFORMATION: @@@@@@@@@@@@EX
)@@G@@@D@@@@             THE STATEMENT NUMBER WITHIN THE PROGRAM  @D@@@@      EY
)@@G@@       THE TOTAL NUMBER OF STATEMENTS EXECUTED  @E@@@@             THE PEZ
)@@G@@ROGRAM EXECUTION LEVEL AND PROGRAM NAME   @B@@@@             THE STATEMEFA
)@@G@@NT BEING EXECUTED @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ IF  THE VALUE ASSIGNED TO 'TRACE' IFB
)@@G@@S > 0,  TRACING STARTS WHEN THE     @F@@@@ STATEMENT WHOSE NUMBER EQUALSFC
)@@G@@ THE VALUE OF 'TRACE' IS REACHED.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 22. 2.   THE DUMPFD
)@@G@@ STATEMENT  @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'DUMP'  STATEMENT PROVIDES A MEANS OFE
)@@G@@F DUMPING THE CONTENTS OF     @G@@@@ VARIABLES,   ARRAYS OR PROGRAMS.   FF
)@@G@@THE THREE FORMATS OF THE 'DUMP'     @#@@@@ STATEMENT ARE:   @@@@@@@@@@@@FG
)@@G@@@A@@@@                    DUMP <EXPR>,... @A@@@@                    DUMPFH
)@@G@@ <IDENT>,...@B@@@@                    DUMP <IDENT>*,...     @@@@@@@@@@@@FI
)@@G@@@G@@@@ IN  THE  FIRST  FORMAT,   <EXPR> REPRESENTS A BIT MASK WHERE BIT FJ
)@@G@@0     @G@@@@ REQUESTS  A  DUMP  OF  THE VARIABLE STORAGE CONTROL VECTOR,FK
)@@G@@  BIT 1     @G@@@@ REQUESTS A DUMP OF THE VARIABLE STORAGE VECTOR, AND BFL
)@@G@@IT 2 REQUESTS     @G@@@@ A DUMP OF THE NPL KEYWORD DESCRIPTORS.  ANY OTHFM
)@@G@@ER BIT SETTINGS ARE     @G@@@@ IGNORED.   FORMAT TWO REQUIRES THE NAME OFN
)@@G@@F AN IDENTIFIER, WHICH IS     @G@@@@ ANY  ARRAY  NAME.    THE  ENTIRE  AFO
)@@G@@RRAY NAMED WILL BE DUMPED,  ANY     @G@@@@ SUBSCRIPT  IS  IGNORED.    THFP
)@@G@@E  THIRD FORM OF THE 'DUMP' STATEMENT     @G@@@@ DUMPS  THE  PROGRAM  NAFQ
)@@G@@MED  BY  <IDENT>.   ALL DUMPS ARE EDITED IN     @G@@@@ OCTAL.    ANY  COFR
)@@G@@MBINATION OF REQUESTS IS LEGAL ON A SINGLE 'DUMP'     @]@@@@ STATEMENT. FS
)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   RFT
)@@G@@EV.23       23-  1@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@^@@@@ 23.   NPL TERMINATION  @@@@@@FU
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 23. 1.   THE END STATEMENT   @@@@@@@@@@@@FV
)@@G@@@G@@@@ THE  'END' STATEMENT IS USED TO TERMINATE THE NPL PROCESSOR.   NPFW
)@@G@@L     @G@@@@ WILL  EXIT NORMALLY WHENEVER AN EXEC8 CONTROL STATEMENT IS FX
)@@G@@ENTERED     @G@@@@ AS  INPUT.  THE 'END' STATEMENT, HOWEVER, BESIDES TERFY
)@@G@@MINATING NPL,     @G@@@@ ALSO  PROVIDES  STATISTICS  CONCERNING  THE EXEFZ
)@@G@@CUTION OF NPL BEING     @]@@@@ TERMINATED.@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 23. 2.   THGA
)@@G@@E ERRX STATEMENT  @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  'ERRX'  STATEMENT  PROVIDES  AGB
)@@G@@ MEANS FOR A PROGRAM TO REQUEST     @C@@@@ ABNORMAL TERMINATION OF NPL. GC
)@@G@@ ITS FORMAT IS:   @@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@                    ERRX [<ERROR MESGD
)@@G@@SAGE>]@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  OPTIONAL  <ERROR  MESSAGE>  IS  A STRING OGE
)@@G@@R STRING EXPRESSION     @G@@@@ WHICH,  IF PRESENT,  WILL BE PRINTED,  ANGF
)@@G@@D CAN BE USED TO IDENTIFY     @G@@@@ THE ERROR REQUEST.   WALK BACK AND GG
)@@G@@STATISTICS WILL BE PRINTED, AND     @ @@@@ NPL WILL TERMINATE IN ERROR. GH
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@ 23. 3.   THE ABORT STATEMENT @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  GI
)@@G@@'ABORT'  STATEMENT  CAUSES  UNCONDITIONAL  AND  IMMEDIATE RUN     @^@@@@GJ
)@@G@@ ABORT.  ITS FORMAT IS: @@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@                    ABORT     GK
)@@G@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   RGL
)@@G@@EV.23       24-  1@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@#@@@@ 24.   APPENDICES @@@@@@@@@@@@GM
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@B@@@@ 24. 1.   APPENDIX A - PROCESSOR CALL     @@@@@@GN
)@@G@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ THE NPL PROCESSOR CALL IS SIMPLY:  @@@@@@@@@@@@@^@@@@      GO
)@@G@@              @NPL@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ NPL  DOES  NOT EXPECT OR USE INFORMGP
)@@G@@ATION FROM THE SPECIFICATION OR     @G@@@@ OPTIONS FIELDS.  ANY INFORMATGQ
)@@G@@ION PASSED THROUGH THE PROCESSOR CALL     @G@@@@ STATEMENT  (OPTIONS,  FGR
)@@G@@ILE NAMES,  ETC.) IS MADE AVAILABLE TO USER     @G@@@@ PROGRAMS  BY  REFGS
)@@G@@ERENCING  THE IMPLICIT NPL DEFINED ARRAY 'INFOR'.     @G@@@@ THE  FORMATGT
)@@G@@  OF INFOR ENTRIES IS DOCUMENTED IN THE 1108 EXEC8 PRM.     @F@@@@ NOTE:GU
)@@G@@ INFOR(0) CONTAINS THE NUMBER OF WORDS OF INFOR PRODUCED.   @@@@@@@@@@@@GV
)@@G@@@A@@@@ 24. 2.   APPENDIX B - NPL MAXIMUMS @@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@       ITEM GW
)@@G@@                       MAXIMUM NUMBER     @D@@@@   ---------------------GX
)@@G@@----------------------------- @@@@@@@A@@@@    EXTERNAL PROGRAMS, FUNCTIOGY
)@@G@@NS AND@C@@@@    DIMENSIONED NATURAL VARIABLES        100    @@@@@@@C@@@@GZ
)@@G@@    NESTED SUBROUTINES (BRANCH)            5    @@@@@@@C@@@@    EQUIVALEHA
)@@G@@NCES AT EACH PROGRAM LEVEL    25    @@@@@@@C@@@@    QUALIFIER SYNONYMS  HB
)@@G@@                  50    @@@@@@@C@@@@    NESTED PROGRAMS (RECURSIVE CALLSHC
)@@G@@)     10    @@@@@@@C@@@@    NESTED FUNCTIONS                      10    HD
)@@G@@@@@@@@@C@@@@    NUMERIC EXPRESSION RECURSIONS         15    @@@@@@@C@@@@HE
)@@G@@    NESTED PARENTHETICAL GROUPS           20    @@@@@@@C@@@@    PROGRAM HF
)@@G@@ARGUMENTS                     20    @@@@@@@C@@@@    FUNCTION ARGUMENTS  HG
)@@G@@                  20    @@@@@@@[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY HH
)@@G@@PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       24-  2@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@C@@@@HI
)@@G@@    ACTIVE FILES                          10    @@@@@@@C@@@@    ALTERNATHJ
)@@G@@ION COMPONENTS                10    @@@@@@@D@@@@    INITIAL MAXIMUM STRIHK
)@@G@@NG SIZE           63 (WORDS)  @E@@@@    INITIAL MAXIMUM STRING SIZE     HL
)@@G@@     378 (CHARACTERS)   @@@@@@@@@@@@@C@@@@ 24. 3.   APPENDIX C - MISCELLHM
)@@G@@ANEOUS KEYWORDS   @@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@#@@@@ 24. 3. 1.   STLIM@@@@@@@G@@@@HN
)@@G@@ 'STLIM'  IS A KEYWORD WHOSE VALUE IS THE NUMBER OF STATEMENTS THAT     HO
)@@G@@@G@@@@ CAN  BE EXECUTED IN A PROGRAM OR PROGRAM NEST BEFORE THE EXECUTIOHP
)@@G@@N     @G@@@@ IS TO BE TERMINATED.   THE INITAL VALUE IS -0,  ALLOWING UNHQ
)@@G@@LIMITED     @G@@@@ STATEMENT  EXECUTION.    USE  OF  STLIM  IS  HELPFUL HR
)@@G@@ IN DEBUGGING     @D@@@@ PROGRAMS SUFFERING FROM INFINITE LOOPS AND THE HS
)@@G@@LIKE. @@@@@@@#@@@@ 24. 3. 2.   STCNT@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  COUNT  OF STATEMENHT
)@@G@@TS EXECUTED IS STORED IN 'STCNT'.   PROGRAM     @G@@@@ ABORT  OCCURS WHEHU
)@@G@@N STCNT BECOMES EQUAL TO STLIM.   STCNT IS SET TO     @G@@@@ MIN(STLIM-1HV
)@@G@@00,STLIM)  WHEN  A TRAP OF ERROR 52 OCCURS,  HELPING TO     @F@@@@ PREVEHW
)@@G@@NT AN INFINITE LOOP FROM OCCURRING DURING ERROR PROCESSING. @@@@@@@^@@@@HX
)@@G@@ 24. 3. 3.   ASCIIT     @@@@@@@G@@@@ THE TRANSLATION TABLE USED BY THE FHY
)@@G@@UNCTIONS ASC, ALC, ACC, AND AFD     @G@@@@ MAY BE ADDRESSED BY REFERENCIHZ
)@@G@@NG THE KEYWORD ARRAY ASCIIT.   ASCIIT     @^@@@@ IS LAYED OUT AS SUCH:  IA
)@@G@@@@@@@@@C@@@@               ASCIIT(F).Q1  =  ASCII LOWER CASE@D@@@@      IB
)@@G@@         ASCIIT(F).Q2  =  ASCII CONTROL CODE    @D@@@@               ASCIC
)@@G@@IIT(F).Q3  =  ASCII UPPER CASE CODE @C@@@@               ASCIIT(A).Q4  =ID
)@@G@@  FIELDATA CODE   @@@@@@@G@@@@ WHERE F IS A FIELDATA CHARACTER,   AND A IE
)@@G@@IS THE LOW ORDER SIX BITS     @G@@@@ OF  AN  ASCII CHARACTER WITH THE UPIF
)@@G@@PER CASE BIT MASKED OUT SO THAT     @G@@@@ THE ASCII CODES ARE FOLDED, IIG
)@@G@@N SOME CASES TWICE, OVER THE FIELDATA     @G@@@@ CHARACTER  SET.    THUSIH
)@@G@@ AN ASCII SOH (01),  UPPER CASE A AND LOWER     @D@@@@ CASE A ALL MAP ONII
)@@G@@TO THE FIELDATA CHARACTER A, ETC.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@A@@@@ 24. 4.   APPENDIXIJ
)@@G@@ D - CHARACTER SET@@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@ THE NPL CHARACTER SET CONSISTS OF TIK
)@@G@@HE FOLLOWING:     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEW YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING IL
)@@G@@LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       24-  3@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@ @@@@       LETTEIM
)@@G@@RS-  A,B,C,...,Z  @@@@@@@ @@@@       DIGITS-  0,1,2,...,9   @@@@@@@C@@@@IN
)@@G@@       PUNCTUATION-  . , : \ ( ) ; ' (BLANK)    @@@@@@@C@@@@       OPERAIO
)@@G@@TORS-  + - / * ! $ % & < > = # @    @@@@@@@D@@@@       CONTROL-  & ? ^ [IP
)@@G@@ ] (BACK ARROW, NONPRINTING)  @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ ADDITIONALLY,   ANY  CHIQ
)@@G@@ARACTER  IN  THE FIELDATA CHARACTER SET MAY     @^@@@@ APPEAR IN A LITERIR
)@@G@@AL.   @@@@@@@@@@@@@D@@@@ 24. 5.   APPENDIX E - REENTRANT PROCESSOR (REP)IS
)@@G@@ USAGE@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  EXEC8 INTERFACE MECHANISM ('ER' STATEMENT IT
)@@G@@IN NPL) CAN BE USED     @G@@@@ TO  LINK  NPL  PROGRAMS  WITH REENTRANT PIU
)@@G@@ROCESSORS WHOSE DATA BANK     @G@@@@ REFERENCES  ARE  'FLOATED'  ON  THEIV
)@@G@@  ADDRESS  FOUND  IN  A CONTROL     @G@@@@ REGISTER.   THE USER PROGRAM IW
)@@G@@CAN SPECIFY THE PROGRAM FILE IN WHICH     @G@@@@ ARE  FOUND  THE  REENTRIX
)@@G@@ANT PROCESSORS IT WILL LINK TO BY EXECUTING     @G@@@@ THE  'ER'  STATEMIY
)@@G@@ENT SPECIFYING THE ER FUNCTION CODE FOR 'RLIST$'.     @G@@@@ THE  REPS  IZ
)@@G@@THUS  DEFINED  MAY  BE LINKED TO BY THE USE OF THE 'ER'     @G@@@@ STATEJA
)@@G@@MENT  SPECIFYING 'LINK$' OR 'RLINK$'.   UPON EXECUTING THE ER     @G@@@@JB
)@@G@@ LINK$ OR ER RLINK$,  THE REGISTER INITIALIZATION FIELD OF THE 'ER'     JC
)@@G@@@G@@@@ STATEMENT  CAN  SPECIFY THE ADDRESS OF A NATURAL ARRAY OR VARIABLJD
)@@G@@E     @G@@@@ TO  BE  USED  BY THE REENTRANT PROCESSOR.   LIKEWISE,  THE JE
)@@G@@REP CAN     @G@@@@ RETURN  INFORMATION  TO  THE  NPL  PROGRAM VIA THE REJF
)@@G@@GISTER RETURN     @G@@@@ FIELD  OF  THE  'ER'  STATEMENT  OR BY STORING JG
)@@G@@DATA INTO THE ARRAY     @E@@@@ WHOSE ARGUMENT WAS PASSED.  THE POSSIBILIJH
)@@G@@TIES ARE MANY.    @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ SUPPOSE  THERE  IS A REENTRANT PROCJI
)@@G@@ESSOR IN THE USER'S FILE NPL$PF     @G@@@@ WHICH  DOES  A BUBBLE SORT ONJJ
)@@G@@ AN ARBITRARY ARRAY.   IT EXPECTS THE     @G@@@@ ADDRESS  OF  THE  ARRAYJK
)@@G@@ TO BE IN REGISTER A1 AND THE LENGTH OF THE     @G@@@@ ARRAY IN REGISTERJL
)@@G@@ A2.   THE REP'S NAME IS 'BSORT'.   THE FOLLOWING     @G@@@@ EXAMPLE  ILJM
)@@G@@LUSTRATES  A  MEANS  OF LINKING TO THIS REP FROM AN NPL     @F@@@@ PROGRJN
)@@G@@AM, ASSUMING THE ARRAY TO SORT IS B$ OF LENGTH 1000 WORDS:  @@@@@@@@@@@@JO
)@@G@@@ @@@@      1.            DIM A$(2) @E@@@@      2.            DATA A$\'NJP
)@@G@@PL$PF','      ','BSORT '\     @B@@@@      3.            ER RLIST$,1*/18+JQ
)@@G@@A$.U  @C@@@@      4.            ER LINK$,A$(2),B$.U,1000    @A@@@@      JR
)@@G@@5.               ... ETC.     @@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ THE  FIRST  STATEMENT  JS
)@@G@@DEFINES  THE  ARRAY A$ TO BE THREE WORDS IN     @[@@@@*****^@G@@@@THE NEJT
)@@G@@W YORK UNIVERSITY PROGRAMMING LANGUAGE   NPL   REV.23       24-  4@@@@@@JU
)@@G@@@@@@@@@@@@@@@G@@@@ LENGTH.   THE ARRAY IS INITIALIZED WITH THE INTERNAL JV
)@@G@@FILE NAME AND     @G@@@@ THE  REP  NAME  FOR  THE ER RLIST$.   THE ER RLJW
)@@G@@IST$ INSTRUCTION IS     @G@@@@ EXECUTED  IN  STATEMENT  THREE,   WITH COJX
)@@G@@NTROL REGISTER A0'S BEING     @G@@@@ LOADED WITH A PARAMETER WORD CONSISJY
)@@G@@TING OF ONE IN THE TOP HALF AND     @G@@@@ THE  PACKET  ADDRESS IN THE LJZ
)@@G@@OWER HALF.   STATEMENT FOUR IS THE ER     @G@@@@ LINK$  INSTRUCTION,  SPKA
)@@G@@ECIFYING THAT THE REP TO LINK TO IS 'BSORT'     @G@@@@ (WHOSE  NAME  IS KB
)@@G@@ IN THE THIRD WORD OF THE RLIST$ CONTROL PACKET).     @G@@@@ CONTROL REGKC
)@@G@@ISTER A1 RECEIVES THE ADDRESS OF THE ARRAY TO SORT, AND     @G@@@@ REGISKD
)@@G@@TER A2 ITS LENGTH.   WHEN THE REENTRANT PROCESSOR EXECUTES AN     @G@@@@KE
)@@G@@ ER  UNLNK$,   CONTROL  RETURNS TO THE NPL PROGRAM AT THE STATEMENT     KF
)@@G@@@^@@@@ FOLLOWING THE ER LINK$.___@@@    ALTERNAT*[S@@[*SDFF*@L@@@@E-*G*)KG
)@@G@@H-\H1$^[6G(2IT(H9,^[\G0)I-*HD3^[(I->H*)GT\H14GD(H13^[4H[>^[!GD,I(-H))G1\KH
